records.name: bunny chow and its durban curry
records.text: this is a story: with a recipe. during the great depression in 1933 indians, whites and chinese in durban, south africa, suffered hunger like everyone else.

records.name: bunny chow and its durban curry
records.text: the kids then discovered that the cheapest curry they could buy (for a quarter penny or half a penny) was made by a vegetarian indian caste known in durban slang as the bania. it was made from dried sugarbeans (no meat).

records.name: bunny chow and its durban curry
records.text: the children didn't have plates, and one kid got the bright idea to hollow out a quarter bread, asked the seller to put the bean curry in the hollowed-out bread, and then used the broken bread he's taken out as a sort of eating utensil.

records.name: bunny chow and its durban curry
records.text: chinese food was called "chow". somehow the two words came together: bania chow. in time it simply became known as bunny chow.

records.name: bunny chow and its durban curry
records.text: bunny chow was what the indian sugar plantation workers took as their day's food to the lands: curry in hollowed-out bread halves. cheap and practical.

records.name: bunny chow and its durban curry
records.text: today it does not matter what your skin colour or station in life is: durbanites and people from the kwa-zulu-natal province love their bunny chow.

records.name: bunny chow and its durban curry
records.text: for this story and the recipe he managed to get from "the mysterious lingela" who makes bunny chows daily, i am indebted to "kitchenboy". should he happen upon this story, he'll know who he is. thanks, braam!.

records.name: caipirinha
records.text: caipirinha is the national drink of brazil. the drink is made with cachaça (pronounced - kuh-sha-suh). it is technically a brandy and a member of the aguardente family.

records.name: caipirinha
records.text: there is an old adage in brazil: "quanto pior a cachaça, melhor a caipirinha" –– the worse the cachaça, the better the caipirinha. the name caipirinha is derived from the portuguese word caipira (hick, hayseed, country bumpkin, rube, etc.

records.name: caipirinha
records.text: ) coupled with the -inha suffix (a diminutive denoting little or small) and can be roughly translated as little hick, little hayseed, little country bumpkin, little rube, etc. , etc.

records.name: caipirinha
records.text: poor man’s drink or not, cachaça has become an integral part of brazilian culture and its significance ranks right up there with soccer/football (futebol), carnival and samba as brazilian national icons. the brazilians like it sweet.

records.name: caipirinha
records.text: very sweet. in brazil, the very best caipirinhas are made with "limões gallegos" –– what in the u. s. is often referred to as a key lime. can also be made by the pitcher!.

records.text: posting for the zwt 5 portugal times are approximate found while surfing and is from food of spain and potugal.

records.name: favorite spinach casserole
records.text: our family's favorite side dish and is served at every holiday!  can be made a day ahead and also freezes well. this recipe will make 2 casseroles but you can easily adjust to make smaller or larger.

records.name: favorite spinach casserole
records.text: so versatile i have even used it as a dip with crackers and as a stuffing for portobellos and chicken breasts. enjoy!.

records.name: feijoada
records.text: a hearty brazilian stew. from cooking light. per 1 cup serving: 415 calories, 12. 2 g fat, 28. 6 g protein, 50. 6 g carb, 8. 9 g fiber, 43 mg cholesterol.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian bean soup
records.text: feijoada (fay-zhwah-dah) is brazil's most famous national dish.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian bean soup  ii
records.text: brazilian bean soup.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian black bean and mixed meat stew  with orange
records.text: traditionally eaten on wednesday's and saturday's throughout brazil with white rice and oranges (amongst other things), this special and rich meaty slow cooked stew has a depth of flavour using simple ingredients that could bring 'ooohs' and 'aaaahh's' from across the atlantic i'm sure.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian black bean and mixed meat stew  with orange
records.text: i save my version for special occasions when i want a really hearty shared meal and i love the way the beans melt into the sauce lending their luxurious almost creamy texture to the finished dish.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian black bean and mixed meat stew  with orange
records.text: originally this was made by african slaves using fatty offal scraps and as tasty as it was (i've tried this version and it is pretty good!) many people nowadays, including myself, make it lighter and use better quality meats.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian black bean and mixed meat stew  with orange
records.text: the orange and coriander salad is not compulsory but comes very highly recommended. absolutely outstanding.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian black bean stew
records.text: feijoada is a typical portuguese dish which is now the national dish of brazil. according to legend, the dish dates back to colonial times when the slaves made a stew out of beef and pork scraps. it is served for lunch.

records.name: feijoada  brazilian black bean stew
records.text: here, it is given a more modern, american treatment. adapted from "everyday with rachael ray," august 2009. serve with white rice, pickled jalapeno slices, and thin orange slices.

records.name: feijoada   brazilian black bean stew
records.text: a vegan stew typical in brazil. prep time does not include bean soaking. you can probably streamline this by using the equivelent amount of canned black beans, rinsed and drained and skip the beginning step.

records.name: feijoada   brazilian black beans with smoked meats
records.text: feijoada is one of brazil's national treasures. this is a dish that is meant to serve a group, and the preparation begins the night before. several kinds of smoked meats, ribs, and beef jerky are simmered with the black beans.

records.name: feijoada   brazilian black beans with smoked meats
records.text: the meats are removed and served separately on a platter  preparation time includes soaking beans and beef jerky overnight. that is why it is so long.

records.name: feijoada   the real one
records.text: this recipe is the real brazilian feijoada. it is like my mother does it, but she spends at least 8 hours cooking it (the secret she doesn't tell me). it can have some differences in other places of brazil (this is the southern style).

records.name: feijoada   the real one
records.text: you can keep the fat if you want it more 'creamy'. some like it on the next day (keep on the refrigerator, of course). the perfect drink is caipirinha, made with 'cachaca', smashed lemons and sugar, cold. you can drink beer, also.

records.name: feijoada   the real one
records.text: be sure to have a place to rest after the feijoada. you'll need it. :)).

records.name: feijoada black bean burgers
records.text: a meatless burger inspired by fejoada, the national dish of brazil.

records.name: feijoada richmond style
records.text: entered for safe-keeping, from dede deane gray in "flavored with tradition: a collection of recipes from charleston, atlanta, and richmond". feijoada is brazil's national dish.

records.name: feijoada richmond style
records.text: i imagine this would be more authentic if chorizo sausage replaced the "smoked sausage"; chorizo sausage can be found at a latin grocer's. for accessibility, most people would substitute kielbasa.

records.name: fettuccine with shiitakes in a saffron cream sauce
records.text: this recipe has the most amazing saffron sauce!  although it calls for shiitake mushrooms, i've made this with oyster mushrooms and it is equally good, but you need to add some color.

records.name: fettuccine with shiitakes in a saffron cream sauce
records.text: red or orange bell pepper, julienne usually does the trick. portobellas are good too. i always reduce the amount of heavy cream in this (by half!). if you don't have fettuccine, this is really good with bowtie pasta.

records.name: fettuccine with shiitakes in a saffron cream sauce
records.text: an oaky chardonnay goes well with this. from food & wine, pasta.

records.name: filet mignon with madeira sauce
records.text: easy enough , yet elegant.

records.name: filet mignon with mushrooms and creamy madeira sauce
records.text: this is a wonderful steak recipe. you can omit the cayenne if desired, my family loves spicy so i add it in.

records.name: filhos  portuguese donuts
records.text: my mother-in-laws recipe, who is 100% portuguese.

records.name: filipino fruit salad
records.text: an unexpected hit that takes familiar ingredients like fruit cocktail and cream cheese. always a hit at summer get togethers. you can easily substitute and add different fruits to your liking.

records.name: filipino fruit salad
records.text: more traditional recipes will include nata de cocoa, lychees, or other regional fruits. my recipe is geared more towards my friends here in the midwest.

records.name: fillet of pork with  mussels  lomo de porco com amijoas
records.text: adapted from dine around the world cookbook, this recipe features in the portuguese section and looks interesting. posted for the zwt region: portugal.

records.name: fish and portuguese shrimp
records.text: a spicy, hearty seafood dish.

records.name: fish piccata  easy and economical
records.text: just saw this on melissa's show: ten dollar dinners with melissa d'arabian episode: melissa's 4-step fish and it looks like a great meal for company! put here for safekeeping.

records.name: food   wine kale and potato soup with turkey sausage
records.text: from foodandwine. com:  the traditional portuguese kale and potato soup inspired this delicious country-style dish. it's especially welcome in the winter months when kale is at its peak. an interesting bread completes this meal with aplomb.

records.name: food   wine kale and potato soup with turkey sausage
records.text: try corn bread or tomato-topped italian focaccia. a good crusty loaf of white bread will do fine, too.

records.name: forevermama s mediterranean red potato salad
records.text: this is my "go to" potato salad that i've been making for quite some time. it's the one my husband always requests because it's so tasty and because it contains no mayonnaise.

records.name: forevermama s mediterranean red potato salad
records.text: for those who do and don't enjoy mayonnaise, this potato salad is sure to please with it's definite mediterranean flavors. this recipe originally came from a high-end grocer, j. bildner and sons in back bay boston.

records.name: forevermama s mediterranean red potato salad
records.text: i've tweaked a bit from the original recipe.

records.name: francesinha  super indulgent portuguese sandwich
records.text: this looks very yummy but certainly not one for the diet!  apparently, it is the portuguese take on the french croque-monsieur.

records.name: frango  moda do alentejana  chicken with potatoes and ga
records.text: a simple, typical portugues chicken dish which i learned from my friend.

records.name: fresh coriander soup  sopa de coentro
records.text: i know there are those who say they don't like cilantro or coriander or chinese parsley. i am not one of those people and this soup is so delicious and comforting when served hot in cold weather, and soothing when served cold in hot weather.

records.name: fresh coriander soup  sopa de coentro
records.text: it's another portuguese recipe adapted from jean anderson's foods of portugal. this is very easy to make but it requires a good 24 hours in the fridge, so plan accordingly.

records.name: fresh fig and port sorbet
records.text: the ingredients are clearly classic portuguese (figs, port) and sorbet was almost part of the moorish repertoire (ice was brought from the sierra nevada mountains to the alhambra to provide coolness for sliced fruit), but in all other respects, this is about as non-traditional a recipe as you can find for the zaar world tour 5 (2009)!   this recipe uses no milk or cream; the flavor of the figs and port is there, but understated and it is absolutely wonderful.

records.name: fresh fig and port sorbet
records.text: you can stay within the traditional iberian palate and use vanilla sugar instead of plain sugar (don't use vanilla extract, unless you cook off the alcohol), but that's just gilding the lilly. full credit goes to eating out loud (http://www.

records.name: fresh fig and port sorbet
records.text: eatingoutloud. com/2008/08/fresh-fig-port-sorbet. html), who in turn credits ms. adventures in italy for the idea of a fig sorbet (http://www. msadventuresinitaly. com/blog/2007/07/03/fresh-fig-sorbet/).

records.name: fresh tomato sauce with fine port wine
records.text: this hearty sauce has a robust, complex flavor with a delicate after-taste. well spiced, it stands up to pizza or livens any pasta dish.

records.name: fried fresh smelts
records.text: this is a dish i remember from my childhood, and it comes to mind every time i see fresh smelts available at the grocery. serve with mashed potatoes for a traditional swedish meal, or french fries for a more modern meal.

records.name: fried fresh smelts
records.text: this dish can also be made with small herring or sardines. posted for zwt6.

records.name: fried portuguese style bay scallops
records.text: this is a simple, straight-forward way to prepare fresh bay scallops without distracting from their natural sweetness. the larger sea scallops would work just as well here.

records.name: fried sardines
records.text: this is from the foodnetwork paula deen show.

records.name: fruit cocktail drink  non alcoholic
records.text: from tudo gustoso.

records.name: fruity sangria with a kick
records.text: really easy to drink. just remember it's not juice. enjoy!.

records.name: garam masala sauteed portobello mushroom curry  in porcini cream
records.text: another wonderful recipe from vikram vij, owner of the hottest indian restaurant in vancouver! asafetida & mango powders are known as hing & amchur in indian grocery stores - if you can't get them, omit them, as well as the fenugreek & add 1 tbsp lime juice after the mushrooms are cooked.

records.name: garam masala sauteed portobello mushroom curry  in porcini cream
records.text: you can purchase garam masala or use one of the recipes for garam masala on zaar.

records.name: garlic pate  pasta de alho
records.text: from jean anderson's "the food of portugal" if you ate this in portugal, it would be made with some wonderful local cheese. these recipe uses brie--a good substitute for those of us with no access to portugese artisanal cheeses.

records.name: garlic pate  pasta de alho
records.text: this would be served with pao torrado, a kind of melba toast. crostini from a baguette are just fine with this. or if the brie is rich enough for you, try it on slices of cucumber.

records.name: gaspacho  alentejana  gazpacho alentejo s way
records.text: cold soup (no stove).

records.name: german ananas mango bowle  pineapple mango wine punch
records.text: bowle is a german summer fruit & wine punch. there are many versions of bowle. this version relies on tropical fruits and madeira to give it a unique taste. bowle is served with clear picks to spear the wine-soaked fruit out of each glass.

records.name: german ananas mango bowle  pineapple mango wine punch
records.text: plan ahead - the fruit needs to soak several hours before your guests arrive. translated directly from the german version i found in.

records.name: giada s portobella parmesan
records.text: recipe courtesy giada de laurentiis, show: everyday italian, episode: vegetarian italian, this has gotten rave reviews on foodnetwork.

records.name: giada s portobella parmesan
records.text: easy and so delicious, great for a quick dinner and your vegetarian guest will love it!  this would also be great for busy college students. i have added a few more spices to the mix.

records.name: giada s portobella parmesan
records.text: great served with whole wheat pasta or/and garlic bread, or try it over creamy polenta! add more cheese and sauce if you like.

records.name: ginataang mais  corn in coco milk
records.text: ginataang mais is a filipino dessert and snack made from whole kernel corn and coconut milk. this is a simple and quick filipino dessert recipe that only takes less than 25 minutes to prepare.

records.name: ginataang mais  corn in coco milk
records.text: the appearance of this quick and easy dessert is similar to that of the maja blanca but there is a big difference in texture; the consistency is more like the goto, arroz caldo, or perhaps the champorado.

records.name: ginataang mais  corn in coco milk
records.text: i like this dessert (particularly this dessert recipe) because of the simple ingredients involved. i also believe that good dishes need not to be complicated and time consuming and this is one of the proofs.

records.name: ginataang mais  corn in coco milk
records.text: you can enjoy ginataang mais for breakfast or as amid afternoon snack. since it is packed with carbs, this can be a good meal before starting to do something that involves a lot of physical work.

records.name: ginger cake  bolo do gingibre
records.text: this is a spice cake recipe with the texture of a poundcake. recipe courtesy jean anderson, the food of portugal.

records.name: gloucester codfish balls
records.text: dried salt codfish is a traditional ingredient not only in northern european cuisine, but also in mediterranean, west african, caribbean, and brazilian cuisines.

records.name: gloucester codfish balls
records.text: the ingredient and the dishes made from it are known by many names, for example baccalà, bacalhau, bacalao, bacallà, morue, klippfisk/clipfish, and saltfiskur. serve these tasty morsels with tomato sauce.

records.name: gloucester codfish balls
records.text: small balls make a very nice appetizer, too. from the new england chapter of the united states regional cookbook, culinary arts institute of chicago, 1947. overnight soaking time not included in preparation time.

records.name: goan black eyed peas  slow cooker
records.text: from "the indian slow cooker" by anupy singla. goa was originally colonized by the portuguese. coconut milk is used frequently in goan cuisine. this was a really delicious meal, although i am not sure about the quantity of water, see note.

records.name: goan black eyed peas  slow cooker
records.text: use a 5 qt slow cooker for full amount, a 3 1/2 qt cooker if you halve the recipe.

records.name: goiabada  guava marmalade
records.text: *** please read the review for recommendations to make this thicker. *** goiabada is a popular dessert throughout the portuguese-speaking countries of the world, dating back to the colonial days in brazil.

records.name: goiabada  guava marmalade
records.text: abundance of sugar and slave labour were crucial for its confection, in large cauldrons cooking over a slow fire. it is a conserve made of guava and sugar. guava is very rich in pectin so no powdered pectin or water is needed.

records.name: goiabada  guava marmalade
records.text: it is still commonly made at home for family use or made as processed food. enjoy!.

records.name: gooey chocolate cake
records.text: this is the chocolate cake we made all the time as poor students with my bestest friend tuija! there are no fancy ingredients, you can put the cake together in minutes and the end result is pure chocolate decadance.

records.name: gooey chocolate cake
records.text: the cake is flat and doesn't exactly make a pretty presenatation (we usually even skipped the parchment paper and scraped the cake off the bottom of the springform pan :-) but the taste more than makes up for it.

records.name: gorgonzola madeira sauce for beef
records.text: this makes enough for about two servings of filet mignon, but can be used for any cut of beef. double, triple, etc. as needed.

records.text: this is a simple and traditional greek way of preparing chicken. adapted from authentic greek recipes.

records.text: a tender steak stir fry with a mixture of ground ginger,cinnamon, allspice, oregano and finished with feta cheese for a greek flair. this is from a treasured soup and stew cookbook from my cookbook collection.

records.name: greek orzo salad with chickpeas   artichoke hearts
records.text: quintessential greek flavors - feta, lemon and dill - combine perfectly in this hearty salad. to complete the mediterranean mood, try pairing it with a greek retsina or a portuguese vinho verde.

records.name: greek orzo salad with chickpeas   artichoke hearts
records.text: from eatingwell magazine  may/june 1996, and "eatingwell serves two"  dietary exchanges: 4 starch, 2 vegetable, 1 very lean meat, 1 fat (4 carbohydrate serving). posted for zwt6.

records.name: greek orzo salad with chickpeas   artichoke hearts
records.text: note: recipe amended to indicate fresh lemon juice and optional addition of some greek seasoning for more flavor.

records.name: green beans with coriander and garlic  feijao verde com coentro
records.text: from: the food of portugal. haven't tried this yet, but it sounded good. did not include marinating time in prep time.

records.name: grilled eggplant and fresh mozzarella on ciabatta
records.text: easy and delicious! the flavors will explode in your mouth. you can add other grilled vegetables with it, such as portobello mushrooms or onions.

records.name: grilled eggplant and fresh mozzarella on ciabatta
records.text: you could even do this in a grill pan if necessary! from bobby flay and his show  grill it! with bobby flay, episode: grilled sandwich showdown.

records.name: grilled general tso s chicken
records.text: since i am calorie counting, i took one of my family's favorite recipes and modified it to bring down the calories. if you cannot find rice wine, you can substitute sherry, madeira or marsala.

records.name: grilled madeira cake with berries
records.text: this delicious, simple dessert comes from "recipes +" magazine, january 2009. be sure to buy an un-iced madeira cake!.

records.name: grilled mushroom sandwiches
records.text: this is a great recipe for a quick, summertime, meatless meal. you need really big portobellos for this. adapted from a midwest living recipe.

records.name: grilled peppercorn crusted roast beef with port wine sauce
records.text: living in florida i love to find great recipes that can be grilled outside to keep the house cooler. this is one i found in cuisine at home magazine and i added garlic powder to the seasoning.

records.name: grilled peppercorn crusted roast beef with port wine sauce
records.text: this isn't your large standard size roast that feeds a group but rather a small 1 or 1 1/4 pound eye of round beef roast.

records.name: grilled peppercorn crusted roast beef with port wine sauce
records.text: if it is tricky to find this size, ask the butcher to cut a larger one in half, or buy the larger roast and cut in half and freeze one of the parts for another time. this was served with horseradish mashed potatoes.

records.name: grilled portabella with thyme   garlic
records.text: grilled portobello with thyme & garlic.

records.text: i found this recipe last summer on epicourious. com. it was the.

records.text: grilled portobello burgers with creamy dijon sauce.

records.name: grilled portobello mushroom sandwiches with basil aioli
records.text: aioli is a garlic mayonnaise, popular in southern france, and tasty as a spread on sandwiches.

records.name: grilled portobello mushroom sandwiches with basil aioli
records.text: this sandwich is hearty, filling, and packed with flavor! you can use minced garlic from the jar where it calls for the garlic in the aioli, but you can definitely tell the difference.

records.name: grilled portobello mushroom sandwiches with basil aioli
records.text: i don't have a press, so i just mince the garlic with a knife. this recipe is from "the barbecue! bible" by steven raichlen.

records.name: grilled portobello mushroom sandwiches with basil aioli
records.text: it is based on using an outdoor grill, but this is a direct-heat method, so you could also use a grill pan (what i do), and it works great too.

records.name: grilled portobello mushrooms   shallots with rosemary dijon
records.text: these can easily become the star attraction to your next grilled meal! for the grilling itself, build a moderate, medium-heat fire. the veggies come out tender and full of smoky flavor and can be served warm or at room temp.

records.name: grilled portobello mushrooms   shallots with rosemary dijon
records.text: if grill marks do not appear after 5 minutes, adjust either the heat level or the position on the grill. i have made these with chunks of red onion with equally good results.

records.name: grilled portobello mushrooms   shallots with rosemary dijon
records.text: these have great flavor!  interesting factoid: once the mushroom reaches 4 to 6" in diameter, it is called a portobello rather than a portabella. adapted from cook's illustrated magazine, may, 2009. hope you enjoy.

records.name: grilled portobello mushrooms with garlic  cheese and pine nuts
records.text: this delicious recipe comes from steven raichlen, "master griller" and author of numerous bestselling cookbooks. this one is from his 'how to grill barbecue bible'. (prep. time does not reflect refrigeration time).

records.name: grilled portobello omelette
records.text: i just got this on a recipe card from my local earthfare store, and i can't wait to try it out! what a unique use of both portobello mushrooms and the grill! it looks like there is a lot of "play" room here, as far as using different cheeses (feta?), veggies (sun-dried tomatoes?), and even brushes of vinegar.

records.name: grilled portobellos with pesto  tomatoes and feta
records.text: many thanks to my dear friend joanna who served these beautiful and oh-so-flavorful mushroom "steaks" for dinner the other night.

records.name: grilled portobellos with pesto  tomatoes and feta
records.text: i thought i had died and gone to vegetarian heaven!  we had them as the main course, but they can also be served as an appetizer or on a sandwich/burger.

records.name: grilled portobellos with pesto  tomatoes and feta
records.text: joanna made her own pesto with fresh basil, toasted pine nuts and extra virgin olive oil. prepared pesto will work fine, but if you can, i suggest making your own for the best flavor.

records.name: grilled portobellos with pesto  tomatoes and feta
records.text: these are super easy and you can make them ahead of time and refrigerate till ready to grill. serving size indicates number of mushrooms.

records.name: grilled portobellos with pesto  tomatoes and feta
records.text: as an appetizer, one mushroom per serving will do, but for a main course i would recommend 4 servings of 2 mushrooms each. the recipe originated in vegetarian times and i'm posting here for safekeeping.

records.name: grilled prawns with raw sauce
records.text: grilling shrimps on skewers seems to be a common way of cooking them in angola, it works well, specially for turning them, and is very attractive.

records.name: grilled prawns with raw sauce
records.text: as is often the case with angolan food, you can find versions of this recipe throughout the former portuguese empire.

records.name: grilled shrimp and chorizo skewers
records.text: this is a rachael ray 30 minute meals recipe that has been a staple of mine for a year or so. includes a recipe for piquillo gazpacho to serve on the side.

records.name: grilled shrimp and chorizo skewers
records.text: (note: i have always used soft chorizo in place of the cured and "grilled" it on a stovetop grill pan and it turns out fine, though be sure to really compact it so they don't fall off).

records.name: grilled spiced white mushrooms
records.text: this recipe is from gourmet june 2005 : written as stated. chef note: i have cooked these stove top by just quartering and adding ingredients to a saute pan.

records.name: grilled spiced white mushrooms
records.text: these are great mushrooms to jazz up that grilled steak! very easy too :)  i used the (jar) ground spices and skipped roasting /grinding them and the flavor was still wonderful.

records.name: grilled spiced white mushrooms
records.text: (sometimes adding more butter if topping a steak) i have made this recipe so many ways- on outdoor grill, indoor grill,  in saute pan, with portobello's. everyone always likes them- they have a nice little kick to them.

records.name: grilled spiced white mushrooms
records.text: special equipment: a mortar & pestle or an electric coffee grinder (i skip this for ease :).

records.name: grilled steak
records.text: this tender steak has a sweet asian touch flavored with pineapple, crystallized ginger,teriyaki sauce, garlic & port wine. quick and easy! can be made with pork or chicken.

records.name: grilled steak with red wine butter
records.text: i found this recipe in a book that suggests it as a home-made replacement for outback's filet with port wine sauce. it has 1/2 the calories and 1/3 of the fat!.

records.name: grilled tomato risotto with roasted portobello mushrooms
records.text: this yummy dish is from emeril lagasse's in the episode emeril's vegetable patch. i have tweaked it just a bit!.

records.name: grilled vegetable muffuletta
records.text: a recipe from rachael ray from the issue of june-july 2008. posted for zwt4 italy. for the portobello, it's not written to slice it. but i guess after it's grilled, we can slice it.

records.name: grilled zucchini and mushrooms
records.text: recipe from natashaskitchen. com.

records.name: guatemala n ceviche
records.text: hello, i'm a big fant of this site. this is my first contribution. here in guatemala we have fnatastic sea food. this is a very easy ceviche recipe. hope you like it!.

records.name: halibut   mediterranean style
records.text: dried italian seasonings are readily available, from most supermarkets, already premixed. this high protein recipe is wonderful with fresh arugula or spinach salad and rice or sauteed new potatoes.

records.name: halibut   mediterranean style
records.text: for more servings, increase the recipe, accordingly. this recipe goes well with other white fish, such as haddock, cod, scrod, catfish, etc. a bottle of chianti to aid digestion would not go amiss.

records.name: hearty portuguese kale soup
records.text: this is a very flavorful soup that is a comfort food for my family. the recipe was given to me by my portuguese mil over 30 yrs ago. her mother had passed it on to her. this soup is easily stretched to make more servings.

records.name: hearty portuguese kale soup
records.text: the chorizo gives the broth a good base for adding another can of beans or more pasta or a little water. soul warming for a cold night, serve with a warm crusty bread. a great next day soup. freezes well.

records.name: herbed rissoles with mushroom sauce
records.text: entered for zwt 5 - round 1. in portugal, rissoles are known as rissóis and are usually filled with cod, minced meat, shrimp or (less frequently) chicken or a combination of cheese and ham.

records.name: herbed rissoles with mushroom sauce
records.text: the australian rissole is generally made from minced meat without a pastry covering, but sometimes with breadcrumbs. mostly cooked on a bbq all year round.

records.name: herbed rissoles with mushroom sauce
records.text: the new zealand rissole is much the same as the australian rissole but may contain diced yellow onion and cooked on a bbq as a healthier option during summer.

records.name: homemade seitan steaks   wild mushroom gravy
records.text: this fresh seitan recipe from the candle cafe is the best i've ever had, but unfortunately it does take about 6 hours to make.

records.name: homemade seitan steaks   wild mushroom gravy
records.text: a lot of that time is simmering or marinating time, but you need to start making this early and be aware that it can take a good half hour to knead the starch out of the dough.

records.name: homemade seitan steaks   wild mushroom gravy
records.text: if will look like a lot when you first form the dough, but by the time you're done washing out the starch, it will have shrunk a lot!  it will puff back up a bit during the simmering, though.

records.name: homemade seitan steaks   wild mushroom gravy
records.text: these end up with a really good flavor and are kind of reminiscent of a beef roast/steaks. these go well with the wild mushroom gravy that the cafe serves them with, so i included that recipe with the seitan one here.

records.name: homemade seitan steaks   wild mushroom gravy
records.text: the ingredients following the hot sauce are for the gravy. you can also use leftover marinade for portobello burgers to grill in the summertime.

records.name: massa de pimentao  red paprika paste
records.text: this is a popular condiment in portugal to accompany meat, poultry, fish, specifically grilled. it keeps for about 2 weeks in an airtight jar in the fridge. preparation time does not include 24 hours marinating time.

records.name: massa de pimentao  red paprika paste

records.name: maureen s pilchard fish cakes

records.name: meat pies with spicy portuguese sauce
records.text: this traditional portuguese recipe is courtesy of emeril lagasse. the sauce complements the meat pies very well, but could also be used on pasta or even as a pizza topping. it's a long recipe but really not that difficult.

records.name: meat pies with spicy portuguese sauce
records.text: read through the entire recipe first. emeril wrote this to use as an appetizer, so there are 36 small meat pies. i suppose you could try to make the pies larger if you wanted to serve it as a main course. enjoy!.

records.name: meatloaf wellington with madeira sauce

records.name: mediterranean mayonnaise

records.name: mediterranean mussels

records.name: mediterranean style dice rice bake
records.text: i started making rice casseroles to bring to potluck lunches at my theater company because i discovered that they were cheaper than pasta (at least where i live).

records.name: mediterranean style dice rice bake
records.text: this recipe came to my mind when i had lunch at a macau restaurant that served portuguese baked rice. in the coming few weeks i began to dream about this brand new colourful, juicy rice casserole.

records.name: mediterranean style dice rice bake
records.text: so i did some research, hit the supermarket, and got busy.

records.name: merill s  baked clam dip oreganata
records.text: this is my sister in law's recipe. it's like a clam pie or a giant baked clam served warm with crackers (i like ritz for this). it could be prepared, up until the baking, a day in advance.

records.name: merill s  baked clam dip oreganata
records.text: just put it in the refrigerator and bake when ready the next day! if you make it and freeze it for the future, just thaw and reheat.

records.name: merill s  baked clam dip oreganata
records.text: this is a family favorite and a crowd pleaser when i make it for guests - enjoy! ps-i like it with 2 cans of chopped clams too! you get bigger clam pieces that way.

records.name: mexican  mole  rub
records.text: a fabulous mexican mole flavored rub with a faint chocolate undercurrent. wonderful on pork, chicken, meaty fish like tuna and salmon, and on roasted or grilled portobellos and bell peppers.

records.name: mixed pepper salad
records.text: i love roasted peppers and with a combination of green, yellow and red peppers this sounds delicious and colorful. it is from "portuguese cooking" by carol robertson. (the cooking time indicated includes the chilling time. ).

records.name: mmm    white chocolate creme brulee
records.text: this recipe came from my friend duncan. he said, "i have a yummy tasty white chocolate creme brulee that is fabulously easy to make. i'm not a big fan of white chocolate and i love this. " he got it from the portobello yacht club.

records.name: molho cru  portuguese sauce for fried fish
records.text: from a facebook group called portuguese recipes. essentially a group for people who like and collect portuguese recipes. since we like fish, in our home, this makes for a good recipe to try.

records.name: molho de piri piri  portuguese peri peri marinade sauce
records.text: this spicy hot marinade can be used on any meat you grill - chicken, beef, shrimp or prawns (i've even tried it with fish!).

records.name: molho de piri piri  portuguese peri peri marinade sauce
records.text: 'aging' the marinade by storing it in an airtight container and refrigerated for a few days allows the flavour to intensify.

records.name: molho de piri piri  portuguese peri peri marinade sauce
records.text: a word of caution: habanero chillies are hot, so please handle them with care! use gloves or oil your hands before touching them so that the chilli 'oil' does not penetrate into the pores of your skin.

records.name: molho de piri piri  portuguese peri peri marinade sauce
records.text: the serving size is a guess-timate - this 1 batch of marinade is enough to marinate 6-8 chicken drumsticks or about 30 shrimps or prawns.

records.name: molotoff  unique portuguese meringue pudding
records.text: this is one of the most delicious puddings i have ever ate in my whole life, and what i love most about it is that it's extremely easy! it does not require special techniques :o) the only thing tricky about it is removing it from it's pan without breaking it.

records.name: molotoff  unique portuguese meringue pudding
records.text: but after a while, you'll end up developing your own little tricks. i hope that anyone that tries this recipe enjoys it as much as i do!.

records.name: molotoff pudding

records.text: this is another emeril's mom (hilda) recipe. great way to make a thick and hearty beef stew. an excellent all-in-one meal!.

records.name: moore s new england baked beans
records.text: after moving to nh, i longed for durgin park's baked beans with codfish cakes. the sweetness of the beans with the saltiness of the codfish cakes is to die for. this bean recipe is modification of the original recipe.

records.name: moore s new england baked beans
records.text: these modifications give the best results in a home kitchen. notes: as in any very simple recipe it's the small things that make a big difference. you will need a 3 quart covered bean pot. 1)a long soaking is imperative.

records.name: moore s new england baked beans
records.text: 2)a bean pot is critical  3)the recipe can be halved & baked in a 2 quart bean pot but the larger quantity makes for a better baked bean, imho.

records.name: moore s new england baked beans
records.text: 4)to mimic the beans baked by the colonists in beehive ovens, raise the oven temp to 425 degrees f uncover the beans & bake for about 15 min to form a slight crust at the end of the cooking time.

records.name: moore s new england baked beans

records.name: moore s new england codfish cakes

records.name: mozambican peri peri sauce for shrimps and prawns

records.name: mozambican peri peri sauce for shrimps and prawns
records.text: this sauce is ideally used with large shrimps caught in the open sea -- not the sickly, tastless "farmed" shrimps. it is served heaped on a plate, with rice. you can peel it yourself, but the heads can safely be crunched.

records.name: mozambican peri peri sauce for shrimps and prawns

records.name: mozambican peri peri sauce for shrimps and prawns

records.name: mozambican peri peri sauce for shrimps and prawns

records.text: a different take on goulash - no veggies and a little bite!  don't leave out the seasonings - they are essential for best flavor. great served with a salad and hot biscuits or cornbread.

records.name: natali s amaretto cookies
records.text: i make these little guys every year at christmas time. they are expected on both sides of my family, therefore i end up making 4 batches to cater to the demand.

records.name: natali s amaretto cookies

records.name: natali s awesome enchiladas
records.text: oh man are these tasty!!!  i typically purchase groceries that will last the month so i do not have to bother with the hustle and bustle of the grocery store more than that.

records.name: natali s awesome enchiladas
records.text: as a result i have to be a little more inventive as my resources deplete. i went to big lots yesterday and found a can of enchilada sauce and figured that could make us a great meal and i could finally try my hand at enchiladas.

records.name: natali s awesome enchiladas
records.text: folks we just had the best damn enchiladas that ever passed our lips and i came straight here to record the magic and share with y'all.

records.name: natali s awesome enchiladas
records.text: these were easy to prepare and coupled with refried beans and spanish rice we were utterly satisfied, i hope you enjoy this.

records.name: natalia s baked green beans
records.text: this is my "go-to" green beans that i've been serving my family for many years. it's one of my daughters favorites. it's always present when i make a roasted chicken or ham and i serve it at almost every christmas dinner party i throw.

records.name: natalia s lasagna
records.text: ”homemade lasagna is one of life's best comfort foods. this recipe is one that has the authentic italian taste your family and friends will love. all seasoning can be increased or lessened to your personal taste and preference.

records.name: natalia s lasagna
records.text: (the fennel seed in my opinion gives a wonderfully authentic taste and some add a pinch of nutmeg to the cottage cheese-if you prefer ricotta cheese this can also be used instead of cottage cheese).

records.name: natalia s lasagna
records.text: i have salt-sensitive members in my family so i buy no-salt tomato sauce as the crushed tomatoes and paste are usually not over-salted (all tomato products are available in no-salt versions if you need to decrease your intake of sodium-the cheeses usually have enough salt as well) i also set the parsley and parmesan cheese on the table for my family to add that last bit of seasoning before enjoying--delizioso!! for best results, prepare one day ahead of baking.

records.name: natalia s marinated steak tips
records.text: these steak tips are full of flavor. they are just as good grilled outdoors or indoors over a cast iron grill pan. they are marinated between 4 - 24 hours. i normally marinate these overnight but they can be marinated as long as 48 hours.

records.name: natalia s marinated steak tips
records.text: the marinade is later transformed into a sauce. because my 12 yr. old daughter loves steak, she is now the one who prepares these tips, marinade and all. it's one of her favorites! the cooking time includes the overnight marinating time.

records.name: natalie s chocolate chip cookies  easy and good
records.text: this was actually taken straight from the blue bonnet margerine tub. my daughter is 9 and wanted to try it. she did well, i merely set the oven and let her have at this. she did well! basic recipe im sure. easy.

records.name: natalie s meatloaf
records.text: this is my mom's recipe and we loved it so much because of the consistency oats gave to it rather than bread crumbs. great leftover sandwiches.

records.name: natalie s potatoes
records.text: good for a home cooked gathering or holiday side dish. southern fare from the cookbook turnip greens in the bathtub. may be frozen prior to baking.

records.name: natasha s mexican casserole
records.text: i created this casserole at least 20 years ago to for a quick, easy meal for my family.

records.name: natasha s railroad cookies
records.text: i make these every christmas and they always disappear!  if there is anyone in your family or set of friends who is lactose intolerant, these are perfect.

records.name: natasha s tomato  avocado  basil salad
records.text: this salad is so good and very refreshing. the dressing is fantastic!.

records.name: new england portuguese clam boil
records.text: this is one of my childhood favorites. i grew up in southern massachusetts where there is a huge portuguese population.

records.name: new england portuguese clam boil
records.text: we would go to the coast and collect any muscles, clams or periwinkles we could find and then toss them in a pot once we got home. these days a trip to the supermarket works okay. feel free to add whatever seafood you'd like.

records.name: new england portuguese clam boil
records.text: ingredient amounts are estimations since we really just threw whatever we had into a large pot. make sure the clams and mussels are fresh and discard any that don't look so great.

records.name: nickey s sardines
records.text: i don't eat sardines very often but this is the way my dh taught me to make them. i used to just heat them served over rice with a little soy sauce. this is a lot more flavorful!.

records.name: nicks pressure cooker bowl of red   traditional texas chili
records.text: this is dyn-o-mite chili. chili has a colorful history and is not a mexican dish at all. it has roots in spain and portugal where a meat stew with peppers was made.

records.name: nicks pressure cooker bowl of red   traditional texas chili
records.text: variations on this eventually made it to san antonio, tx which many boast as having the best chili and is the home to the beginning of the chili cookoff craze. tradition has it that true texas chili does not have beans.

records.name: nicks pressure cooker bowl of red   traditional texas chili
records.text: so this recipe does not include beans. you can vary the recipe by adding chopped tomato for a chunky rather than smooth stew. serve with chopped jalapeno, cheddar cheese, and sliced green onion for garnish.

records.name: nicks pressure cooker bowl of red   traditional texas chili
records.text: this recipe originated from a discussion with a friend and customer about chili.

records.name: nicoise salad
records.text: for a summer lunch or dinner, one of my favorite salads. there is always a debate going on about this salad, what should be in there and what not. i don't use potatoes in mine, but if you like to add them, do so.

records.name: nicoise salad
records.text: i have added the sardines because i like them in this salad, but you can leave them out. the dressing can be drizzled over the salad instead of mixing it in, or you can use your own favorite dressing.

records.name: nicoise salad

records.name: nigella lawson portobello mushroom cheesesteak sandwich

records.name: no cream vegetarian carbonara

records.name: no knead broa  portuguese corn bread
records.text: broa is a very rustic recipe from portugal and bears little resemblence to american southern corn bread. it's a very dense loaf that's perfect for sopping up hearty soups. another great recipe from artisan bread in five minutes a day cookbook.

records.name: noelias original spanish recipe for padron peppers
records.text: padron is a small area of spain situated very close to the northern border with portugal, on the atlantic coast side and it’s just a short distance south of  the famed santiago de compostela.

records.name: noelias original spanish recipe for padron peppers
records.text: so these are a sweet pepper (pimientos de padrón in spanish) that originated from south america that you lightly fry and then eat… then what’s the twist? well the twist is that for some unknown reason roughly one pepper in 20 or 30 will have a slight kick to it, not a whopping belt of a kick like a jalapeño or habanero pepper, but just a pleasant surprise to tickle your taste buds.

records.name: noelias original spanish recipe for padron peppers
records.text: no, they don’t throw one of a different variety of pepper into the bag as a joke, apparently the “ odd one with a kick” is a natural  quirk of this pepper variety. warning, these are addictive!.

records.name: noelias original spanish recipe for padron peppers
records.text: and a brilliant tapas recipe! there is one other similar recipe here, but it uses garlic and balsamic vinegar and a lot more olive oil, this is the original spanish recipe from the family that farm padron peppers in herbon – padron, spain.

records.name: nut crusted portobello mushroom strips
records.text: thin strips of meaty portobello mushrooms with a crunchy nut coating, sauted in olive oil, become wonderfully satisfying! a great breakfast entree, or side dish, or snack! adapted from mollie katzen's sunlight cafe(breakfast all day).

records.name: oak bluffs massa sovada
records.text: portuguese sweet bread was a traditional  treat in my mother-in-law’s family for generations. nowadays,  you find it in ordinary grocery stores, but not yummy as this version.

records.name: oak bluffs massa sovada
records.text: thickly sliced, toasted, then spread with real butter is a little bit of heaven. mace, which is the outer covering of a nutmeg, is the ingredient that gives it a distinctive taste. it is also the dominant spice in old-fashioned plain doughnuts.

records.name: oak smoked breast of duck with port wine reduction

records.name: oak smoked breast of duck with port wine reduction

records.name: oak smoked breast of duck with port wine reduction
records.text: you will need 1/4 pound of oak wood chips for this recipe. i noticed that he used both dry and wet chips for this recipe. he said that soaking the chips is done to maintain a longer smoke.

records.name: oak smoked breast of duck with port wine reduction

records.name: pasta  bucatini  con le sarde  sardines
