records.text: this is one of my favorite vegetable side dishes inspired by a similar dish by rachel ray. the sherry is what gives it the unique lip-smacking flavor, so try not to substitute anything for it.

records.name: shrimp and crabmeat madeira
records.text: this is a very ellegant special dinner for two, but it can easily be increased for more servings. originally from a february 1978 issue of bon appetit magazine.

records.name: shrimp and tilapia oreganata
records.text: this comes from woman's world magazine.

records.name: shrimp oregonata
records.text: great italian shrimp recipe. one of my favorite ways to make shrimp.

records.name: sicilian eggplant caponata
records.text: from eating well magazine.

records.name: sicilian style caponata
records.text: i serve with crostini. yum!! from southern living.

records.name: sicilian style sardine pasta with breadcrumbs
records.text: recipe courtesy of rachel ray.

records.name: sicilian style sardine pasta with breadcrumbs
records.text: it took me awhile to repeat preparing this dish - am i sorry it took so long! very easy and tastes great too! update: july 10,2008: according to a poster lemon-pepper adds that extra kick to the recipe, as well as adding some olive oil to the pasta (she prefers angel-hair) as well as the pasta water, and then finish with some grated or shredded asiago.

records.name: sicilian style sardine pasta with breadcrumbs
records.text: just made it with these changes and it turned out beautifully!!!.

records.name: simple beef stew
records.text: this simple stew makes those cold winter nights bearable!  this recipe, originally called deer isle stew, is from natalie g. sylvester's "the home-cooking cookbook. ".

records.name: simple salad
records.text: i don't know if this is where it originates, but our thanksgiving company that was visiting from portugal made this salad and it was awesome, simply put. i only knew what was in the salad, not the amounts, so i just eyeballed the amounts.

records.name: simply sardine pate
records.text: who would have thought that sardines could be so addictive. i have to confess that when my friend served this at her party i ate half of the pate before anyone else found it.

records.name: sizzling spanish garlic prawns   tapas style
records.text: sizzling spanish seafood, perfect for a summer's evening or a tapas party. this simple, baked dish is one of our favourites, great with a glass of ice-cold fino.

records.name: sizzling spanish garlic prawns   tapas style
records.text: you can serve these in the middle of the table - in a large, attractive earthenware dish or in individual bowls. provide plenty of paper napkins for fingers and faces!! or, finger bowls with iced lemon water would be a nice idea.

records.name: sizzling spanish garlic prawns   tapas style
records.text: tactile food at its best!.

records.name: skillet jambalaya
records.text: a recipe from the best 30-minute recipe of cook's illustrated. if you can't find andouille, use tasso, chorizo or linguiça sausage. serve with plenty of tabasco. you can use your favorite creole spice blend instead of old bay seasoning.

records.name: skillet linguica with pasta
records.text: this recipe from the azorean greenbean website, dedicated to preserving azorean cooking, is a dish that was served in the childhood home of the blogger.

records.name: skinny portuguese kale and potato soup  caldo verde
records.text: a skinny version of a portuguese classic.

records.name: slow cooked beef stiffado
records.text: this is a greek beef and onion stew, not taken from a greek cook book but from 150 best slow cooker recipes by judith finlayson.

records.name: slow cooked beef stiffado
records.text: i have cooked many traditional recipes from many cook books that i've brought home from greek holidays but i always return to this recipe for its great flavours and ease to cook.

records.name: slow cooked portuguese lamb
records.text: a delicious recipe that creates a very soft succulent meal.

records.name: slow cooked beef stifado
records.text: i have this addiction, i have to read every recipe that i come to!!  here is one that i haven't had time to make yet, but man, oh man, does it sound good,  reading the ingredients just make my mouth water - definately on my to-do list, and in the near future i predict!!.

records.name: smoked salmon and eggs on toast with capers and dill
records.text: inspired by sardines and eggs on toast from cookthink. com, this scandinavian-influenced recipe makes a good breakfast or a light lunch.

records.name: smokey guacamole
records.text: found online courtesy of natalieskillercuisine. com. i love guacamole so this will be made soon!.

records.name: sopa de cenoura   carrot soup   portugal
records.text: this recipe is submitted for play in zwt8 – spain/portugal. it is a recipe by ana patuleia ortins  this is a truly wonderful dish that is easy to make and loaded with vitamin a.

records.name: sopa de cenoura   carrot soup   portugal
records.text: it is unique because a straight forward puréed soup that does not require other ingredients to give it additional texture is unusual in portuguese cooking. when entertaining, i dress this soup up with a drizzle of heavy cream.

records.name: sopa dourada  portuguese christmas golden soup
records.text: golden soup is actually a portuguese dessert served during the christmas season in portugal. this recipe is from "the taste of portugal" a great portuguese cookbook by edite vieira.

records.name: sopa verde
records.text: this is a delicious kale and chicken soup with plenty of garlic, white wine and that light, distinctive portuguese flavor of cloves.

records.name: sopa verde
records.text: in portugal, "caldo" is generally a lighter soup, and "sopa" is a soup with more vegetables and meat, and is often thickened slightly by using potato cooking water, as this one is.

records.name: soupas   a  portuguese feast soup  t r l
records.text: this is a traditional portuguese soup served in homes, and especially at the holy ghost feast, a yearly celebration.

records.name: soupas   a  portuguese feast soup  t r l
records.text: i don't get to there any more, but at least i have the recipe! some of the true afficionados use several kinds of beef, including liver. all ingredient amts are estimates, as are the number of servings.

records.name: south beach portabella florentine
records.text: a light version of baked stuffed portobello mushrooms, suitable for phase 1 of the south beach diet and probably other diets as well. submitted for ready set cook winter 2005. note: spinach or mushroom haters should avoid this recipe.

records.name: spaghetti alla siracusana
records.text: something different to do with sardines! they blend into the other flavors, so this is not an overtly "fishy" taste. this is not  saucy, rather it just dresses the pasta and the bread crumb mixture adds texture as well as flavor.

records.name: spaghetti alla siracusana
records.text: from food and wine magazine.

records.name: spanish comfort food  egg   sausage casserole
records.text: a number of years ago in a village in spain i was served a dish similar to this recipe and thought of it as true comfort food. it was baked in a clay oven. it's been a while but this is my version of it.

records.name: spanish comfort food  egg   sausage casserole
records.text: it was served for breakfast but i think of it more as a one dish dinner meal. it is an easy recipe with minimal preparation. you can make it ahead, reheat adding the eggs for the last 10 minutes.

records.name: spanish comfort food  egg   sausage casserole
records.text: it can be as spicy or as tame as you like simply by  choosing a type of sausage that you like. if you can get portuguese linguica sausage they would be perfect.

records.name: spanish comfort food  egg   sausage casserole
records.text: i used spanish corizo-a very robust sausage full of smoke &  flavor,  you may even try ham slices instead of sausage. the cook time is for making the recipe straight through-for "do ahead" allow another 40 minutes.

records.name: spanish lentil soup with chorizo
records.text: when i first arrived in córdoba, spain to study for a year, the cook in my dorm served this, my first lunch in my new home. i had never had lentils before, but this dish quickly became my absolute favorite.

records.name: spanish lentil soup with chorizo
records.text: my additions to the recipe are the garlic, onion and potato; i tried carrot once but i overcooked it and was traumatized by the mushiness, so i haven't done that since.

records.name: spanish lentil soup with chorizo
records.text: the best part about this recipe is it costs less than $10 to make and feeds many.

records.name: spanish scrambled eggs with pimenton and asparagus
records.text: huevos revueltos con esparragos - this traditional spanish recipe is usually made with wild asparagus - but very tiny sprues will work equally well.

records.name: spanish scrambled eggs with pimenton and asparagus
records.text: this delicious and very indulgent light supper dish will feed four people with side dishes and crusty bread, or two greedy people! it is also excellent served as a tapas dish - make sure there is lots of bread to scoop it up with!.

records.name: spanish tapas manchego  membrillo and chorizo toasties
records.text: this is such a great recipe! i found it in a supermarket recipe leaflet, and i have made these tasty little toasted sandwiches regularly since then. they are great for tapas style appetisers or, serve them for a light lunch or snack.

records.name: spanish tapas manchego  membrillo and chorizo toasties
records.text: try to use a high quality chorizo that contains real spanish smoked paprika. if you cannot source "membrillo", a spanish quince paste, then you could use a high fruit content jam or preserve.

records.name: spanish tapas manchego  membrillo and chorizo toasties
records.text: serve these as appetisers with glasses of chilled fino sherry. alternatively, these can be served for a light lunch or a snack.

records.name: spanish tomato bread with jamn serrano
records.text: these tasty tapas snacks are ready in just 5 minutes, the perfect accompaniment for a drinks, tapas or summer cocktail party. jamón serrano is a spanish ham & similar to prosciutto - which you could use instead.

records.name: spanish tomato bread with jamn serrano
records.text: try to use sun ripened (not cold frame) tomatoes - they really make a huge difference to this recipe! this recipe serves 10 to 12 people, with other accompaniments on offer.

records.name: spanish white bean tortilla with piri piri sauce
records.text: entered for safe-keeping. from june 2012 vegetarian times. a spanish tortilla is actually a frittata with a starchy filling like potatoes or beans.

records.name: spanish white bean tortilla with piri piri sauce
records.text: this recipe includes a piri-piri sauce to season the frittata and to make a sauce to serve with it. the piri piri spice mix appears as recipe #479857 #479857.

records.name: special garlic shrimp
records.text: this looks and tastes the the garlic shrimp that you would order from a portuguese/spanish restaurant.

records.name: special roasted potatoes
records.text: elegant and delicious. try this - you'll love it!.

records.name: spiced  beef
records.text: easy recipe i got off of the may issue of chatelaine. makes excellent meatloaf, burgers, meatballs and more.

records.name: spiced bean stew
records.text: an arabic-style dish containing delicious mixture of spices and beans. from the book: the kitchen shrink: foods and recipes for a healthy mind by natalie savona. substitute nutmeg for cardamom if desired.

records.name: spiced bean stew
records.text: add a dash of chili powder for added spice. you can use any canned beans as well as preparing your own dried beans. both canned and dried beans taste about the same but using dried beans would be a healthier choice.

records.name: spiced bean stew
records.text: if using dry beans prepare them according to your recipe or as noted on package before adding to recipe.

records.name: spiced red wine punch
records.text: wonderful punch for a holiday cocktail party. the holiday spice syrup recipe makes 3 cups and can be refrigerated for up to 1 week.

records.name: spiced red wine punch
records.text: the left overs can be used in a great drink recipe: december stormy #146719 recipe is by eben klemm, the supremely creative bar manager and mixologist at pico, new york's most elegant portuguese restaurant.

records.name: spiced red wine punch
records.text: punch needs to stand at room temperature for 1 hour before serving.

records.name: spicy cod greenport
records.text: great buttery recipe for codfish. i found this on the website for the new york seafood council and tried it last night. it was super good and easy to make.

records.name: spicy cod greenport
records.text: i didn't baste as directed because i wasn't sure if the crumbs were supposed to be spooned over the top of the fish or not. i also had to cook mine a little longer, but it came out great.

records.name: spicy sardine dip
records.text: a tiny bit of my portugese heritage all jacked up with american ingredients. when we were kids, my dad would gather us kids around and we would share a bowl of this nutty goodness, even though it grossed my mom out.

records.name: spicy sardine dip
records.text: now i eat this thinking of dad, all while grossing my dh out!!.

records.name: spicy shrimp mozambique
records.text: a portuguese shrimp recipe that can be served as an appetizer or as a main meal.

records.name: spinach stuffed portobellos
records.text: i got this recipe from a recipe card at walmart.

records.name: spinach with pine nuts and almonds  espinacas con pinones y almo
records.text: found on alleasyrecipes. com. posted for zwt8- spain/portugal.

records.name: spinach with raisins and pine nuts
records.text: from the new spanish table, posted for zwt 3, spain and portugal.

records.name: spinach stuffed portobello mushrooms
records.text: i think this was taken from the light & tasty magazine.

records.name: sponge cake  portuguese pao de lo
records.text: this is a delicious light and airy textured sponge cake. it tastes just like the ones i used to buy at a portuguese bakery. yummy served with vanilla ice cream and strawberries.

records.name: spring mackerel with sour grapes and saffron salsa
records.text: this recipe comes from the portuguese islands of madeira and the azores (chicharros de agraco com molho de acafrao).

records.name: spring mackerel with sour grapes and saffron salsa
records.text: fresh sardines and mackerel are favorites in the portuguese cuisine and while fresh sardines are hard to find, mackerel are more readily available.

records.name: spring mackerel with sour grapes and saffron salsa
records.text: usually made in midsummer, the grapes used are sour because they are in the middle of their growing season and are thus immature -- you can substitute mature grapes, unless you have a vineyard nearby!  the ingredients all speak of portugal: fish, olive oil, saffron, garlic, onion, grapes.

records.name: spring mackerel with sour grapes and saffron salsa
records.text: traditionally, this  is made in a casuela, an unglazed earthenware dish which will fry without burning. you can substitute any heavy seasoned cast iron or non-stick pan.

records.name: spring mackerel with sour grapes and saffron salsa
records.text: an unseasoned pan will ruin the wonderful cornmeal coating and skin of the fish. we had this recipe at a restaurant in the douro valley, but this version is from elisabeth luard's "the food of spain and portugal".

records.name: spring mackerel with sour grapes and saffron salsa
records.text: submitted for zaar world tour 5 (2009).

records.name: steak chicana
records.text: incredible portuguese/hispanic comfort food. thanks to my dad for preparing this recipe so often when we were growing up.

records.name: steamed clams  portuguese style
records.text: with a large portuguese population in ri, this is typical of how steamed clams are served ('steamers'). this is a combo of several recipes. it's great w/some crusty bread to sop us the broth. prep time includes 4 hrs cold water bath in fridge.

records.name: stefado  greek beef stew with small onions
records.text: stefado is a delicious greek beef stew made with small onions, tomato paste, red wine and spices (typically bay leaf and cinnamon). it's super-easy and is scrumptious over rice or a heap of mashed potatoes.

records.name: sticky walnut and grape chicken
records.text: this is pretty quick to make and is super yummy. it was discovered one hungry night. the recipe is a major adaption of something i read in a cookbook once (though that involved guinea fowl, madeira and a lot of other things i'd never find).

records.name: sticky walnut and grape chicken
records.text: i used chicken thighs because that's all i had, i think you should be able to use anything else though. breast meat might be a *little* dry. the quantities i have given are quite small.

records.name: sticky walnut and grape chicken
records.text: it should feed one hungry person, or perhaps a lighter meal for two. i haven't doubled the recipe before, but it should still work fine.

records.name: stir fried beef with madeira sauce
records.text: for a really good low cal meal, serve this over any leafy veggie,(romaine,spinach, chopped cabbage, etc. ).

records.name: strawberry buttermilk oatmeal muffins
records.text: recipe by dianatakesabite. blogspot. com.

records.name: strawberry mango limonata
records.text: so about a month ago, we celebrated our daughter’s first birthday!  a mother goose-themed party, i had to have something for "jack and jill" to contribute to the party. i didn’t want plain water, and i didn’t sparkling water.

records.name: strawberry mango limonata
records.text: but i did i have some san pelligrino limonata (fizzy lemonade) in my stockpile!  i ran an extensive search online for drinks using limonata, but couldn't find much that wasn't alcoholic.

records.name: strawberry mango limonata
records.text: i kept reading about people asking for strawberry mango limonata recipes, though. it is apparently a very popular drink at the olive garden.

records.name: strawberry mango limonata
records.text: i figured, what the heck?  "jack and jill" probably went up the hill to get water and berries for their mom's lemonade anyway!   well, i can’t vouch that my version is anywhere similar to the olive garden version (since i've never had it) but i like it (and so did our guests, young and old).

records.name: strawberry mango limonata
records.text: hope you enjoy it, too!.

records.name: string beans   feijao verde ou carrpato guisado
records.text: this is from portugal and was found in the worlds best recipes. posted for zwt5.

records.name: stuffed baked sardines
records.text: grilled, baked and fried, sardines are eaten in all mediterranean coastal ports. i have chosen to stuff these sardines to make a more robust dish.

records.name: stuffed baked sardines
records.text: if you find that pomegranates are out of season, dried cranberries make an acceptable and appropriately tart substitute for the crimson pomegranate seeds.

records.name: stuffed balsamic grilled portabella mushrooms
records.text: grilled portobellos, with smoked mozzarella cheese and balsamic vinegar, set on a mound of steamed spinach. i'm hungry! great summer fare from delicious living magazine.

records.name: stuffed mushrooms
records.text: i discovered this recipe in better homes and gardens several years ago. it can be served as an appetizer or vegetable. i make it as an appetizer for holidays, and use portobello mushrooms when served as a side dish.

records.name: stuffed portobella mushrooms with tuna   swiss cheese
records.text: a quick and tasty mushroom appetizer or light lunch. serve with salad and some crusty bread.

records.name: stuffed portobellini mushrooms
records.text: a friend gave me this recipe. it's very different and very flavorful.

records.name: stuffed portobello mushrooms
records.text: found in toh's june/july 2008 magazine. submitted by mike bass who says you can also substitute feta or cream cheese for the goat cheese.

records.name: stuffed portobello mushrooms with spinach and goat cheese
records.text: the filling can be made up to 2 days ahead of time and refrigerated. rewarm the filling before stuffing the mushrooms.

records.name: sugar cookies  south africa
records.text: a spicy sugar cookie from south africa. the addition of brandy and port wine make these unique. posted for zwt 2006. cooking time does not include chilling the dough before rolling.

records.name: sugee cake
records.text: this is a very famous cake among the portuguese eurasian families. no christmas tradition is complete without it in malaysia.

records.name: sweet bread
records.text: this bread is dense and has a great colour, good with stews, meat dishes or with tea or coffee. i got this recipe from a portuguese cookbook. and love making it. enjoy.

records.name: sweet rice pudding    arroz doce   portugal
records.text: this recipe is submitted for play in zwt8 – spain/portugal. it is a recipe by ana patuleia ortins. a lovely rice pudding that is flavored with orange and garnished with cinnamon.

records.name: sweet savory chick pea curry
records.text: this is an unusual twist on the classic curry dish, which has a sweet kick to it with fennel undertones. the raisins and carrots add a rich color and delightful taste that will satiate your palate.

records.name: sweet savory chick pea curry
records.text: this dish comes from my mother in law, shirley in south africa where many african dishes have an indian influence because they descended in the 19th century as indentured workers transported to work on the sugar plantations of natal.

records.name: sweet savory chick pea curry
records.text: the result is a fusion indo-african dish, which is best served over basmati rice.

records.name: tamale casserole   crock pot
records.text: dh hates tamales and i love them. i'm posting several recipes so that when he's out of town i can go on a tamale binge and know where to find the recipes! you can use either chicken or beef tamales for this.

records.name: tamale casserole   crock pot
records.text: this one is from the best slow cooker cookbook ever by natalie haughton.

records.name: tapas 177 s rosemary aoli
records.text: this is a delicious, flavourful aïoli recipe from the rochester, ny restaurant, tapas 177. it was printed in bon appétit (nov. 2000). it works really well on turkey sandwiches, on grilled portobello mushrooms, or fish.

records.name: tapas 177 s rosemary aoli
records.text: it's also really great with roasted garlic (rather than raw) and with homemade mayo. yield: makes about 1 cup.

records.name: tapas style spanish  rioja marinated chorizo sausage
records.text: a deliciously simple and yet very tasty spanish tapas dish. the beauty of this recipe is that is steeps in the wine for 24 hours - making it very easy to plan ahead.

records.name: tapas style spanish  rioja marinated chorizo sausage
records.text: serve in an an attractive earthenware dish and sprinkle with chopped flat leaf parsley.

records.name: tapas style spanish  rioja marinated chorizo sausage
records.text: i like to skewer these with toothpicks, to make it easier and less messy to eat! do try to use very high quality spanish chorizo sausage - the cheaper types do not taste nearly as good, and contain a very high fat content.

records.name: tasty spanish oven rice
records.text: one of our favorite rice dishes.

records.name: tavira tuna steaks
records.text: adapted from "food of spain and portugal".

records.name: tender beef kabobs  shashlik
records.text: recipe from natashaskitchen. com.

records.name: tenders pepperonata
records.text: i got this recipe a long time ago on another site. i found it to be an easy dish to prepare with nice flavor. it is good for a beginner chef. i serve this over angel hair pasta, tossed with olive oil, garlic cloves and parmesan cheese.

records.name: texas trash salsa
records.text: my husband and i lived on a small island in the azores for two years. fresh foods were hard to come by at times, so our group of friends all found many recipes using canned foods.

records.name: texas trash salsa
records.text: this recipe is from a friend named bobbie and i still make it today, even though i can now find a multitude of fresh ingredients. this is also good when used as a topping for hamburgers.

records.name: texas trash salsa
records.text: if you want to make it spicier, you can add chopped jalapenos or hot sauce to taste. cook time is chilling time.

records.name: thai masaman chicken    gaeng masaman gai
records.text: compliments of the website importfood. com which states: "the "massaman" indicates that the recipe is of a "musselman" or islamic origin.

records.name: thai masaman chicken    gaeng masaman gai
records.text: it probably owes something to early portuguese influences, and is similar in concept to the "sour and hot" goan-style vindaloo dishes. by thai standards this is usually a fairly mild curry.

records.name: thai masaman chicken    gaeng masaman gai
records.text: " begin planning  your menu and preparing the ingredients the day before.

records.name: thanksgiving green bean bake  revisited
records.text: sooo good!  from bh&g magazine, nov. 2005. same flavors in a new way. instead of french fried onions, use a fresh onion cut into wedges; in place of mushroom soup, use fresh baby portobello, cremini or button  mushrooms.

records.name: thanksgiving green bean bake  revisited
records.text: this can be made ahead! i just made it and it looks great (i used a red onion). i'll reheat it on thanksgiving. * i used about 3 lbs. beans and doubled the olive oil, balsamic, and soy but kept the cheese the same and only used 3 tbsp. milk.

records.name: thanksgiving green bean bake  revisited
records.text: if you use splenda brown sugar, use half the amount, so use 1 1/2 tbsp. which is how i made it.

records.name: thanksgiving green bean bake  revisited
records.text: this went over very well at my thanksgiving! * i found it is easy to do the beans first then put them in a bowl with mushrooms and toss them in there with the soy, balsamic and olive oil and then use the pan to cook the onions- i also made thin wedges and they separated in the pan which was fine and added more color on top.

records.name: thanksgiving green bean bake  revisited
records.text: i didn't put it in the oven for the last 5-8 minutes to heat through since i made this ahead. i simple made it up to adding the cheese and onions on top and then on thurs. i will heat the whole dish through.

records.name: the coach house s black bean soup
records.text: the coach house restaurant on waverly place in new york city was legendary. it was owned by a greek, the beloved leon lianides, and dedicated to serving classic american food in an era when fine dining spoke french.

records.name: the coach house s black bean soup
records.text: after suffering ups and downs in its later years, it closed for good in 1993, and mr. lianides died in 1998.

records.name: the coach house s black bean soup
records.text: but there are plenty of new yorkers who still grow misty-eyed at the thought of the coach house corn sticks, the black bean soup with madeira and -- sweetest memory of all -- the mocha dacquoise.

records.name: the coach house s black bean soup
records.text: i had acquired the black bean soup recipe back in the early 80's, and decided to post it here for posterity, and for those who might remember it fondly. beware, though, that there is nothing quick about making this soup.

records.name: the oxford bishop  19th century spiced mulled port wine
records.text: a lovely traditional old english recipe by eliza acton, a 19th century victorian cookery writer of great repute.

records.name: the oxford bishop  19th century spiced mulled port wine
records.text: this unique beverage is also mentioned in "the christmas carol" by charles dickens, although in the book it was called smoking bishop!! this is a fruity & spiced warm mulled port wine drink which brings a glow to your face & warmth to your aching joints, believe me! just the festive beverage to have after returning from christmas midnight mass or whilst listening to carols from king's college on christmas eve.

records.name: the oxford bishop  19th century spiced mulled port wine
records.text: also wonderful as a welcome drink for a party or special event. it is easily topped up if extra guests arrive, and i have used wine in the past when the port was finished!.

records.name: three mushrooms crostini
records.text: this recipe is from the issue of february 2006 of coup de pouce. it is recommanded to use exotic mushrooms (oyster, shiitake, stem removed and portobello).

records.name: tilapia a la portuguesa
records.text: this is very easy to make and is simply delicious. the wine is an optional ingredient, but i think it really gives the fish great flavor.

records.name: tomates recheados  portuguese deviled tomatoes
records.text: this is a great portuguese appetizer. it also can accompany grilled meat or fish very nicely.

records.name: tomatoe rice
records.text: posting this recipe for zwt 2012. found it on the portugal website and sounds fresh and easy - a nice side with just about anything. states it's a vegatarian dish.

records.name: torresmos   marinated pork with chili peppers  wine and garlic
records.text: this recipe is submitted for play in zwt8 – spain/portugal. it is a recipe by ana patuleia ortins  this is similar to the another recipe except that it uses pork butt and is cooked in the oven.

records.name: torresmos   marinated pork with chili peppers  wine and garlic
records.text: note: this can also be braised on the stove top in the marinade until fork tender. note:  prep time is the meat marinating in the fridge overnight.

records.name: torresmos portuguese garlic roasted pork
records.text: *needs to marinate 24 hours* the marinade is a wonderful flavor enhancer for the pork. original recipe from david leite, and adapted to our taste.

records.name: tortellini and caponata bake
records.text: i made my caponata recipe (recipe #184613) for appetizers and had 2 cups left and had to decide what to do with it.

records.name: tortellini and caponata bake

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: i have lots of wonderful wild purslane growing in my garden, and apart from adding it to salads, it is extremely useful in keeping the weeds down! although purslane is rarely seen on our own tables today, this pretty herb has a long and interesting history.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: english medieval cooks and gardeners loved purslane; in fact, it is often known as the “elizabethan salad herb” in the uk, as it was extremely popular as a form of greenery during  that era.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: it is thought that the genus name, portulaca, is from the latin porto and laca meaning ‘milk carrier’ in reference to its milky sap. the species name oleracea is latin and means ‘potherb’.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: native to persia and india, it was introduced into europe by arabs in the 15th century as a salad herb.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: purslane makes an excellent edible ground cover and in many countries, it is cultivated as a vegetable, though many unknowingly consider it a weed. it was once believed to offer protection from evil spirits.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: purslane is very nutritious and is rich in vitamin c and alpha linolenic acid (one of the omega-3 fatty acids).

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: which the body converts into the essential fatty acids known as epa: almost 3 percent of purslane by weight consists of alpha-, beta-, and gamma-carotene and lutein.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: not only is it easy to grow purslane in your home garden, it is hard to keep it from overrunning other plants. when the plants are young, they make a tart but succulent addition to salads with just a little washing and dicing.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing
records.text: after the plants are mature, they are best parboiled in salted water for 1-2 minutes before adding them to salads.

records.name: wild purslane salad with olive oil and lemon dressing

records.name: italian beef sandwiches  west sider style

records.text: imagine, right after we moved, we bought "beefs" at a stand, and to our horror, found little bitty onion chunks and carrots mixed in the shreds of roast beef.

records.text: this was definitely not like "back inda naybuhhood" !! personally, we like slices, others like shreds, but still -- the only veggies allowed to be seen are the peppers tucked in once  you load your sandwich.

records.name: italian beef sandwiches  west sider style
records.text: make sure to get a good firm italian bread loaf or crusty, full-bodied sandwich rolls. wimpy, airy bread and rolls won't hold the "gravy", as we call it, and it's just not a beef without that.

records.name: italian beef sandwiches  west sider style

records.name: hyderabadi chicken biryani

records.name: hyderabadi chicken biryani

records.name: 3 2 1 sausage dip

records.name: honey bourbon brine  for steaks
records.text: just wait until you taste your steaks with this brine, you will be in heaven lol! it's a fantastic brine for steaks and also any cut of beef. the brine is enough for 6 (1-inch) steaks or a few less thicker steaks.

records.name: honey bourbon brine  for steaks
records.text: do not brine the steaks anymore than 6 hours, 8 hours maximum, and please do not brine for 24 hours! the steaks must be left out on the counter for a couple of hours to bring down to almost room temperature, this is an important step to relax the meat fibers, this will create a more tender and juicy steak, so start this recipe early in the day.

records.name: honey bourbon brine  for steaks
records.text: use kosher salt *only* for this brine!.

records.name: beef lombardi casserole

records.name: beef lombardi casserole
records.text: :)  i like to use the brand ro-tel tomatoes with mild green chilies. if you like hot, by all means use the original. we just like the mild flavor better.

records.name: beef lombardi casserole
records.text: also, i like to mix the whole tomatoes and the diced tomatoes in a blender for just a few seconds just enough to break up the tomatoes a bit but, this is not necessary. i just like my tomatoes broken down a little more, yet not saucy.

records.name: beef lombardi casserole

records.name: easy olive caper relish

records.name: green papaya salad  som tum
records.text: in thailand, green papaya salad is called som tum, with “som” meaning “sour” and “tum” referring to the pounding sound of the large pestle used to crush ingredients.

records.name: green papaya salad  som tum
records.text: it is eaten by itself as a snack, or with marinated grilled beef and chicken. in the middle of a hot afternoon, green papaya salad wakes you up with the sour and the spicy.

records.name: green papaya salad  som tum
records.text: in  laos and thailand, there is always a vendor selling green papaya salad. the most important flavor for lao green papaya salad is the heat from chilies. everything else is there to balance it out.

records.name: green papaya salad  som tum
records.text: peanuts in green papaya salad are thai, not authentic lao, which the major difference.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: first you must catch your haggis! these little creatures are very shy and extremely wiley - so you must proceed with caution and patience! i find the best place to find them is behind or under highland heather bushes, although i have been known to catch a couple lurking near thistles! having caught your haggis - you must treat it with great respect and cook it well for the burns night tribute supper! that is why my haggis is baked instead of boiled - and it is served with lindseylcw's special cumberland sauce with lashings of good scotch whisky! other traditional accompaniments are: clapshot, bashed neeps and tatties, rumbledethumps, buttered leeks, skirlie mash, champit tatties and buttered cabbage.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: don't forget the "correct" format for a burns night supper: chairperson's opening address. a few welcoming words start the evening and the meal commences with the selkirk grace. the company are asked to stand to receive the haggis.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: a piper then leads the chef, carrying the haggis to the top table, while the guests accompany them with a slow handclap. the chairman or invited guest then recites burns' famous poem to a haggis, with great enthusiasm.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: when he reaches the line 'an cut you up wi' ready slight', he cuts open the haggis with a sharp knife. it's customary for the company to applaud the speaker then stand and toast the haggis with a glass of whisky.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: the immortal memory:   one of the central features of the evening; an invited guest is asked to give a short speech on burns.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: there are many different types of immortal memory speeches, from light-hearted to literary, but the aim is the same - to outline the greatness and relevance of the poet today.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: toast to the lasses: the main speech is followed by a more light-hearted address to the women in the audience. originally this was a thank you to the ladies for preparing the food and a time to toast the 'lasses' in burns' life.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: the tone should be witty, but never offensive, and should always end on a concilliatory note. response: the turn of the lasses to detail men's foibles. again, should be humorous but not insulting.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: poem and songs:  once the speeches are complete the evening continues with songs and poems. these should be a good variety to fully show the different moods of burns muse.

records.name: burns night baked highland haggis with whisky cumberland sauce
records.text: favourites for recitations are tam o' shanter, address to the unco guid, to a mouse and holy willie's prayer. the evening will culminate with the company standing, linking hands and singing auld lang syne to conclude the programme.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: i lived in big sur during the 70' and 80's. i went to nepenthe practically everyday! my friends lived and worked there. this is one of the favorite dishes served there made by chef willie nelson.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: and now some history: in 1947, lolly and bill fassett moved with their five children into the log house in big sur.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: once a get away for the trail club of jolon, the cabin is perched on a hillside overlooking the south coast of monterey county.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: big sur, with yellow genesta popping in august heat; purple lupine tangling with sage on mountains shrouded in fog, was a wild sanctuary. bill and lolly imagined an open-air pavilion with good food and wine and dancing under the stars.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: it would be a place where people from up and down the coast would come and forget their cares. working with rowan maiden, a student of frank lloyd wright, they sketched out their vision.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: legendary big sur builders, frank and walter trotter built the structure using native materials; redwood, hewn from the canyons and adobe bricks, which lolly made with her own hands.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: and people came, not just from the ridge-tops and canyons, but from all over the world: vagabonds, poets, artist, lovers.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: later, the phoenix shop would grow out of the traveling merchants who spread their colorful wares on lolly's living room floor.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: when there were fewer people on the coast, when nights were longer and days lonelier, nepenthe was a place to gather.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: famous even before it opened for it's unique architecture and incandescent views, nepenthe is known today for its family hospitality, legendary guests, and irresistible "ambrosiaburger.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger
records.text: "   in greek, nepenthe means "isle of no care," a place to find surcease from sorrow. so it continues to be for travelers today. a place to stop, to dream, to lift a cup to kindness.

records.name: nepenthe s famous ambrosia burger

records.text: [edit 3/24/08:  after a couple bad (and unexplained) reviews, i think i should note that this recipe is not for novice cooks. it is quite labor intensive and requires a ton of prep work. i say this knowing that the end result is well worth it.

records.name: ratatouille terrine
records.text: please do give it a try, if you're looking for a fabulous ratatouille.

records.name: ratatouille terrine
records.text: ]     my "meat-and-potatoes" husband never missed the meat or potatoes in this dinner, and my vegetarian friends were blown away when we served this at a dinner party (if you make it for a dinner party, either make it group effort or make it ahead of time).

records.name: ratatouille terrine
records.text: it's out of this world good - adapted from gourmet. tip: when heating the olive oil for each round of sauteing, do not let it get hot enough that it begins to smoke.

records.name: ratatouille terrine
records.text: also, the wetness of the tomatoes can make the hot oil jump, so be careful when sauteing. i know this all sounds like a pain, but like i said, it's worth it.

records.name: aromatic noodles with lime peanut sauce
records.text: ellie krieger, the food you crave; 1 c. pasta, 1 cup vegetables, and 2 ½ t. sauce = 450 calories.

records.name: cranberry ginger fizzes
records.text: from real simple. and it doesn't get easier than this! you can also make this in individual servings.

records.name: my tater tot casserole
records.text: this is a recipe i received from a friend many years ago and tweaked to suit my family's tastes.

records.name: strawberry shortcake cupcakes
records.text: a sweet treat for anyone who loves strawberries! recipe is from redbook.

records.name: jambalaya alaskan style
records.text: this recipe came from carol, of anchorage, ak, and was posted at the the alaska seafood cookbook website from the alaska seafood marketing institute.

records.name: jambalaya alaskan style
records.text: the site suggests to serve with a cool, tangy coleslaw and plenty of cold beer-or something else to quench the fire! this recipe is moderately hot, and you can substitute less spicy sausages, if you like.

records.name: jambalaya alaskan style
records.text: if you have nice chunks of cooked salmon or halibut, or seared scallops, you can add those when you add the shrimp, too!  they make a nice addition.

records.name: tropical chicken pizza from boston pizza
records.text: have not tried this recipe yet. this is one of my favourite pizza's from boston pizza.

records.name: mint mousse tart
records.text: junior mints are my candy of choice. always! this is just an added treat for me but oh so good and chocolate minty!!!.

records.name: mushroom vegetable soup
records.text: lowfat soup for the crockpot. can substitute beef broth with vegetable stock to make vegetarian.

records.name: healthy zucchini bread
records.text: this bread is great for you!  there is just a little sugar and no oil or butter. not only that, it tastes great too. it is perfect if you are watching your weight, or for feeding toddlers and kids. you can use fresh or frozen zucchini.

records.name: healthy zucchini bread
records.text: you can add in 1 cup dried fruit if you want too. raisins are wonderful in it.

records.name: curried corn salad
records.text: this is a delicious side with chicken or pork. i love how the flavors mix together. although this is a side dish, it is my favorite part of any meal it is served with. i could sit and eat a bowl of this with just a bit of bread to go with it.

records.name: curried corn salad
records.text: this was originally a fit for life recipe, but my mom made some alterations to it.

records.name: easy hermits
records.text: these are easy, tasty little buggers, sure to please both kids and adults alike. you can also use diced, mixed candied fruits instead of the raisins. i always use walnuts for the chopped nuts. yum!!!.

records.name: grilled salmon with a pineapple  mango and strawberry salsa
records.text: fresh salmon is just the best. i go fishing in alaska once a year and bring home a fair amount. testing different peoples recipes is great. this one is from emeril. i keep some of his essence on hand at all times.

records.name: grilled salmon with a pineapple  mango and strawberry salsa
records.text: the fruit salsa is so refreshing and a great summer time addition to the fish. i have not tried it on other fish but i am sure it would be great.

records.name: sourdough crumpets
records.text: a quick, easy way to use up your sourdough discard, which i always hate to throw out. i got this from the king arthur website and we love it. you can use proper english muffin rings or clean tuna cans with the bottoms cut out.

records.name: rum punch for one  barbados
records.text: i found this recipe on the totally barbados website when looking for a rum cocktail that doesn't require any tropical fruit (only because i didn't have any on hand at the time). so i gave this a try, and it's quite good.

records.name: rum punch for one  barbados
records.text: i made it with passion fruit juice instead of water.

records.name: rum punch for one  barbados
records.text: the original source explained that the word "punch" comes from the indian word "paunch", which means five, and the five refers to the five ingredients of sour, sweet, strong, weak and spice.

records.name: rum punch for one  barbados
records.text: and this cocktail follows the standard of including one measure of sour, two of sweet, three of strong, and four of weak with a dash of bitters and sprinkle of spice.

records.name: cherry mash
records.text: alot like the cherry mash candy i used to buy when i was young.

records.name: low carb cheeseburger soup
records.text: my family loves this soup, especially on one of those rainy, cold days that we have so many of during the winter in western washington. they don't even mind that it's low carb!.

records.name: baked chicken and spinach stuffing
records.text: anna ginsbergs, 2006 pillsbury bake-off winner. an old-fashioned chicken dinner is updated for two, with a surprising ingredient that makes the spinach stuffing extra special.

records.name: baked chicken and spinach stuffing
records.text: the zaar computer is not recognizing '1 package' of pillsbury dunkables. (the recipe uses only 9 sticks, and 3 of the syrup cups from the package of dunkables).

records.name: roasted string beans
records.text: here is a delicious side dish that goes great with steak. the shallots and garlic start to caramelize adding a depth to the dish. these green beans certainly are not your typical beans.

records.name: roasted string beans
records.text: if you really want to add something to dish roast some cherry tomatoes along with the beans, they add a great burst of flavor. i hope you enjoy!.

records.name: salmon with caramelized onion and fig sauce
records.text: light and easy.

records.name: smoked salmon omelet with herbs
records.text: epicurious. serve with an arugula salad and fresh fruit.

records.name: swedish cardamom meatballs
records.text: from a food network "calling all cooks" segment several years ago as made by inglill mutti with my alterations. these are about as swedish as they get and my once a year must make recipe each christmas season.

records.name: swedish cardamom meatballs
records.text: this joins my top ten favorite recipes! two tips:  cardamom can be expensive & hard to find. i finally found it at  "wild oats" where bulk spices are sold by the ounce.

records.name: swedish cardamom meatballs
records.text: i also use tyler florence's recipe for the accompanying lingonberry sauce, another hard to find item. i found 2 brands at cost plus world market, and i also hear it's sold at ikea if there's one near you.

records.name: blueberry oat flaxseed muffins
records.text: for the love of breakfast flyer.

records.name: triple chocolate cheesecake
records.text: this cheesecake is impressive to look at and to eat. the steps are easy but it takes some time to prepare. however, it freezes beautifully for up to a month, so it can be prepared far in advance of your event.

records.name: triple chocolate cheesecake
records.text: i have made this cheesecake many times as a birthday cake. use a high quality chocolate in this recipe, not chocolate chips or baking chocolate. try valrhona, callabeut or lindt, which you can get at many grocery stores. lindt bars come in 3 oz.

records.name: triple chocolate cheesecake
records.text: bars. also, this cake must bake at the temperature directed or it will be raw in the middle and overdone on the edges.

records.name: southern bbq sauce  texas variety
records.text: texans love their barbecue.

records.name: vegan bubble squeak cakes
records.text: this recipe comes straight from the bbc, except i veganized it and added a little something. bubble and squeak doesn’t need to come in cake form, but when given the choice, i can’t see myself ever not wanting to make it this way.

records.name: vegan bubble squeak cakes
records.text: i mean, look at the adorable little cakes, full of squeaky goodness!.

records.name: black bean soup  south beach diet phase 1
records.text: in newest book. haven't made yet.

records.name: sugar snap pea and strawberry salad
records.text: an easy way to use up strawberries (2 of those little green baskety thingies). light and summery too. from the diane mott davidson series about a caterer who solves murder mysteries. this one is from "the main corpse.

records.name: sugar snap pea and strawberry salad
records.text: " i read them for the recipes! if you don't have sugar snap peas, snow peas or green beans work too.

records.name: gerry s zucchni soup
records.text: a low fat hearty soup.

records.name: brined maple turkey with cream gravy
records.text: this appeared in cooking light's november 2002 issue. one of my all time favorite cooking light issues (2002 was a particularly spectacular year for cl). this turkey is moist, juicy and incredibly flavorful. don't let the cola stop you!.

records.name: michigan beans and sausage
records.text: i got this recipe from a taste of home cookbook, and have taken it to two potlucks and it was a big hit!.

records.name: lemon pudding dessert
records.text: a cool and yummy dessert thats great during the summer.

records.name: banana cupcakes with cream cheese frosting
records.text: adapted from cooking light (sept. 1999). original recipe uses plain fat-free yogurt, but i prefer powdered buttermilk, reconstituted. this allegedly yields 12 standard-sized cupcakes, but i like to make 24 mini ones for parties.

records.name: banana cupcakes with cream cheese frosting
records.text: nutmeg adds that special something.

records.name: avocado tower with tomato and almond sauce  and some shrimp
records.text: what more could you ask for? :)  it's elegant but easy and yummy. recipe is for 1 but can easily be increased.

records.name: amaretto freeze
records.text: amaretto ice cream treat!  quick & easy, but delicious. if you'd like, you can add some half and half or some milk to each serving and make a nice milkshake!  cooking time is freezing time.

records.name: shannon s meatballs
records.text: i came up with recipe for a friend's party. everybody loved them. i make them ahead of time and freeze them then defrost and throw into a crockpot with any type of spaghetti sauce.

records.name: braised brisket
records.text: from the ottawa jewish bulletin. this is a wonderfully flavorful and tender way to prepare brisket. it is best prepared the night before. don't be afraid of all the steps, it's actually pretty simple.

records.name: homemade canned salsa
records.text: fresh salsa for your dips or anything else you wish to use it with.

records.name: drunken meatballs  with crock pot instructions
records.text: i found these on another website ages ago ad they have since become a regular at my parties. you can use any bourbon but i have done well using southern comfort.

records.name: pb   h  ultimate quickie sandwich
records.text: i came up with this when i realized i was out of jelly and jam. now i eat it almost everyday for lunch with a few baby carrots on the side!.

records.name: chili glazed shrimp skewers
records.text: like i need another addiction--now it's mae ploy sweet asian chili sauce. from sunset.

records.name: creamy corn tortilla bake
records.text: a yummy veggie side dish, edited to add milk.

records.name: turkey and wild rice soup
records.text: found this recipe in a magazine years ago and have made it faithfully after thanksgiving ever since. it is similar to a.

records.name: broccoli   cauliflower salad
records.text: this is a family favorite! it goes with anything, whether grilling out or frying pork chops. wonderful!! a friend gave me this recipe. it is out of this world!.

records.name: sausage and potato pie
records.text: from reader's digest "one dish meals" cookbook, this yummy dish is a thin potato crust filled with sausage, cheese, red pepper and zucchini. we typically use the kielbasa option (cut into discs) with mozzarella cheese and red potatoes.

records.name: sausage and potato pie
records.text: it never lasts long!.

records.name: orange sesame chicken   vegetable stir fry
records.text: given to me by a friend.

records.text: a very good bread machine bread. this recipe makes a one pound loaf.

records.text: this is so easy to make. very flavorful. this recipe can easily be doubled.

records.name: green tea passion fruit spritzer
records.text: for green tea lovers, this is delicious.

records.name: crock pot   pulled pork
records.text: this was sent to me via email. i love crock pot recipes!.

records.name: family shrimp salad  ww core
records.text: this is a recipe from my dad's sister. using fat-free mayonnaise will make this a weight watchers core recipe. i have not made this yet, and servings are estimated.

records.name: banana pecan whole wheat pancakes
records.text: down in south carolina, i ordered these fantastic banana pecan buttermilk pancakes. this isn't with buttermilk, but it's very easy and very yummy.

records.name: apple smiles
records.text: another one of my no-flame-required, kid-friendly recipes. i remember making these in my after school program in grade school and loving them. they are a great wholesome activity for kids parties. just make sure an adult slices the apples.

records.name: apple smiles
records.text: my favorite apples to use are pink lady because the tart flavor is a nice compliment to the peanut butter. for a healthier variation, use cubed slightly green bananas instead of marshmallows. ripe bananas may be mushy.

records.name: apple smiles
records.text: if you are worried about peanut butter allergies, substitute cashew nut butter as it is far less common to be allergic to.

records.name: vegetable tetrazzini
records.text: a variation on a recipe i found in "1001 lowfat  vegetarian recipes"  this recipe can be made with as much or as little garlic as you want. the amount listed is the amount i usually use.

records.name: vegetable tetrazzini
records.text: the original had no garlic, and it didn't taste right to me.

records.name: double baked potatoes
records.text: these are amazing i make them all the time for dinner parties the mushroom and swiss go great together!!!.

records.name: chicken corn chowder   quick
records.text: great on a cold night after christmas shopping, and quick too! (cooking light).

records.name: double layer birthday cake   allergen free
records.text: i got this recipe from the www. foodallergy. org website. i never made it but am saving it here to come back to later. it is milk, egg, peanut, treenut, and soy free.

records.name: jamaican black fuitcake
records.text: one of the best fruitcakes i've ever made. my first attempt at posting this was cause to edit for clarification. the first step, mix all the fruits thoroughly with the alcohol, cover and let sit for up to a month at room temperature.

records.name: jamaican black fuitcake
records.text: the prep time doesn't include the macerating time. if you don't care for lime, substitute orange rind and orange essence for the lemon (or use half of each),.

records.name: cheddar cheese pie
records.text: a fabulous easy recipe that can be used as a main course or side dish. sure to please any cheese lover.

records.name: sweet green  mung  bean soup
records.text: a perfect dessert for an oriental meal. sometimes i just drink it as a snack. very fragrant due to the coconut milk.

records.name: sweet green  mung  bean soup
records.text: i've even poured it into a popsicle mold and ended up with a sweet bean popsicle! refreshing and low in fat (without the coconut, anyway *grin*)!.

records.name: crocked fruit
records.text: this is a like a fruit in sauce recipe for waffles, ice cream, crepe, pork,or even a basting sauce for ham adding fruit later as garnish. you can substitute pine apples cherries, strawbwrries, ect.

records.name: caramel whiskey sauce
records.text: wonderful on all sorts of things: greek yogurt, ice cream, pancakes, pies, bread pudding, and cakes to name a few.

records.name: war cake
records.text: this is a recipe my mother gave me. it was typical of the types of cakes baked during the war when shortages and rationing was in effect. it is moist and delicious. mother always made it at christmas time and we thought it was a real treat.

records.name: war cake
records.text: posted in response to a request.

records.name: shining star cookies
records.text: - after the cookies are done, you can thread a ribbon through the small holes and hang them on the christmas tree. but please don't eat them if you put them on the tree.

records.name: shining star cookies
records.text: - you will also need a large star-shaped cookie cutter, a fat drinking straw, a small round cookie cutter (slightly larger than the candy you are using), parchment paper, and a large baking sheets.

records.name: 7 alarm chili
records.text: i love the heat associated with chili and when i think chili, i think an immense amount of heat, equally balanced with flavor.

records.name: 7 alarm chili

records.text: you'll need a large crock pot for this chili, which contains beef chuck, ground beef, hot italian sausage and bacon, plus canned beans and plenty of hotness from chiles.

records.name: spinach balls
records.text: i got these off of allrecipes. i haven't tried them yet but they sound good. i am going to add them to my christmas buffet.

records.text: this recipe requires some time and effort but i think it is so worth it.

records.name: grilled  venison burgers
records.text: delicious venison burgers with that.

records.name: authentic jewish yiddish chicken soup
records.text: this is the way to make soup-you can alter the recipe a little here and there but this is the best. make sure that you include the chicken neck ( and the cleaned feet! ) in the soup. use kosher chicken and canned soup-its tastes better.

records.name: authentic jewish yiddish chicken soup
records.text: my recipe adaptation uses skinned chicken so there is a lot less fat to be skimmed off in this soup.

records.name: authentic jewish yiddish chicken soup
records.text: if you want very clear soup then cool first, strain the soup through cheesecloth and reheat, cut up chicken and vegetables and add back--but i served the soup as is.

records.name: ironman breakfast
records.text: my uncle is an ironman triathlete, and this is what he always eats on hard training days or before events. he always made it for me when i was little, so it's one of my ultimate comfort foods!.

records.name: greek lamb baked in clay pots
records.text: this method of roasting meat in clay pots or water jugs was used by women during the greek war of independance to surreptitously bake and bring food to their soliders in the mountains. any clay or earthen cookware will do.

records.name: greek lamb baked in clay pots
records.text: i use individual serving size clay bowls.

records.text: kids and adults love it, serve with a dollop of sour cream or sweet whiped cream if you like.

records.name: pumpkin raisin muffins fat free dairy free egg free
records.text: these muffins have no dairy, egg or fat added. they come out moist & delicious. i made these in a muffin magic appliance, not the oven, and they cook in less than half the time.

records.name: pumpkin raisin muffins fat free dairy free egg free
records.text: you can also substitute splenda blend for baking instead of white sugar (use 1/4 cup of the blend instead of 1/2 cup sugar).

records.text: a low-guilt sweet treat that my hippie mother made all the time. so good, most people don't guess they're not terrible for you.

records.name: parsnip soup
records.text: i love this soup and i know a lot of people love parsnips also and are looking for different ways to use it. i found this wonderful recipe in a magazine and it is so quick and easy and great on a cold winter's night.

records.name: curry roasted broccoflower
records.text: my son asked me to buy a broccoflower, and i had no idea how to cook it. the grower had a great recipe site tanimura & antle. my family loved it. its smells great when cooking too.

records.name: two cheese panini with tomato olive pesto
records.text: this is a tom colicchio recipe (wichcraft) that i cut in half, but once you make the pesto, it's easy to make 1 or 20. (i still don't see how they get 20 out of it--lol).

records.name: aunt betty s famous pie crust
records.text: my aunt betty was famous for her pies. as she is no longer with us, i believe she would want to share it.

records.name: puffy parmesan pinwheels
records.text: this is a great hors d'oeuvre that i found in a cosmopolitan holiday entertaining guide. my party guests loved them. i recommend using hungarian paprika as it has better flavor.

records.text: my friend lashella told me about this delicous meaty stew hergrandmother made her for birthday's.

records.text: this is our favorite bean dish, the one my mom is famous for. great for potlucks, picnics, or just any old time. this dish needs to sit 2 hours before baking. (cooking time includes this. ).

records.text: absolutely scruptous.

records.text: awesome blueberry muffins which use either fresh blueberries or frozen. yes the amounts for cinnamon and baking powder are right. enjoy!.

records.text: this recipe has been in my family since it was first made in a small town north of palermo, sicily.

records.name: off the boat  sicilian pasta sauce
records.text: i am exposing this family recipe because i know it will help some people be able to continue their love for pasta and still be able to stay on their diet.

records.name: blueberry dumplings
records.text: one of my childhood memories is picking wild blueberries with my siblings when our family went camping in northern ontario - then my mother would make blueberry dumplings for us! this recipe from jim dodge, food & beverage manager at the getty center in l.

records.name: blueberry dumplings
records.text: a. , is much better - sorry mom! wild blueberries are best - but cultivated or frozen blueberries or even saskatoons will work. top with creme fraiche or whipped cream.

records.text: this recipe i got from living for 6 weeks in dharamsala, himmachal pradesh, india.

records.text: from the website whats4eats, this is describes as a dish typical to costa rica and nicaragua. other variations are included below and give a regional taste from other parts of central america.

records.name: pulled pork  shrimp and mushroom etouffee
records.text: i created this one the other night on the fly with some leftovers, but i think i'm on to something new here. we had a hog roast for my birthday and had a ton of leftover smoked pork.

records.name: pulled pork  shrimp and mushroom etouffee
records.text: i also made some fresh morel mushrooms, and i was looking at the leftover mushroom infused oil, and said to myself "idea!, there's a quality roux in the making. ".

records.text: eggs with a difference. good for the lunchbox or great served with salad platters. family favourite.

records.name: chocolate   pizza

records.name: bob s red mill easy gluten free banana bread
records.text: this comes from the back of bob's red mill all purpose gf flour packaging. it's a quick and easy recipe.

records.name: bob s red mill easy gluten free banana bread
records.text: the bread is especially good toasted with butter!  i have substituted 1/2 almond meal and 1/2 white rice flour for the all purpose flour, and just about any combination of gf flours seems to work. i always leave out the raisins & nuts, too.

records.name: banberry jam
records.text: from linda j. amendt's book "blue ribbon preserves". the taste and color of this jam are delightful. please don't duplicate the ingredients, or the jam may fail to set.

records.name: super yummy crock pot pork roast
records.text: i put this in the crock pot before work sometimes. its nice to know there is a hot meal waiting for you at home. after a busy day, its a welcome treat!  i used a boneless pork loin roast but any cut will probably do.

records.name: super yummy crock pot pork roast
records.text: at the end, take some of the liquid and make a home made gravy to complete it. then all you need is a loaf of crusty bread and viola!!!  dinner.

records.name: low carbohydrate salad nicoise
records.text: this is a lovely adaptation of nicoise salad from a low carb recipe book i have. the recipe calls for 175g grilled tuna steak, however i used a tin of ocean rise yellow fin tuna slices in olive oil with chilli (sold by aldi in oz).

records.name: low carbohydrate salad nicoise
records.text: using a tuna in olive oil enables you to use the oil from the can to make a lovely spicy salad dressing.

records.name: low carbohydrate salad nicoise
records.text: my dh and i both enjoyed this very much and it is so quick and easy to make and low carb to boot! note: i made this again with other tinned tuna and i have to admit that the results are much better using the olive oil that the tuna has been canned in.

records.name: quick and healthy lentil stew with artichokes
records.text: i love this by itself in a big bowl on a cool night,  but it also pairs well with chicken or meat for those who 'need' meat.

records.name: bills chile
records.text: this is easy and the end product is excellent. you can also freeze it for later. we really enjoy it all year long but especilly the winter. sometimes we have over spegetti noodles. you have to try it!.

records.name: the sleeping pickle sandwich
records.text: a fun and cute way to serve up a hot ham, turkey or bologna and cheese sandwich to your little one. this recipe is courtesy of better homes and gardens kids' snacks; 1985.

records.name: egyptian rice     t r l
records.text: found this on another site and will be trying it today. there were a few ambiguities which i hope i fixed. i'll let you know how it turns out. :) cook time is a guess. check after about 15 mins.

records.name: fettuccine alfredo  again
records.text: my husband absolutely loves this version of fettuccine. very easy and good! my daughter put this in my cookbook,"blessed bounty. ".

records.text: dude, i love this recipe, people rave over my peach cobbler. my girlfriend is vegan so i like to make stuff vegan for her.

records.text: you can punch it up with more flavor with coconut extract if you really want a heavy duty flavor. this recipe is meant to have a hint of flavor and not an over powering coconut flavor.

records.name: blushing italian
records.text: campari is an alcoholic aperitif obtained from the infusion of bitter herbs, aromatic plants and fruit in alcohol and water. it is a type of bitters. regular campari has an astringent, bittersweet flavor, but a sweet campari is also available.

records.name: jo mama s sweet potato pie
records.text: i have been on a quest to find the best (at least my family's favorite) sweet potato pie. this has been the reigning champion to all since 1992. at thanksgiving, i cook it and a new contender each year.

records.name: jo mama s sweet potato pie
records.text: i am adding strong contenders to my cookbook as well.

records.name: lemon honey thyme focaccia
records.text: another lemon bread recipe, which can be made entirely in the bread machine (and is thus, no longer a focaccia) or taken out as dough and hand-formed into the focaccia and baked in the oven.

records.name: lemon honey thyme focaccia
records.text: note: the amount of yeast depends on the preparation, 2 teaspoons for machine or 1 tablespoon for the hand-formed loaf.

records.name: quick  n  easy beef   bean burritos
records.text: these are a weeknight favorite of our family's and they are made from ingredients i always have on hand! i can have dinner on the table in 40 minutes from start to finish and everyone always cleans their plates!.

records.name: crustless  lime  cheesecake
records.text: this is an excellent cheesecake recipe from mr. food, so "ooh its so good!". enjoy it.

records.name: ratbag steak
records.text: a little like carpetbag steak with a different suprise in the middle to oysters! this is obviously quite hot but you could replace the wasabi paste with a mild mustard if you must.

records.name: ratbag steak
records.text: the quantitity shown is enough for two small streaks or one large one.

records.name: ratbag steak
records.text: this is how i cooked mine but unless you have a very sharp knife you may find it easier to cut the pocket before marination and possibly while the steak is still partially frozen.

records.name: gasthaus cucumber salad
records.text: my husband and i have been trying to replicate the cucumber salad we have at our favourite little german restaurant. this isn't quite the same, but close enough. recipe adapted from razzledazzlerecipes. com.

records.name: roasted garlic tomato sauce
records.text: a rich intense sauce filled with sweet red peppers, sweet onions, earthy mushrooms, savory herbs and of course creamy roasted garlic. don't hesitate with the garlic use it all.

records.name: roasted garlic tomato sauce
records.text: a foundation for so many yummy dishes - pizzas, pasta, chicken, and fish, or use in a parmesan dish of choice.

records.name: braised cauliflower with capers   toasted bread crumbs
records.text: recipe adapted from molly stevens.

records.name: five minute hollandaise sauce
records.text: i love hollandaise sauce but hate making it. i found this microwave recipe in a cookbook that my parents got with their first microwave almost 30 years ago. the sauce always turns out perfectly!.

records.name: bush tucker muffins
records.text: a modern australian recipe using the best of native ingredients.

records.name: dilled biscuit ring
records.text: this is delicious. it is also fairly easy, and quick. i found it in a magazine, about 3 years ago, and have made it numerous times since.

records.name: easy onion meatloaf
records.text: i believe you are a meatloaf person or you aren't; simple. i also believe the best meatloaf is the one you grew up on; others just seem to taste not quite right. i haven't found the one my family eats on here.

records.name: easy onion meatloaf
records.text: after trying several others, i keep coming back to my mom's. it's not necessarily better but it's the one i grew up on and that makes all the difference in the world. meat, onions, gravy and a big pile of ketchup on the side for dipping, yum.

records.name: easy skillet cheese topped chili macaroni
records.text: this is a quick and easy recipe for a weeknight meal. its very tasty and very filling. dh loves it when i make this and always takes leftovers to work!.

records.name: instant pot chicken and dumplings
records.text: love my instant pot, and here's one more reason! this yummy soup takes just minutes, but tastes like it was simmered for hours!.

records.name: rice cooker green rice
records.text: this recipe is adapted from ingrid hoffmann's green rice recipe (foodnetwork. com) so that it will work in a rice cooker. it has great flavor with just the right amount of heat.

records.name: rice cooker green rice
records.text: i now use this recipe instead of the standard red rice with mexican dishes. it is great as a side dish with almost any mexican food.

records.name: rice cooker green rice
records.text: the hub and i have even put left over rice in lightly-fried tortillas to make rice tacos that were out of this world. note - i use sushi grade rice almost exclusively in my cooking becuase i love the stickier texture.

records.name: rice cooker green rice
records.text: accordingly, i have not tried making the recipe with standard or brown rice. you may need to adjust the amount of chicken stock, especially if using brown rice. this recipe is very easy to double or triple when feeding a crowd.

records.name: rice cooker green rice
records.text: it is also a tried and true pot-luck pleaser!.

records.name: garam masala  hot mixed spice
records.text: this is a multipuropse spice. i used to buy it from ethnic east indian stores but i have started making it from the dry spices. the aroma and taste are exceptional.

records.name: sandwich
records.text: veg sandwich low calorie.

records.name: roasted salmon salad
records.text: this gorgeous salad is definitely dinner-party material!.

records.name: maple apples
records.text: don't know why it is called maple apples, when there are just as many sweet potatoes in it, but it sounds good. from "old timey recipes" cook book.

records.name: havarti cheese pastry
records.text: my mom used to make this as a special treat when we were little. it is sort of like the brie pastry but she never cared for brie so she swapped it. it's so easy and pleases everyone. very rich and creamy it is perfect for an appetizer or party.

records.name: havarti cheese pastry
records.text: you can also buy havarti cheese with various spices and herbs mixed in to switch it up a little bit. the havarti with dill is divine. if the cheese leaks out, which it occasionally will even if you think you sealed it well, that is okay.

records.name: havarti cheese pastry
records.text: just scoop it off the pan and pile it on top. it is not as pretty but just as tasty ;) prep time is to let pastry thaw. enjoy!.

records.name: sultan s tent carrot salad
records.text: this recipe is from a lady named dana kayal. she was in calgary, canada and dined in a fabulous restaurant called the sultan's tent. they serve authentic morrocan food and this is one of the wonderful recipes she ate.

records.name: sultan s tent carrot salad
records.text: when she told them how good it was and she wanted the recipe, they gave it to her!.

records.name: simple sweet   spicy balsamic dressing
records.text: extremely simple dressing that is a favorite in my household. enjoy!!.

records.name: ricotta cheese burfi
records.text: burfi is a traditional indian sweet, which is made from many things and can be compared to the shape/consistency of fudge. this is a ricotta cheese version that is so good. sweet, great texture.

records.name: ricotta cheese burfi
records.text: you can either cut into pieces, or, eat with a spoon from a bowl. preparation time does not include refrigeration time.

records.name: boomette  s american dream coffee
records.text: a take off from chef #383346  's recipe #244809. can be made with hot coffee or cold.

records.name: caramelized onion and bacon mini quiche
records.text: great hot or cold. fab picnic fare.

records.name: acadia s marinara sauce
records.text: this is my version of marinara sauce for pasta! yummy! i omit the salt as i use canned crushed tomatoes which i find for us to have enough salt. however, if you use fresh tomatoes i would add the salt for your taste. enjoy!.

records.name: baby bok choy with yellow bell peppers
records.text: wonderfully simple, with bok choy, peppers, and green onions fresh from the farmers market, this veggie stir-fry doesn't even really need added salt, there is enough naturally in the bok choy itself.

records.name: goji berry trail mix
records.text: goji berries add a new twist to trail mix, & with substitutions &/or additions or nuts, dried fruits & small pretzels, etc, the results can be endless.

records.name: bally s casino bread pudding
records.text: i just adore simple homey but elegant custardy bread pudding. this one is adorned with the most wicked bourbon sauce ever devised.

records.name: bally s casino bread pudding
records.text: such a combination!  saved forever!  from the times-picayune - "bally's casino first shared this recipe in 1996, then it was reprinted in sept. of 2006 for a reader who had a copy on her refrigerator when katrina came through st.

records.name: bally s casino bread pudding
records.text: bernard parish. the pudding was very light and fluffy, she said. ".

records.name: australian stuffed cucumbers
records.text: this recipe comes from the australian heritage cookbook, and is perfect for an appetizer or over a salad. submitted for zwt8.

records.name: white rice   chicken casserole
