records.name: cinnamon raisin and apple bran muffins
records.text: my own adaptation of the muffin recipe on the side of the kellogg's all-bran box. i use splenda instead of sugar, and i only use half of what the original recipe asks for. the muffins may not look that appetizing, but they taste amazing!!!.

records.name: omelette w goat cheese  green onions   cilantro
records.text: i'll save this breakfast for a saturday morning when i know i have the time to fully enjoy it. so simple, so good. this recipe comes from a rose reisman book. make it a little more healthy by using egg whites and a multi grain or rye bread.

records.name: tomato rice
records.text: this is a good dish to go with a mexican meal. it's also vegetarian so throw in some black beans and you've got a complete meal.

records.name: cherry pork chops
records.text: so simple and so yummy.

records.name: chipotle fish cakes with guacamole salsa
records.text: this chipotle fish cake recipe was "planned over" recipe when i needed to be frugal and quickly use-or loose- some delicious barbecue salmon (recipe on www. thekosherchannel. com/barbecue-salmon. html ).

records.name: chipotle fish cakes with guacamole salsa
records.text: my challenge: adapting this exotic sounding recipe to my family's tastes while using only ingredients already in my kitchen. i came up with this winner. from the kosher channel.

records.name: the lady s coleslaw  paula deen
records.text: there are about as many coleslaw recipes as there are people. i myself like a variety coleslaws. i especially like the sweetness of this recipe from paula deen of the food network.

records.name: the lady s coleslaw  paula deen

records.name: the lady s coleslaw  paula deen
records.text: i also like to mix in red cabbage for lots of color. (cooking time listed is time standing in refrigerator).

records.name: banana pudding trifle

records.name: seared chicken with smashed potatoes   herbed pan sauce

records.name: my jambalaya
records.text: this is my jambalaya recipe. when my grandpa makes it, he doesn't use butter, but cooks down really fatty bacon and sausage to get the grease out of it, and then discards the remaining chunks of grizzle before adding the onions, etc.

records.name: my jambalaya
records.text: you can use canned chicken and broth if you don't want to mess with the thighs. really, jambalaya is supposed to be a cheap meal that stretches meat, so you can use whatever leftover meat that you want to in place of the sausage and thighs.

records.name: my jambalaya

records.text: a great breakfast for the daniel fast.

records.text: based on a similar recipe here on food. com, but with all the ingredients included in the recipe so you can see the true nutrition. i also lightened up using skim milk and 2% cheese, etc.

records.name: stuffed chard

records.text: rich, with a light lemon flavor and a nice lemon glaze!.

records.name: kung pao chicken with cashews

records.text: please substitute another sweetener of your choice. ingredient amounts are estimated. i had visions of blueberry pie dancing in my head while composing this recipe.

records.text: make a victorian sandwich sponge cake, the original british way (very few ingredients needed).

records.name: crumb cake or coffee cake with easy streusel topping
records.text: it is easy to get the consistency of the crumb topping just right. you could substitute other types of nuts if you wanted.

records.name: best chili ever

records.name: best chili ever

records.name: amazing crock pot white chili w  chicken
records.text: this recipe is so easy to make and chock full of flavor. it can be made on the stove as well just as quick. it's great served with cornbread. enjoy!.

records.text: this is a version of a recipe that was originally in jeff smith's the frugal gourmet cooks three ancient cuisines. this was a favorite of my boys when they were growing up.

records.name: cream cheese blueberry muffins
records.text: i love the taste of cream cheese and blueberries, these make a great breakfast treat or snack and it's so easy.

records.name: shrimp and crab salad rolls
records.text: from cooking light (may 2005).

records.name: greek easter cookies   koulourakia
records.text: found atbella online's greek food editor these sesame cookies are perfect any time, but for many they´re associated with the easter holidays. not sure of how many cookies it makes!.

records.name: happy trails muffins

records.name: happy trails muffins
records.text: i luv how easy and quick it comes together and how tasty the muffins are while still being good for you.

records.name: couscous with mushrooms   chickpeas
records.text: something different aust weight watchers 4pts.

records.name: purely simple guacamole
records.text: in my opinion the fresh and simple is best when considering a guacamole recipe. i know lots of recipes add lots of peppers and spices to doctor the flavor. but i like the flavors of  the vegetables to highlight my guacamole.

records.name: purely simple guacamole
records.text: i found this recipe in the september issue of saveur magazine.

records.name: purely simple guacamole
records.text: it originally comes from rosa mexicano restaurant in new york city, where the guacamole is prepared fresh at your table side using a traditional molcajete (a mortar made of volcanic rock).

records.name: purely simple guacamole
records.text: in preparing this recipe, if you do not have a molcajete, you can use a mortar and pestle, or a bowl and the back tines of a fork to combine ingredients, which will work just as well. i love this recipe and it has become my favorite.

records.name: purely simple guacamole
records.text: i hope you will enjoy it, too!.

records.name: salsa  taqueria style red
records.text: an authenic easy to make salsa based on a recipe from taco grande, a wonderful little restaurant in katy, tx. you can control the heat by using more (or less) jalapenos.

records.name: buttermilk caramel syrup
records.text: this caramel syrup recipe is going to change your life. ok, maybe that is a bit of an exaggeration, but it is going to change your breakfast. serve it with waffles and every type of pancake.

records.name: buttermilk caramel syrup
records.text: it is absolutely heavenly!  i found this recipe on the epicurean connection. i have not tried this, but hoping to soon!.

records.name: fudgy buttermilk brownies
records.text: i found this on a book mark from "the new american heart association".

records.name: cashew lentil loaf for the crock pot
records.text: this is posted in response to a request for a vegetarian loaf that cooks in the crock pot. it is from "125 best vegetarian slow cooker recipes" by judith finlayson.

records.name: fried wontons
records.text: this is a great appetizer that is a nice change of pace. can be prepared ahead of time. it makes lots so it helps to have a buddy to to some folding! serve with sweet & sour sauce for dipping.

records.name: parmesan salisbury steak skillet
records.text: wow. this is outstanding. i was looking for a new way to fix salisbury steak and found this recipe in one of my mom's cookbooks and we all loved it.

records.name: alaskan smoked salmon chowder
records.text: my brother gave me this recipe and i made it for my family and they went nuts! it was out of this world delicious! you can use any seafood you want but it is a must to have smoked salmon. my daughter who is 14 loved it.

records.name: emily s spinach salad
records.text: i found this in the original taste of home cookbook. i have made it many times.

records.name: mock coconut pie  spaghetti squash
records.text: few would know this pie is not coconut. i found the recipe in a community newspaper when vacationing in a very rural area of west virginia about twenty years ago.

records.name: janae s spaghetti
records.text: the easiest way to make spaghetti!!.

records.name: 10 can spaghetti sauce   oamc
records.text: i really did make up this recipe on my own, with the help of an italian lady through emails. the mingling of the oil/spices is the key. we were really into once a month cooking for awhile and this sauce is/was a hit.

records.name: goat s cheese and cherry tomato puff
records.text: this is so easy to put together and looks really good. it makes an excellent lunch or light dinner served with a leafy salad. if possible use a mixture of yellow and red tomatoes.

records.name: saffransbrod

records.name: rotisserie chicken spaghetti casserole
records.text: this is one of those casseroles with many versions. what makes mine somewhat different is the use of rotisserie chicken, there are also no tomatoes, as well as some other slight differences. this is a kid pleaser and makes a nice potluck dish.

records.name: rotisserie chicken spaghetti casserole
records.text: if you can't find the chicken soup with herbs in it, just use regular cream of chicken and add a bit of dried herbs (perhaps 1 tsp of mixed dried green herbs).

records.name: rotisserie chicken spaghetti casserole
records.text: i used the reduced sodium versions of the soup because otherwise the sauce base can be too heavy and salty. if you  dislike cream of mushroom, you may use a different flavor of "cream of. " soup however.

records.name: the original best ever meatloaf
records.text: my mother's been making this meatloaf forever an it tastes delicious!! the combination of the worcestershire sauce, ketchup and garlic are so flavorful that you'll be making this every week!!! add more or less salt and pepper to your liking!! but don't leave out the garlic!!!.

records.name: veggie tex mex tortilla wraps

records.name: mushroom cheeseburgers
records.text: simple, basic burger recipe that my kids like.

records.name: to die for dipping oil
records.text: pretty much the most amazing flavors on earth. i snagged the recipe ingredients to this divine dipping oil from the sommelier at my new favorite restaurant on the planet- celadon, in napa valley.

records.name: to die for dipping oil
records.text: this oil is sooooooo darn good- just grab a fresh crusty baguette and dig in! ***(the ingredients below are not in exact measurements- add a little of this and a little of that until the flavors match your taste.

records.name: to die for dipping oil

records.name: pork chops in onion sauce  schweinekotelett in zwiebelsosse
records.text: easy, simple and fast. scalloped potatoes go very well with these chops.

records.name: rachael ray s spanakopita burgers
records.text: i'm always looking for a good turkey/chicken burger and this is wonderful. juicy, full of flavor and not a bland thing about it. serve with a yogurt cucumber sauce if you like. works very well on the george foreman.

records.name: broccoli cheddar  pie
records.text: great side dish or meatless main dish. quick to fix and great to throw in the oven with whatever you have roasting.

records.text: delicious cheesy lasagna that will feed a crowd!  great flavor and texture. the beef and sausage is infused with moisture from the slow cooker.

records.name: mom s fantasy fudge
records.text: this is a fudge recipe my mom made every christmas. the fudge always disappeared long before christmas came. she gave it to all of our neighbors. a close friend of the family told us that it wouldn't be christmas without my mom's fudge.

records.name: mom s fantasy fudge
records.text: little do they know how easy it is! my dh always looks forward to christmas, because now i make this fudge!.

records.name: tater tot cups with cheese and eggs
records.text: tater tots in muffin pan with eggs--baked in the oven. a great breakfast for kids. quick, easy and not messy. there is no salt since the potatoes are seasoned. some like to put a-1 sauce on their potatoes.

records.name: anna s uber spaghetti with meatballs
records.text: a great, spruced up, version of the old classic. this sauce can be made with what ever type of riesling wine you prefer. also you can substitute ground pork, veal, chicken, turkey or any combination of ground meat for the beef.

records.name: hot dogs in toast
records.text: this is a yummy lunch that i came up with one day when i had limited food in the house, and was really hungry!.

records.name: off the cob  freezer corn
records.text: this recipe allows you the fresh taste of sweet corn-on-the cob all year long. i've been making it for years and will today make it with olathe corn i picked up at the market for 10 ears for $1.

records.name: off the cob  freezer corn
records.text: it stacks neatly in your freezer and is ready in a jiffy.

records.name: pineapple cream pie  diabetic friendly
records.text: a delicious recipe that i found on a diabetic website.

records.name: orange honey carrots
records.text: i got this from my mother-in-law. it adds a nice tang to the carrots. i don't much like cooked carrots but this was fantastic. the carrots can either by julienned or cut into rounds.

records.name: bread pudding souffle with whiskey sauce
records.text: i love bread pudding! this recipe comes from one of my favorite restaurants,the commander's palace in new orleans! cut the boubon in half if you consider the taste too strong. enjoy!.

records.name: spinach in spicy yoghurt  palak raita

records.name: godiva brownies
records.text: i followed all of the directions, and baked the brownies in a 9 x 13" glass baking dish. after 30 minutes, my brownies were still gooey in the middle.

records.name: godiva brownies

records.name: jamaican sweet potato pudding
records.text: hell a top, hell a bottom hallelujah in the middle!  this is a jamaican riddle and most people know that the answer is a delicious sweet potato pudding, baked in an iron dutch pot or dutch oven with live coals in the bottom of the coal stove and also on the top of the dutch pot.

records.name: jamaican sweet potato pudding

records.text: this is dh's lazy chicken parm recipe. it is too easy to be so good. i make an awesome chicken parm but sometimes i just really crave this recipe. this particular recipe serves 4 but it is just as quick and easy to make for 1 or 10.

records.name: steve s ghetto chicken parm
records.text: hope you enjoy!.

records.name: asparagus and brie open pastry
records.text: this is a fabulous open pastry oozing with brie! what more could you ask for? :).

records.name: ginger scallion tripe  dim sum style
records.text: my son and husband are both obsessed with the tripe from our favorite chinese dim sum restaurant, so i've spent the last month trying to perfect a recipe at home to duplicate it.

records.name: ginger scallion tripe  dim sum style
records.text: the trick is to infuse the tripe with lots of the ginger and scallion flavor while it's becoming tender, during the initial boiling step. the outcome is a flavorful dish well worth the effort. here it is. and enjoy!.

records.name: jamaican baked beans
records.text: baked beans with a jamaican flare.

records.name: buttermilk cheese biscuits
records.text: wonderful tasting biscuits for breakfast or dinner. my husband is now our official biscuit maker b/c he enjoys this recipe! they are pretty easy to make, too. this recipe was found in the cook 'n on the go software.

records.name: spiced lentils
records.text: this is really yummy. it can be used as a stuffing for mini pumpkins or tomatoes. i served it over some plain brown rice with mango chutney. it does make lots of leftovers and is pretty good cold the next day.

records.name: settler s pie
records.text: this originally was shown on 7:30 south, a regional news programme in the southern south island of nz. it has always been a favourite in our house and the pastry is very easy.

records.name: soft shell crabs mia
records.text: i love soft shell crabs!  this recipe comes from the crabplace. com. it is very easy and very delicious!  i have also sauteed these in alittle butter and olive oil.

records.name: gluten free chocolate cake
records.text: this is a great chocolate cake recipe. it is not too sweet, has a beautiful texture, and will easily fool the smartest taste tester!.

records.name: light chicken and capsicum  for the bbq  grill or oven
records.text: chicken breast (or other pieces of your choice) cooked in a foil parcel with chargrilled capsicum. it's also a low-fat meal. serve with veges or a salad.

records.name: light chicken and capsicum  for the bbq  grill or oven
records.text: you can substitute for the capsicum with onion and tomato, a squeee of lemon, fresh herbs etc.

records.name: spicy chipotle bean dip
records.text: healthy, spicy, and very low fat! i think you'll like this if you like a little heat in your dip and, it's a little different than the many other good recipes posted here on 'zaar.

records.name: spicy chipotle bean dip
records.text: to reduce the heat, you can omit or use less of the adobo sauce, use only 1 chipotle pepper, or use a mild salsa (i like pace medium chunky salsa and don't measure).

records.name: spicy chipotle bean dip
records.text: i use my favorite brand of refried black beans, but the recipe works just as well with refried pinto beans, which make a great foundation for bean nachos if you don't use too much salsa. serve with tortilla chips.

records.name: stacked reuben sandwich
records.text: the flavor combination of a reuben sandwich facinates me - and my pressed and grilled sandwich is a way to get more of all of that in an easy to eat package - a double decker reuben!.

records.name: burst in your mouth cherry tomatoes
records.text: have you ever had a nice warm cherry tomato just burst in your mouth with sweet juices? if not, you have a real treat in store for you when you try this recipe. it's so simple, but sometimes that's the very best way to enjoy a vegetable.

records.name: english parsley potatoes
records.text: a classic british potato dish, which is probably traditionally served with roast beef, english mustard and green peas. adapted from a recipe on a 'pan or wok' recipe card from international masters publishers.

records.name: english parsley potatoes
records.text: a suggested variation on the card is that these potatoes can also be made with left-over roast potatoes. i've only made this dish with new potatoes, and served it as an accompaniment to grilled or bbqd meat.

records.name: peruvian  sauteed beef tenderloin  lomo saltado
records.text: this is another main course recipe from peruvian cuisine, i copied the recipe from yanuq. com http://www. yanuq. com/english/recipe. asp?idreceta=520 preparation time is aprox.

records.name: algerian cucumber salad
records.text: posted for the zaar world tour. a yummy salad!.

records.name: easy strawberry jam
records.text: this has to be good because it is by barefoot contessa- ina garten. no commercial pectin is used in this recipe, it gets it's gel from the apple.

records.name: sour cream and horseradish sauce
records.text: we use this dipping sauce for beef fondue or prime rib. it has lots of flavor and i like that the horseradish isn't too over powering.

records.name: cranberry apple stuffed squash
records.text: it's fall in wisconsin! made this up last night after traveling to our local apple orchard and picking out a beautiful autumn cup winter squash, a 'cousin' of the butternut squash, too good not to share!.

records.name: zuppa di pollo  italian chicken soup with pasta   cheese
records.text: a light yet filling soup. takes just a few minutes to prepare.

records.name: flourless apple caramel cake  5   hour cook time
records.text: this apple-caramel cake is worth every minute of the 5 hour bake time. don't try to shorten it, the granny smiths need all the time to work their magic! this recipe comes from take home chef (tlc). thanks, curtis!.

records.name: glazed strawberry tart
records.text: fresh strawberries make this a delicious and easy tart to make. you can bake the crust a day or two ahead of time and assemble the tart just before serving. crust dough requires at least 1 hour chill time.

records.name: low fat chocolate creamer
records.text: my husband loves chocolate creamer, but gave it up for a low fat diet. i have created this version so he can still enjoy his morning coffee treat.

records.name: low fat chocolate creamer
records.text: as written this recipe gives more of a dark chocolate creamer, but you can increase the sugar if you like sweeter. the most important thing is to use a good quality ingredients.

records.name: low fat chocolate creamer
records.text: i made first with nestle cocoa powder, my husband found it bitter with a strange texture. i made the second time with giradelli's and the flavor and texture were greatly improved.

records.name: favorite homemade chicken and noodles
records.text: i wanted to share with everyone this quick and easy noodle recipe that my mom used to make when she was short on money but always had these ingredients in the kitchen.

records.name: favorite homemade chicken and noodles
records.text: i will show you how to make it so that it is not as fattening as when she made them but they still taste as wonderful.

records.name: burriquitas  mini burritos
records.text: these are perfect for parties, watching the big game on t. v. or poker night. you can also make a batch and store in ziplocs in the fridge to reheat for quick meals or snacks. the epazote is available at penzeys.

records.name: burriquitas  mini burritos
records.text: com (we have a store here in winter park, fl) but there are so many flavors here that it's not critical to the recipe.

records.name: margarita pie  pastel de margarita
records.text: this is an adopted recipe. i think it looks fabulous for a mexican/tex-mex feast, particularly on a hot summer night, but have not yet tried it. comments from those who get to it before i do are appreciated via a review. thanks!.

records.name: creamy chocolate pudding ii
records.text: this is from www. meals. com.

records.name: creamy chocolate pudding ii
records.text: when i made it, i substituted dry milk powder for the evaporated milk, thinking it was the same thing! as a result, my pudding ended up with the consistency of a fudge bar! but this tastes fantastic, so i'm sure it makes a fabulous pudding when you use the right ingredients! :-) enjoy!.

records.name: cookies   cream cocktail
records.text: this is a lovely decadent cocktail, a great one for after dinner drinks, simply delish! recipe from kraft.

records.name: blt dip  homemade gourmet
records.text: dip using homemade gourmet's blt seasoning.

records.name: hot hot crab curry
records.text: this was my mother's delicious hot crab curry recipe. to learn how to prepare this dish, i had to watch her make it because there was no recipe written down.

records.name: hot hot crab curry
records.text: she passed away on may 16, 2002, but her crab curry will be enjoyed for generations to come !.

records.name: potatoes elizabeth
records.text: potato lovers unite! this deliciously different recipe uses rutabaga to jazz up the spuds. hearty but healthy and low-fat. try this for thanksgiving or a potluck! tested at high altitude.

records.name: polenta and grilled vegetables with roasted red pepper sauce
records.text: this dish is perfect in the spring or summer when vegetables are plenty. it reminds me of a rustic dish you could get at a little italian eatery. don't be daunted by the long list of ingredients, the meal comes together quickly.

records.name: polenta and grilled vegetables with roasted red pepper sauce
records.text: i have a gluten allergy and the polenta satisfies any bread cravings i might have. the dish is also a great vegetarian option, but i swear it will make any carnivore happy :) the vegetables can also be  done in the broiler.

records.name: tex mex beef and chorizo burritos
records.text: the original tex-mex (texas-mexican) wrap sandwich. this filling pairs ground beef with chorizo, a garlicky mexican sausage made with pork and flavored with herbs, spices and chiles, available fresh or smoked.

records.name: tex mex beef and chorizo burritos
records.text: easy and very, very good! from ladies home journal.

records.name: eddie s corn
records.text: i first had this made for me by a fellow named eddie while on vacation in florida. i've never had anything like it! the shoepeg corn is not too sweet and doesn't get mushy at all, and the serrano chiles give it a little heat.

records.name: eddie s corn
records.text: great warm or room temperature, so great for picnics and potlucks. gets recipe requests every time!.

records.name: hot knots with sweet onion dip
records.text: this party snack will disappear in moments! spicy dough knots are fantastic on their own, but can be enhanced (and tamed) with sweet onion dip!.

records.name: coffee   prune   cream of wheat sweet tamales

records.name: coffee   prune   cream of wheat sweet tamales
records.text: this is a recipe from a famous mexican chef. preparation time does not include preparation of wrapping leaves.

records.name: velveeta potatoes au gratin
records.text: this is simple and very good! the potatoes are best when cooked and completely chilled before slicing and using in this recipe, so if possible make the potatoes a day ahead, cover and refrigerate overnight.

records.name: mama s best  macaroni and cheese
records.text: my kids say this is better than 'the blues' and gobble it up, even when i toss in a handful of cooked veggies like broccoli, peas, carrots, etc. make it a one dish meal with some tuna, cooked ham, etc.

records.name: mama s best  macaroni and cheese
records.text: it is just as easy as the 'blue box' at least i think so and it is much healthier!.

records.name: fougasse  olive bread

records.name: middle eastern   twice baked potatoes

records.name: middle eastern   twice baked potatoes
records.text: adapted from "practical cookery: low fat". these potatoes could also be served on their own as a light vegetarian meal. in view of the comments by reviewers about the potatoes being a bit dry, i have added a tablespoon of tahini.

records.text: i have also added some garlic. i'm not sure how the recipe escaped having garlic in it when i first posted it!.

records.text: i love mushrooms and i am a big fan of stroganoff so this sounds like a good combo to me.

records.name: harira  moroccan chickpea soup
records.text: posted in the hope of joing the north african and middle eastern zaar tag game :-)  please note that the "pint" i mention is a british pint of 20 fl oz.

records.name: smoked pork tenderloin with green peppercorn sauce
records.text: this recipe uses a stovetop smoker with 1 1/2 tablespoons of hickory wood chips. note on cooking times:  place the smoker on the stovetop with the lid slightly open. when the first hint of smoke appears, close the lid and start cooking time.

records.name: smoked pork tenderloin with green peppercorn sauce
records.text: fyi: the temperature inside the smoker is about the same as a 375 f oven. smoke time is an estimate due to the differing stovetops. ceramic tops must add 20% cook time, for example.

records.name: smoked pork tenderloin with green peppercorn sauce
records.text: assure your smoker is sealed properly and increase time appropriately, but refrain from raising the temperature.

records.name: marie callender s pumpkin pie filling by todd wilbur

records.name: orange pecan salad

records.name: c est si bon smothered fish bake
records.text: one of my very favorite cookbooks is a private printing done by some really neat ladies from baton rouge. one of them who had approved of my d. btagbs presented me with a signed copy. the book was c'est si bon, the best of baton rouge.

records.name: c est si bon smothered fish bake

records.text: regular pourable egg substitute like store-brand or eggbeaters also works. i used recipe #411869 for baking powder for added health quotient. the sunflower oil is vitamin e rich and adds a nice clean taste to the batter.

records.text: may jello live on for all of us!  shelly's original comments are:  "i make fun of jello molds but this is not a jello mold! it is a little weird but my mother makes this every year around the holidays and i love it.

records.name: colorful layered salad
records.text: i made this for thanksgiving yesterday, and it turned out beautiful. so many different flavors. i tweaked the recipe a bit to my own taste. i added sliced cheddar, shredded mozzarella cheese and carrots and left out the peppers and eggs.

records.name: colorful layered salad

records.name: turducken  a chicken in a duck in a turkey
records.text: a turducken is a de-boned turkey stuffed with a de-boned duck, which itself is stuffed with a small de-boned chicken. the name is a portmanteau of those ingredients, turkey, duck, and chicken.

records.name: turducken  a chicken in a duck in a turkey
records.text: the birds can be deboned the day before to save some time since this recipe requires a long slow cook time.

records.name: deb s kid pleasin  hash

records.name: deb s kid pleasin  hash
records.text: you are gonna thank me a million times for this one!!!.

records.name: crispy fish tacos
records.text: excellent recipe! this is so fresh-tasting and different. use with my chili mayo (see in my recipes).

records.name: low sugar coconut cream pie
records.text: i use this pie because i'm diabetic and i find it to be better than any store bought i ever ate. i figured it out to be about 5 grams sugar per slice, and that means i can have dessert.

records.name: low sugar coconut cream pie
records.text: make this and you'll love it and you'll never know it's low sugar by the taste.

records.name: linguine with asparagus and goat cheese
records.text: we love all 3 of these ingredients and they go together well in this dish. from cooking light.

records.name: granny wilson s candy chocolate frosting
records.text: my husband's maternal grandmother's famous chocolate frosting. best used with chocolate layer cake. i can't answer any questions about this recipe or how to make it as i've never made it before. i'm just putting it out there for posterity's sake.

records.name: guacamole pronto
records.text: this is my husband's favorite way to make guacamole. i prefer a more complicated recipe when i make it with fresh tomatoes, garlic, lime, etc.

records.name: guacamole pronto

records.name: ultimate seven layer dip

records.name: ultimate seven layer dip
records.text: this one takes quite a bit of preparation, but if you decide to make it, don't "cut corners" or you'll be disappointed.

records.name: ultimate seven layer dip
records.text: it's important,  especially for us zaarites who love to meddle with recipes, to follow the directions and the ingredient list precisely. enjoy!.

records.name: austrian coffee cake

records.name: coconut peanut sauce sliced steak  london broil

records.name: coconut peanut sauce sliced steak  london broil

records.name: al kabsa   ancient arabian chicken and fragrant rice
records.text: this classic arabian dish is saudi arabian in origin, and is believed to originate from the nomadic bedouin tribes centuries ago. arabic cuisine has its roots in tent cookery.

records.name: al kabsa   ancient arabian chicken and fragrant rice
records.text: nomadic tribes could use only transportable foods such as rice and dates, or their nomadic stock like sheep and camels in their recipes.

records.name: al kabsa   ancient arabian chicken and fragrant rice

records.name: kittencal s homemade deep rich turkey stock broth
records.text: roasting/browning the turkey bones and vegetables firstly in the oven will create a more intense deep rich stock i would not even think of making stock without using this method and you will see the difference for yourself after you try this stock --- i use this stock in so many recipes i even make gravy with it and you will use this for so many things also, it is wonderful to have handy in the freezer, to thaw just microwave for a couple of minutes or refrigerate overnight -- serving amounts are listed for a 12-13 pound turkey and about 4 quarts of water, you may use a larger turkey with more water just make certain to use enough water to cover the carcass and veggies --- if possible don't discard all the extra bones from the legs, thighs and wings and add into the pot along with the carcass the more bones the better!.

records.text: that is the way of it all. if you can find it use soy sauce made with water, soy beans, and salt and nothing else. it is much richer and better. portions and cooking time are a guess.

records.name: smoked cream cheese chicken jalapeno poppers
records.text: these little bites of poppers are absolutely incredible. my brother-in law first made them with beef and cheese so i changed it to my tastes. these are the first to go at parties!! people ask if i'm going to bring them!!.

records.name: cream cheese cookie cups
records.text: this is so simple to make and a big hit in my family. i like to top them with a sliced strawberry. easy to make and easy to eat. bet you can't eat just one. my kids love the cookie crust.

records.text: this is a great recipe anytime but is perfect for induction on the atkins diet. i like the "crust" that forms on the outside so i do use muffin tins instead of a pie shell.

records.name: mini cannoli cream cups    yummmmm
records.text: how to make cannolis the easy way!!! i saw this recipe on line submitted by "cooking with sugar" and im telling you, this is sooo easy. from start to finish 40 min. and taste just like cannolis with out all the work.

records.name: mama kat s squash casserole

records.name: mama kat s squash casserole
records.text: the sausage is key!  enjoy!!!.

records.name: vera s green tomato relish

records.name: vera s green tomato relish

records.name: vera s green tomato relish
records.text: i know it will keep for 1 year, but we have never had a batch last longer than that--we eat this stuff on everything. time includes soaking time.

records.name: christiana campbell s tavern salmagundi
records.text: salmagundi was the chef's salad of 18th century england. in present day england and in colonial williamsburg, the name has been revived. my mother enjoyed serving this as a main course for dinner. we always liked it!.

records.name: french style basil chicken

records.name: peanut buttery cupcakes
records.text: this is a yummy recipe. you can follow the frosting recipe or of course buy any kind you choose 8).

records.name: authentic tacos

records.name: meatloaf topping
records.text: we've been topping our meatloaf with this super-easy sauce for years. makes enough to top one meatloaf (8 slices from a pyrex-type loaf pan).

records.text: i got this recipe while on vacation in mackinaw city, mi. cooking time includes time required for chilling.

records.text: this recipe is a family heirloom recipe, probably irish in origin as it comes from my maternal grandmother who was first generation canadian of irish descent.

records.text: goes great with chicken and noodles with peanut sauce. also from cooking light magazine.

records.text: first time and it came out wonderful! the only thing i would change is to add more garlic if you really love garlic. hope you all enjoy this recipe as much as we did.

records.name: mary s pea picking cake
records.text: mary and charlie made a trip down south and came back with this recipe came from charlie's sister. and just like mary, charlie and his sister. this gets better with age.

records.name: bbq nachos a la  famous dave s
records.text: we had these at my husband's favorite bbq restaurant, "famous dave's", and we both fell in love with them. it's a meal in and of itself, and so delicious (and easy, too!).

records.name: new jersey zucchini bake
records.text: from maria porreca of millville. published in the star ledger.

records.name: quiet spirit tea blend
records.text: this is another recipe from "the big book of preserving the harvest" by carol w. costenbader. it is supposed to calm the nerves and digestive tract. if you grow your own herbs and dry them, it is really good, but you can use storebought.

records.name: herbed muffins
records.text: these are nice just buttered but even better if you make a slice in the top and fill with salmon cream cheese:)  can be made in normal size muffin pans or mini size.

records.name: ultimate chocolate cream pie
records.text: this recipe comes from my aunt and it is the smoothest, creamiest, yummiest chocolate cream pie you will ever eat! the recipe can be adapted to make other cream pies, such as banana and coconut.

records.name: where s the beef      vegetarian black bean chili
records.text: a delicious meatless alternative -- great for buffet suppers or game day parties. original recipe comes from the greens restaurant in san francisco, however i've once again made some adjustments.

records.name: where s the beef      vegetarian black bean chili
records.text: if necessary a good quality chili powder can be substituted for the pasilla peppers.

records.name: emily s hot pepper jelly
records.text: hot pepper jelly. not real hot, but it has a little zip. this is great spooned over cream cheese and eaten on crackers.

records.name: fresh peach dessert
records.text: this dessert is so fabulous!  it is my mother-in-law's recipe that can also be made as strawberry or raspberry by switching the jello flavor and fruit.

records.name: fresh peach dessert
records.text: it is so fresh tasting that you will have a hard time stopping at just one serving!  note:  it is important to note that the pudding used is the cooking kind, not the instant.

records.name: fresh peach dessert
records.text: this makes a 9 x 13 size dessert, but you could also put it in 2 pie crusts, or half the recipe for one smaller dessert. enjoy!.

records.name: truffle cookie bar
records.text: this is a very good cookie. easy and everyone will love them. for something different, you can also sprinkle on coconut too. i hope you enjoy them as much as my family does.

records.name: pumpkin oatmeal raisin cookies
records.text: my mom gave me this recipe and i love it. they are very moist.

records.name: salad with blackberries and goat cheese   sweden
records.text: from swedish chef tina nordstrom.

records.name: spicy cream cheese spread
records.text: my family likes this spread because.

records.name: sesame roasted asparagus
records.text: easy and tasty side dish from cooking light, may 2001.

records.name: oreo dump
records.text: this is a recipe that my mother used to make for us when we were small.

records.name: oreo dump
records.text: i don't recall where she got the recipe from, but it is very yummy! hope you enjoy! i don't know if 24 ounces of oreo's is the correct size, but i do know that it is the largest pack of the oreo cookies.

records.name: no knead rosemary parmesan sun dried tomato  bread
records.text: this is an adaption of one of my recipe #248237 to use sullivan street bakery's no-knead method of making bread. it's amazingly easy and oh so tasty!  the only special equipment needed is a 4 quart cast-iron or cast-aluminum dutch oven.

records.name: no knead rosemary parmesan sun dried tomato  bread
records.text: see note at bottom before staring.

records.name: frozen fudge pops
records.text: an easy way to make fudge pops that kids will love. i've put the original recipe in, but feel free to use sugar free pudding or splenda in place of the regular pudding and sugar.

records.name: andy s garlic bread
records.text: this is definitely a garlic lover's garlic bread. if one person eats it for dinner, everyone ought to eat it. everything up to baking the loaf can easily be done by children.

records.name: delicious and moist red velvet cake
records.text: very yummy and moist cake. add icing of your choice.

records.name: peanut butter and apple sandwich
records.text: i like this recipe because it replaces high sugar jams with something that is healthy and has fiber. it gives a crunch to pb sandwiches. it is something different to try and not feel quilty about.

records.name: craftscout s leftover turkey soup
records.text: the best part of thanksgiving: leftovers! :)   2007 update: this is still the best soup i have ever made and the secret really is the sweet potato.

records.name: craftscout s leftover turkey soup
records.text: this year i saved about a cup of  green beans from making the green bean casserole, and added them in to the soup about 10 minutes before the end of the cooking time. delicious!.

records.name: keep my kids healthy smoothie
records.text: i started making this smoothie about 3 years ago as a way to get fruit  into my kids in the morning. i got tired of talking about eating your  fruit in the morning.

records.name: keep my kids healthy smoothie
records.text: now it's a daily thing and all winter they have  not had one single cold - these are highly allergic kids with asthma. i put in a.

records.name: keep my kids healthy smoothie
records.text: 3 oz of emergen-c supplement, during the winter months to make sure they have enough vitamins to fend of viruses. these can be found at trader joe's or any health food store.

records.name: toasted orzo with peas  onion and bacon
records.text: toasting the orzo really makes this dish. it gives it a nutty flavour, very nice.

records.name: cheese and onion pasties
records.text: the traditional cornish recipe uses a cheese such as double gloucester or english cheddar, but i have made some very tasty varieties using stilton, feta, bleu cheese, and even havarti.

records.name: cashew bar cookies
records.text: my husband loves cashews and these cookies fit the bill.

records.name: greek style spinach and tortellini salad
records.text: this is a filling salad as is but you can add in some cooked chicken breast strips if desired. also i like to add in a few tablespoons of parmesan cheese to the dressing but that is optional.

records.name: greek style spinach and tortellini salad
records.text: plan ahead the tortellini needs to chill with the dressing for a minimum of 4 hours or up to 24 hours. do not use more than 1 teaspoon minced fresh garlic or it will overpower the salad, or you can omit the garlic totally.

records.name: scrambled eggs hotel style    very simple
records.text: when i was a newlywed 15 years ago, i burned eggs every time i made them and the only way to get good scrambled eggs was to go out for them. one day i saw a cooking show and it changed how i made eggs.

records.name: scrambled eggs hotel style    very simple
records.text: today my whole family loves this fluffy, delicious breakfast dish. my own mother who is a great cook extraordinaire loves these and when she just recently learned the secret was shocked at how simple it is.

records.name: scrambled eggs hotel style    very simple
records.text: so without further ado, here is the recipe for hotel style eggs.

records.name: sauce for blooming onions
records.text: this can be used for what ever you want but i made this for fathers day along with my blooming onion recipe #70382. my sil said it tastes just like outback steak house makes.

records.name: light chicken broccoli alfredo soup  lower fat
records.text: when i ran across chef #55221's recipe for recipe #155375, i thought it sounded like something my family would love. being on a "lower fat" diet, there was no way i could make it as written though.

records.name: light chicken broccoli alfredo soup  lower fat
records.text: i was really pleased with how well the recipe modified to meet my dietary needs. it was still rich and delicious, and everyone loved it. here is my lightened up version.

records.name: easy tasty pork roast
records.text: i looked and didn't find any pork roast made this way. this is the way i have made a pork butt roast our entire marriage of 48 years. it is easy and oh so tender, juicy and delicious.

records.name: easy tasty pork roast
records.text: i always serve it with mashed potatoes and make gravy from the rich drippings. if you make a large roast the leftovers can be made into many other dishes. even bbq pork sandwhiches if you simmer some of it in bbq sauce until it is absorbed.

records.name: nacho joes
records.text: a different take on sloppy joe's.

records.name: cheesy stuffed meatballs and spaghetti
records.text: i got this recipe from tops courtesy of ragu. my family loved these meatballs. i added some salt and pepper to my meatball mix. i used 1-inch pieces of mozzarella cheese.

records.name: cheesy stuffed meatballs and spaghetti
records.text: i baked my meatballs in the oven on 350 for 30 minutes then finished them in the sauce as directed.

records.name: shreveport chicken and shrimp gumbo
records.text: we found a great gumbo recipe from one of those magazine type cookbooks you find at the grocery store check-out, and we've tweaked it a little to create this delicious dish.

records.name: yorkshire tea loaf with mixed spice  cherries and raisins
records.text: yorkshire tea is a black tea blend produced by taylors of harrogate, one of the few remaining family tea and coffee merchants in the uk. the company was founded in 1886 by yorkshire tea merchant charles taylor.

records.name: yorkshire tea loaf with mixed spice  cherries and raisins
records.text: needless to say i drink yorkshire tea at home in france, i bring boxes and boxes of it back from the uk when i travel there!  the yorkshire tea loaf was produced by taylors as a way of using their yorkshire tea to expand their range.

records.name: yorkshire tea loaf with mixed spice  cherries and raisins
records.text: it involves using the choicest fruits which are infused overnight with the tea.

records.name: yorkshire tea loaf with mixed spice  cherries and raisins
records.text: this is my take on their famous tea loaf; moist tea infused fruits really make this loaf something special and it is sublime when served with a traditional english cuppa.

records.name: yorkshire tea loaf with mixed spice  cherries and raisins
records.text: serve this tea loaf in thick slices just as it is - although you could also serve it with butter or with a slab of wensleydale cheese for that authentic yorkshire experience.

records.name: yorkshire tea loaf with mixed spice  cherries and raisins
records.text: (this is an adapted version of the recipe that is posted on the yorkshire tea website. ).

records.name: pepper   vanilla marinated shrimp  papantla style
records.text: this unusual (but i think delicious) recipe is purported to originate in the vanilla-producing regions of eastern mexico.

records.name: pepper   vanilla marinated shrimp  papantla style
records.text: it calls for the use of pure vanilla extract; artificially flavored vanilla extract would be a poor substitute for the real thing.

records.name: pepper   vanilla marinated shrimp  papantla style
records.text: it is very peppery, which we like, but if you want less heat i would begin by cutting the pepper called for in half.

records.name: pepper   vanilla marinated shrimp  papantla style
records.text: serve over lots of rice, this makes a lovely sauce! prep time does not include minimum 1 1/2 hr marinating time, so plan ahead.

records.name: pan fried chicken livers
records.text: best comfort food and a great appetizer!.

records.name: baked new potatoes
records.text: try these delicious creamy potatoes.

records.name: chicken in pepitoria
records.text: the saffron, chicken, and rice flavor of chicken in pepitoria is reminiscent of the famous spanish paella. in paella, however, rice cooks together with all the meats and vegetables in a special shallow round paella pan.

records.name: chicken in pepitoria
records.text: from classical international recipes. posted for zwt!.

records.name: pear pistachio and chocolate cake
records.text: easy and good to serve with coffee.

records.name: easy baked pasta
records.text: i threw this together tonight to use up some stuff from the fridge, and the result was really tasty and fairly healthy! it also makes a smaller amount than most baked pasta recipes, which i appreciate since it is just dh and i.

records.name: easy baked pasta
records.text: the measurements for spices are approximate, and you can definitely play with the veggies and throw in whatever moves ya!.

records.name: luby s cafeteria old fashioned egg salad
records.text: for fans of cafeteria cuisine. cooking time for hard boiled eggs not included in preparation time. from  luby's 50th anniversary recipe collection cookbook.

records.name: cucumber kimchee
records.text: this popular dish was printed in our local newspaper, the honolulu advertiser.

records.name: squaw rice
records.text: this is a recipe created by my friend bev's mother. bev is one of the wildest aussies i ever had the chance to meet. unfortunately she moved back to her homeland early in 2002.

records.name: squaw rice
records.text: i really enjoy this recipe though, you can eat it as a meal alone with a little bread and butter.

records.name: detox salad
records.text: packing a powerhouse of nutrients, this light & energizing salad will have you bursting with energy. it makes a lot so you can enjoy it all week long for easy, energizing lunches.

records.name: detox salad
records.text: don't skip the currants and raisins as it adds a much needed sweetness to balance out the vegetables and lemon juice. good drizzled with a touch of maple syrup just before serving. feel free to use any herbs and spices you wish.

records.name: detox salad
records.text: from ohsheglows, inspired by whole foods.

records.name: onion kuchen
records.text: my sister, ashley, found this in an old betty crocker cookbook. she says it’s delicious!.

records.name: breaded chicken with avocado
records.text: tasty and simple to prepare; the toppings and cheese add a richness to the flavorful crunchy coated chicken.

records.name: most excellent corn spoon bread
records.text: want a yummy, creamy, comfort-food that can be served as a side dish or bread?  think of a savory bread pudding and you have corn spoonbread.

records.name: most excellent corn spoon bread
records.text: we have fallen in lust with this easy and fast creation, and have made it numerous times as requests pour in from family and friends. just couldn't wait to share it with my 'zarr family!.

records.name: scrambled egg casserole
records.text: this is a great brunch casserole, plan ahead as this casserole needs to sit in fridge for 2-3 hours before baking or just prepare a day ahead and bake the next day.

records.name: after dinner coffee
records.text: delicious ending the the perfect meal.

records.name: choca blockas
records.text: a favorite, these are mounds of shortbread with chocolate chips and walnuts. they bake long and low to  turn out with a wonderfully crunchy texture. adapted from all butter fresh cream sugar packed baking book by judy rosenberg. enjoy!.

records.name: marshmallow cinnamon rice krispies bars
records.text: after eating a cinnamon granola bar, i thought i would try putting cinnamon in my rice krispies bars. my family loved the addition.

records.name: the easiest fudge
records.text: this is a fun fudge to do with the kids, because of it's ease and rich/creamy flavor. prep time does not include refrigeration.

records.name: almost fat free fudge brownies
records.text: from "madhuram's eggless cooking" - http://www. egglesscooking. com/2010/07/26/non-fat-fudge-brownies/.

records.name: another bean salad
records.text: a sweet, tangy bean salad.

records.name: balsamic strawberry shortcake
records.text: here is an delicious twist on the traditional strawberry shortcake. classic sweet biscuit base meets fresh berries laced with balsamic vinegar.

records.name: breakfast egg bake
records.text: lowfat breakfast dish. may be baked ahead, refrigerated, and reheated at breakfast. it will take about 40 minutes to reheat. i use reduced-fat cheese. nonfat doesn't melt enough!.

records.name: beef  cheddar and potato pie
records.text: no need to wait until the end of the meal to get your pie fix! {everyday with rachel ray, recipe by rori trovato}.

records.name: nif s teriyaki salmon steaks
records.text: do you like salmon? then you will love this tender and tasty recipe! serve with rice and vegetables. enjoy!.

records.name: cinnamon griddle cakes
records.text: this is one of my family's favorite pancake recipes! it's an extremely fluffy and sweeter pancake, i found that using 1 tablespoon of cinnamon gives it a mild cinnamon flavor, you might want to increase the cinnamon for a more intense cinnamon flavor, the addition of the corn syrup gives these pancakes a unique twist! i used maple syrup on these but regular pancake syrup will do fine.

records.name: indian pudding
records.text: good cold weather dessert. from an old issue of real simple.

records.name: pumpkin melt in your mouth biscuits
records.text: i had extra pumpkin puree that i needed to use upo and in my search for a good way to use it, i came across this. these were very good. light and fluffy, with a great taste.

records.name: 3 minute apple crumble
records.text: really easy. not as good as the real thing, but a quick snack alternative.

records.name: weight watchers cornbread
records.text: i received an email this morning from a weight watchers leader by the name of cheri ann blessum. there were actually 3 recipes. this is one of them.

records.name: thai fish sauce   kosher  easy style
records.text: i couldn't find a kosher fish sauce to make pad thai with, so i make this instead. works like a charm!.

records.name: hearty cabbage soup
records.text: a thick and hearty cabbage/potato soup which is just perfect for those cold winter nights.

records.name: granny smith apple cake
records.text: slightly modified version of a recipe in everyday food magazine. this cake is so good, especially while it's still warm (or reheated). great for breakfast. or topped with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

records.name: granny smith apple cake
records.text: i choose granny smith apples for their tartness and because they hold their shape after baking. the apples come out completely soft after baking. i love the tartness of the apples mixed with the sweetness of the cake.

records.name: granny smith apple cake
records.text: optional: add 1/2 cup chopped walnuts if desired. note: the original recipe called for 1/2c of butter, but i reduced that to 1/4 and added in 1/4 applesauce to lower the fat in the recipe. you won't even miss the extra butter at all.

records.name: full moon
records.text: a drink with rum, kahlua, spices and cold espresso. taken in a book.

records.name: shaker bread pudding with oozing caramel sauce
records.text: from recipesource. com via the fat free junk food cookbook.

records.name: creamy italian orzo
records.text: orzo is a small italian pasta that looks very much like rice. this dish is a fabulous blend of creaminess which gently balances the punch of the onion and garlic.

records.name: creamy italian orzo
records.text: peas and cremini mushrooms are an added surprise in this dish that can be eaten as a side or a main course.

records.name: canadian maple glazed walnuts
records.text: this recipe uses maple syrup and cinnamon to spice up walnuts. simple to do and very good. posted for zwt4.

records.name: breaded rib roast
records.text: a very different way to serve a standing rib roast! the "crust" seals in the juices, resulting in a very tender roast!.

records.name: tortiere
records.text: i went hunting recently for a tortiere recipe, this is an amalgamation of several recipes and my personal preferences to boot. and to add to the debate of what to serve with tortiere?  my family likes hp sauce with theirs.

records.name: tortiere
records.text: for the pastry you need a double-crust pie dough, chilled for an hour. i usually make the full block of shortening, and add an egg and a tablespoon of vinegar to my water, it makes an awesome crust.

records.name: tortiere
records.text: even though i am now making dough enough for 3 double-crust pies that way. the rest i often turn into butter tarts or an apple pie, no one ever complains about that!.

records.name: mrs  field s soft and chewy peanut butter cookies
records.text: soft and very chewy.

records.name: orange honey sweet potatoes
records.text: this is our favorite way to serve sweet potatoes for the holidays. you can even spoon the delicious mixture into hollowed out orange shells for a beautiful, individual serving presentation.

records.name: bolognese
records.text: i got this recipe from one of my mom's cookbooks.

records.name: braised celery
records.text: this a nice way to cook celery.

records.name: amish turnips
records.text: very good recipe! i never had mashed turnips before, but i loved them. servings are approximate. i can't really remember how many servings i got out of it.

records.name: juicy peach crisp
records.text: a couple of summers ago a friend gave me some fragrant fresh peaches. tossed with almond extract and topped with a yummy brown sugar topping, i developed a delicious dessert that begs for the company of vanilla ice cream!.

records.name: fabulous spinach marinara
records.text: i came up with this recipe while trying to use up left over turkey. i was surprised with how easy it was to make and how delicious it tasted. i hope you enjoy!.

records.name: tres leches
records.text: i acquired this recipe for tres leches (three milks cake) while living in miami. although you can find it at many cuban restaurants, its origins are probably mexican or nicaraguan. it is very moist and intensely sweet.

records.name: tres leches
records.text: due to the milk content this dessert must be kept refrigerated, and is best when served chilled.

records.name: smartie bark
records.text: amazingly easy and an awesome gift! you can use red and green smarties for christmas, pastel colors for easter, etc. prep and cook time does not include cooling time.

records.name: cranberry citrus marmalade
records.text: from chamber of commerce cranberry cookbook, from westport/grayland area of washington coast. use fresh cranberries, in season. i buy many bags in season and freeze them for up to a year. if using frozen, no need to thaw them first.

records.name: strawberry risotto
records.text: a very unusual savory dish as published in our local paper. cooking time is approximate.

records.name: v8v fusion pan seared salmon in peach mango sauce
records.text: this is a fantastic way to cook your salmon - the sauce is just delicious!!.

records.name: sherri s herbed carrots
records.text: my friend at work brought these to me to try when his wife made them because they are so good. i have to say i could eat these all day.

records.name: spiced avocado sandwich
records.text: a great sandwich for summer! nice and spicy! you can use wraps or bread instead of pita if you like.

records.name: baked rigatoni with bechamel sauce
records.text: recipe courtesy giada de laurentiis this is a great side dish or main dish!.

records.name: dream bars
records.text: found the original recipe in king arthur flour's baking companion. i reduced the sugar content and i prefer them that way. you may also melt some chocolate chips and spread over the bars. you won't regret it!.

records.name: newbridge style steak tips
records.text: as weird as the marinade sounds it is soooooo good. you don't taste any one ingredient over the over. this recipe is a copy cat of a restaurant in massachusetts that serves these. preparation times does not include marinating overnight.

records.name: swiss mocha mix
records.text: this makes a nice gift in the winter time, especially for chocolate lovers, because it is so rich and creamy.

records.name: ham stuffed apples
records.text: the apple takes the place of individual serving dishes when stuffed with a nice ham mixture. great for a small dinner party. taken from the "from storebought to homemade" cookbook.

records.name: mom s stove top pork ribs
records.text: posted by thelmalu99 on allrecipes: "this is how my brazilian mom prepares pork ribs. boiling the ribs with the seasonings ensures that the meat will remain moist and juicy, and that the flavors will fully penetrate the meat.

records.name: mom s stove top pork ribs
records.text: i hope you like these as much as i always have! serve with lime wedges, rice and a fresh green salad. ".

records.name: strawberry chocolate rice krispies squares
records.text: tried several recipes but wanted some with a kick!! tried this and everyone wanted recipe so badly they offered almost everything! a definite alternative to the usual.

records.name: lemon fruit sauce
records.text: this is a really quick and easy to make sauce. it is good used as a dressing for fruit salad, as a dip for fresh fruit, or as a dessert sauce over pound cake. prep and cook time does not include the 8 hours of chilling time.

records.name: lemon fruit sauce
records.text: this is from the junior league in pasadena, ca.

records.name: cream of artichoke soup with chervil and fried artichokes
records.text: posted by request. this recipe is from the panera bread cookbook: breadmaking essentials and recipes from america's favorite bakery-cafe by the panera bread team. recipes by ward bradshaw and joel cammett. © 2004 by panera bread.

records.name: chicken crunch casserole
records.text: from the 1990 celebrate minnesota cookbook, submitted by members of the lyle 1990 celebration.

records.name: dawn s orange loaf cake
records.text: this is a definite cross between a light dessert or a breakfast quick bread treat. it has the texture of a cake but in loaf form. from a toh booklet and submitted by dawn c. from florida.

records.name: dawn s orange loaf cake
records.text: this uses cake flour which i find makes a really lighter texture to the loaves than standard flour.

records.name: dawn s orange loaf cake
records.text: you can substitute all purpose flour but reduce the total by 3 1/2 tbls (for every cup of cake flour you need to reduce all purpose by 2 tbls) but remember that all purpose will probably give you a heavier texture of cake loaf.

records.name: spanish cream
records.text: a silky, cool old-fashioned dessert, prep time includes chilling.

records.name: light and fluffy biscuits
records.text: if you like biscuits, i am sure you will like this one. i can't tell you how many batches i baked to come up with this recipe. i wanted to make a light, fluffy biscuit that didn't choke you on the way down and i finally achieved my goal.

records.name: light and fluffy biscuits
records.text: they are great with gravy.

records.name: soft gluten free naan bread  indian flatbread
records.text: a soft, easy to roll gluten free naan that you have to try to appreciate. made dairy-free or not, these are the talk of the gluten-free community!.

records.name: peppered steak in sherry cream sauce
records.text: from sarah ainley’s book, the world’s best recipes, caribbean section. “this dish would be perfect for supper, served on a bed of noodles or with boiled plantains. ” prep time doesn’t include 30 minutes marinating time.

records.name: quiche in pepper cups
records.text: this is fabulous! there are lots of leftovers if you are only cooking for two, but they reheat very well. pick small peppers or the cups will be too big and the edges will burn.

records.name: holiday walnut cake
records.text: this is a wonderful recipe that mamere made every year at christmastime.

records.name: dijon chicken with panko crust
records.text: this is a very good and tasty recipe, takes only 30 minutes to prepare. panko is available in well-stocked supermarkets and asian grocery stores. the recipe comes from sunset.

records.name: strawberry cheese dip
records.text: use as a dip for fresh fruit, pound cake or as a spread for scones.

records.name: bacon   chicken liver pate
records.text: i have yet to try this recipe but it looked good and i wanted to keep it for later to use. i love chicken liver pate and bacon so this seemed perfect.

records.name: spicy grilled tuna un roll
records.text: no rolling here. this variation for tuna rolls is a great summer meal refreshingly light, made with fresh grated ginger, powdered wasabi, soy all flavors from asia. plated over avocado slices and served with additional soy and wasabi.

records.name: jalapeno rellenos
records.text: great appetizer to serve with your next mexican meal.

records.name: chickpea and spinach with fresh figs and black olives tajine
records.text: i thought i might do a little variation on a traditional morrocan dish (because i bought myself a new tajine). this dish has the unusual combination of orange zest and fresh green chillies and whole spices.

records.name: chickpea and spinach with fresh figs and black olives tajine
records.text: the tajine i am using is a 32cm one (quite large but everything will fit in a large casserole dish).

records.name: chickpea and spinach with fresh figs and black olives tajine
records.text: and please try to use fresh figs (i have a little tree that gives me some fruit now and then) and tinned spinach (it just has that deeper taste).

records.name: chickpea and spinach with fresh figs and black olives tajine
records.text: i just like it in a bowl with warm pita or soft tortilla but can be served with couscous or boiled rice. please enjoy and let me know what you think. i love it.

records.name: the best marinated grilled flank steak
records.text: a really simple marinade- which i like to use a couple of days in advance, but it's totally not necessary! a simple 2 1/2 hours will certainly do that yummy cut of meat some justice!.

records.name: caramel apple upside down cornmeal cake
records.text: from better homes and gardens.

records.name: smoky spinach macaroni and cheese
records.text: this is an interesting twist on an old favorite. also a verrrry clever way of sneaking spinach into your family's mouths. smoky, creamy and oh-so-satisfying.

records.name: pan seared cajun tilapia
records.text: based on recipe from grouprecipes. com. hubby loves it!  great with steamed broccoli and red potatoes. quick and easy!  pretty spicy though.

records.name: meat loaf with red wine glaze
records.text: the meat loaf brushed with the red wine glaze, caramelizes as it bakes. making it delicious! the "maligned" meat loaf takes on beautiful glaze & the glaze makes it especially easy to pair with wine.

records.name: meat loaf with red wine glaze
records.text: the meat loaf isn't heavily seasoned so it can be paired with almost any fullbodied red. try a firm cabernet like the 2005 chateau ste michelle columbia valley.

records.name: meat loaf with red wine glaze

records.name: garlic roasted red potatoes

records.name: hoe cakes

records.name: charcoal grilled blackened red snapper
records.text: "if using fillets that are 1/2 inch or thinner, reduce cooking time to 3 minutes per side.

records.name: charcoal grilled blackened red snapper
records.text: if using fillets that are 1 inch or thicker, increase cooking time on second side by 2 minutes, moving the fish to the cooler side of the grill after the second side has browned.

records.name: charcoal grilled blackened red snapper
records.text: if you cannot find red snapper, striped bass, halibut, and catfish can be substituted. making the slashes in the skin requires a sharp knife. if your knife isn’t sharp enough, try cutting through the skin with a serrated knife.

records.name: charcoal grilled blackened red snapper
records.text: however, cut in one direction (don’t saw) and be careful not to cut into the flesh. if you choose not to eat the skin, be sure to remove it after cooking rather than beforehand.

records.name: charcoal grilled blackened red snapper
records.text: serve fish with lemon wedges and our rémoulade or our pineapple and cucumber salsa with mint. "  skin-on fillets will buckle when grilled because the skin will shrink back, pulling the flesh along with it.

records.name: charcoal grilled blackened red snapper
records.text: the fillets will remain flat if the skin is scored first, which prevents it from contracting more quickly than the flesh.

records.name: jamaican shrimp pepper pot soup

records.name: jamaican shrimp pepper pot soup

records.name: if you like pina coladas  protein smoothie
records.text: you will be singing that song from the 70's all the time you are drinking this great tasting, healthy smoothie! make sure you get some little paper umbrellas!.

records.name: linzer cookies

records.name: linzer cookies

records.text: an easy midweek meal using storecupboard ingredients such as ground beef, pasta, frozen veg and a tin of tomato soup!.

records.name: large batch chocolate chunk  chocolate chip  cookies  oamc
records.text: i've been making these cookies for over 20 years. i found this recipe in an old service league cookbook from the 1950's. the recipe was originally contributed by the green bay day nursery, and gently tweaked over the years.

records.name: large batch chocolate chunk  chocolate chip  cookies  oamc
records.text: i can't begin to tell you how many people have asked for the recipe. the cookies do not spread much resulting in a nice thick drop cookie.

records.name: large batch chocolate chunk  chocolate chip  cookies  oamc
records.text: because of the large volume of  cookie dough this produces, i use my ka stand mixer to prepare the dough and just mix the extras in by hand with a sturdy wooden spoon. this dough freezes very well, and can be halved successfully if desired.

records.name: large batch chocolate chunk  chocolate chip  cookies  oamc
records.text: don't be intimidated by the long directions as the dough itself is extremely easy, i have added variations and fun tips which make the instructions seem longer. i hope you enjoy these as much as we do.

records.name: berry citrus mini muffins
records.text: these muffins are healthy and delicious by themselves, but they are also excellent served with a little bit of low fat cream cheese!  if you are using this recipe for a light desert, i would recommend creating a glaze for the top of the muffin.

records.name: berry citrus mini muffins
records.text: mix together confectioners sugar along with some lemon or orange juice and drizzle on the muffins are they have baked and cooled, enjoy!  i came up with this recipe when preparing lemon blueberry muffins.

records.name: berry citrus mini muffins
records.text: i have strawberries that needed to be used or else they would of gone bad so i decided to throw them in along with a few other ingredients. to lighten these muffins up i used egg substitute and less butter than are found in most muffins.

records.name: berry citrus mini muffins
records.text: also i added wheat bran to give that extra fiber.

records.name: my  famous  shredded chicken
records.text: now, to me this really isn't a recipe, but i was telling a friend how i make shredded chicken for recipes and she said i should post it. it always comes out tender, and has frozen well for me.

records.name: my  famous  shredded chicken
records.text: i usually make double at once for oamc since it is so easy.

records.name: go nuts granola

records.name: rich and decadent butter pecan bread pudding

records.name: artichoke hearts in lemon parsley sauce
records.text: from the williams-sonoma "vegetable" cookbook. dh and i enjoyed this as a side to a lemon chicken recipe. choose either fresh or frozen artichokes (the default when listing this would not let me write "or").

records.name: artichoke hearts in lemon parsley sauce
records.text: we used frozen artichoke hearts from trader joe's and it turned out really nice.

records.name: butternut squash soup   vegan
records.text: this was one of the recipes i made in the vegetarian cooking class i attended at johnson & wales university culinary school.

records.name: butternut squash soup   vegan
records.text: this soup was particularly delicious because you could really taste the sweet, earthy goodness of the squash, because it was not masked over by heaps of butter or cream.

records.name: butternut squash soup   vegan
records.text: this class was also the first time i had used an immersion blender (industrial stength, of course!). this mechanical wonder pureed our gigantic pot of soup into pure, velvety smoothness in minutes.

records.name: butternut squash soup   vegan
records.text: at home, i will probably use my plain ol' blender, and work in batches. since i did get this recipe from the chefs at the culinary school, please note the "precise"ness of the directions regarding the size of the dice etc.

records.name: butternut squash soup   vegan
records.text: i am sure at home, we are all not that precise, but for one day, it was fun to cook with the pros!.

records.name: creamy clouds over tranquil turquoise  seas

records.name: creamy clouds over tranquil turquoise  seas
records.text: amazing! must try!.

records.name: gingery limeade
records.text: from cooking light august 2007. a nice twist on traditional limeade.

records.name: guinness banana nut bread

records.name: guinness banana nut bread
records.text: top it with this recipe #86695 if your want to really bring it up a notch! heart optional: you can replace 1/2 cup of flour with irish steel cut oats. i just spun them in the food processor with the sifted ingredients. better for your heart!.

records.name: karin calloway s crock pot sweet and sour meatballs
records.text: karin is the food writer for the augusta chronicle. she shares quick and easy recipes like the following one for entree meatballs. this version is not as syrupy as most sweet and sour recipes.

records.name: karin calloway s crock pot sweet and sour meatballs

records.name: savory salsa
records.text: tired of looking for a good (not sweet) homemade salsa similar to what you would buy in the store (for 4-6 dollars a jar)?  so was i, but i have been playing with multiple salsa recipes this summer due to the few hundred pounds of tomatoes in the garden.

records.name: savory salsa
records.text: i think this one is the best of the bunch. everyone who has tried it has liked it and our friends even serve it at their parties at home. this is a cooked not a fresh salsa, medium hot, and can be canned.

records.name: imitation crab  orzo and veggie skillet
records.text: this is a work in progress. i need to mess around with the spices, but i had all this in the fridge, and i didn't want to go to the store. i'm thinking next time i might use white wine as a stock.

records.text: let me know if anyone has any other ideas! the veggies were good together and the orzo added a nice buttery flavor. **the amounts of spices are guessed.

records.name: michelle s  french mayonnaise in a flash

records.name: andy s south west chicken soup  atkins low carb

records.name: mark bittman s basic biscotti

records.name: macaroni and cheese ala isaac and good and plenty
