records.text: type of meat wasn't stated, just "whatever ground meat you can find".

records.name: herbed basmati pilaf
records.text: we love basmati rice, this is a good pilaf recipe. enjoy.

records.name: quick and easy spaghetti sauce
records.text: learned from my mom, very basic recipe. it can be changed to suit any taste. i usually use more garlic, and some parmasian, even used italian sausage instead of ground beef, but i'm just putting down the basic way i learned.

records.name: bon bon cookies
records.text: these will look great on your holiday cookie platter.

records.name: rustic wheat cinnamon raisin bread
records.text: i looked and looked for a cinnamon raisin bread with wheat flour that wasn't for the abm and couldn't find one. so i made my own!  makes a very large loaf or two small loaves.

records.name: rustic wheat cinnamon raisin bread
records.text: **note** this recipe calls for instant yeast! if you use regular active yeast, you will need to adjust the amount of yeast, your dough will take longer to raise, the water temperature will need to be reduced and method of mixing should include proofing the yeast before adding it to the mixture.

records.name: rustic wheat cinnamon raisin bread
records.text: both poor reviews came when reviewer used active yeast - i suggest only using instant yeast unless you are an experienced bread maker (i am not, thus why i use the instant yeast, its much more forgiving).

records.name: the best chicken marinade
records.text: this is from the freezer cooking manual from 30 day gourmet: a month of meals made easy. i had this at a friend's birthday party.

records.name: the best chicken marinade
records.text: he marinaded chicken breasts overnight in a plastic food bag and then used his george foreman grill to them the next day.

records.name: walnut topping
records.text: yummy topping for ice-cream, pancakes, waffles, etc.

records.name: hummus inspired veggie dip w  garlic pita chips
records.text: this is more hummus inspired than actually hummus but yummy all the same. it is packed with veggie goodness and has a fresh garden type taste that goes great with the rustic (and seriously easy) baked garlic pita chips.

records.name: spanish grilled cheese sandwiches
records.text: recipe source: bon appetit (march 2009).

records.name: yeah  man   a jamaican drink
records.text: this is a dorinda recipe. one cup equals 240 ml. make sure to chill your glasses.

records.name: seven vegetable stew
records.text: moroccans consider seven to be a lucky number. this i never knew! i gained this recipe when i traveled through africa one long hot summer. i gained a journal full of recipes and a case of sceptaecemia as a bonus gift!.

records.name: not your grandmother s bread pudding
records.text: i recently pruchased a dozen very large  hot cross buns on my way home from visiting my new grandson in alberta, only to discover they were really stale (packaged in one of those "clam shells" as bakery departments are known to do).

records.name: not your grandmother s bread pudding
records.text: unwilling to throw them out, i thought i should try making bread pudding out of them. i'm going make it every easter!.

records.name: barbecue chicken bundles
records.text: i got this recipe a long time ago from a land o lakes cooking mag. this is excellent for summer bbq's as a steak or burger alternative. you can also use different types of cheese as well.

records.name: barbecue chicken bundles
records.text: you can also broil this dish in the oven at 400 degrees for 30 minutes, then turn over and cook for 20 minutes. you will need to half cook the bacon first if you broil this dish!.

records.name: green beans  pears  and ham   germany
records.text: this looked yummy and easy to make. from "the best recipes in the world" cookbook. "this is a good recipe to use ordinary ham, as long as it is not too sweet; prosciutto or the like would be overkill".

records.name: fast and easy zucchini pie
records.text: from gooseberry patch-mom's favorite recipes. i received this in the cookbook swap from mandabears and just love the simplicity of the recipes and the wholesomeness that comes with them. easy to make, simple food that is nutritous and tasty!.

records.name: blueberry pancake syrup
records.text: i've made this blueberry syrup several times, but i bet it would work well for raspberries. it's worth a try!.

records.name: gnocchi with wild mushrooms
records.text: use store bought gnocchi to make this deliciously rich dish.

records.name: breaded beef
records.text: our all-time favorite meat item! everybody who has ever had this has flipped out! it's so easy and make extra and freeze it for a meal in 5 minutes!! give it a try--i promise you won't be disappointed!.

records.name: one pan balsamic salmon
records.text: modified from someplace on the internet. sorry i can't give proper credit. it's delicious!.

records.name: hot chicken  broccoli cole slaw mmin wraps
records.text: a nutritious , balanced meal that is a snap to put together. broccoli, coleslaw, shredded cabbage, and chicken are stuffed into a tortilla with a hummus spread. great with leftover chicken. from healthy eating. com.

records.name: rack of lamb with minted pea puree
records.text: mint and lamb are made for each other! i found this in an aussie magazine, and it looks pretty good to me.

records.name: scallops with asparagus
records.text: from gourmet april 2007. super quick!.

records.name: irene s tamale pie
records.text: this recipe is from my mother-in-law, irene. she was vegetarian most of her life. this was not something i was use to, but learned to love some of her recipes.

records.name: irene s tamale pie
records.text: this recipe is versatile, so add what ever your family likes to this mexican casserole!  "we miss you, mom" 1919-2007.

records.name: mexi burger
records.text: i made this when i just didn't want a plain grilled burger.

records.name: steak dipping sauce
records.text: this sauce is very nice for dipping thinly sliced strips of steak, and it can also be used as a base for a shrimp cocktail.

records.name: roasted red potatoes with rosemary
records.text: from quick fix meals with robin miller on the food network.

records.name: zucchini tea loaf
records.text: coffee or tea - it doesn't matter. this moist loaf tastes good with anything!.

records.name: easy stewed zucchini with feta
records.text: talk about cheating!! i was a waitress for 16 years in new york diners. one of my favorite veggie sides was stewed zucchini, (the greek chefs made this daily). well, this is just as good and so easy. this is also my first post. hope you like it.

records.name: spicy fried asparagus stalks
records.text: i adore asparagus but too often i trim off the tips and much of the stem goes to waste. i decided to take inspiration from one of my favourite recipes here on zaar, spicy fried celery #23818 by jans, to create this use for asparagus stems.

records.name: applebee s red apple sangria
records.text: there is little at applebees' that i enjoy eating but go there often so i can enjoy this sangria.

records.name: sweet potato pecan burgers
records.text: these vegetarian burgers work well as burgers or as a meat replacement patty for meals.

records.name: fluffy pink dump salad
records.text: a. k. a. "pink stuff"--only 4 ingredients! this is *so* easy to make and great for potlucks, barbeques, picnics, family get-togethers, especially in the summer! it's a nice cool, light, sweet side dish or dessert.

records.name: fluffy pink dump salad
records.text: it's called a "dump salad" because all you have to do is dump the ingredients together and stir. definitely double the recipe and make a large bowl for a gathering of 20+ people!.

records.name: layered citrus dessert
records.text: great make-ahead, lemon no bake dessert. as the dessert refrigerates overnight, the wafers sofen and absorb the milk. from kraft canada. do not use low fat products; the result will not be the same. time includes overnight refrigeration time.

records.name: layered citrus dessert
records.text: posted exactly as written on kraft canada website. please read the review from 2 blue for helpful tips on can sizes and lemon juice.

records.name: baked empanadas
records.text: a spanish-style appetizer.

records.name: thai green apple salad
records.text: probably not authentic but i thought it was delicious.

records.name: my pasta salad
records.text: lots of fresh vegetables make this an easy, healthy, and delightful side dish. i often add cooked chicken or ham for a cool summer meal.

records.name: my pasta salad
records.text: you can vary the vegetables you use - it will make it colorful and just to your taste! please make one day before serving to allow flavors to blend.

records.name: bananas foster cocktail
records.text: delicious!  from food network semi-homemade with sandra lee.

records.name: pumpkin blizzard pie
records.text: i adopted this recipe from the recipezaar account as i am always on the look out for make ahead desserts. this is the original introduction : "i came up with this recipe after having a pumpkin pie blizzard.

records.name: pumpkin blizzard pie
records.text: i like to serve it with cool whip and a little nutmeg. ".

records.name: ground beef stroganoff  like hamburger helper
records.text: really yummy recipe. my own creation based on lots of other stroganoff recipes out there. makes great left-overs :).

records.name: pork chops dijon   low carb
records.text: quick & yummy recipe that i made last night, and loved!  i used sliced pork loin instead of chops, and i didn't have any low-carb italian, so used woody's parmesan peppercorn, instead.

records.name: pork chops dijon   low carb
records.text: and surprisingly, it didn't have a strong mustard flavor, even with 3 tbs of dijon. another keeper from better homes & gardens "phase i low carb recipes. ".

records.name: mrs  gordon s chinese chicken wings
records.text: my mil used to make these - everyone loved them, and so i got the recipe from her so i could make them more often.

records.name: mrs  gordon s chinese chicken wings
records.text: now i try to avoid eating chicken wings, but i make an exception for these - every christmas eve my mom makes them, and they are always a big hit - no left overs!.

records.name: carnitas del crock pot
records.text: from thekitchn. com. this will get your through a busy week. cheap, filling, satisfying.

records.name: broiled chicken with fettuccine earl s
records.text: very good dish but very spicy. we love hot and spicy, and this was a little too potent for us. i cut the jalapenos in half now. from the rsvp section of bon appetit, earl's, calgary, alberta.

records.name: easy chocolate chip cake
records.text: my mother used to make this recipe whenever we had company. it was legendary in our neighborhood. it is quick and delicious!.

records.name: cooking a pre cooked ham in the crock pot
records.text: i met a lady sorting through a bin of hams at the grocery store. i had missed those and she commented they were the best. they were smoked, mostly boneless, butt portions.

records.name: cooking a pre cooked ham in the crock pot
records.text: well, they were half the price of the sliced one i had in my basket, so i asked her how she cooked it. she wraps the ham in foil and cooks in the crock pot until done. the foil keeps the juices in, she said. so i tried it for christmas dinner.

records.name: cooking a pre cooked ham in the crock pot
records.text: superb.

records.name: onion cheese tartlets
records.text: adapted from a recipe on tastefood blog. this recipe was inspired by a swiss onion and cheese tart.

records.name: passionfruit vanilla slice
records.text: an australian tradition. actually i don't know where it comes but it's served in every school tuckshop (canteen) and bakery in the land. this is always popular and is my husbands favourite.

records.name: arni exohiko   surprise  lamb country style
records.text: an interesting dish !!.

records.name: spinach salad with chili lime dressing
records.text: with jicama, avocado and sunflower seeds tossed in a spicy dressing, this is not your typical spinach salad. from southern living.

records.name: crockpot tapioca pudding
records.text: taken from aarp blog by jeff yeager, july 2012. note:  recipe does not include chilling time for pudding.

records.name: caramelized peaches or nectarines
records.text: my neighbors peach tree is overflowing in my backyard and dripping with large peaches. i'm on a hunt to get recipes to use them before my dogs eat them all! this can be served over ice-cream over pancakes or crepes and is from epicurious.

records.name: caramelized peaches or nectarines
records.text: (if using peaches, you must skin them first).

records.name: tuna rice balls
records.text: appetizer or entree--easy to make and tasty! substitute crab or lobster. from food blog with my changes.

records.name: easy homemade noodles
records.text: it just takes a few minutes to make wonderful, homemade noodles. all you need is flour, egg and a pinch of salt 2 tablespoons of milk.

records.name: easy homemade noodles
records.text: what a tasty addition to fresh chicken soup! my grand kids love these noodles in chicken broth with shredded chicken. if you are in a hurry you can drop little chunks of the mix into boiling broth instead of rolling, cutting, and letting dry.

records.name: easy homemade noodles
records.text: they are more like dumplings than noodles this way. (they must be very small chunks because if they aren't dried first they puff up. ).

records.name: tennessee coleslaw
records.text: this recipe is good for those of you who don't like mayonnaise in coleslaw. you could certainly use the packaged pre-shredded cole slaw mix.

records.name: chicken and peaches piquant
records.text: my family loves this, with the exception of our son, who thinks we are weird to pair meat with fruit. pay no attention to that kid, sweet and savory is great! i serve this over rice.

records.name: hot dogs   noodles
records.text: absolutely my kids' favorite dish!  they request it whenever they spy hot dogs in my frig. it's super easy and quick to fix.

records.name: chicken pizza
records.text: this is a good recipe--it's easy.

records.name: the polish church pound cake
records.text: years ago this was the most popular and coveted recipe at the polish church of my youth. the flavoring most used was a butter/vanilla/nut flavoring combination sold locally.

records.name: the polish church pound cake
records.text: the cherries and nuts were not cut fine; thus they formed a pretty pattern in a slice of cake. the cake is moist and flavorful with a lovely texture. very important to start baking in a cold oven!. and the baking time is long!  no icing needed.

records.name: the polish church pound cake
records.text: or wanted!.

records.name: blue mesa grill sweet corn cake
records.text: this is a recipe i submitted in response to a request. i have not tried it.

records.name: candied walnut gorgonzola salad
records.text: another recipe with gorgonzola cheese, doesn't get any better.

records.name: shredded pork sandwiches
records.text: the crock pot & your favorite bottled bbq sauce or my recipe for recipe #277503 makes cooking up these delicious sandwiches very easy. the meat is tender & practically shreds itself.

records.name: shredded pork sandwiches
records.text: i've been making this recipe for 20 years & always get rave reviews.

records.name: chai spiced cheesecake with ginger crust
records.text: the spices in indian chai tea flavor this creamy cheesecake. the topping can be made 2 days ahead. chill until cold, then cover and keep chilled. courtesy bon appetit. and their photo looks sinful!.

records.name: swedish meatballs ii
records.text: this is an old, classic recipe for swedish meatballs. serve with sautéed vegetables and fresh bread.

records.name: pat s baked beef
records.text: i didn't know what to do for dinner one evening, and only had a few ingredients in the house to use with beef charcoal steaks. so i threw this together, quick, simple and now have to make it at least once a week.

records.name: pat s baked beef
records.text: hope you enjoy it as much as we do!! you can also use any kind of beef with this recipe, such as--beef ribs, cubed steak, round steak etc.

records.name: garlic and white wine prawns
records.text: taken for an old copy of australian good taste for safekeeping as sounds good and easy !!.

records.name: the lady s chicken noodle soup   paula deen
records.text: this recipe is from the days that paula deen started "the bag lady", where her sons would go out and sell their mother's meals. the recipe is courtesy of paula deen, 2003 television food network.

records.name: the lady s chicken noodle soup   paula deen
records.text: she was very overwhelmed when she cooked this soup and it looked very good! hope to be trying it very soon. 05/08/07 update.

records.name: the lady s chicken noodle soup   paula deen
records.text: delicious, did change a few things around - first added carrots and celery to the stock, as well as dill (it really makes the soup even better. ).

records.name: chow mein with shrimp and pork
records.text: another recipe from a chinese cooking class that i attended. simple and yummy.

records.name: broccoli chicken soup  hcg   phase 2
records.text: i had broccoli the other night and didn't want to cook (or throw out) the stem, so i cut it up and decided to use it in a soup. this was my result.

records.name: broccoli chicken soup  hcg   phase 2
records.text: =)  it kind of reminds me of some kind of soup you could get in a chinese restaurant for some reason. =)  also, this recipe is for two servings, so only eat half of it if you're on the hcg diet.

records.name: broccoli chicken soup  hcg   phase 2
records.text: if you want to add or remove certain spices, feel free to do so!!  =).

records.name: german pancake with buttermilk sauce
records.text: by penny chmura.

records.name: june bug  cocktail
records.text: oh so good!  like sipping a bit of the tropics. i'm not much of a drinker, but this has all my favorites. midori, pineapple, coconut; a little sweet, a little sour.

records.name: june bug  cocktail
records.text: yum! i've seen the banana liquor left out in some recipes, so i've listed it as optional. (f. y. i. 1 oz. is the size of a small shot glass. ).

records.name: corn and potato chowder for masako
records.text: we had our friends masako and her husband from my hometown in japan as guests for about 6 weeks last year. we toured the us - mostly the east coast and the  southwest showing them all the fabulous sights.

records.name: corn and potato chowder for masako
records.text: during our touring, masako was introduced to potato and corn chowder and from that point on, every place we stopped she would ask me if the restaurant had corn and potato chowder.

records.name: corn and potato chowder for masako
records.text: knowing how much she loved this chowder, i knew exactly what i was going to make for her upon our return home. my favorite corn and potato chowder from one of the best places to eat bbq - dinosaur bbq in syracuse and rochester, ny.

records.name: corn and potato chowder for masako
records.text: we try to eat there anytime we are nearby visiting my nephew - the food is great, but i just love their cookbook. every recipe i've tried from the book is sooo good!  this recipe is not the exact copy from the book, but very close to it.

records.name: corn and potato chowder for masako
records.text: this chowder  will thicken if you refrigerate and may need to be thinned out by adding some water to your taste. alternatively, if you prefer for dietary reason, you can substitute milk for half-and-half.

records.name: rhubarb cake with a mix
records.text: history in the baking. this one has marshmallows in it,   this is a very nice cake the jello and the marshmallows melt  to make a beautiful glaze. its sweet and very rich. very  easy.

records.name: moroccan spiced vegetarian chili
records.text: a wonderfully fragrant vegetarian chili - serve with couscous, rice, or toasted pita.

records.name: chicken   broccoli casserole
records.text: this has a rich and hearty flavor & it's a one dish meal that is easy and delicious! you must try this one ! my family's favorite around the holiday's!.

records.name: fruity white tea smoothie
records.text: i've been playing around with this recipe a lot. and i think i found the best way to do it. it's a great and healthy pick me up.

records.name: easy baked potato hash browns
records.text: i love this recipe, it is quick and easy. i got bored one night and rummaged around in my cabinets for a quick dinner. i created this and my husband ate it all! lol it is now a house favorite!.

records.name: david  the latke king  firestones crispy latkes
records.text: these perfect latkes (potato pancakes) are from molly o’neill's classic, "the new york cookbook". the recipe is from her friend david firestone who hosts a latke party every hanukkah in queens. serve with applesauce and sour cream.

records.name: david  the latke king  firestones crispy latkes
records.text: makes 16 latkes.

records.name: super easy kulfi  pakistani ice cream
records.text: you will not believe how great this taste. ooh so good. very very easy. you can use recipe #179155 to make a pakistani ice cream sundae float.

records.name: mexican clam dip
records.text: really good clam dip. nice little zip to it. from  epicurious. com.

records.name: sticky date cake
records.text: drizzle this moist cake with a warm caramel sauce as a sweet dessert for your guests or for those days when you crave something sweet to eat. i have alot of those craving days, especially now that my son is on his own.

records.name: sticky date cake
records.text: as an empty nester, i am constantly feeling the need to bake something just to stay busy. then i take everything i make to work. i love that feel good feeling when people ask me for my recipes. (makes me feel wanted. ).

records.name: chocolate coconut cheesecake squares
records.text: something like a candy bar, this has a fudgy crust with, creamy cheesecake center and is topped with toasted coconut. please make sure to use unsweetened coconut which will be labeled "desiccated" coconut. from martha stewart.

records.name: garlic herb pepperoni bread  bread machine
records.text: this recipe smells great baking and is great toasted with butter or cheese. kids love it! makes 1. 5 lb. loaf. cook time listed includes dough prep and rise time.

records.name: buttery peanut brittle
records.text: so buttery and good. i would leave the peanuts out for my dad. for everyone else, i used raw peanuts. cooling time is not figured in.

records.name: a1 chicken thighs en croute on a bed of dijon cooked spinach  a1
records.text: a. 1. original sauce recipe contest entry. a1 steak sauce and dijon create a delicate flavor for these en croute chicken thighs. this pocket of deliciousness on a bed of spinach cooked with dijon and a1 steak sauce is a tasty and balanced meal.

records.name: our favorite pancakes
records.text: this is a recipe i've fiddled with a little bit over the years, and is usually what the kids ask for every morning for breakfast! i use a griddle that makes about 9 at a time, with one ladle-full of batter per pancake, so if you make them bigger or smaller of course the yield will be different.

records.name: banana chocolate strawberry smoothie
records.text: a low fat yummy smoothie. if you're not watching your weight you may wish to up the chocolate sauce to 2 tbsp. the amount listed lends a light chocolate flavor.

records.name: banana cookies
records.text: this recipe is orginally a raisin drop cookie recipe but i ommited the raisins, cinnamon and vanilla and this is what you get.

records.name: banana cookies
records.text: recipe may be double since it is only 1/4 of the orginal recipe if mixture is still dry after adding all ingridents add a small amount of milk or water to moisten it up.

records.name: cumin seed flatbreads
records.text: from the robinhood flour website. posting for safe keeping since i always seem to lose recipes in cyberspace lol.

records.name: ruth s white bean and ham soup
records.text: very close to my mom's ham and bean soup.

records.name: ruth s white bean and ham soup
records.text: *update 2/5/08* my mom called and said she never used a bay leaf in her soup so if i'm going to keep her name on this recipe i need to remove the bay leaf :-) -- i always listen to my mom (well at least now!).

records.name: jewish deli style chopped chicken livers
records.text: the jewish version of pate, this rich spread gets a flavor boost from the sweet caramelized onions and the rendered chicken fat. not a dish for the faint of heart, literally.

records.name: jewish deli style chopped chicken livers
records.text: it's wonderful on little pumpernickel squares with cornichons, but in a jewish deli you can also find it spread between two slices of rye for lunch. can be made 1 day ahead and kept in the refrigerator. from the take-out menu cookbook.

records.name: loubia
records.text: algerian green beans and almonds served as a side dish. i found this for zwt 6. algeria north africa.

records.name: new potato or red potato salad ala nita
records.text: excellent and delicious! this has evolved over 50+ years of cooking. always a hit.

records.name: oh so good corny beans
records.text: this is wonderful! it's a great side dish and goes nearly with everything! it's so amazing and can be used as a main dish!if you don't have one of the kinds of beans listed, just toss in what you have, or just leave it out.

records.name: oh so good corny beans
records.text: great little recipe for pot lucks, picnics and get togethers.

records.name: fried mexican capsicum   potatoes
records.text: a deliciously spiced potato/capsicum side dish to complement grilled chicken or fish, or to accompany other mexican dishes.

records.name: fried mexican capsicum   potatoes
records.text: posted for the 2005 zaar world tour, this recipe has been adapted from an international masters '1001 recipes for pan or wok' recide card.

records.name: fried mexican capsicum   potatoes
records.text: if like me, you don't like really spicy food, omit the chillies and add dried italian or greek herbs, and perhaps 1/2 teaspoon cumin.

records.name: fried mexican capsicum   potatoes
records.text: realise of course that this is then no longer really a mexican dish!  testimony surely to just how many recipes are so easily crossing national and international boundaries!.

records.name: south african pudding
records.text: this recipe was sent to me, via all recipes. posted for zaar world tour!.

records.name: if give a kid a candy    they always come back  for more  fruit
records.text: my neighbor annie is a fantastic fake out cook. rachel ray has nothing on her. she develped these fake out candies for her kids when they wanted something sweet. they are eating fresh fruit, and can you believe, begging for more.

records.name: if give a kid a candy    they always come back  for more  fruit
records.text: for the harried mom, these are easy to make and you can include the little ones in preparation. kids like to eat what they have helped to make. cooking time is actually freezing time.

records.name: garlic fingers
records.text: friedel described these in a canadian-themed thread, and really sparked my curiousity. i found this recipe on a copycat site, and these sound like something amazing. just don't plan on any intense kissing after eating these!.

records.name: lentil sloppy joes
records.text: a grown-up version to the sloppy joe.

records.name: how to make dried chickpeas in a crock pot
records.text: it was a garage sale bargain i couldn't resist. so after all these years, i am first using a crockpot--and one of the first things i made was this--and these chickpeas are outrageously good. no more canned chickpeas for me.

records.name: sara belle s veg all casserole
records.text: this recipe is a wonderful childhood memory of visiting with grandpa and grandma thomas in south carolina.

records.name: banana oatmeal rocks
records.text: don't let the name fool you!  these are cookies that end up soft and tender with a nice crunch from the nuts. i love the flavor comination of the lemon and banana.

records.name: banana oatmeal rocks
records.text: i personally don't care for rasins, so i use crasins (dried cranberries) this is another great way to use up ripe bananas!.

records.name: cinnabon cake
records.text: oh my!  this is heaven in a pan. delicious served warm anytime of the day or night.

records.name: curry comfort chicken pot pie
records.text: i love comfort food, but my husband likes more exotic flavors. so this is a compromise that i came up with recently. it satisfied my craving for something warm and belly-filling while tempting his adventurous palate.

records.name: curry comfort chicken pot pie
records.text: this recipe improvises upon three recipes i found here, numbers 100215, 10744 and 51269. you can substitute carrots and cauliflower for the sweet potatoes and parsnips, respectively.

records.name: curry comfort chicken pot pie
records.text: i prefer the bisquick crust, but puff pastry and regular pie crust would also work well.

records.name: french martini
records.text: another great martini recipe for all you chambord lovers!.

records.name: green beans in sour cream
records.text: rather nice beans!  can be made richer with the use of cream and butter, or calorie conscious with yoghurt!  from readers digest : quick and thrifty cooking in south africa.

records.name: maple bars
records.text: i don't remember where i got this recipe but it is so good. i get asked to make these and they are always gone fast. you could sprinkle chopped nuts on top of the icing if you wanted. the icing would also be good on a cake.

records.name: rosemary   smoked sea salt roasted walnuts
records.text: an easy to prepare and cook savoury snack with walnuts, smoked sea salt and fresh rosemary. we enjoyed these roasted walnuts with our aperitifs and i also served the rest of them with the cheese and salad course.

records.name: rosemary   smoked sea salt roasted walnuts
records.text: i plan to make some more of these and use them for salads, they would be absolutely brilliant with a hot chèvre (goat’s cheese) salad, as well as making great gifts for friends and family.

records.name: vegan cowboy tamale pie
records.text: yummy and healthy!  this recipe came from a cooking show done by cinda sanner on 3 angel's broadcasting network. she has recipe books out, but i'm not sure which one has this delicious dish in it.

records.name: vegan cowboy tamale pie
records.text: i made this for two potlucks and everyone loved it both times. i used the vegan cornbread recipe posted on zaar by vino girl. tastes great served with our creamy vegan mashed potatoes.

records.name: vegan cowboy tamale pie

records.name: who put an apricot into my apple  walnut  crumble  longmeadow fa
records.text: apples were literally flying through the air, as we went around trying to gather the last of our mcintosh's from the cool ground. the wind was blowing so hard i thought my own farm coat would blow right off my back.

records.name: who put an apricot into my apple  walnut  crumble  longmeadow fa
records.text: what was i gonna to do with last apples, anyway? upon reentering my home, i poked around the cupboard, to see what my be behind the can of sauerkraut and a bag of white beans. low and behold! i found dried apricots.

records.name: who put an apricot into my apple  walnut  crumble  longmeadow fa
records.text: and in another cupboard next to my canned applesauce, i found some walnuts that needed to be cracked or perhaps thrown out to the squirrels who were already devouring the birdseed in the feeders.

records.name: who put an apricot into my apple  walnut  crumble  longmeadow fa
records.text: i want something quick, that smells beyond compare, and to serve warm later this afternoon.

records.name: who put an apricot into my apple  walnut  crumble  longmeadow fa
records.text: why do i pick walnuts instead of pecans for the crumble? well, for us on the farm, pecans tend to be a good sizable price difference, and also these are the little walnuts that came from our tree in the orchard.

records.name: who put an apricot into my apple  walnut  crumble  longmeadow fa
records.text: can't get much cheaper then this, right? anyway, please feel free to use pecans interchangeably.

records.name: who put an apricot into my apple  walnut  crumble  longmeadow fa
records.text: i know either way, sitting down in the rocking chair later today, with a scoop of this aromatic crumble will allow your mind to wonder and you get to rest and daydream for a bit.

records.name: swiss cornmeal casserole

records.name: swiss cornmeal casserole

records.name: chimichurri sauce a la uruguaya  south america

records.name: chimichurri sauce a la uruguaya  south america
records.text: with both combinations, you can make a natural herb sauce for meat that will both inspire, enhance, and showplace your meat grilling while impressing friends and relatives.

records.name: chimichurri sauce a la uruguaya  south america
records.text: chimichurri sauce from uruguay is not meant to be peppery hot; there are no serrano, jalapeno or chile peppers grown in uruguay at all.

records.name: chimichurri sauce a la uruguaya  south america
records.text: rather, the sauce is meant to provide a subtle yet robust flavor explosion to be eaten with grilled meats to bring barbeque "alive" with natural flavors. if mixed right, it accomplishes this goal very easily and readily.

records.name: chocolate raspberry mousse cake
records.text: this is a very elegant cake for a special occasion which i found years ago in canadian living magazine. it looks complicated but is actually quite easy to make. it can be served as is or with a raspberry coulis.

records.name: double carrot bread
records.text: the secret ingredient is baby food! this is an '80's recipe from the us greeting card company, current, inc. it's a permanent part of my.

records.name: tilapia tamales  rsc
records.text: ready, set, cook!  reynolds wrap contest entry. unwrap these flavorful tamales to discover the surprise filling - a flaky, perfectly cooked tilapia fillet.

records.name: tilapia tamales  rsc
records.text: the tilapia is surrounded with chile pepper cream cheese, red peppers, green onions, and a sweet masa dough made with fresh corn. fresh vegetables and healthy fish together in one savory foil-wrapped package - what could be better?.

records.name: spicy stir fried tofu with bok choy or baby broccoli
records.text: this is a really basic stir-fry that i found on nytimes. com "recipes for health". simple flavors, few ingredients, healthy. i like to serve this over quinoa but you could use rice or noodles with equal success.

records.name: spicy stir fried tofu with bok choy or baby broccoli
records.text: when browning the tofu, i add some extra chili paste and fresh ginger to the pan for flavor. after it's done and draining on paper towels, i sprinkle it with some kosher salt.

records.name: spicy stir fried tofu with bok choy or baby broccoli
records.text: the result is far from bland tofu! it's also good to keep some extra soy sauce and hot sauce on the table so that eaters can season to taste.

records.name: spicy stir fried tofu with bok choy or baby broccoli
records.text: also, freezing tofu and then thawing it before you cut it up gives it a chewier firmer texture that i really enjoy. cheers to healthy eating!.

records.name: easy sour cream banana bread
records.text: this recipe always comes through!  everyone always loves it and when i give the bread as a gift, i’m always asked for the recipe!  it’s easy to make, doubles well and freezes well!  the *secret* to a super moist and flavorful bread is to use the sour cream (generous portions) and to use very ripe (we’re talking black on the outside and super soft and aromatic on the inside) bananas!    i make the bread as loaves, large muffins and mini-muffins and each turns out perfectly yummy!  enjoy!.

records.name: beach bread
records.text: you could call this beach bruschetta. an extremely popular appetizer when at fort myers beach. so good.

records.name: chicken breasts   stuffed
records.text: whole chicken breasts stuffed with crab, a delicate flavor with the crab meat adding a delightfully different taste and  texture.

records.name: butternut squash and corn chowder
records.text: thick and creamy, and all for rsc, thanks for giving me this great idea recipezaar.

records.name: little dutch tarts
records.text: these are my variation of dutch letters. it's recommended that you use pure almond paste that contains only almond & sugar rather than almond filling that contains corn syrup or sucrose.

records.name: beef daube provenal
records.text: this classic french braised beef, red wine, and vegetable stew is simple and delicious. the flavor and texture allow you to keep it warm for your guests.

records.name: beef daube provenal
records.text: buy a whole-grain baguette, bagged salad greens, and bottled vinaigrette to round out the meal. directions to make in slow cooker included.

records.name: easy broccoli cheese chicken
records.text: skillet meal that i've been making for years. it is a family favorite.

records.name: cauliflower and leek risotto
records.text: this simple and elegant recipe is from chef mark kiffin (of compound restaurant, santa fe) and was published in gourmet magazine (oct. 2003). he recommendes using carnaroli rice which you can find at italian markets, but arborio will do.

records.name: asparagus nut stir fry
records.text: bursting with color and flavor. it is delicious and versatile. and healthy. bonus! i think this recipe came from taste of home magazine. i make it often!.

records.name: asparagus cream soup
records.text: "the most cherished of all the vegetables in germany is asparagus. although the green variety is enjoyed in many dishes, the most prized is white asparagus.

records.name: asparagus cream soup
records.text: either variety works well in this asparagus cream soup" from classic international recipes. the serving amount is for 6 side dish or appetizer servings, not for a meal. i'd say it is 2 or 3 servings if used as a main dish soup.

records.name: pain de mie   french pullman bread  abm
records.text: this recipe comes from king arthur. i made minor changes to reflect more generic ingredients. according to them, the best bread for thin-slicing is called pain de mie, a butter- and milk-rich loaf baked in a special lidded 13" x 4" x 4" pan.

records.name: pain de mie   french pullman bread  abm
records.text: the lid ensures that the baking bread won't expand too much, keeping it very close-grained-and thus totally non-crumbly, and easy to slice. you can use all all-purpose flour without the whole wheat.

records.name: creamy bacon and spinach fettuccine
records.text: i found this recipe in a magazine at work, and it is tried and tested. i love it because it is so easy to prepare and is a favourite with my family.

records.name: crock pot cider braised chicken
records.text: this recipe also includes directions for stove top preparation.

records.name: cauliflower provencal
records.text: this is a lovely way to have cauliflower, particularly for people who say they don't like it. quick, as it is cooked in the microwave.

records.name: burritos  red bean
records.text: i'm always looking for tasty ways to get those healthful beans in my diet since i'm not exactly a big fan of them.

records.name: burritos  red bean
records.text: this recipe was adapted from breaking the food seduction : the hidden reasons behind food cravings---and 7 steps to end them naturally by neal d. barnard, founder of the physician's committee for responsible medicine (www. pcrm. org).

records.name: crock pot scalloped taters
records.text: we love these scalloped taters. adapted from quick cooking.

records.name: asian glazed salmon
records.text: this recipe comes from legal seafood, a restaurant in boston.

records.name: delmonico chicken
records.text: fanny farmer cookbook gets the credit for this, and the recipe is from memory, it was great!.

records.name: pagliacci s new york cheesecake
records.text: this recipe was given to bon appetit magazine by the renowned victoria, b. c. restaurant, pagliacci's. it's been an institution in that beautiful city for decades and this cheesecake is just one of the menu items people can't get enough of.

records.name: pagliacci s new york cheesecake
records.text: it's a deceptively simple and decadent treat. easily adapts to low carbing by substituting splenda (or davinci's syrup) for the sugar, a nut crust for the crumb one and omitting the flour. my second favourite cheesecake of all time.

records.name: chicken and cheese patties
records.text: i got this recipe off a package of bordens shredded cheddar cheese and thought i'd give them a try. they're really good and make a quick lunch or dinner.

records.name: victoryred s famous beer can chicken
records.text: this is a very moist tasty bird with the right combination of six herbs and spices mixed with butter.

records.name: strawberries savannah with chocolate crepes
records.text: these make an elegant breakfast treat or can be served for dessert. i personally prefer to serve them as a dessert. i have included a quick dessert crepe recipe as well. the crepe recipe will yield about 18 to 22 crepes.

records.name: strawberries savannah with chocolate crepes
records.text: they are great to allow them to cool down, place wax paper between them, stack and place in ziplock bag in the freezer. this recipe comes for a 1976 vintage crepe cookery cookbook.

records.name: pumpkin spice french toast bake
records.text: i may have gotten a little carried away over the holidays when it came to buying canned pumpkin.

records.name: pumpkin spice french toast bake
records.text: the last two years there was a canned pumpkin shortage and i didn't want to run out of it in the middle of the year when there are no cans of pumpkin in the grocery store.

records.name: pumpkin spice french toast bake
records.text: now i find myself with a large stockpile of canned pumpkin, just in case. we have pumpkin chocolate chip muffins and cookies regularly. but i wanted to change it up a little!  here is a fun new recipe i encourage you to try.

records.name: heavenly turtle cake
records.text: a thick chocolate/caramel gooey delight. this is a recipe taken from several other recipes and "tweaked". it is a hit at every party it is taken too. a word of caution:  this is very heavy (in weight & calories) but worth the splurge.

records.name: creole style black eyed peas
records.text: transplanted here from the mayo clinic's website for zwt9. i did alter it a smidge.

records.name: my cabbage and noodles
records.text: my version of a well loved combination. caramelising the sugar gives it the special something. the flavoring with vinegar, butter and caraway is typically german.

records.name: my cabbage and noodles
records.text: the flavor of egg noodles is essential for this dish i think, so best don't use pasta.

records.name: lion house picnic brownies
records.text: called picnic brownies because they are easy to stack and place in picnic basket.

records.name: pasta with spinach  beans and cheese
records.text: plenty of flavor and nutrition with a low fat content. a practical cold-weather dish to make at short notice, since you'll probably find you have some of the ingredients already on hand.

records.name: pasta with spinach  beans and cheese
records.text: this recipe is compliments of the american dairy association.

records.name: ruth s chris steak house barbecue shrimp orleans
records.text: sautéed new orleans style in reduced white wine, butter, garlic and spices, drenched with a delicious barbecue butter. say it with me. "om. " i have yet to try this, but will vouch for anything from this restaurant.

records.name: brownie mix cookies
records.text: i didn't have any flour in the house, but i needed to make some cookies and all i could find was a box of brownie mix. very chocolaty, with a brownie texture and the shape of a cookie. i used low-fat brownie mix.

records.name: pinto bean burritos
records.text: from good housekeeping.

records.name: potatoes baked with tomato and onion
records.text: mediterranean style potatoes that are flavorful and make a great side dish. from "italian gourmet".

records.name: tuna melts
records.text: comfort food for the totally stupefied. i make these probably once a month or so, depending on how many different sports are being played at the time.

records.name: amaretto almond liqueur  homemade
records.text: this is from emeril lagasse's website. i needed some for a recipe and didn't have any so i tried this. very quick and easy. even had some left over for a sour. it was great and much cheaper.

records.name: strawberry banana split dessert  no bake
records.text: recipe is from taste of home's april/may 1999 edition. they call it a "cake", but there is no flour or cake mix. definitely more of a light dessert!!!  this is delightful and perfect for spring/summer picnics and parties.

records.name: strawberry banana split dessert  no bake
records.text: young and old alike love this one!  note:  cooking time listed is actually chill time in the fridge, not actually cooking time since this is a no bake recipe.

records.name: extra moist cornbread with sour cream
records.text: this cornbread remains moist and is so good! we really enjoy it with soups or chili.

records.name: crab salad with jicama  avocado and edamame
records.text: wow. food & wine.

records.name: crispy chicken salad wraps
records.text: restaurant quality wraps--from america's test kitchen. these are outstanding. best served warm, but could be served cold. i was surprised how easy and tasty these are.

records.name: crispy chicken salad wraps
records.text: i thought the mayo and sour cream wouldn't be enough but worked perfectly, without the mayo and sour cream taste! wraps are heated in skillet to sear seam. i used my mini food processor to 1st chop celery then 2nd chop cilantro.

records.name: fast n easy ham glaze
records.text: i was in a rush and had none of the usual glaze goodies, so i made one up. there may actually be one like this somewhere, but here's mine.

records.name: maple treats
records.text: this recipe comes from a little bed and breakfast in white salmon, washington. my family stayed there when i was a teenager and this yummy treat was served for breakfast among many other wonderful dishes.

records.name: maple treats
records.text: we often serve these christmas morning with a strong cup of coffee. there may be left over filling which can be kept in the fridge but i prefer to eat it with a spoon!.

records.name: honey lacquered duck with sour cherry sauce
records.text: a gorgeous, mahogany-coloured duck. the rich meat is set off by the tart cherry sauce. i would serve this with steamed or roasted broccoli. developed for the rsc 2004 contest.

records.name: mom s quick and easy quiche
records.text: this is a great and easy quiche that is delicious!.

records.name: seaside garden sandwich
records.text: we used to take our kids for one last summer camping trip to the pacific ocean during the weekend before school started each fall. one of our favorite towns was seaside, oregon. and in seaside, there was (and maybe still is.

records.name: seaside garden sandwich
records.text: i don't know as i haven't been back there in over 10 years) a great little family-owned deli that served the most scrumptous sandwiches and soups. my favorite sandwich was their garden sandwich.

records.name: seaside garden sandwich
records.text: yum yum yum!   i grabbed a take-out menu during one of our trips so that i could make the sandwich at home---no reason to wait another year to enjoy such a great sandwich!.

records.name: cinnabon ish cinnamon rolls  gluten free
records.text: this is a combination of two or three recipes. makes some absolutely delicious and decadent cinnamon rolls. the frosting is good straight out of the bowl.

records.name: cinnabon ish cinnamon rolls  gluten free
records.text: i have successfully substituted buckwheat flour and rice flour for the millet flour in this recipe and a review has used oat flour to great success as well. i'm betting brown rice flour wouldn't be horrible either.

records.name: cinnabon ish cinnamon rolls  gluten free
records.text: the last 2 times i made these, the dough required a bit more flour than listed.

records.name: squash and apple bake
records.text: nice holiday/fall/winter vegetable side dish.

records.name: new york style soft pretzels
records.text: when i was in new york city, i ate soft pretzels and now i can make them at home! dipped in a little mustard or not, you will enjoy these! adapted from martha stewart via herbivoracious.

records.name: new york style soft pretzels
records.text: here's what it says: "have you ever bought something from a pretzel vendor? it’s as if a drug deal is going down, but with pretzels. “i’d like (some of your finest crack) a pretzel please.

records.name: new york style soft pretzels
records.text: ” and then, you take a couple bucks out of your pocket, hand it to the pretzel (dealer) vendor, and he hands you a nice warm pretzel.

records.name: new york style soft pretzels
records.text: you pick up the yellow bottle placed in front of you, squeeze a generous amount of fluorescent yellow mustard around the entire pretzel, and make your merry way around new york city, while the pretzel kindly (because pretzels can be kind, just like humans and cats) warms your fingers, as your other hand hides in your coat pocket from the gelid winter breeze.

records.name: new york style soft pretzels
records.text: " go to herbivoracious to see great step by step pictures of how to shape the pretzels. prep time includes rising time.

records.name: buckwheat pancakes   boghvede pandekager
records.text: great alternative to buttermilk pancakes. serve with your favorite syrup or topping, or with recipe #504584.

records.name: quiche cups to go
records.text: south beach low-carb recipe. so tasty! these are so simple to make in the muffin tins and are perfect individual servings. for convienence, i like to just use frozen diced green peppers and onions.

records.name: quiche cups to go
records.text: any combo of veggies or cheese can be used and these can be made veggie-friendly without the bacon. also, these can be easily frozen and re-heated in the microwave.

records.name: pink bean soup
records.text: this is a recipe i've been searching for for a long time. on my trips to southern california, i would always stop in a restaurant named keefer's inn in king city, california.

records.name: pink bean soup
records.text: unfortunately, the restaurant changed hands and this soup served there wasn't the same. in the old restaurant, in their gift shop, burlap bags of pink beans were sold along with a recipe card for this soup.

records.name: pink bean soup
records.text: i never bought one because i thought the restaurant would be there forever! i wrote in to a local newspaper food column asking if anyone still had the recipe and lucked out! pink beans are smallish, sweet, meaty beans sometimes are known as chili beans; however, any pea or bean will work.

records.name: pink bean soup
records.text: i just love the pink beans for this savory soup. * cooking time does not include overnight soaking ** a ham bone can certainly be used instead of a ham hock.

records.name: veggie portabella pizza
records.text: if you love pizza, but are trying to cut down on the calories and fat, try this!enjoy, and feel guilt free!.

records.name: easy fresh nectarine cake
records.text: you can substitute finely chopped peaches if you can't find nectarines. delicious and easy to make. top with a glaze of your choice.

records.name: jilllyray s cinnamon rolls
records.text: cinnamon rolls, made with refrigerated crescent rolls. from paula deen's "my first cookbook".

records.name: sweet   sour stir fried vegetables
records.text: sweet & sour is so easy to made and much better then any sauce you can buy in grocery stores. you can add your favourite vegetables or tofu and enjoy this dish with fried rice.

records.name: ukrainian dried fruit compote uzvar
records.text: this compote, a traditional dish made from dried fruit is served for christmas eve.

records.name: curried carrot and coriander soup
records.text: this warming soup is gently spices with cumin, cardamom and coriander and is also delicious served chilled on a hot summer's day.

records.name: madagascar chicken
records.text: a very different way to spice up the same old chicken! plus a name that may unspire kids to get excited about the recipe! i found this recipe while searching the web.

records.name: madagascar chicken
records.text: minor changes have been made to make this even better! note: one pound shelled and deveined shrimp can be added to or substituted for the chicken.

records.name: roasted asparagus with onions
records.text: from cooking light, 1995.

records.name: coconut lentil chutney
records.text: this is a one really easy and incredibly tasty chutney.

records.name: coconut lentil chutney
records.text: this is my mom's recipe and no one makes it better, honest :) store the chutney in the refrigerator (for not longer than a day; after that it usually goes bad), unless using it immediately, since the coconut makes it very perishable.

records.name: shape s vietnamese shrimp salad
records.text: will be trying the recipe this week, posted as-is from my favourite magazine - shape!.

records.name: jalapeno cream cheese
records.text: to be used as a dip or spread for bagels, sandwiches, burgers, tortillas or any other dish that would be compatible.

records.name: jalapeno cream cheese
records.text: can, also, be used just as is spread between two pieces of bread for finger sandwiches or with the added sweetness of a fruit preserve or jelly.

records.name: scrumptious vegan chocolate maple cookies recipe
records.text: these chewy, flavorful delights go fast :-) this recipe is a takeoff on the carob walnut cookies recipe in john robbins' "diet for a small planet. ".

records.name: sweet noodle salad
records.text: don't let the sweetened condensed milk throw you - it might seem like an odd ingredient for a pasta salad but it is delicious. i got this recipe from a church published cookbook so it is a tried and true recipe.

records.name: sweet noodle salad
records.text: feel free to adjust the veggies or even add meat (diced ham, bacon, etc. ) to make it a little heartier.

records.name: mushroom and egg casserole
records.text: this is really simple to make and i usually have all of the ingredients on hand.

records.name: pumpkin bread  less sugar and less oil   still amazing
records.text: this is delish!  moist and full of flavor. what makes it even better?  it has half the sugar and half the oil than most other recipes. note:  this bread becomes moister after a day or two. enjoy!.

records.name: golden tofu salad with carrots and hijiki
records.text: the mild hijiki is a great way to introduce seaweed to wary family and friends. this was my favorite recipe from the whole foods class i took in spring of 2003 at bastyr university. careful - the salad is highly addictive!.

records.name: bahian shrimp stew
records.text: if you like fish stews you love this. very quick and easy.

records.name: habanero vodka

records.name: habanero vodka
records.text: as soon as my peppers are mature i will let you know how this turns out.

records.name: ham pot pie
records.text: this is a pennsylvania dutch recipe my mom has made all my life and it is my favorite dish. she usually serves it alone or with some small side dish, because everybody fills there plate with the pot-pie.

records.name: ham pot pie
records.text: my husband never heard of it till i made it for him. now it is one of his favorite dishes.

records.name: hawks restaurant sunday supper meatloaf
records.text: husband and wife michael fagnoni and molly hawks, owners of hawks restaurant in granite bay, serve this hearty meatloaf monthly as part of their sunday supper prix fixe dinners. recipe published in the sacramento bee.

records.name: grits bread
records.text: this is so easy and so good. this can be made early in the day and refrigerated  until ready to bake. it is an alternative to spoon bread. i have been making this since 1955. my children did not like spoon bread and when i made this they loved it.

records.name: grits bread
records.text: it has replaced spoon bread  for us.

records.name: jello pastel cookies
records.text: from food and family magazine. a good cookie for the kids to make using those boxes of jello that never get made. do not overbake!.

records.name: sptzle with lentils from scratch  gluten free
records.text: zwt6 before the invention and use of mechanical devices to make these noodles, they were shaped by hand or with a spoon and the results resembled spatzen (meaning little sparrows) this theory may reflect that traditional spätzle are never shaped.

records.name: sptzle with lentils from scratch  gluten free
records.text: serving amount is a guess. from http://noglutenrequired. blogspot. com.

records.name: olive and cream cheese dip
records.text: a friend served this at a small get together and it was all gone in minutes. you can serve it with any crackers or tortilla chips that you like.

records.name: picante onion soup
records.text: i believe this was a pace picante sauce recipe, but you can use any brand. a nice twist on onion soup!.

records.name: black bean chicken appetizer
records.text: this is a great hot dip recipe or a quick dinner idea. even with the spinach, my two kids loved it and asked for more. what a great way to get everyone to eat something a little more healthy.

records.name: vegan truffles
records.text: incredibly yummy vegan truffles.

records.name: mom s fried green tomatoes
records.text: this recipe is my mom's recipe. i'm not a big fried green tomato person but when i get my once a year craving i reach for this recipe. my 4 yrs old nephew & 6 yrs old nice really liked these tomatoes.

records.name: banana bread muffins
records.text: i had some over ripe bananas & wanted to make banana bread, but couldn't find my loaf pans.

records.name: banana bread muffins
records.text: i modefied this banana bread recipe, & ended up with the most fantastic banana muffins! my husband (who's very picky), & son (just as picky), went nuts over these. very good. the best part, is not having to slice up a loaf.

records.name: banana bread muffins
records.text: just peal off the cupcake papers & eat!.

records.name: make ahead turkey gravy
records.text: this recipe is from women's day magazine 11/1999. it's a life saver for me, it takes some of the stress from thanksgiving day.

records.name: lentil veggie soup
records.text: a nice healthy soup. inexpensive to make, too.

records.name: apple custard bars
records.text: this was originally a pie recipe that i got from toh magazine, but i converted it to bars, just for fun!  this does make an excellent pie, too, just halve the recipe.

records.name: apple custard bars

records.name: apple custard bars
records.text: the crust is quite simple (finally!)  i never can make a crust without the family running away in fear of getting hit with flying pastry thrown in frustration. this doesn't look too pretty, but it sure is good!.

records.name: chocolate gingerbread cookies

records.name: chocolate gingerbread cookies
records.text: dough must chill for an hour before rolling out. an alternative (make-ahead) way to make this recipe is as an icebox cookie. shape the dough into a 12” long log, wrap in waxed paper or plastic wrap and freeze for up to 3 months.

records.name: chocolate gingerbread cookies
records.text: slice log into 1/4” slices and bake as directed.

records.name: crispy dulse chips for sea vegetable lovers
records.text: a flavorful snack that is absolutely packed with nutrients!.

records.name: basmati asparagus rice
records.text: easy way to combine your veggies with your sides.

records.name: swiss meatloaf
records.text: from a long-time friend's cookbook compilation.

records.name: canary island style pollo en adobo
records.text: one of the most popular ways to serve chicken in the canary islands is in adobo. adobo is as varied as there are chefs, but the basic ingredients are the same.

records.name: canary island style pollo en adobo
records.text: feel free to play with the quantities of the ingredients! cooking is a creative endeavor! prep time does not include marinating time, so be sure to allow for that.

records.name: tortellini primavera
records.text: i'm a huge fan of spinach, not to mention pasta. this makes a spectacular dinner-all you need is salad & of course, garlic bread. it's quick, easy and minimal clean up! this comes from the great american favorite brand name cookbook.

records.name: three cheese lasagna with italian sausage
records.text: an awesome, basic recipe for good ol' lasagna. the sauce is perfect: hearty and flavorful. this recipe was originally from epicurious. com, but i have edited it somewhat. this variation is quite a bit cheesier, and uses oven-ready, no-boil noodles.

records.name: three cheese lasagna with italian sausage
records.text: i'm not one to cut corners, but in fact, i think the no-boil variety taste just as good as regular noodles. using them also eliminates one of the more tedious steps in lasagna-making.

records.name: easy eggplant  aubergine  sandwich
records.text: a wonderful way to fix eggplant!.

records.name: chili rubbed chicken with roasted garlic sauce
records.text: found in the toronto tv guide as part of the celebrity chef series. don't know who the chef is as their web site is no longer. don't expect the skin to be crisp if you leave it on but it is tasty.

records.name: mama iuliucci s famous meat a balls  italian meatballs
records.text: here it is, my mom's famous meatball recipe! this is thee most requested of her for anything, anywhere! whenever there is a shower, birthday, christening, etc. , someone is asking for 150 to 200 of her famous meatballs.

records.name: mama iuliucci s famous meat a balls  italian meatballs
records.text: :) of course, she always says yes! she is not one for "exact" measurements (a little of this, a dash of that), so i tried the best i could to adapt her recipe.

records.name: mama iuliucci s famous meat a balls  italian meatballs
records.text: of course, these are best served with my mama iuliucci's "don't skip a step" spaghetti sauce recipe #26947, but i have used jazzed-up jarred sauce and they are still great.

records.name: mama iuliucci s famous meat a balls  italian meatballs
records.text: however, meat-a-balls like these deserve a homemade sauce, in my humble opinion!.

records.name: cheesecake caramel toffee chocolate chip cookie bars
records.text: this recipe combines my love of cookies with my love of cheesecake. plus, it has some toffee bits and caramel bits thrown in for my pleasure good measure.

records.name: cheesecake caramel toffee chocolate chip cookie bars
records.text: if you're not familiar with caramel bits, they can be found right in the chocolate chip section in your supermarket. they are made by kraft. they come in an eleven-ounce bag and cost around three dollars.

records.name: cheesecake caramel toffee chocolate chip cookie bars
records.text: they are super adorable (well, as adorable as little balls of caramel can be). they are just like kraft wrapped caramel candies, but in little ball form - perfect for baking.

records.name: rigatoni and asparagus
records.text: this quick-to-make meatless pasta dish is ready in a flash and oh-so good!  it is from a 1990 cookbook called "365 easy one-dish meals".

records.name: mandarin martini

records.text: on those occasions when you are serving a crowd, it's great to have a recipe that doesn't need to be doubled or tripled.

records.name: walnut chicken for a crowd

records.name: walnut chicken for a crowd

records.name: walnut chicken for a crowd

records.text: this lasagna is very saucy and can be soupy the day it's made (especially if you are using a smaller pan with 12 noodles instead of 15). it still tastes great though.

records.name: sweet and savory lasagna

records.name: jenny approved hamburger spinach tomato pasta one dish meal

records.name: chocolate chip oatmeal vegan cookies

records.name: tuscan tomato basil soup
records.text: this is a lighter copy cat version of the tomato soup from safeway. i found it on the internet. it was revamped by carol devenot from hawaii. i have never had the "real stuff" so i don't know what i am missing. this was very tasty though.

records.name: tuscan tomato basil soup
records.text: thick and hearty. i had lots of butternut squash left over so i steamed it for a few minutes and then froze it in 2-1/2 cup portions to make more soup later. one 4-1/2 lb squash will make about 4 pots of soup.

records.name: tuscan tomato basil soup
records.text: i used 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. if you have an immersion blender it's alot easier than trasferring the soup to a blender since you can just puree in the pot.

records.name: tuscan tomato basil soup
records.text: this definitely gets better overnight, so if you can, make it a day ahead of time. serve this with a grilled cheese sandwich and you have a warm, hearty meal!.

records.text: for those who think that you can't make a good pesto without pine nuts. i found out that cashews are marvelous instead.

records.text: i love this soup, i made it 5 times already. its high fiber low-fat. and very tasty. points 4.

records.name: easy ginger tea

records.name: kittencal s easy gnocchi
records.text: instant potato flakes makes these quick and fast ---  instead of pinching off pieces of dough roll the dough into a 1/2-inch diameter rope and then slice into about 1-inch long pieces, you may indent the center with a fork or your finger --- the dough may be shaped covered with plastic wrap and refrigerated until ready to cook or you may freeze the shaped uncooked gnocchi just drop them into boiling water still in their frozen state, do not thaw --- this recipe was developed using instant potato flakes, subsitiuting cooked mashed potatoes will not produce the same results --- these are best if heated up in a tomato or cream sauce or pan fryed with garlic and butter then sprinkled with parmesan cheese :).

records.name: mango fool  jamaica  caribbean

records.name: mango fool  jamaica  caribbean

records.name: chairman mao s red braised pork

records.name: red lobster parrot bay coconut shrimp by todd wilbur

records.name: dr  weil s miso soup

records.name: dr  weil s miso soup

records.name: black bean amanatto  candied black beans

records.name: fortnum and masons authentic scotch eggs with sausage and herbs
records.text: freshly boiled eggs are encased in a herb flavoured sausage “jacket” and are then deep-fried until golden and crisp, delicious! contrary to popular belief, scotch eggs are not scottish, and they were actually invented by the famous london department store “fortnum & mason” in 1738, where they are still available today.

records.name: fortnum and masons authentic scotch eggs with sausage and herbs
records.text: the word "scotch" is an old english word meaning to chop or mince, and obviously, the eggs are covered with “chopped or minced” pork sausage meat, hence the name scotch eggs.

records.name: fortnum and masons authentic scotch eggs with sausage and herbs
records.text: they are traditional british picnic food but i also like to serve them as a light lunch or snack, and they make a wonderful addition to the buffet table.

records.name: fortnum and masons authentic scotch eggs with sausage and herbs
records.text: these tasty traditional english specialities have had bad press over the years; mainly down to commercial mass production, but if you make them at home with fresh, free-range eggs and the best quality sausage meat, they will taste divine, and they will always be the stars of the picnic hamper or family lunch table! please use high quality sausage meat or sausages, with at least 70% meat content.

records.name: fortnum and masons authentic scotch eggs with sausage and herbs
records.text: historical note: founded in 1707, fortnum & mason (f&m) stocks "food fit for a queen".

records.name: fortnum and masons authentic scotch eggs with sausage and herbs
records.text: the 300-year-old  british department store, famous for its jams, teas, and sauces, provides the queen with her annual supply of christmas puddings and holds the "royal warrant.

records.name: fortnum and masons authentic scotch eggs with sausage and herbs
