records.text: make this creamy soup with last night's potatoes and serve it steaming hot in mugs.

records.name: homemade cereal bars
records.text: this morning my son and i argued over whether he was having egg, cereal or marshmallows for breakfast lol. so  i prepped the pan with butter to make the eggs. my newborn started to cry so i went to go get her.

records.name: homemade cereal bars
records.text: by the time i was back my ds had put 1/2 of a bag of marshmallows in the buttered pan. instead of getting mad, i just laughed. he really wanted marshmallows for breakfast i guess.

records.name: homemade cereal bars
records.text: so this is what i came up with to compromise the whole ordeal (i'll remember next time to put the marshmallows on the top shelf though :) ).

records.name: chicken salad with cranberry dressing
records.text: a really tasteful version. might become your favorite.

records.name: sweet   sour cabbage rolls
records.text: after combing through dozens of cabbage roll recipes on zaar, this is the only one i could find that has a sauce quite like this one. the secret ingredients are bottled chili sauce and grape jelly.

records.name: sweet   sour cabbage rolls
records.text: there is also no rice and no brown sugar in this recipe and there are no tomatoes except for ketchup. adapted from.

records.name: the naughty burger
records.text: this is suppose to be an orginal new york city recipe! best piece of meat between 2 buns. ever. mission:to convert as many vegetarians into meat eaters as possible, burger by burger. just use the pulp of the french onion soup.

records.name: oven fried herb chicken
records.text: another old recipe i've saved. but still good and easy to fix.

records.name: southwestern spring rolls
records.text: this is a modification of a chili's recipe (i made it up and don't usually measure so pretty much everything is approximate).

records.name: stuffed pork chops in mushroom soup
records.text: i helped my parents move into a retirement home and "stole" my mother's recipe box. i am trying to get her favorite recipes posted. this recipe was stained so i knew it had to have been one of my dad's favorites.

records.name: pioneer woman s not your grannys mac   cheese
records.text: from pioneer woman's blog. i haven't made this yet but it looks positively scrumptious! please visit her blog for some mouth-watering pictures and recipes.

records.name: three minute spelt bread
records.text: amazingly quick, simple and delicious seedy spelt bread - i'm hoping that some friends of mine who can't tolerate wheat will be able to eat this, it does contain gluten so isn't any good for those have problems with gluten.

records.name: three minute spelt bread
records.text: recipe originally comes from the telegraph magazine, i found it on the true food coop website. seems a bit wrong that this bread is not kneaded and doesn't get left to rise yet still works so well.

records.name: three minute spelt bread
records.text: as i write i have a loaf cooling on the counter top calling to me!  i've since read that allowing the dough to rise overnight in a cool place makes it even better - i'll be trying that when i'm not in a rush.

records.name: pineapple coconut chicken curry
records.text: i found this on an indian site--sounds delish. very layered.

records.name: cream of anything soup mix
records.text: i got this off a frugal website many years ago. a great recipe to keep on hand. the variations are endless. not sure how many servings this makes.

records.name: jumbo shrimp with asparagus
records.text: got this recipe from another online site and love the combo of shrimp and asparagus, add the ginger and what's not to like. i do add garlic and some chopped shallots to the mix to but as the original recipe didn't have it left it out.

records.name: jumbo shrimp with asparagus
records.text: the best part is how simple and fast it is, i served over angel hair pasta but think it would be just as good with rice. there's not a lot of sauce with this, so if you like a lot this may not be for you - but the flavors are so good.

records.name: curried cabbage soup
records.text: i created this soup for a very dear vegetarian friend (although it can be easily made non-vegetarian if you prefer), and it quickly became one of his most requested dishes. it is very filling, and great comfort food.

records.name: curried cabbage soup
records.text: try to make this soup the day before and let it sit in the refrigerator overnight at least. the flavors blend, the curry mellows, and the resulting soup is just fantastic.

records.name: curried cabbage soup
records.text: if you prefer a non-vegetarian version, just substitute the soy sausage patties with regular sausage patties, or even just 1/4 to 1/2 pound of ground beef.

records.name: simple pesto mayonnaise
records.text: i first tried pesto mayonnaise when we were at our granddaughter's ski meet. she had a sandwich with it on it--delicious. when i got home i got some fresh basil and made some pesto so we could have the mayonnaise. lots of work.

records.name: simple pesto mayonnaise
records.text: one day i wanted some and didn't have fresh basil--guess what? this is a yummy substitute and you can have it anytime, and it is so easy and takes only a couple of minutes. i only make enough for a few sandwiches; then make again next time.

records.name: quick and easy tropical coffee cake
records.text: 1973 bake off in pillsbury contest.

records.name: sliced oranges in syrup
records.text: has middle eastern origins.

records.name: cranberry cherry pinwheel christmas cookies
records.text: this makes a pretty and popular christmas cookie.

records.name: cranberry cherry pinwheel christmas cookies
records.text: the filling came from a recipe in a newspaper at least 16 years ago, but to get the cookie i dreamed of, i tried the dough from many pinwheel cookie recipes before finally settling on this one about five years ago.

records.name: cranberry cherry pinwheel christmas cookies
records.text: keep chilling the dough if it gets too soft while working with it. **a reviewer had trouble getting the pinwheel effect, so i have altered this recipe and ingredients to make the dough rectangle a little bigger.

records.name: cranberry cherry pinwheel christmas cookies
records.text: also, i always bake my cookies on a silpat so sticking is never an issue. i find i get more consistent browning and fewer overdone edges when using a silpat, too.

records.name: alfredo bacon chicken pizza
records.text: abc pizza. creamy and gooey pizza. out of the ordinary pizza. this is total comfort food. it comes together quickly with the use of premade alfredo sauce and pizza crust.

records.name: jolean s saki flank steak
records.text: my mom made this for us on special occasions. she always served it with rice, and there were never any leftovers!  this is a wonderful japanese marinade that you've gotta try to believe!.

records.name: roasted red capsicum
records.text: i found this in the new idea magazine and it works very well.

records.name: pam s pumpkin pie
records.text: my best friend's mom makes a couple of these every year and now that i've moved away i prevailed up on her to share the recipe with me so i can have a taste of home away from home.

records.name: risotto with dried wild mushrooms
records.text: a very creamy rice. use whatever dried mushrooms you have available such as oyster, shitake, chanterelle or even morels if you feel extravagant!.

records.name: broccoli  cauliflower and feta salad
records.text: you may use lower fat yogurt and mayonnaise for this ;-) plan ahead this needs to chill for a few hours before serving, adjust all ingredient amounts to suit taste.

records.name: barefoot contessa s caramelized onions
records.text: these are wonderful on top of a hamburger.

records.name: mango smoothie shake
records.text: my teenage daughter, a mango smoothie junkie, found this recipe on the internet and proclaims it the best she's ever tasted.

records.name: broccoli with rosemary
records.text: this recipe is a little different , very simple, and one of my favorite side dishes. i've made it with olive oil instead of the butter, but it's really not the same. it's very good with a little garlic, but i've posted it as written.

records.name: broccoli with rosemary
records.text: preparation and cooking times are estimates. enjoy!.

records.name: cinnamon meringues
records.text: found on the atkin's diet website. this dessert recipe is also south beach friendly!.

records.name: mushroom veggie salad
records.text: found this one on a mushrooom website. sounds really good, especially for cool summer eating.

records.name: lynne s cheesecake
records.text: found this on a marshallow fluff website. i have made it, and it is tasty. definitely easy to put together. (my sil, who's a die-hard cheesecake fan, even gave it her approval. ) cook time includes 1 hour of cooling time.

records.name: doritos taco bake
records.text: great alternative to taco night!.

records.name: chicken with garlic cream sauce
records.text: this is very similar to a pasta dish that i love at macaroni grill. i think it's called pasta milano.

records.name: impossibly easy ham and cheddar pie
records.text: this is the pie that makes its own crust. it has a delicious blend of flavors; the apples and onions offset each other nicely and ham and cheddar cheese are known for their compatibility.

records.name: impossibly easy ham and cheddar pie
records.text: you can substitute colby-jack cheese for the cheddar if you like.

records.name: tomato   pistachio asparagus
records.text: asparagus is one of my favorite culinary ways to welcome spring. i almost always make this recipe for passover, which falls at just the right time of year. it would also be great for easter for the same reason.

records.name: tomato   pistachio asparagus
records.text: this is a pretty flexible dish -- you can play with quantities, change up the onions, etc. and it still turns out delicious. i have been replacing much of the butter with olive oil, and that works fine too.

records.name: tomato   pistachio asparagus
records.text: cooking time assumes pre-trimmed and pre-cooked asparagus, though what i usually do is trim it (it's more tender if you break it wherever it breaks naturally than if you cut it) and start it steaming, then make the sauce.

records.name: peach pie with almond pecan streusel
records.text: cut from our local newspaper a few years ago. it has become a family favorite. "if apple is the quintessential american pie, then peach is surely our summertime favorite, and all the more if it's served a la mode.

records.name: peach pie with almond pecan streusel
records.text: to make a peach pie worth of the name, use fully ripe fruit and a pastry crust that's rich and tender but still sturdy enough to contain its sweet, juicy burden without collapsing.

records.name: peach pie with almond pecan streusel
records.text: to remove the skins from peaches easily, pour boiling water over them, then quickly dip fruit into ice water. use your fingers or a small knife to slip off the skins.

records.name: peach pie with almond pecan streusel
records.text: this recipe calls for a crumbly nut topping, but you could substitue a classic lattice crust that lets the fruit show through. serve the pie warm or at room temperatue, with or without ice cream.

records.name: peach pie with almond pecan streusel
records.text: to gauge the amount of sugar and cornstarch to use, take your cue from the ripeness of the peaches; if they are very sweet-tasting and quite juicy, use the smaller amount of sugar and the large amount of cornstarch. ".

records.name: sugared peanuts
records.text: this used to be my family's one xmas tradition. then we all got healthy. *sigh* i do miss these. we made these in an electric fypan. but you could probably use a large frypan on the stove top. the cooking time is a guess.

records.name: sugared peanuts
records.text: but it never seemed to be all that long. double quantities work well - as long as you have a large enough frypan.

records.name: cinnamon apple waffles
records.text: from darlene kossman. has grated apple in the batter. it only makes 4 waffles so double the recipe; really good.

records.name: yummy baked ziti
records.text: this recipe came from the back of a ziti box. i love it and wanted to post it because it is not always on the back of the box. it is simple and my daughter thinks it is the best dinner ever!.

records.name: chili con carne pie
records.text: adjust the heat to taste. it's from a lesley waters (uk tv-chef) cookbook. some of the meat you'd normally find in this kind of dish has been replaced with lentils to make it healthier.

records.name: cinnamon chocolate chip banana bread
records.text: a delicious adaption of traditional banana bread, decided to make it for my mom for mother's day, first time ever making it, and everyone loved it.

records.name: cinnamon chocolate chip banana bread
records.text: best bananas to use to this recipe is right before you would normally throw them away, when the skins are turning black.

records.name: fill me up with garlic cheese loaf
records.text: can you say "to die for"? this is sooo worth the calories. taken from the book, "tuxedos to tailgates".

records.name: barbecue baked fish
records.text: we eat fish (usually fried or grilled) once a week. i don't remember where i found this recipe. i think maybe southern living, but i adjusted it just a bit. we all liked it for a change of pace from the usual.

records.name: fire baked bananas
records.text: interesting.

records.name: chili lemon shrimp
records.text: easy, simple, make-ahead appetizer. from the seattle times newspaper.

records.name: biscuits and rich sausage gravy
records.text: wondering what to make for mother's day that's comforting, delicious, and good to eat at any time of day? this version of the classic biscuits and gravy is kicked up a notch with the addition of portabella mushrooms and swiss cheese.

records.name: coffee concentrate
records.text: this recipe really makes good coffee - hot or iced!  from lynne rossetto kasper and found at the splendid table.

records.name: ma leetle petit pois
records.text: french tart, this is for you!  when 4th of july rolls around in bowerbank, maine, it's off to the farmer's market for the first of the fresh peas!!  please don't overcook the tender sweet leetle things. ;).

records.name: oven fried eggplant or and zucchini parmesan
records.text: i'm posting this recipe for eggplant and or zucchini. no need to peel the zucchini. i've also done both in one recipe. you can also just oven bake the eggplant and dip into sauce for appetizers.

records.name: oven fried eggplant or and zucchini parmesan
records.text: my husband and i just love it!  especially when the eggplant and zucchini is home grown! no buttermilk no problem just place 1 teaspoon lemon juice or vinegar in a 1 cup glass then top with milk let sit while gathering the rest of the ingredients.

records.name: raspberry christmas dessert
records.text: i make this on christmas day! we love it!.

records.name: shake  n bake spicy barbecue chicken
records.text: this recipe is from "kraft: food and family", winter 2006.

records.name: nif s garlic and bread crumb spaghetti
records.text: this is a surprisingly good combination of pasta and bread crumbs. i had never heard of that until i tried noo's recipe #309164.

records.name: nif s garlic and bread crumb spaghetti
records.text: i came up with a version of my own that i think is quite tasty too! :) this is quick and easy as well, so it's a great last minute meal. enjoy!.

records.name: easy crispy fried cheese topped hash browns patties
records.text: i added in minced garlic also when sauteeing the onion but that is optional. these go great with eggs!.

records.name: irma s cream cheese green onion chip dip
records.text: my mom, irma, passed away 2 years ago, and this was one of my favorite "treats" that she made. she never liked sour cream dips, but she loved cream cheese. she found/made up this recipe before i was born. christmas, easter etc.

records.name: irma s cream cheese green onion chip dip
records.text: , a family party just wasn't a party without this dip and lots of potato chips! when i brought my boyfriend(now husband) to the first family party, he wasn't too impressed with the dip, as he was used to the saltier, stronger tasting sour cream onion soup mix dip.

records.name: irma s cream cheese green onion chip dip
records.text: but now he loves it! he uses it on everything when i make it! he likes it on potato chips, of course, but also on hamburgers, hotdogs, bagels, crackers and even veggies.

records.name: irma s cream cheese green onion chip dip
records.text: it has a smooth, creamy texture that enhances other foods instead of overpowering them. one of my sisters uses the basic recipe and then adds a can of drained baby shrimp-if you like shrimp, you'll love that.

records.name: irma s cream cheese green onion chip dip
records.text: other family members add garlic or other spices. i'm submitting the basic recipe that mom used, with my addition of bon appetit, as that is my favorite way to do it. i hope you enjoy this as much as our family does! p. s.

records.name: irma s cream cheese green onion chip dip
records.text: you can use low/no fat or neufchatel cream cheese for fewer calories, and it still tastes good.

records.name: tropical beef   low fat
records.text: another delicious ediet recipe. i think calling it tropical may be stretching a little, since the only fruit is an orange. however, it is very good and healthy. hope you enjoy!.

records.name: cheese stuffed chicken
records.text: preparation is a bit involved, but well worth the time and effort.

records.name: samosa soup
records.text: this soup was the product of an insatiable craving for samosas and no indian restaurant nearby. making indian appetizers is way too much work and the overpowering stench of a deep fryer is enough to permeate your home for days.

records.name: samosa soup
records.text: so, i created this soup which tastes just like a samosa - and it's low fat too! this was quick and easy to prepare and quite good. it tasted very similar to a nice spicy samosa and was complemented nicely by storebought nan bread.

records.name: brouillade of mushrooms  or the best scrambled eggs you ll ever eat
records.text: i love this recipe. the title makes it sound so much better than plain old scrambled eggs and appropriately so because it is much better than just scrambling a few eggs in a pan, without any garnishes. and not much more work either.

records.name: strawberry kolaches
records.text: this recipe is from the red, white & blue ribbon 2004 cookbook. it's a collection of recipes from contests and food festivals. there are some real winners in this book. this is one of them.

records.name: strawberry kolaches
records.text: it was the "berry best in show" winner at the 2003 poteet strawberry festival in poteet, tx and was entered by paige smith. recipe note:  i use butter instead of margarine. times indicated do not include refrigeration overnight, or rising time.

records.name: chinese style broccoli
records.text: this recipe is from south beach diet. ordinary broccoli springs to life with this garlicky lemon-soy dressing. serve it with any asian-flavored dish or even a simple grilled chicken or shrimp skewer.

records.name: pecan   red onion bread  for bread machine
records.text: tasty bread makes a nice accompaniment to any meal. especially nice with a roast beef.

records.name: paula deen s texas pepper pork ribs
records.text: these ribs can either be grilled or baked. since the temperature is too cold for grilling at the moment, i've only tried the baked version.

records.name: paula deen s texas pepper pork ribs
records.text: these ribs are quite peppery, so if you're not a huge fan of black pepper i would recommend reducing the amount in the recipe by half.

records.name: 2 4 6 8 ranch dip
records.text: 2 green peppers, 4 tomatoes, 6 green onions and 8 oz. of mozzarella all covered in ranch and served on a cracker - yum!  my dear friend annette introduced this to us. it's an easy appetizer that tastes great.

records.name: 2 4 6 8 ranch dip
records.text: i have not made it myself yet so, i am unsure how much ranch to use. just add a little at a time until it reaches a good consistency. once i make it i will add an exact amount, it should be easy to figure out. we love it.

records.name: ouzo   rose water kourambiethes
records.text: this is my own version kourambiethes (greek almond shortbread cookies). when i created this recipe, i was looking for a way to create kourambiethes with less sugar and less cholesterol, which i achieved by using less sugar and no egg yolk.

records.name: ouzo   rose water kourambiethes
records.text: other changes i made to the traditional kourambiethes recipe are: use of fragrant, dry roasted almonds made into a coarse flour (rather than simply chopped) and a liberal use of ouzo and rose water to play up some accent flavors.

records.name: ouzo   rose water kourambiethes
records.text: enjoy -- please let me know how yours turn out!.

records.name: healthy for them  yogurt popsicles
records.text: my children and their friends ask for my homemade popsicles morning, noon and night.

records.name: healthy for them  yogurt popsicles
records.text: i never turn them down; who am i to tell them that they are good for them! for variety i substitute different flavours of frozen juice - grape, fruit punch, tropical etc.

records.name: roasted carrots with orange zest and cinnamon
records.text: this unusual combination of flavors will be popular with eveone at your table. serve these carrots with roasted chicken or fish and a green vegetable.

records.name: roasted carrots with orange zest and cinnamon
records.text: i like this recipe (from williams-sonoma "essials of healthful cooking") because it's easy and flavorful!.

records.name: pastie soup
records.text: this is an economical soup that taste just likes pasties ( a potato & meat pastry that is popular in the up of michigan).

records.name: moroccan stewed lentils
records.text: moroccan stewed lentils are very flavorful and can be served as a side dish or entrée.

records.name: mom s macaroni   cheese
records.text: warming, comfort food from childhood.

records.name: jamaican jerk chicken for two
records.text: don't close your eyes while listening to the steel drum, or someone might steal your chicken.

records.name: watermelon ice pops
records.text: buying a watermelon so often leads to leftover melon. here’s a delicious way to make use of this largesse. buy 5-oz (150 g) paper “bath cups”—they make great moulds for ice pops, as the paper just peels away.

records.name: watermelon ice pops
records.text: gelatin helps keep drips at bay and also adds to smoothness. from lcbo food & drink magazine. time to prepare does not include time to freeze.

records.name: watermelon ice pops
records.text: watermelon is thought to have originated in southern africa, where it is found growing wild, because it reaches maximum genetic diversity there, resulting in sweet, bland and bitter forms.

records.name: smashed red skin potatoes
records.text: great mashed potatoes!.

records.name: hot vegetable and fruit stew
records.text: from a recipe book on 18th century frontier outpost recipes.

records.name: the best indonesian peanut sauce
records.text: this recipe comes from the vegetarian times and is actually a vegan recipe, though i am not either of those things :-).

records.name: the best indonesian peanut sauce
records.text: i made this because i just love peanut sauces and this is the best one i have had, not to mention how simple it was to make! i used reduced fat peanut butter and it didn't seem to affect the recipe at all.

records.name: the best indonesian peanut sauce
records.text: it will keep up to a week or so in the fridge and personally, i like to either toss it with noodles and chicken or serve it with chicken chunks over brown rice. i don't like things spicy and this was perfect.

records.name: the best indonesian peanut sauce
records.text: i also saute the chicken chunks in 1 tsp sesame oil just to enhance the flavor. it makes quite a bit of sauce, i would say it serves 6!  enjoy!.

records.name: zucchini logs
records.text: this recipe is super easy, impressive looking, delicious and relatively healthy!  what more could you ask for?  i serve this in the summer time and it's a great alternative to a mundane veggie side.

records.name: zucchini logs
records.text: it's beautiful and will impress any guests! the number of zucchini you use greatly depends on the size. eyeball it. i'm sure you will find something to do with them if there are any extras!.

records.name: macaroni and cheese pie
records.text: who doesn't like cheese and pie? well, this recipe is one of my favorites made by my mother growing-up. i'm interested to see what 'zaar says the calorie intake is!.

records.name: bua loi phuak  taro balls in coconut cream
records.text: a scrumptious thai dessert that i can't resist, i first tried this in my favorite thai restaurant here in seattle. it never gets old!.

records.name: texas armadillo eggs
records.text: this is a wonderful appetizer. the flavors of jalapeno, pork sausage, and cream cheese make mouths water. my family loves this, and begs for it on every holiday.

records.name: kielbasa biscuit pizza
records.text: found in quick cooking june 2005 issue.

records.name: buttery yeast rolls
records.text: these are the absolute best dinner rolls. they are light and fluffy and buttery. the dough can also be shaped in many other ways, so use your imagination. makes awesome cinnamon rolls too!.

records.name: club sandwich
records.text: they serve these at a lot of restaurants and they are easy to do, except cutting the puppies. they are good on hot days.

records.name: chinese rice salad with snow peas
records.text: this salad keeps fairly well. time does not include cooking the rice. you can use a sweet onion like walla walla in place of the red onion. from stoney plains organic farm.

records.name: jamaican  grits rice cooker optional
records.text: zwt 9 caribbean i made this in rice cooker ,all the way, turned out great. will post how i did it its not as pretty but tastes good.

records.name: asparagus lasagna
records.text: this is a great recipe for celebrating the arrival of spring! the lemon makes it light and fresh-tasting and the flavor is so good. you won't even miss the meat! (recipe was adapted from canadian living magazine).

records.name: german  pumpkin  noodle salad
records.text: i have not tried this yet, but am sharing it in honor of pumpkin being the current ingredient of the month. in germany, all squash are referred to as pumpkins. this salad uses butternut squash in a unique way.

records.name: german  pumpkin  noodle salad
records.text: i am guessing at the serving amounts. translated directly from the german version found in.

records.name: green tomato  apple and raisin pie
records.text: old fashioned goodness. don't let the green tomatoes scare you off, you don't know they are there.

records.name: nanny s tomato soup
records.text: this recipe was my grandmother's passed down to my father and then to me. it's a simple soup that is my favorite comfort food.

records.name: grilled chicken with chili corn sauce
records.text: this recipe is absolutely delicious! seasoned chicken with a savory sauce and veggies on top! i love this served with rice and black beans (. and don't forget the margaritas!).

records.name: healthy oatmeal cookies
records.text: these cookies are so good, and you can add anything you want into them, such as nuts, chocolate chips, crasins, or just raisins!!!.

records.name: cheryl s crock pot chicken chili with black beans ww points 5
records.text: i threw this together for the hubby this morning.

records.name: sittin  on the porch cocktail
records.text: a smooth sipper featuring southern comfort from my cowboy cocktails book.

records.name: island oatmeal  pina colada porridge
records.text: after trying all the different porridge combinations from the british leg of zwt iii. i thought i would create my own for the caribbean leg. this is quite sweet so no additional sweetner is needed.

records.name: island oatmeal  pina colada porridge
records.text: if you don't want it too sweet, use half juice, half water for cooking. for the toasted coconut i put this under the grill (broiler) as i put the porridge in the microwave and they were both ready at the same time.

records.name: mum s yemista  greek  stuffed vegetables with rice
records.text: yemista is a common dish during summer. its great either warm or cold.

records.name: mum s yemista  greek  stuffed vegetables with rice
records.text: you can stuff any vegetables you like, some use to stuff potatoes, large portabellos , bell peppers any colour, grapes leaves and even zucchini's flowers, the last ones are hard to find but they are the best.

records.name: mum s yemista  greek  stuffed vegetables with rice
records.text: also, in the filling some add feta, great!.

records.name: a1 ultimate jambalaya
records.text: i could live on this!  everybody loves this one, and agrees that its better than any jambalaya they've ever ordered in a restaurant. give it a try, you won't be disappointed i promise. the secret is the roasted red peppers and the butter.

records.name: a1 ultimate jambalaya
records.text: don't be put off that the dish is finished in the microwave, it just ensures that there are no burnt pans to deal with later!  the only other veg that work in this i find are sweetcorn or butternut squash/pumpkin cut into chunks and added just before it all goes in the microwave.

records.name: a1 ultimate jambalaya
records.text: even my friends from louisiana find it hard to accept that its perhaps even better (if not a little different) than they make. enjoy!.

records.name: butter dips
records.text: these simple "scone-like biscuits" are a family favorite. we make them most always when we make beef stew and chili, but they are great with any meal. they are crisp and buttery on the outside and soft inside.

records.name: butter dips
records.text: i'll bet your friends and family will like them too!.

records.name: kauai nightcap
records.text: a pleasant way to end the day. if you are not familiar with tuaca, here is a description i found on-line.

records.name: kauai nightcap
records.text: "tuaca is a lightly sweet, amber italian liqueur based on fine, cask-aged brandy, possessing a rich fruit-like flavor of vanilla and citrus. ".

records.name: summer squash   rice gratin
records.text: this can be made all year round, a great side for any meat. points. 7.

records.name: bbq  pork lo mein
records.text: this sounds easy and good. variations, instead of pork, use left over cooked, roast beef, lamb, shrimp or chicken. other fresh vegetables in season can be used in place of the sprouts and bok choy. from "dim sum" by ruth laws.

records.name: strawberry salad with monterey jack
records.text: spring mix salad greens, monterey jack cheese cubes, and fresh strawberries tossed with a red wine vinegarette dressing. recipe given to me by friend mindi roberts.

records.name: yaki mandu  korean egg roll

records.name: silky chocolate fondue
records.text: this is a pampered chef recipe that is simply sinful!.

records.name: strawberry salad w  poppy seed dressing
records.text: strawberries and cukes over mixed greens with a low fat poppyseed dressing. great as a main meal or pretty side-dish. serves 3-4 as a main dish.

records.name: banana cream pie  diabetic
records.text: i found this on a store-brand pudding box and modified it to make it diabetic friendly. tastes so rich and good!.

records.name: clapp family smoothie
records.text: so yummy! the best smoothie ever!.

records.name: all american macaroni and cheese
records.text: this is very good homemade macaroni and cheese if you don't have a lot of time on your hands.

records.name: bengali chingri malai curry  shrimp milk curry
records.text: my mom being bengali taught me how to make this recipe that i love to eat during winter time.

records.name: delightful papaya salad
records.text: this is from mexico. a lovely combination of flavors!.

records.name: fall tastic apple crisp
records.text: this is an easy and uncommon recipe that is loved in my home. it simple enough for everyday but it works very well for a make as do ahead for thanksgiving. serve warm with ice cream if desired.

records.name: pistachio pot de creme
records.text: the pistachios add a rich creaminess to this dessert and lend it their pale green colour. this recipe can be done ahead of time.

records.name: velveeta broccoli cheese soup

records.name: bacon biscuit wreath
records.text: this is a great little appetizer, snack, or food gift. this is actually a kids in the kitchen recipe, so it's quick and easy. i usually use a little more bacon and serve with a hot mustard dipping sauce.

records.name: greens coleslaw
records.text: the hot dressing poured over this salad slightly wilts the greens without cooking them. chilling the salad lets the flavors develop.

records.name: greens coleslaw
records.text: you can use collard greens, swiss chard, flat leaf kale, beet greens, even spinach! adapted from vegetarian times magazine.

records.name: golden focaccia
records.text: this recipe is from king arthur. i have made it several times, and it is very delicious and easy to make, although it does take some time. it is light-textured, about 1/2 " thick - not a bready focaccia.

records.name: golden focaccia
records.text: the starter and multiple rises really add to the flavor. actual hands-on time is about 30 minutes, but it does have to rise several times, including overnight.

records.name: khouzi ala timman  iraqi lamb shanks and rice   gluten free
records.text: very good scaled-down version of the arab iraqi specialty of a whole lamb stuffed with rice. adapted from the complete middle east cookbook by tess mallos. serve with recipe #366129 with or without using stock.

records.name: brown rice salad with zucchini  beans and dried cherries
records.text: different! but so good! this dish is so complete it has the protien, carbs, fiber and bursting with flavor!.

records.name: ww zesty mayo
records.text: this condiment is only 0. 5 pts per 2 tablespoons. quick and simple. i found it on the ww web site.

records.name: icy cold summer fruit soup
records.text: with heat from fresh ginger and a chili. summer freshness at its best! organic is the way to go. be sure to wash and drain well.

records.name: chipotle chicken rolls with avocado dipping sauce
records.text: this is a rachel ray recipe from her 365 - no repeats cookbook. this is a yummy easy dinner, that looks harder than it is to make.

records.name: unattended prime rib roast
records.text: this method is for an 6-9 pound roast, do not use this recipe for a roast that is over 9 pounds ---  never fuss over your prime rib again,  cook for 20 minutes,turn oven down to a low temp and forget about it for 8 hours, but remember do not open the oven door while the roast is cooking at a low temperature.

records.name: unattended prime rib roast
records.text: tape it shut!.

records.name: creamy parmesan garlic mushroom chicken
records.text: use thinly sliced chicken breasts to be ready in 30 minutes.

records.name: chicken  rice and vegetable soup
records.text: i pulled down a recipe for chicken rice soup and then started adding stuff, so what i ended up with was very different then the original. i think it turned out very good and made a nice supper, great for a cool day.

records.name: jamaican rice with  peas
records.text: i found this recipe in a book in the library and it instantly appealed to me because of its unusual exotic flavour (coconut and chili).

records.name: jamaican rice with  peas
records.text: there is a little story behind its name: in jamaica they say peas when they mean beans and therefore this dish is called rice with peas even though there are none in it.

records.name: white b b q sauce
records.text: a good b-b-q sauce for chicken.

records.name: chocolate peanut butter chip cookies
records.text: i made these at christmas time of last year to put onto my cookies trays for co-workers and family - they have since become a favorite! who can beat the combo of chocolate and peanut butter together?.

records.name: apple bacon tomato soup
records.text: a thick soup that is full of bacon and sautéed apple flavors. when ready to serve top with mozzarella cheese and have a wonderful crusty bread along side. adapted from another cooking website's email newsletter.

records.name: lemon grass chicken
records.text: this recipe is from a great cookbook, quick and easy thai. also included in the zaar world tour 2005 swap, asia.

records.name: mushroom beef rice
records.text: great change from potatoes with beef. i have cooked this recipe for numerous years and my family has always loved it. easy too.

records.name: stove top stuffing mix
records.text: this dressing tastes every bit as good as the famous box mix, but without all the sodium. also, using my bread machine and salt substitute, my husband can have his dressing anytime he likes.

records.name: stove top stuffing mix
records.text: i do not recall but believe this recipe was published in the newspaper many years ago. prep time excludes bread baking time.

records.name: raw apple muffins
records.text: i made these years ago everyday in a small cafe i worked at. they are chunky with the batter just holding all the fruit and nuts together.

records.name: cherry strawberry preserves for the bread machine  abm
records.text: i usually buy lots of fruit and sometimes the fruit goes past its prime- or you can use the freshest fruit--these preserves come out amazing ! i have a 2 pound bread maker with a jam cycle- this recipe is  not too sweet-- i like the preserves with plain greek yogurt !.

records.name: zesty tomato garlic fish
records.text: simple, easy, baked fish in a lemon-garlic tomato sauce--- a great light dinner. serve with pasta and a salad.

records.name: carrot cake   with splenda
records.text: a friend gave me this recipe, i think it is from the splenda web site.

records.name: easy pumpkin pie ice cream
records.text: major yummy! briefly heating together the pumpkin and spices allows the sugar to blend more easily and makes the kitchen smell fabulous! try this with spice cake, pumpkin bars, oatmeal or molasses cookies or hot apple pie.

records.name: easy pumpkin pie ice cream
records.text: prep time includes overnight freezing.

records.name: bamieh okra  and lamb  middle east  palestine
records.text: this is a tomato sauce based recipe that uses okra. with the lamb meat flavor it tastes great over rice! not hard to make at all either =)   also, you can substitute the lamb meat for chicken, it comes out just as delicious!.

records.name: g i batter fried shrimp
records.text: this is a really great recipe for frying batter. it is better than restaurant style.

records.name: char siuglazed pork and pineapple buns
records.text: easy chinese barbecue pork sandwiches. i finally got around to making them again and they’re totally delicious.

records.name: char siuglazed pork and pineapple buns
records.text: the flavor comes through in each bite of the sandwich, and works really well with the sweet tropical notes of the pineapple and sticky, addictive char siu sauce.

records.name: savory rice with mushrooms  johnny cash s mother s recipe
records.text: johnny cash was my husband's cousin and i was lucky enough to obtain a cookbook of johnny's mother's recipes titled, "favorite recipes from mama cash's kitchen.

records.name: savory rice with mushrooms  johnny cash s mother s recipe
records.text: "  i've been asked to post some of the recipes from the book and this is one of them.

records.name: strawberry milkshake
records.text: a very yummy and creammy strawberry flavored drink.

records.name: steamed fingerling potatoes with creme fraiche
records.text: recipe created by suzanne goin from the april, 2003 issue of o, the oprah magazine. have not tried this recipe but it looked and sounded so good i thought i would post it and share. had to guestimate the time it takes to prepare.

records.name: cream of coconut pecan pie
records.text: a new twist on a southern favorite.

records.name: light vanilla flan
records.text: this is a wonderful light custard recipe. i have made it many times and it cures my craving for the more sinful versions.

records.name: crock pot chili mac
records.text: this is a family favorite that i adapted from taste of home ground beef cookbook. i keep cooked ground beef in my freezer, so this is easy to put together in the morning before going out the door.

records.name: chocolate soymilk banana peanut butter smoothie
records.text: i hesitated to call this one a smoothie because it is so decadent. it tastes like a milkshake. i love silk brand chocolate soymilk is for this recipe as it is extremely chocolatey and rich. prep time includes freezing.

records.name: turkey dilly meatballs
records.text: although these are a more healthy alternative to swedish meatballs, served over rice or noodles they are just as tasty. i believe i got this recipe out of a good housekeeping magazine 10 to 15 years ago.

records.name: rice  krispies  date balls  aka angel cookies
records.text: another recipe from my aunt's recipe clippings. this one also came from the sept 19, 1969 chicago tribune originally. the clipping is crinkled with old yellow tape holding it together to make sure the recipes stayed intact.

records.name: rice  krispies  date balls  aka angel cookies
records.text: :) these are not like the typical angel cookies at all - they are little balls of dates, coconut, and rice krispies rolled in powdered.

records.name: rice  krispies  date balls  aka angel cookies
records.text: don't use the prechopped dates as they aren't sticky enough - buy the whole pitted dates and chop them yourself. also be sure to use the canned coconut.

records.name: rice  krispies  date balls  aka angel cookies
records.text: the kind that comes in bags is too dry and you will have a hard time getting the cookies to roll up otherwise.

records.name: roasted corn and red pepper chowder  crock pot  slow cooker
records.text: from rival versaware crock pot owner's manual and cookbook, c. 2006.

records.name: best bread machine buns
records.text: this recipe is easy and foolproof. it makes a soft and tasty bun with a slightly flaky crust. this is a combination of several recipes i've tried, but i've changed it to suit our tastes.

records.name: easy cheesy beef roll ups
records.text: the spicy canned soup is the key to this easy, tasty recipe.

records.name: natural chocolate peanut butter oatmeal
records.text: this is a healthy, delicious way to start the day. it combines my two favorite flavors, peanut butter and chocolate. it's a healthy version of a peanut butter cup.

records.name: sunshine blueberry muffins
records.text: who doesn't like blueberry muffins? these stay moist with the use of yogurt and the combination of tart lemon zest with the sweet glaze just melt in your mouth. lighten up the calories with low fat yogurt and splenda.

records.name: oven fried eggplant cutlets
records.text: i can't remember where i found this recipe, but it is the only way my family likes eggplant.

records.name: oven fried eggplant cutlets
records.text: even the grandkids like it, and that's a miracle! i suggest adding different types of cheeses to the breading if you like because the cheese gives a lot of flavor and crispiness. shredded cheddar or mozzarella cheese also works well.

records.name: oven fried eggplant cutlets
records.text: i also usually double the recipe for a large eggplant. the amount of garlic is also a personal preference.

records.name: real italian tomato sauce
records.text: great on any type of pasta. can be made ahead of time.

records.name: grilled peanut butter and banana sandwich

records.name: cambodian style fish poached in coconut milk
records.text: this recipe was featured in our local paper and is a kylie kwong and from her cookbook it tastes better and her intro to the recipe was  "i love this recipe because it is quick and simple to make, yet so exotic in flavour.

records.name: cambodian style fish poached in coconut milk
records.text: the galangal, turmeric and kaffir lime leaves add that gorgeous earthy, aromatic flavour so particular to south-east asian cuisine, and the taste and texture of fish cooked gently in coconut milk are sublime.

records.name: cambodian style fish poached in coconut milk
records.text: if you like, you can substitute the fish with any other seafood, or even chicken. ".

records.name: potatoes paprika
records.text: i love potatoes and i'm always looking for interesting ways to prepare them. this savory dish is a hit with my family.

records.name: filet mignon with cabernet sauce
records.text: this recipe is from cooking light.

records.name: barkram swedish berry cream dessert
records.text: posted for zwt6.

records.name: honey roast vegetables on pepper polenta with creamy blue cheese
records.text: tasty dish to be had on its own or a smaller serve as a side with a grill. this recipe can be halved quite successfully and i have made it with creamy blue camembert. if the fennel is not baby would suggest blanching it for a while first.

records.name: meatloaf   simple and delicious
records.text: this is a tasty meatloaf recipe that you can make when you don't have a lot of time to fuss.

records.name: coconut brownie bars
records.text: these are sinfully rich and delicious. enjoy!.

records.name: pumpkin hermits
records.text: a recipe from the "exclusively pumpkin" cookbook that virginia bunn lent me. i have to return the cookbook so am recorded recipes to try on recipezaar!  i love pumpkin and my family loves hermits!.

records.name: blueberry pizza

records.name: grandma s molasses cornbread
records.text: sweet corn bread that my grandma used to make, then my father made, and now i make. i serve this with chili, although i do like traditional corn bread too. this just really complements chili.

records.name: absolute best mango salsa
records.text: i absolutely adore fresh mango, and this salsa is the perfect way to make them shine!  the result is very fresh, sweet and spicy, and chunky. similar to pico de gallo in texture. make sure you use mangoes at their peak.

records.name: absolute best mango salsa
records.text: if they are too ripe, your salsa will be mushy. i make this often for guests by serving with blue corn tortilla chips (the color is so much prettier than plain ol' tortilla chips!) or serve alongside mahi mahi or other grilled fish.

records.name: absolute best mango salsa
records.text: i hope you enjoy it as much as i do!.

records.name: white chocolate lavender cookies
records.text: a delicate cookie with a pleasant lavender icing, great to substitute low-fat and low-calorie alternatives.

records.name: quick and easy cherry chocolate chip cookies
records.text: sweet cheat cookies that look great on any cookie tray and taste just as good. no down side here.

records.name: hot and spicy sloppy joes
records.text: spicy!!!! crock pot recipe! yes! there is no reason you can't make these stove top. just simmer till flavors meld and meat is tender. i also puree an optional carrot and red bell pepper for sweetness and extra nutrients for the family.

records.name: traditional roast beef with gravy
records.text: nothing fancy here - sometimes you should just stick to tradition.

records.name: easiest lemon pie
records.text: this is so very easy to make, and you can substitute other types of fruit for the lemonade concentrate, such as frozen strawberries in syrup. just be sure to drain the strawberries well if you substitute with them.

records.name: easiest lemon pie

records.name: zebra cheesecake bars

records.name: pork aux champignons  french pork with mushrooms

records.name: pork aux champignons  french pork with mushrooms
records.text: per his intro, "the art of simmering is a very important part of bistro cooking. all you have to do is combine all the ingredients, put them in a skillet (or casserole dish) & allow to cook b4 enjoying the rich flavors.

records.name: pork aux champignons  french pork with mushrooms
records.text: " even that part of the recipe won me over. a white burgundy (rully or pouilly-fuisse) was suggested to accompany this dish.

records.name: pork aux champignons  french pork with mushrooms
records.text: *enjoy* ! *edited to add* in response to reviewer comments, i added the word *whole* to help describe the spice cloves, suggested med-sized shallots & gave options for the onion ingredient. :-).

records.name: broccoli with sauce  amish
records.text: this broccoli dish is easy to make, cooked cubed chicken breast can be added to this dish with bread crumbs on top for an super easy dinner.

records.text: adding a dollop of hummus (i like the variety with roasted peppers and garlic) to any sautéed vegetable gives a delightful twist on flavor.

records.name: ethiopian sauteed lamb or beef

records.name: lemon muffins made with splenda

records.name: virtually fat free mini pumpkin muffins

records.name: spicy ham hocks and black eyed peas
records.text: you can serve this on rice or simply as a side dish. it's alittle bit spicy, but you might like to add some tabasco or hot green pepper sauce to give it a little more punch. i do.

records.name: babzy s spaghetti sauce
records.text: okay, well spaghetti is, (and always has been), my favorite food in the whole wide world. i absolutely love it every which way.

records.name: babzy s spaghetti sauce
records.text: this is my final, favorite recipe after years of trying different recipes and finally tweaking them all to my liking. i like it served with garlic bread and sprinkled with lots of parmesan cheese.

records.name: babzy s spaghetti sauce
records.text: this recipe has some optional ingredients that definately aren't needed, just added extras! i also use this as my base recipe for other pasta dishes (like lasagna or by replacing the ground meat with italian sausage slices for a sausage and pepper penne, etc.

records.name: velvety vegetable cheese soup
records.text: omg - i made this tonight and i haven't tasted a soup this good in a long, long time. i had some velveeta cheese left over, and saw this recipe in my recent kraft food and family magazine. this is also so incredibly easy. try it. trust me.

records.name: velvety vegetable cheese soup
records.text: you will love it!.

records.name: smoked turkey   caramelized onion wraps
records.text: this is a recipe i found a long time ago i make it for get togethers or just for  a yummy summer lunch.

records.name: orange and ginger carrots

records.text: i found this in a kraft food magazine. it originally called for mushrooms, which i don't eat so i adapted it to things i like.

records.name: chocolate zucchini bread

records.name: pepper s spicy cocoa
records.text: i made this for gifts for christmas. this makes a good amount so good to put in a container and wrap up for a present or put in a basket. great for those who can't have milk too, make with soy or almond milk.

records.name: quinoa and corn grits polenta
records.text: from my recipe files.

records.name: apricot cheesecake
records.text: a heavenly sounding dessert, even for someone like me who doesn't really care for cheesecake. i haven't tried this one yet but have been asked to make it soon. i've included all the time for cooling in the.

records.name: crock pot chicken   rice ii
records.text: this is great when you don't have time to watch the oven for the chicken & rice to bake. i can put it in the crock pot overnight and it's ready when i wake up. make sure to use a crock pot liner.

records.text: a hearty beef and vegetable stew that is a great way to feed the whole family. a great dish for wintertime and if anyone around the house is sick. my husband loves my extras in it and it cooks on the stove so its pretty quick and easy!.

records.name: mile high meatless lasagna pie
records.text: i just love lasagna!  this one is great - it's loaded with vegetables. and cheese!  i love the spinach in this dish!  i adapted this from a recipe from bh&g biggest book of italian recipes.

records.name: crock pot maple chicken breasts

records.name: crock pot maple chicken breasts

records.text: a drink recipe i got from bon appetit. sounds wonderful!.

records.name: yellow fruit salad
records.text: a recipe from ricardo.

records.name: easy blackberry  lime  filled angel food cake
records.text: 4 ingredients to make a quick impressive cake. you can make it all from scratch using my lemon curd recipe/angel food recipe. but the idea for this is quick and easy! and most of all yummy!.

records.name: pasta with sausage and chicken
records.text: a hearty and satisfying dish.

records.name: the frugal gourmet s  southern barbecue sauce
records.text: this is the only barbecue sauce i use for "pulled pork" barbecue. from jeff smith's first cookbook, "the frugal gourmet", 1984  one recipe is enough for about 10 lbs. of meat. it keeps well in a jar in the fridge.

records.name: the frugal gourmet s  southern barbecue sauce

records.name: pork and beans with chorizo

records.name: bananas wonton

records.name: low fat beef and bean tortilla bake
records.text: i found this recipe in a little betty crocker magazine called simple healthy meals.

records.name: low fat beef and bean tortilla bake
records.text: this recipe is so good because it is made with on hand ingredients so i use this as an easy, last minute idea when i cant think of anything to make for dinner. this dish is very healthy and doesnt taste like it is.

records.name: low fat beef and bean tortilla bake
records.text: the few changes i make to the recipe are i just use all black beans, since they are healthier than pinto beans.

records.name: low fat beef and bean tortilla bake
records.text: i use extra sharp full fat cheddar, you dont need very much anyways being extra sharp so why not? and i like to add a can of my favorite el pato tomato sauce (yellow can) to the meat mixture also.

records.name: low fat beef and bean tortilla bake
records.text: and also i just lay out the tortillas tearing them so they fit in the pan. the strips are extra work i dont think that is neccesary. i like to serve this with a little bit of sour cream.

records.name: cheeseburgers on sandwich buns  crock pot
records.text: have not tried this yet, but it sounds like a great idea. i imagine a large quantity of this could be made and kept warm in the crock pot when you are entertaining guests.

records.name: arabic samboosak

records.name: arabic samboosak
records.text: at the time, the recipe i had attempted was based on a very rough arabic translation, so chef #239758 kindly turned me onto this one.

records.name: arabic samboosak
records.text: i tried this samboosak, and would recommend serving them with a sauce such as recipe #36126 -- if anyone knows of a more appropriate arabic sauce, please let me know! :) i think they're quite good without a sauce, too!.

records.name: asparagus roast

records.text: for a poolish, just mix one third of the flour with one third of the water and add 1/4 teaspoon of instant yeast. cover and leave on counter for 4 hours until bubbly and risen to double.

records.name: linda s incredibly complicated yet  fantabulous antipasta

records.name: linda s incredibly complicated yet  fantabulous antipasta
records.text: we stuffed black olives with cream cheese (philly, of course) and ate more than we served until grandmom threatened us with a wooden spoon. we made this when our family got together, usually 30 - 40 people.

records.name: linda s incredibly complicated yet  fantabulous antipasta
records.text: these meals were big events and we cooked for a week. i hope you try this when you have a special occasion with your family.

records.name: linda s incredibly complicated yet  fantabulous antipasta
records.text: get the teenagers to help assemble but don't bonk them with a wooden spoon should they eat too many olives! aunt nancy and i were faster than grandmom so we escaped, laughing (most of the time).

records.name: linda s incredibly complicated yet  fantabulous antipasta

records.name: roasted garlic and herb beurre blanc   an amazing sauce

records.name: kittencal s greek roasted lemon garlic chicken with potatoes

records.name: toolie s party size  salsa

records.name: toolie s party size  salsa
records.text: smooth, or with chunks. mild, medium, hot, fiery, or volcanic eat it on its own, or in conjunction with meats, on sandwiches, with cheese, dipped or spooned. some cultures call it salsa, while others will dub this delicacy, chutney.

records.name: toolie s party size  salsa
records.text: the versatility of salsa is: if you do not like the flavour, adjust it to suit your own palate. there is no "wrong" way to make salsa. there is only a "right" way. and all recipes are right. whether you call it "salsa" or "chutney".

records.name: toolie s party size  salsa

records.text: i occasionally find that the seasoning mixture used to rub over the chicken is not enough and so i sometimes wind up mixing up more. depends on how much chicken you actually use. just keep the proportions the same and its fine. enjoy!.

records.name: sour cream apple square

records.name: sour cream apple square

records.text: scalloped potatoes layered with onion and rosemary and half and half baked all together.

records.text: this came from an old canning book i have, i found it very hard to find a recipe to can this. there is no prep time, it all depends on how much horseradish you have and how you can handle the heat.

records.text: with thanks to avital p of the israel-foods yahoo discussion group who helped me find the basic recipe. i've added my own family touches.

records.text: this colourful mediterranean starter of juicy roasted peppers strewn with basil and garlic couldn't be simpler to make.

records.name: southern fried oysters
records.text: my dad loves to have a good old southern fish/seafood fry. this is the recipe he uses for fried oysters.

records.name: my chicken fried steak
records.text: my family loves chicken fried steak. i like flavor, so i created this recipe. serve with mashed potatoes and cream gravy.

records.name: fruit salad with orange liqueur
records.text: i tossed this together at the last second for a fruit salad and it turned out wonderful. i did not have time to chill the salad, but it was fine at room temp.

records.name: fruit salad with orange liqueur
records.text: use cold fruit so the salad does not have to be chilled before serving or bananas and apples may turn brown.

records.name: steak   mushrooms in beef dijon sauce
records.text: yummy, simple, and a hearty meal for those rushed nights. enjoy with your favorite bread and a green veggie, we like steamed broccoli.

records.name: orange tic tac
records.text: this can be made as a drink or a shot. and it does taste a lot like an orange tic tac candy. addictive.

records.name: double chocolate oatmeal bars
records.text: delicious cookie bars you can make ahead! store airtight with wax paper between layers at room temp for up to 5 days or freeze up to 3 months. this is a favorite with my girls!.

records.name: spiced pumpkin pancakes
records.text: these are great in the fall!  from bon appetit.

records.name: karol z no bake pecan pie
records.text: a very old recipe makes for a taste delight!  you will love this great way of making pecan pie. quick and easy, this will soon be a favorite. cook time is cool time.

records.name: seafood salad croissant sandwiches
records.text: these elegant sandwiches would be great for a shower, reception, or luncheon. serve on mini-croissants or slice a regular croissant in half if using as part of a buffet.

records.name: seafood salad croissant sandwiches
records.text: you may want to add a leaf of butter or boston lettuce to these sandwiches and you can substitute 3 to 6-inch pieces of french bread, buttered and lightly toasted, for the croissants.

records.name: seafood salad croissant sandwiches
records.text: from an august 1988 issue of bon appetit in the "cooking for friends" section.

records.name: turkish wedding pilaf  dugun pilav
records.text: a nice simple and tasty pilaf. i sometimes use chicken stock in replacment of the meat one. it's a must to use basmati! very good with braised lamb (tas kebap). basically the recipe from the complete middle east cookbook by tess mallos.

records.name: new england chop suey
records.text: american chop suey (or goulash if you leave bos/ne) is a cheap hearty food that gained popularity with our grandparents during wwii for obvious reasons. this is a great winter comfort food.

records.name: new england chop suey
records.text: the basic shell is here, although this version is a bit zazzed up. traditional recipe calls for beef, elbows, onion, green pepper, tomato soup and s&p to taste. this should make about 8 servings.

records.name: new england chop suey
records.text: left overs will taste even better, and this is also good to freeze.

records.name: amazing rice pudding
records.text: i have been making this recipe for since 2006, i got it out of a magazine and i wish i could remember the magazine because if all their recipes are this good, i would make them my all time recipes.

records.name: perfect banana bread
records.text: this banana bread is awesome! it's loaded with pecans, brown sugar and cinnamon! also, it's loaded with flavor! i found it in a lhj magazine many years ago. the riper the bananas, the better.

records.name: perfect banana bread
records.text: this loaf freezes well and can stay out of refrigerator for up to 2 days, wrapped well.

records.name: outback kookaburra wings
records.text: i haven't had outback's wings to compare, but these are delicious! add more hot sauce if you like real spicy wings!.

records.name: sesame beef and asparagus stir fry
records.text: get out the chopsticks it' s chinese for dinner tonight. this recipe goes together easily if you do all the prep work before starting to cook. this is an easy family supper that has everything meat, side and vegetable in one dish.

records.name: machbous rubyan  rice with shrimps
records.text: this is a classic gulf dish -- yum yum! i've adapted this recipe from a recipe booklet that came free with "ship madras curry powder" i made it the other day and my husband thought it was wonderful! serve with a nice, colourful salad, otherwise it'll look a bit yellow yellow yellow! next time i want to try putting whole king prawns on top to add a bit of colour!.

records.name: moroccan lentils and couscous
records.text: this superb moroccan favorite can only be described as heavenly, with the combination of aromatic spices and crisp, brown onion adding a real spark to the subtle flavors of the lentils and couscous.

records.name: pesto cheese blossom  paula deen
records.text: this is a recipe from paula deen. i made it for a new year's party and everyone raved. it makes a beautiful presentation when sliced. *changed to add an additional 8 oz pkg of cream cheese per home-by-dawn's review. thank you!.

records.name: ginger salmon steaks
records.text: salmon is my favourite fish. this is an easy recipe, it's quick for the weekday meal and it has lots of flavour.

records.name: sparkling strawberry tea
records.text: tea with frozen strawberries, frozen lemonade concentrate, and sprite/7-up. refreshing!  from southern living. cs.

records.name: cinnamon potato rolls
records.text: this recipe has been in my family for many years. i make them often and hope they will be a hit with your family too.

records.name: gujarati potatoes
records.text: easy to prepare--spicy but not too hot. it is a great accompaniment from anything from  buffets to barbecues.

records.name: denny s beer cheese soup
records.text: a rather strong and cheesy soup, with no.

records.name: beef cups
records.text: i made these for my family's dinner. my family really liked these. my 4 yrs old newphew really liked these. we thought they tasted so yummy. they were so easy to make and fast. when i made these i used store brand bread.

records.name: beef cups
records.text: i found it easier to cut the crust off my bread to fit them in my medium size muffin tin. i also used more tabasco sauce. i found it's best to bake the muffin tin on a cookie sheet lined with foil as the cheese melts over.

records.name: beef cups
records.text: i got the recipe from pinching your pennies.

records.name: jenns incredible honey chai frappe
records.text: my dd created this drink since she desired a chai smoothie. this drink is perfect for cooling off on a hot summer day, an afternoon pick me up.

records.name: zucchini cupcakes
records.text: this is a recipe i found in my toh magazine that i tried and now have adapted it to my tastes. it is a great way to use up those wonderful zucchini   squashes this summer and great for all ages.

records.name: zucchini cupcakes
records.text: there are at least 4-5 posted recipes posted for the recipe that was in toh, but without the changes i made, but i found the cloves too strong in the other version, personal preference.

records.name: banana caramel bars
records.text: found this on the web -- looks great!.

records.name: butterballs
records.text: this recipe is from the silver palate cookbook by julee rosso and sheila lukins. these are incredible. have eaten these at julee rosso's wonderful wickwood inn b&b in saugatuk, mi, where the food alone is worth a stay in the charming inn.

records.name: butterballs
records.text: these are always on our cookie tray at the holidays.

records.name: c g s macaroni and cheese sandwich
records.text: another invented recipe from circa 1970. of course, it was mom's homemade macaroni and cheese recipe i used in this sandwich, but i will allow you to use your favorite mac 'n' cheese.

records.name: c g s macaroni and cheese sandwich
records.text: the key is to use leftover mac and cheese, not freshly baked. *this being my seven hundredth recipe posted, i had to make it extra special. *.

records.name: tofu bourguignon
records.text: vegan version of french classic beef bourguignon.

records.name: salsa pico de gallo
records.text: i do not like the bottled salsas at all so i always make my own. this one has the traditional ingredients and my family loves it. i use the milder version of ro-tel for the children and the regular version for us.

records.name: chocolate snacker
records.text: this is a quick snack cake and easy to put together. it makes a change to have cocoa instead of chocolate. i have had this from an old magazine (with my own changes) at least 10 years and i have made it often.

records.name: iced nutty butterscotch coffee
records.text: i made this for a bbq we had and it went over real well! great for those warm days when you don't want hot coffee. you can add more creamer if you like it lighter. you can make it one tall drink or share it.

records.name: cherry orange chicken
records.text: i was skeptical at first about this recipe but was delighted with its flavour. also, i use chicken breasts instead of the whole chicken. the crew licked the platter clean with this one.

records.name: pimiento cheese dip

records.name: saucy rice lunch  comfort food
records.text: very yummy, easy and healthy. spice it up for a side dish at dinner or eat it more bland for a comfort food lunch. a world of opportunity with this dish.

records.name: strawberries   strawberry fruit dip
records.text: enjoy a quick and easy low fat dessert.

records.name: cream of butternut squash soup
records.text: this is from heartland soups cookbook. this is a really good soup. i don't know the exact prep or cook time except for the 1 hour to bake the squash. hope you enjoy as much as we do!.

records.name: cumin spiced honey carrots with lemon coriander vinaigrette
records.text: a wonderful way to fix the ordinary carrot! influenced by african spices, try this! this recipe may be halved easily. adapted from foodservice recipes. this is a middle eastern/african recipe.

records.name: chocolate pecan upside down cake
records.text: the gooey topping is poured into the bundt pan first, and creates a yummy topping for this upside down cake. plus it is chocolate!.

records.name: pizza spread
records.text: my grandma used to make this all the time when we were little. i spread a little on buns and toast them in the oven.

records.name: radish and cilantro relish
records.text: taken from the backwoods home magazine.

records.name: pork stew with celery

records.name: old fashioned family pie
records.text: i love pies, and i especially love meat pies with mushrooms in them ! , this one is simple to make and very tasty. great on a cold winter night, by itself or served with chips, mashed potatoes or mushy peas. hope you like it.

records.name: ruth reichl s roast chicken with potatoes   onions
records.text: i've just enjoyed ruth reichl's book about her time as a restaurant critic for the ny times, "garlic and sapphires". she gives a simple, practical recipe for roast chicken that i thought great, although i did tweak it a tiny bit.

records.name: ruth reichl s roast chicken with potatoes   onions
records.text: she considers that it's not necessary to "make a big to-do about roasting chicken". she's so right.

records.name: healthy oatmeal surprises

records.name: deconstructed banana cream pie    bananas foster variation

records.name: deconstructed banana cream pie    bananas foster variation

records.name: good canned green beans   from bland canned to garden fresh

records.name: good canned green beans   from bland canned to garden fresh
records.text: when i got older, someone told me to cook them with oil, and that got me started on the quest for the perfect way to doctor canned green beans to make them taste closer to fresh.

records.name: good canned green beans   from bland canned to garden fresh
records.text: and here it is!  (tip: i love the big can of hanover green beans, in the white can. they seem to have better flavor. ).

records.name: bourbon drunken upside down turkey

records.name: marmaliga

records.name: vegan  buttermilk  southern style biscuits
records.text: this is an incredibly simple recipe for "buttermilk" southern style biscuits, minus the dairy and cholesterol! i adapted this recipe from a traditional biscuit recipe and these take only a few minutes to make and use incredibly simple ingredients.

records.name: vegan  buttermilk  southern style biscuits

records.text: this recipe starts with frozen potato wedges!  no chopping!  no endless baking!  it got rave reviews on bhg. com, so i knew i had to post it here.

records.name: kittencal s tzatziki  greek cucumber and yogurt salad
records.text: this is worth making it is so delicious! greek yogurt is richer and thicker then regular yogurt and is the best used for this recipe, if you cannot find greek yogurt just use 4 cups regular full-fat plain yogurt and drain it in the fridge through a triple thickness of cheesecloth for 8 hours or overnight, if you are using greek yogurt you will not have to strain it, once you try greek yogurt you will never go back to regular yogurt again! plan ahead this needs to chill for a minimum of 2 hours, you won't be able to keep your spoon out of the bowl lol! make certain to drain the cucumber very well for this.

records.name: kittencal s tzatziki  greek cucumber and yogurt salad
records.text: serve this anyway or with anything you want to, it is great on pita. prep time is only if you are using the greek yogurt if you are straining the yogurt prep time will be more.

records.name: grilled chicken and apples with rosemary
records.text: i got this recipe from a cookbook years ago, and it remains one of my all-time favorite chicken recipes. the meat is so juicy and flavorful, and the apples taste like baked apples. it is such an easy meal to prepare and so delicious.

records.name: posole  tex mex style
records.text: this is a good tex-mex recipe for a hearty soup to warm you on a cold winter day. it was first printed in the junior league cookbook in the city in which i live. it tastes better the longer it cooks. you can use a crock-pot to cook it.

records.name: simple cake filling
