records.text: this is a swiss family recipe i received from my aunt. it is a well balanced dessert. it is a traditional european dessert bread that can be served during a meal or as a light dessert.

records.name: gugelhopf
records.text: it is known for its understated sweetness and characteristic ring shape. traditionaly this is baked in a mold known as a gugelhopf (or kugelhopf) pan. bundt pans, with their round form, deep fluted sides and central funnel will substitute fine.

records.name: vegetable stir fry
records.text: this is a delicious, hearty vegetable stir fry perfect for anyone in the family.

records.name: pizza croissants  quick and easy
records.text: these are great as a quick and fun weeknight meal. my fiance came up with this one when he was out of town for a week. when he came back and shared it with me i was really surprised with how good they were.

records.name: chava s thin and crispy potato kugel
records.text: if you love thin and crispy, this is the kugel for you!.

records.name: southern fried corn ii
records.text: from hallmark magazine november/december 2006. i'm considering using fresh corn that has been grilled or roasted next time i prepare this. thought processes in motion.

records.name: english gingerbread cake
records.text: posting for zwt 6  based on a traditional english recipe in rose levy beranbaum’s rose’s heavenly cakes.

records.name: almond amaretto cheesecake
records.text: i started making this cheesecake back in the early 80's. i went to a southern living cooking class and it was on the menu. my mother and friends always ask me to make this on special occasions.

records.name: almond amaretto cheesecake
records.text: it is time consuming but i guarantee you it is wonderful.

records.name: company s coming  stuffed  winter squash
records.text: a savory wild rice and apple stuffing fills these golden squash rings. delicata are oblong green and yellow striped squash; sliced crosswise they make beautiful scalloped rings, or use any other winter squash.

records.name: company s coming  stuffed  winter squash
records.text: you can also make the wild rice stuffing without the squash for a side dish. serve with shiitake mushroom gravy. adapted from delicious living magazine.

records.name: mushroom   chicken appetizers
records.text: a "do ahead" appetizer. the puffs can be room temperature when you fill them. fill them just before serving. these would also be nice with the filling heated.

records.name: whole sticky glazed chicken
records.text: i found this chinese inspired chicken recipe in the paper. chicken represents happiness and marriage. serving chicken whole signifies family togetherness. the chicken is so sweet and juicy made this way.

records.name: whole sticky glazed chicken
records.text: you will need unwaxed kitchen string for this recipe.

records.name: sweet and sour beans roquefort
records.text: source	southern living - dinner and supper cookbook.

records.name: glady s chicken salad
records.text: this is another wonderful dish that my grandmother always served to her customers.

records.name: perfect sand cake
records.text: this recipe is the final result of all cake recipes i have ever tried and this is (in my opinion) the best recipe you could use for having a great cake.

records.name: perfect sand cake
records.text: i consider this recipe is the basic mixture i use and then i use any of the variations i know to end up with a different cake each time.

records.name: perfect sand cake
records.text: note: regarding the flour, i either use 3 cups of all-purpose flour or 2 cups all-purpose flour + 1 cup whole-wheat flour to have that grainy rustic texture of cake which i like, so it depends on your personal taste.

records.name: italian crusted chicken
records.text: i've had this recipe for years and it's one my family's favorites. quick, easy but good enough for company. it is a very versitle recipe in that you can add any additional spices or seasonings to your own taste.

records.name: italian crusted chicken
records.text: i have tried to substitute olive oil for all of the butter, but it doesn't work for our tastes. i add a little olive oil to the butter because we do like the richness it gives yet not too overpowering.

records.name: italian crusted chicken
records.text: i use stovetop stuffing mix and the parmesan cheese in the can. also great for pork chops.

records.name: chicken soup   best ever
records.text: this is modified from the second ave. deli recipe in nyc. it won a good housekeeping chicken soup taste test. i've made it many times, and this is my family's favorite. some of my family likes noodles in their soup, some rice, some neither.

records.name: chicken soup   best ever
records.text: this pleases everyone. it's simple, but very yummy.

records.name: curried coleslaw
records.text: from the show "licence to grill".

records.name: artichoke mushroom caps
records.text: a want-to-try recipe from quick cooking.

records.name: not your average tabouli salad
records.text: i found this in one of the food network magazines with a slight adjustment. very refreshing and travels well.

records.name: best ever butter pound cake
records.text: yummy yummy butter pound cake. just a little effort, but very well worth it. just like grandma use to make.

records.name: penne a la betsy  pioneer woman recipe
records.text: from pioneer woman, her little sister, betsy's recipe. i loved this!  made with milk instead of cream and it was great. would be even better with the cream, of course ; ).

records.name: basic custard  vanilla
records.text: a very basic "true" custard, originally developed for boston cream pie, but also yummy on its own. the best part is that you can add any flavor you like!!!.

records.name: mom s quick tuna
records.text: quick, easy, and light dinner. you can use leftover chicken, instead of tuna.

records.name: espresso marbled panna cotta
records.text: this is from donna hay's autumn issue 2 (from about 2001 i think). i added more vanilla (you can reduce this to half if you only like a slight vanilla taste) and used raw sugar (not as sweet).

records.name: espresso marbled panna cotta
records.text: i have made this with raspberries as well (see separate recipe). looks great in a clear glass so you can see the pretty marbled effect (and no messy unmoulding!)  time doesn't include refrigeration time.

records.name: rise and shine casserole
records.text: some thing that will start your day off right.

records.name: creamy rice  chicken   spinach dinner
records.text: my family loves this meal!  easy way to get some spinach into them!  i do love it with the dressing called for but have also used plain italian and even just oil. it is from kraftfoods. com.

records.name: sweet onion salad
records.text: my mom used to make this salad when she was a caterer. at first, people where afraid of it. however, once a few brave souls gave it a try; it's popularity grew in our small town.

records.name: broccoli bacon salad
records.text: this great side dish is prepared all summer long and on new years day along with ham sandwiches and baked beans. this stuff is so flavorful and even more addicting!.

records.name: spring mix strawberry asparagus salad
records.text: this delicious salad is great when fresh strawberries are in season.

records.name: annis  black bean chili
records.text: i was in santa fe for a weekend more than 10 years ago and tried to get a reservation at mark miller’s coyote café for dinner with no luck. the bar downstairs served appetizers and i had this great chili.

records.name: annis  black bean chili
records.text: as it happened the sous chef was in the bar having a corona and i asked him if chocolate was the secret was to his great chili – he said well maybe!  he wouldn’t give me the recipe but this is close.

records.name: pecan encrusted pork tenderloin with mustard cream sauce
records.text: this is an excellent recipe created by a collegue. it is incredible. he says it is a pretty fool proof recipe. we have used it for elegant dinners because the flavors and textures are so interesting and the taste is wonderful.

records.name: pecan encrusted pork tenderloin with mustard cream sauce
records.text: we like to serve it with a wild rice, sautéed onion and mushroom mixture, and oven-roasted asparagus with garlic. we also have served it with garlic mashed potatoes as a substitute for the rice. that is a good combination too.

records.name: lil  smokey wraps
records.text: a guy at work made these and brought these in. some of the yummiest i've had in awhile. wanted to share it with ya'll!  it's great.

records.name: orange rice   rice cooker
records.text: this is a refreshing rice side with a hint of orange using this simple recipe #195964 using orange. this is a recipe for a standard rice cooker - please adjust the water if cooking in a pan the conventional way.

records.name: orange rice   rice cooker
records.text: great with black beans, any asian dishes, orange flavored chicken, ribs, fish.

records.name: southwest chuck steak
records.text: i didn't have any idea what to do with the chuck steaks in my freezer so i read a few recipes here and on other sites and came up with this. i served it on rice and it was quite tasty.

records.name: southwest chuck steak
records.text: dh gave it two thumbs up! i prefer the rotel brand tomatoes and for the beef base you can't beat the better than bouillon brand.

records.name: steak   ale hawaiian chicken
records.text: cover the floor with newspaper to catch the family drool when they smell this on the grill!.

records.name: ginger ale ice cubes
records.text: my mother's friend gave her this recipe when i was just a young thing. many moons ago. i still make it when i have a good reason to do so and find it is so refreshing.

records.name: milli jhooli sabji   mixed vegetables
records.text: this recipe comes from the chef at klay oven, a fine indian restaurant in chicago. i'm kind of a chicken when it comes to indian recipes but i can easily do this one!.

records.name: chicken soup with wild rice and mushrooms
records.text: this recipe is from the gooseberry patch cookbook celebrate autumn. it is great on a cold fall day!.

records.name: winter minestrone
records.text: here is a delicious soup i prepare in the morning, and let it cook during the day. i come home add spinach, and cook for 10 minutes, and i have a wonderful soup.

records.name: black forest stuffed cupcakes
records.text: i found this recipe while trying to check my email. it was a happy "oops". they looked so unique and tasty that i had to share.

records.name: sour cream chive bread  bread machine
records.text: i just saw this in a magazine and wanted to share. i'm new to the whole bread machine world but this sounded really good. i hope to make it soon! cook time is approximate (depends on your machine).

records.name: zippy cheese cauliflower
records.text: my university roommate thought i was insane when i told her this was my favourite way to eat cauliflower, but she tried it and started making it this way herself, too.

records.name: zippy cheese cauliflower
records.text: quantities of everything (including the cauliflower itself) are all sort of approximate, and can be varied to suit your taste/appetite.

records.name: adult fruit salad    alcoholic  martinique    caribbean
records.text: this recipe was found on the internet at recipeisland. com. preparation time includes the peeling, slicing & dicing of the fruit, but not the hour needed for the fruit to chill.

records.name: adult fruit salad    alcoholic  martinique    caribbean
records.text: although this recipe should make 6 servings, it could make much less if someone decides to 'drink' it!.

records.name: the best pork chops ever
records.text: this is one of the first things my husband ever cooked for me. his dad came up with the recipe long ago and i've perfected it.

records.name: the best pork chops ever
records.text: we have this for every special occasion in our family- my 2 year old even loves it!  this recipe is simple yet delicious. i cook mine for 4-5 hours though to get the extra gravy because that is the best part.

records.name: the best pork chops ever
records.text: don't be alarmed if your gravy looks curdled. it's suppose to. enjoy and watch it disappear.

records.name: cracked sugar cookies
records.text: my daughter and i wanted a soft and chewy cookies and after trying oodles of recipes we came up with this good sugar cookie.

records.name: fried chicken fingers  tenders
records.text: ever crave those restaurant style chicken fingers? why pay restaurant prices for one serving when you could pay the same price for an entire meal. you'll have to vary the spices to your taste. the spices listed is how we makes these at home.

records.name: fried chicken fingers  tenders
records.text: serve with buffalo wing sauce, honey mustard or bbq sauce for dipping.

records.name: season s easiest fruit cobbler
records.text: another cobbler from season. told you fanatic!! this is best with fresh fruit and always better warm. the next day just warm it up in the microwave oven for 1 minute.

records.name: rolled fillet of sole
records.text: an easy and quick fish dish to make for family or company.

records.name: cranberry nut bread
records.text: beautiful loaf for the holidays.

records.name: kadhi
records.text: this is an accompaniment with almost all khichdi (rice lentil combos) dishes or even plain rice. you can make adjustments to the basic recipe as per your liking.

records.name: kadhi
records.text: eg you may add choice vegetables or pakodis (lentil croquettes)or few piece of papad (raw to boil with kadhi) or spinach and fenugreek leaves. the consistency of a kadhi should be thick enough to coat the back of a ladle.

records.name: herbed baked catfish
records.text: taste of home.

records.name: black eyed peas supper
records.text: black eye peas and sausage. i got this recipe off a label of bushes' black-eyed peas.

records.name: guilt free chocolate mousse
records.text: simple low cal, low fat chocolate mousse.

records.name: hawaiian baked beans
records.text: this is a wonderfully different,tasty and easy recipe, that came from a little community paper here in mississippi. the best part is, that you do not need to heat up your kitchen. :-).

records.name: hot and smoky baked beans
records.text: a nice side dish for barbecues. from bon appetit.

records.name: roast chicken with cilantro pesto and vegetables
records.text: this is ready to go into the oven in just minutes, so you can kick back and relax with your family while it cooks. if you're not a cilantro fan, substitute parsley. recipe roots in spain, mexico, southwest. usa,.

records.name: healthy turkey bacon quiche
records.text: very easy to make and tastes great! great for a family meal, or keep in the fridge for a week full of goodness.

records.name: green eggs and ham breakfast pizza
records.text: i was looking for something creative to make for my students on dr. seuss' birthday this year (read across america day). i threw this together, and i got 25 thumbs up. hopefully others enjoy it.

records.name: green eggs and ham breakfast pizza
records.text: using egg whites was a personal preference- feel free to experiment with regular eggs.

records.name: new england scallop casserole
records.text: a very easy casserole and so good!! enjoy.

records.name: lemon easy cookies
records.text: easy to make and just enough for two people. you could use any flavor jello. cherry sounds good for my next time.

records.name: kahlua   eggnog
records.text: this is a great recipe from a 1986 kahlua recipe book.

records.name: white house chicken  oregano chicken
records.text: from a community cookbook that i removed and had in a pile. it says it's from the white house. not sure what year but here it is. note: 3-4 hrs. marination. can bake or grill this easy recipe.

records.name: white house chicken  oregano chicken
records.text: * i have another version of this recipe called chicken oregano where you just rub the spices and lemon juice on a whole chicken, about 2 1/2 lbs.

records.name: white house chicken  oregano chicken
records.text: ,inside and out, and then place in a 7 x 10 inch baking dish with 1 cup of water and 1/2 stick of butter. bake at 400 degrees f. until golden brown and then lower oven to 350 degrees f. and bake for about 30-40 minutes longer, basting frequently.

records.name: white house chicken  oregano chicken
records.text: that recipe was from katherine beeson of the azalia garden club, marion, sc. i found the recipe again as a favorite of mrs. richard nixon from favorite recipes of our first ladies, 1971. it is called barbacued chicken in that book.

records.name: gran smith s meat roll  361cals per serve
records.text: i remember gran making it when i was a kid. nice simple recipe, but o'so good.

records.name: vegetarian egg casserole
records.text: this recipe is very versatile, the only required ingredients are bread, eggs and milk or soy milk. i recommend using all ingredients listed, but in a pinch you can skip any of the optional ingredients.

records.name: vegetarian egg casserole
records.text: can be made dairy free with soy milk and soy cheese.

records.name: fresh avocado dressing for modern tastes
records.text: modern food fashion leans toward fresh, clean tastes which do not obscure the main ingredients. with this in mind i created this dressing. i especially did not want to add mayonnaise.

records.name: fresh avocado dressing for modern tastes
records.text: an avo dressing can never be thin, but this one is "thinner" than most. it has a very clean and pure avo taste.

records.name: fresh avocado dressing for modern tastes
records.text: it's excellent with salads, marvellous with fresh fried fish fillets, as well as with many other simple foods such as potato or fish cakes. do not use those watery avo's: go for a large, perfectly-ripe creamy avo.

records.name: fresh avocado dressing for modern tastes
records.text: we have plenty to choose from at the moment, so remember this recipe when your avo season rolls round!.

records.name: buffalo wing lettuce wraps
records.text: i had this at the firehouse in pb and was inspired to make my own at home! so this is what i put together!.

records.name: fried eggs with beef and onions
records.text: recipe from lebanon. another recipe from my cherished cook book from saudi arabi by nahda salah.

records.name: ramen noodle stir fry
records.text: way back in our early marriage we recieved a wok as a wedding gift and it came with a cookbook, moving clear across the country with little money each pay day we had to economize and eat cheap.

records.name: ramen noodle stir fry
records.text: so i adapted many of the cookbook recipes to fit our budget. this dish could be made with out any meat at all and still taste great. use a large nonstick skillet if you don't have a electric wok.

records.name: peach schnapps and vodka plugged watermelon
records.text: this recipe is from the september 1989 issue of gourmet magazine. this picnic treat for grown-ups can be made 2 days in advance.

records.name: enfrijoladas
records.text: chile de árbol is a long, thin, red pepper commonly referred to in the u. s. a. as a szechuan pepper. it is very spicy so a little goes a long way. enfrijoladas make a wonderful breakfast or light supper.

records.name: enfrijoladas
records.text: this is another recipe from ana maría flores sánchez.

records.name: 2bleu s pumpkin ginger crumble
records.text: why wait til the holidays? indulge! serve warm with ice cream or chilled with whipped cream. this is a little something bird created.

records.name: 2bleu s pumpkin ginger crumble
records.text: :) note: we love sam's idea of a cream cheese layer in there also, suggest 8 oz cream cheese whipped with 2 tbsp sugar, and put on before the pumpkin layer. :).

records.name: beer batter seasoned fries  potatoes   vegetables
records.text: long half-inch wide peeled potatoes or thin slices of cauliflower, across the grain, dipped in batter and fried in oil or oven. i like to use vegetables that have minimum water content, less spatter and batter holds while frying.

records.name: marie s italian sausage casserole  one pot meal
records.text: i was looking for something easy to make for sunday dinner and put together this casserole and let the oven do the work. the sausage was so juicy and really flavored the cabbage, potatoes and carrots beautifully.

records.name: lazy cabbage rolls   cowboy style
records.text: easy "all in one meal" that delivers real comfort food.

records.name: classic tomato sauce
records.text: i found this recipe on cooking. com. since finding recipezaar, this is my "go to" web site, so i'm posting here for safe keeping!  i haven't tried this recipe yet, but will soon.

records.name: classic tomato sauce
records.text: too many tomatoes and not enough time to can them all!    note **if you don't have fresh tomatoes use three 14-1/2 oz cans whole italian-style tomatoes. *** can also use oregano or parsley in place of basil.

records.name: classic tomato sauce
records.text: ****serving size is based on 2 tablespoons.

records.name: zippy chicken mushroom soup
records.text: this is a recipe i found in a taste of home magazine and modified slightly. it is so simple to make and so tasty!  try it, you won't be disappointed!.

records.name: patio ribs
records.text: 3 steps to great ribs with an asian flair from the best of bridge ladies. i baked these ribs in the oven for about 30 minutes at 375f and they turned out great.

records.name: patio ribs
records.text: also, i have made half of the recipe for 3 of us, serving the ribs with stuffed potatoes and salad. enjoy!.

records.name: strawberry fruit protein shake
records.text: i found this recipe on an ediets web site. you can substitute any fruit you like for the strawberries.

records.name: rosemary   merlot flank steak
records.text: wonderful taste, serve with roast potatoes and green beans. (30 minute marinating time not included in cook time) from cooking light.

records.name: mint marinade
records.text: a/k/a.

records.name: chicken ramen noodle salad
records.text: another quick cheap lunch or dinner from my college days.

records.name: mom s sweet potato casserole
records.text: this is a recipe that my husband's family has been making for years. they usually make it for christmas and thanksgiving. we sometimes will eat it as a nice vegetarian meal.

records.name: almond blueberry cobbler
records.text: i got a recipe from a friend for pear cobbler. it was really good. i decided to come up with my own recipe. the only thing that i kept the same was the sugar and flour measurments.

records.name: 1 000 artichoke hearts
records.text: by chef anthony fielding at poncho's wreck restaurant in wilmington, vermont.

records.name: herbed baked potatoes
records.text: my mom made these often instead of mashed potatoes. they are great for a buffet or brunch. the lefties are great the next morning used as home fries.

records.name: herbed baked potatoes
records.text: i have cooked them the night before, stored in refrigerator and reheated (brought to room temp) and put in oven with whatever is in there cooking!  they also reheat well in a microwave.

records.name: hearty corn  chile and potato soup
records.text: this is a great comfort food for those chilly evenings!.

records.name: salmon summer rolls with dipping sauce
records.text: a very fresh and delicious way to enjoy salmon, using rice paper for the wrapper. the ingredient list may look long, but it is mostly ingredients that you will have on hand.

records.name: salmon summer rolls with dipping sauce
records.text: if you have never used rice paper before, this is a great way to learn how to use them. if you are not particular about making an even 16 rolls, go ahead and play with the amounts to use more or less of what veggies you want.

records.name: salmon summer rolls with dipping sauce
records.text: the veggies add a delicious crunch and flavor to the rich salmon.

records.name: cauliflower and potato curry
records.text: i found this in the tri-city news back in 2005. it's vegetarian, easy and very delicious. it says it is a zero fat dish and it cost about $7 to make.

records.name: easy   caramel apple  dessert
records.text: this is so good and easy to make. i have given measurements, but it is to your taste. you can use more or less of any of the ingredients. the key direction is to refrigerate at least one hour.

records.name: easy   caramel apple  dessert
records.text: if you serve it right away the flavors will not have blended and will not taste as good.

records.name: salsa eggs
records.text: just a little something i came up with while bored of plain scrambled eggs. serves 2 or 3, but if you're really hungry it can serve one or can be doubled to serve more!.

records.name: mango yogurt smoothie
records.text: this comes from splenda. it makes a very good light smoothie.

records.name: creamy braised chicken
records.text: a smooth and delicate cream sauce gives special taste to these tender chicken breast accompanied by sweet pearl onions and sauted mushrooms. this dish is so rich tasting, you'll want to serve it to company.

records.name: cream of tomato   basil soup
records.text: this is a quick recipe that is great served with a green salad and french bread with garlic butter. excellent!  i add more garlic than the recipe calls for and it just gets better!.

records.name: hamburger stromboli
records.text: from connie griffin at the hope lodge here  at mayo. she's every inch the lady and i thank her. these can be made ahead and frozen. can you get any easier than that.

records.name: italian hamburger veggie soup like olive garden soup
records.text: this recipe was one i came up through trial and error after eating at olive garden last year on my birthday. we don't eat out much and we love homemade soups. i also don't personally care much for canned soup.

records.name: italian hamburger veggie soup like olive garden soup
records.text: i had been looking for a new soup to try and after i liked the soup at olive garden so much i decided to give this a try. i personally used a 50/50 mix of ground beef and venison burger for this but use what ever you like.

records.name: italian hamburger veggie soup like olive garden soup
records.text: i also like to make my own stocks but i found the progresso beef broth works very well for this when i am time crunched. i have done this on the stove top but it works great in the crock pot too.

records.name: italian hamburger veggie soup like olive garden soup
records.text: i grow and preserve my own veggies and freeze some soup ready mixed veggies but you can just as easily buy mixed veggies if you wish. canned works ok for stove top but turns to mush in the crock pot, use frozen for that.

records.name: italian hamburger veggie soup like olive garden soup
records.text: don't feel intimidated by the long list of ingredients, this throws together in about 15-20min and in the crock pot its almost no effort at all.

records.name: italian hamburger veggie soup like olive garden soup
records.text: we serve it with a fresh salad and breadsticks so its just like the resteraunt soup, salad, and breadsticks special. i buy frozen breadsticks that are just brown and serve.

records.name: super bowl nachos
records.text: my favorite team will probably not be in the superbowl but we'll enjoy these nachos none-the-less. the garnishes listed are just a suggestion, use your imagination! obviously, beer is the best beverage to go along with this treat!.

records.name: yogurt a go go c o   tasty dish
records.text: this is kinda like the yogurt parfaits sold at mcdonalds. mommy found this on kidshealth. org. you will need a clear plastic cup or glass serving dish to serve the yogurt.

records.name: shrimp with sun dried tomato basil sauce
records.text: adapted from a newspaper recipe. use any shape pasta you like.

records.name: asparagus pasta soup
records.text: this recipe was a happy accident. add salad and french bread to make a meal.

records.name: quick fajitas
records.text: i created this recipe to try and copy the first fajitas i ever had. i've never had any like these since. the ingredient amounts can be changed to suit your tastes.

records.name: quick fajitas
records.text: you don't have to use a cast iron skillet however the taste cannot be reproduced any other way. it comes from the reaction of the acidic tomatoes with the cast iron.

records.name: garlicky rice
records.text: great with chicken or fish. this recipe is from great chicken dishes by linda fraser. i love the lemony flavour.

records.name: egyptian salad
records.text: the name of this dish is egyptian salad, but i've seen this in moroccan restaurants, ethiopian restaurants, israeli restaurants. it's name should be more like north african salad.

records.name: apple slice with creamy topping
records.text: i didn't believe the recipe when my friend lesley gave it to me, but having tasted the slice, and loving it, i tried it and had sucess the first time i made it, eveyone loved it.

records.name: apple slice with creamy topping
records.text: the family call it my "stolen apple slice" it freezes very well!!  update jubes used a gluten free cake mix, and reports that it turned out very well. nice dessert for those people that cant tolerate gluten!.

records.name: easy cranberry mustard pork chops
records.text: a nice combination of flavors in a very easy recipe. prep time doesn't include marination.

records.name: artichoke potato gratin
records.text: a sophisticated twist on the classic gratin. serve this at your next dinner party to amaze your guests.

records.name: philadelphia dip
records.text: feel free to use regular, lite or ff sour cream or cream cheese with this recipe. serve with crackers or pita chips.

records.name: cranberry vodka delight
records.text: a smooth and delightfully lite drink.

records.name: nutty basmati pilaf
records.text: nutty, slightly sweet in flavor, this rice pilaf dish beautifully complements any indian meal. translated from "cocina tradicional india" by rafi fernandez.

records.name: secret sauce meatballs
records.text: try this crowd pleaser soon.

records.name: lemon sesame glazed greens
records.text: this recipe is adapted from alton brown's good eats. you may use spinach, mustard greens, kale, or greens of your choice.

records.name: full flavored steak
records.text: my husband is a steak man, and this is one of his very favorite ways to enjoy it. i have been making this for years, and i hope you enjoy it!.

records.name: baked penne with mushrooms  shrimp and broccoli
records.text: mixed up some of my favorite ingredients.

records.name: grilled pork with salsa
records.text: wonderful. prep time does not include marinating time.

records.name: sausages with potatoes and rosemary
records.text: a great all in one dish. just add a salad to complete the meal.

records.name: irish ice cream
records.text: uses bailey's irish cream. requires an ice cream maker.

records.name: mini savory clafouti
records.text: the batter for this tiny crustless quiches is so quickly and delicious you must try it.

records.name: gooey almond butter cake
records.text: this is a hand me down recipe. this was handed down from one of my friends mom. she would make this once a week.

records.name: spicy oatmeal raisin cookies
records.text: a co-worker brought these in to share for the holidays. they were delicious, soft and chewy. i asked her for the recipe, and here it is:.

records.name: edamame lo mein
records.text: recently, this is my favorite easy dinner. i like to make a large batch and eat the leftovers for lunch all week.

records.name: edamame lo mein
records.text: it's good hot or cold!  this is a mixture between a recipe i found in the local newspaper and one from alex jamieson's the great american detox diet. it can easily be adapted to whatever's in your veggie drawer.

records.name: cocoa berry shortcakes
records.text: the rich-tasting banana cream filling for this recipe would also make a tasty dip for a variety of fresh fruit. taken from the "quick, healthy and delicious cooking" cookbook by bh&g.

records.name: multigrain loaf  by the canadian living test kitchen
records.text: here is a great recipe for a multi-grain loaf that i would love to share with you. i have made this wonderful loaf over and over and it has turned out beautiful each time.

records.name: multigrain loaf  by the canadian living test kitchen
records.text: this loaf, with its lovely wheaty flavour, even crumb and rustic artisanal look, will make even novices into confirmed bread bakers.

records.name: multigrain loaf  by the canadian living test kitchen
records.text: you do have to begin the day before to mix the flour, water and yeast starter, but all three loaves – multigrain, whole wheat and white – are worth it. for all three, we used robin hood best for bread flours.

records.name: indian spiced shrimp wrap
records.text: from cooking light. per serving: 213 calories, 3. 3 g fat, 24. 1 g protein, 20. 3 g carb, 1. 1 g fiber, 162 mg cholesterol. marinate time 1-2 hours.

records.name: turkey pita sandwiches with brie  pecans and home
records.text: a perfect lunch with the fruity taste of the mayonnaise, the crunch of  the toasted pecans atop of brie smothered turkey, all tucked away in a pita. made for rsc#11.

records.name: turkey pita sandwiches with brie  pecans and home
records.text: i have altered all the amounts to better explain this recipe as well as make a smaller amount of mayonnaise.

records.name: low carb ricotta gnocchi
records.text: when i saw kathleen daelemans making these on her foodtv "cooking thin" show, i was pretty excited!  as anyone who has eaten a lower carb menu knows, we do miss our bread and pasta dishes.

records.name: low carb ricotta gnocchi
records.text: but here's a gnocchi that's much lower in carbs, lower in fat, but not low in taste!  prep time includes chilling.

records.name: diane style casserole
records.text: this recipe is used with beef casserole base #48835 (recipe posted). it's really delicious and once the beef base is done it is so quick and easy to prepare.

records.name: beef tongue   vegetables
records.text: i had a college roommate who prepared beef tongue the way her russian mother and grandmother prepared it before her. i never actually got her recipe, but i found this one out of an old cookbook years ago.

records.name: beef tongue   vegetables
records.text: this is the traditional method of preparing tongue. sliced leftover tongue makes excellent sandwiches. i toast the bread and slather on grainy mustard and a little horseradish.

records.name: salty and sweet walnuts
records.text: these walnuts are great to serve to you guests at a party. the combination of sweet and salty is a different taste from the regular spiced or sweet nuts. i think you will really go for these. make lots of these, cause you will need them.

records.name: salty and sweet walnuts
records.text: they go fast! note: these nuts will keep in an airtight container for up to 1 week, also, try to use only lard if you can for stir-frying the nuts, as it produces better results.

records.name: wake  me up martini
records.text: a very fresh and citrus-y beverage!.

records.name: rhubarb chicken
records.text: a traditional english dish.

records.name: kitchen kouture ranch pasta salad
records.text: this is the best pasta salad. it is so much better if you let it refrigerate overnight. lots of veggies, and very light dressing. perfect for gatherings.

records.name: simple crock pot chicken
records.text: i made this for my husband when he had to eat his food soft and not too spicy. he loved this! this is a good starting point recipe, so feel free to add vegetables if you like. you may also use any chicken part for this recipe.

records.name: mexican style chocolate bananas
records.text: prevention magazine.

records.name: crock pot spicy seven bean
records.text: this is a combination of a five star vegan recipe, my own, and a friends. i always use this recipe when i make seven bean soup, its a keeper!.

records.name: greek shrimp lasagna toss
records.text: a quick-to-fix week night delight. from good housekeeping with my changes.

records.name: spicy cuban chicken
records.text: i got this from a friend at church; i haven't made it yet, but she brought it to a potluck and it was so yummy i had to ask for the recipe. it is credited to the bean education & awareness network. prep time includes marinating time.

records.name: spicy cuban chicken
records.text: ****update**** i messed up the marinating once i finally made this and left out the garlic and red pepper in the marinade. instead i put the garlic in while sauteing the chicken and put in the red pepper with all the other spices.

records.name: spicy cuban chicken
records.text: this made it pretty spicy, but good!.

records.name: coco snowball cocktail
records.text: vanilla vodka, malibu rum, coco lopez and blue curacoa. ohhhhh my!  swiped from the wedding blog.

records.name: egg flower soup
records.text: another recipe from diana liu's cookbook i've used for 42 years. the chicken broth used here is 1 can ( 14 oz. ) chicken broth, 28 oz. water, 1/2" piece of fresh ginger and 1 green onion. remove ginger and green onion before pouring over eggs.

records.name: splenda creamy cheesecake
records.text: got this recipe off of the back of a splenda package.

records.name: breakfast burrito
records.text: i make this a lot in the morning before he leaves for work. it's easy and yummy!.

records.name: slow cooker stout   chicken stew
records.text: delicious stew from eating well magazine jan/feb 2012.

records.name: perfectly poached eggs
records.text: how to poach eggs--nice to know.

records.name: oriental sesame dressing
records.text: this is not a low fat dressing, but it tastes great. this was hit with everyone who tested it. i highly recommend this as a great salad dressing.

records.name: crab artichoke and spinach dip
records.text: this is a great dip! and it is always gone really quick!.

records.name: ham balls in  sauce
records.text: this is super easy and super yummy!  i always double the recipe and freeze one batch for later on. also, instead of buying the ham, pork & beef, my grocery store sells "ham loaf". i just use two pounds of that and skip the separate meats.

records.name: ham balls in  sauce
records.text: i throw everything into my kitchenaid mixer and let 'er rip (i don't even crush the crackers ahead of time). you can also skip the eggs and it will turn out just fine. i serve this with white rice and green beans.

records.name: ham balls in  sauce
records.text: it's my 5 year-old's favorite meal!.

records.name: mustard glazed fish
records.text: a recipe from ricardo that i made tonight. i made it with tilapia and it tastes great.

records.name: red curry chicken wings
records.text: easy crock pot game day recipe from better homes and gardens.

records.name: hot cheddar bean dip
records.text: i adopted this from the recipezaar account. a great bean dip that's a bit different from others. i sometimes add a little extra cheese or hot sauce. serving size is an estimate.

records.name: pumpkin roll  gluten free
records.text: warning: this is dangerously addicting!! :) the mix of cream cheese and pumpkin rolled up together is exquisite, indeed, and even better, it is now gluten free! actually, this was one of the easiest recipes for me to make a gluten free version of, and i actually truly prefer it to any other pumpkin roll! we've actually given this recipe to non-gluten-sensitive friends as they too agreed it was amazing! you can check out more gf recipes on my blog: www.

records.name: pumpkin roll  gluten free
records.text: glutenfreegirls. blogspot. com.

records.name: picante roast beef sandwich with garlic  lime  and green chile
records.text: this is a robin miller recipe and it's fantatic. i often add a little beef broth and let it simmer for a bit more aus ju. i have also subbed rotel for the diced tomatoes and green chilis with good results. you can't mess this up!.

records.name: two bean cassoulet
records.text: from bhg.

records.name: cheesy carrot casserole
records.text: this is so yummy. it's creamy and cheesy and you can hardly tell you're eating carrots.

records.text: this smells as good as it tastes! great served over pasta or rice, or scooped up with crusty bread. adapted from cooking light magazine(june 2004).

records.name: pecan crunch cookies
records.text: history in the baking again. i haven't tried these cookies but they sound good. i sure hope they take the calories out of their recipes up here. hehehe.

records.name: victory s deli  pickle wraps
records.text: very simple yet very tasty only 3  ingredients.

records.text: this milk shake is a refreshing treat but it also offers protein, calcuim, bvitamins, potassium, and a subtle does of peanut butter flavor. from family fun magazine.

records.name: papaya yogurt boats
records.text: light fruit salad, breakfast or dessert! perfect for hot summer days.

records.name: a different crock pot vegetable casserole
records.text: a friend gave me this recipe and it sounds really interesting. i have not tried it yet, but look forward to making it soon. i am posting it here so i won't lose it.

records.name: tomato cucumber salad  salad shirazi

records.name: tomato cucumber salad  salad shirazi
records.text: i haven't made this salad yet, but it seems like it would be a wonderful summer salad.

records.name: fresh figs with stilton and walnuts in a honey drizzle dressing

records.name: fresh figs with stilton and walnuts in a honey drizzle dressing
records.text: but please do wipe them first! serve these figs with crusty bread, some mixed herb and salad leaves. and a glass of chilled wine.

records.name: fresh figs with stilton and walnuts in a honey drizzle dressing
records.text: quantities for figs depend on the size; allow one or two large figs per person or, between three and six for medium to small figs. this makes a fabulous dinner party starter, or a light salad for lunch.

records.name: fresh figs with stilton and walnuts in a honey drizzle dressing

records.name: passover matzo stuffing

records.name: passover matzo stuffing
records.text: the result was delicious and tastes exactly like the original recipe.

records.name: margarita party
records.text: this recipe is delicious! my friend jen served these at her mexican themed pampered chef party the other night. i'm posting it here so i never lose it. it makes about a gallon. be sure to use diet sprite or they'll be too sweet.

records.name: margarita party
records.text: i will also add fresh lime slices or fresh lime juice to perk it up a bit.

records.name: perfect coconut macaroons
records.text: i got this from another website. i have made these for my oldest daughter and today i made them for my husband. they loved them. i have tried this recipe with the almond extract and also with the vanilla extract. your choice.

records.name: maple  walnut   flax pancakes

records.name: maple  walnut   flax pancakes
records.text: you can add some cinnamon to the batter, throw in some blueberries, mash in a banana, or substitute wheat germ or oats for the flax seed meal.

records.name: maple  walnut   flax pancakes
records.text: if you don't have buttermilk, you can use the yogurt & milk substitution, soymilk, or about a tablespoon of vinegar to regular milk and let it sit for 5 minutes and use that.

records.name: cucumbers
records.text: this  came  from  my  mother  an   is simple an  can   have  other  vegtables  added.

records.name: marmite chicken

records.name: marmite chicken
records.text: cooking time is approximate only. i am a bit of a slowpoke in the kitchen so others may dish this up much faster than me.

records.text: i made it a bit simpler by substituting cheddar for the fontina (not a really close substitution, i know, but i'm so much more likely to have it on hand, and it still tastes great!), replacing the fresh thyme with dried, and adding a french-fried onion topping instead of breadcrumbs, which adds a lovely flavor.

records.name: sweet   white potato gratin

records.text: by the way, as an italian, i am pleading with you not to use the canned powder masquerading as parmesan cheese!  the bagged, pre-shredded cheese i'll allow, however! :).

records.name: cakes with nuts from chile  torta de mil hojas

records.text: fresh peppery salad greens, lemon vinaigrette garnished with hazelnut parmesan crisps.

records.name: jarjeer  arugula  salad

records.text: another good stuffed pepper recipe.

records.name: very flavourful chinese honey chilli chicken

records.text: a great singapore style noodle my brother sent me. very easy and impresses my roommates without digging a hole in my budget. it's versatile as well.

records.name: hot chicken curry vermicelli
records.text: you can substitute chicken with tofu, shrimp (another favorite), beef, imitation crab, canned tuna, etc. plus, it's much healthier than cream-based pasta. enjoy!.

records.name: eggless mayonnaise
records.text: this a great mayo, it will keep 4 to 5 days in the refrigerator and can be doubled or tripled or cut in half.

records.name: honey roasted vidalia onions
records.text: the owner of the company i used to work at sent everyone a 5 lb box of vidalia onions every year. this was included on a recipe brochure one year from the farm. i was surprised at how much i liked them, and they are healthy too.

records.name: zucchini pomodoro

records.name: quick italian ground beef dinner
records.text: (note: although the noodles from the packaged mix could be added to the mixture without pre-boiling, but i find that they remain hard, it is better to cook them separately, then just add to mixture before serving. ).

records.name: cheese and herb bread
records.text: this is a great bread to serve with stews or casseroles. i always make it when i cook my jumbuck stew which i think is listed here under aussie jumbuck stew. my measurements are using the australian tablespoon.

records.text: this is a beginner's cook recipe sure to impress company.

records.text: a boneless chicken recipe that i really enjoy. quick to make. original recipe in the 1998 toh cookbook. i adjusted a bit to our tastes.

records.name: date nut zucchini spice bread
records.text: this is a delightful, moist, and flavourful treat. it doesn't feel or taste oily like most zucchini bread recipes. i created this recipe to use up those giant zucchinis. it is easily doubled and freezes well.

records.text: very moist, i played around and came up with this recipe. if you don't over mix it will be very tender and melt in your mouth.

records.text: this is a cake traditionally served on chinese new year. it doesn't appeal to everyone, but a lot of people like it.

records.name: gluten dairy free molasses cookies
records.text: i created this recipe for my little celiac toddler. i wanted him to be able to have all the flavors of the fall season and not miss out. this is a very yummy recipe with great texture! makes 3 dozen large cookies.

records.name: refreshingly cool almond tea
records.text: had this at a potluck and it was wonderful. i am not a tea drinker but this cold drink is great on a hot summer day. and it is easy to make! add the vodka to make it an adult drink.

records.name: refreshingly cool almond tea
records.text: note: take a 64 oz can of pineapple juice and freeze it in 1 c portions for quick preparation all summer.

records.name: ham and beans
records.text: this is a comfort food, stick to your ribs, cold night dinner! serve wwith hot buttered corn bread. enjoy!!!.

records.name: sour cream bread
records.text: this is an absolutely fabulous recipe. my whole family loves it. try it toasted with butter and jam. yummy!.

records.name: marinated goat cheese and walnuts meets  green beans
records.text: the marinade for the goat's cheese compliments the green beans and walnuts so well!  pick through the green beans for the little thin ones for this recipe. adapted from the good cooking cookbook by jill dupleix.

records.name: warm citrus fruit with brown sugar
records.text: really great breakfast dish. or for a snack. i think that it would even be appropriate as a dessert for a light meal. recipe was originally printed in better homes and gardens magazine.

records.name: magnolia bakery s vanilla birthday cake and frosting
records.text: these comments are from their cookbook:   "at magnolia we decided to make our cake not quite a traditional yellow cake or a traditional sponge cake, given the use of whole eggs in our recipe.

records.name: magnolia bakery s vanilla birthday cake and frosting
records.text: we're sure you'll agree this recipe is moist, delicious and makes a beautiful layer cake or cupcakes for birthdays or any celebration.

records.name: magnolia bakery s vanilla birthday cake and frosting
records.text: frost with pink buttercream icing and lots of colored sprinkles as we do, and feel as though you're at your seventh birthday party all over again!".

records.name: selection of spiced tea cookies
records.text: 4 in 1! with the same dough you'll prepare a 4 different cookies to offer to your guests!.

records.name: bill s focaccia bread
records.text: this is bill hingley's recipe which we love. original recipe located at http://www. upword. com/bread/billfoca. html. i recently bought a breadmaker. although i love to knead bread, i haven't had the time for, ohh. 10 or so years to do it regularly.

records.name: bill s focaccia bread
records.text: my two growing teens adore this focaccia bread recipe that i adapted from various sources.

records.name: cucumbers with easy dressing
records.text: my mom always made something similar using evaporated milk, but i almost like this more (sorry mom).

records.name: parmesan shrimp with basil dressing
records.text: shrimp can be prepared and refrigerated up to 24 hours before using. toss in cheese just before cooking. prepare dressing up to a few hour in advance. if possible , use freshly grated parmesan cheese. if basil is out of season, substitute parsley.

records.text: the dijon mustard adds the perfect taste. serve with baby potatoes.

records.name: oodles of noodles   peas and parmesan variation
records.text: these noodles are wonderful if you need a quick side dish. they use ingredients you may already have in your pantry making them a great last minute dinner addition. the recipe comes from canadian living's make it tonight.

records.name: cottage cheese veggie wrap
records.text: jillian michaels recipe.

records.name: lemongrass soup  vegetarian tom yum
records.text: i made this today and it turned out well. let it sit overnight in your refrigerator for the best flavor.

records.text: this is a livened up version of oven-fried chicken using ancho chili powder and cheddar cheese.

records.name: grandma s carrot cake
records.text: this is my grandmother's recipe. it's super moist and delicious. frost with your favorite cream cheese frosting.

records.name: spicy stir fried chicken with cashews
records.text: a quick chicken stir-fry from bhg. it does the trick when you are short on time.

records.name: dad s maple syrup
records.text: this is my dad's recipe. it lasts a long time in the refrigerator and has all the body of store-bought syrup. 1:1:1:1 proportions, so it's easy to memorize and you can make any amount you want!.

records.name: doctor bird cake
records.text: a wonderful tasty jamaican treat, posted compliments of a member of negril. com.

records.name: whippy whip cream
records.text: this is by far the one & only recipe that you shall not mess up whatsoever! you will need three simple items; 1. hand mixer, 2. heavy whipping cream, and 3. granulated sugar.

records.name: whippy whip cream
records.text: this whipped specialty is best with fresh strawberries, ice cream, hot chocolate, and so much more.

records.name: barbecued wings
records.text: when you want a crowd pleasing appetizer or a novel supper, wing it, but be sure to supply plenty of napkins for these finger lickin favorites.

records.name: polenta with green chiles and cheese
records.text: we love polenta, this is a delicious with green chiles and cheese. this can be made 1 day ahead and refrigerated. makes 4 main course servings or 8 side dish servings. i got this recipe off of the internet.

records.name: hot chocolate pudding
records.text: hot chocolate in pudding form. what could be better?.

records.name: fruit stuffed pork tenderloin
records.text: slightly sweet juicy pork that is great for company or for weekday dinner.

records.name: mansion on turtle creek mop sauce
records.text: when chef dean fearing was executive chef at the mansion on turtle creek in dallas, texas he showed this recipe on a local television show.

records.name: mansion on turtle creek mop sauce
records.text: this sauce can be used as a bbq mop sauce but the one he showed that i used was pan searing beef filets in this sauce just until desired doneness. i did make a couple of adjustments.

records.name: mansion on turtle creek mop sauce
records.text: the original recipes called for 1 cup malt vinegar which you will see i tweaked. also, instead of the thyme i used parsley and added grated garlic to taste. this is truly wonderful but you must use shiner bock beer.

records.name: mansion on turtle creek mop sauce
records.text: i thought i lost this recipe and it is no longer posted. just found it and putting it here for safe keeping.

records.name: super tender swiss steak
records.text: this makes in one pan. start on the stovetop and finish in the oven. so tender you can cut it with a fork. gravy is excellent over mashed potatoes or egg noodles.

records.name: super tender swiss steak
records.text: revision: thanks to 3 killerb's for pointing out some corrections that needed to be made to this recipe.

records.name: coconut cream mocha espresso
records.text: found this is the beverage section of the newspaper and thought it might be good to keep around.

records.name: corn cob syrup
records.text: from nebraska pioneer cookbook by kay graber, c. 1974. i haven't made this yet, but will this summer when i have the corn cobs.

records.name: garlic and cream mashed potatoes
records.text: this dish is a great time saver, since it can be prepared totally in advance and reheated just before the meal.

records.name: garlic and cream mashed potatoes
records.text: it's also great because you can play around with the seasonings to suit your family's taste ie: more garlic, or onion, or both! i also think the flavor of these potatoes tastes great using the low fat versions of cream cheese and sour cream.

records.name: garlic and cream mashed potatoes
records.text: however, when i make these for holiday meals such as thanksgiving or christmas, i sometimes use regular sour cream and cream cheese.

records.name: garlic and cream mashed potatoes
records.text: if i'm using chives for garnish, i like to mix in about 1/4 cup right into the cream cheese/sour cream mixture as i heat it.

records.name: canadian maple syrup pie
records.text: found this on the internet and it sounded really good!!.

records.name: grilled swiss cheese and chicken sandwiches
records.text: these are great for a quick lunch or a soup and sandwich night. kids love these as well as the grown ups. sourdough is another fantastic choice of bread to grill these on. you can interchange any type of cheese.

records.name: grilled swiss cheese and chicken sandwiches
records.text: please use the best ketchup you can find, i use heinz, as it will make all of the difference.

records.name: small tuna and broccoli crust less quiche
records.text: i threw this together for lunch today, i'm doing a low carb diet right now and thought a quiche would be a nice change from a salad type lunch.

records.name: small tuna and broccoli crust less quiche

records.name: yokohama style shumai dumpling

records.name: yokohama style shumai dumpling
records.text: so, it is no wonder shumai became very popular in yokohama and yokohama style shumai became famous thoughout japan. i've had my share of shumai since leaving yokohama and  i am generally not happy with most of the offerings outside of japan.

records.name: yokohama style shumai dumpling
records.text: the problem is the texture. most shumai filling is too hard - like biting into small hamburger - you can literally bounce filling off the wall hard after steamed. you can use round gyoza wrappers, pot sticker wrappers or square wonton wrappers.

records.name: yokohama style shumai dumpling
records.text: i prefer gyoza wrappers because japanese style wrappers are generally thinner, but if you cannot find it, please use either pot sticker or wonton wrappers. you will need about 35- 40 wrappers. there may be leftover - more below.

records.name: yokohama style shumai dumpling
records.text: if you do not have bay or sea scallops, use all shrimp along with ground pork. i like the taste and texture when it has some bay or sea scallops though.

records.name: yokohama style shumai dumpling
records.text: what i do with the leftover filling is form into small hamburgers and saute with a bit of oil. for each wrapper , use about 2 tsp filling. please see various photos of before and after.
