records.name: turkey  okra  and rice soup
records.text: in 'the berghoff cafe cookbook'.

records.name: jello waldorf salad
records.text: one of my all-time jello salads that my mom's made since the sixties.

records.name: peanut butter chocolate pretzel candy
records.text: my mother-in-law shared this recipe with me that she received from a church friend. this is easy and tasty.

records.name: bishop s cake
records.text: a moist poundcake from 1982 the silver palate cookbook.

records.name: cacciatore pizza
records.text: this is a yummy way to use up leftover chicken cacciatore!.

records.name: easy low fat crock pot spaghetti sauce
records.text: i came up with this recipe after looking through several recipes for an easy low-fat sauce. this can easily be frozen.

records.name: chicken  spinach   gnocchi soup
records.text: from the food network favorites cookbook. my friend maura, sent me this recipe after telling me it was so good, she had dreams about it!  didn't want to lose it.

records.name: new orleans corn   shrimp soup
records.text: frank davis is a resident cook in new orleans as well as hosting his own cooking show. this is his recipe that i have adapted to my preferences. it is wonderful as an appetizer or a superb main course on a cold rainy day.

records.name: leek stewpot with sausages  swiss papet vaudois
records.text: this very basic recipe is from the french part of switzerland. this is one of the simpler variations (there are many). some include cream and cheese, but this one does not.

records.name: leek stewpot with sausages  swiss papet vaudois
records.text: i tried to use ingredients which are easily available, giving the more traditional ones in brackets.

records.name: leek stewpot with sausages  swiss papet vaudois
records.text: the only problem is that you might find it hard to obtain the real vaudoise-type sausages! use any good, fat, continental-type pork sausage you like.

records.name: sugar and cinnamon spiced pecans
records.text: i love this recipe. it is such a hit, especially around the holidays. this is one of those recipes that can be made and given for an edible gift. hope you enjoy!.

records.name: arabian gulf shortbread cookies  ghiraybah
records.text: very nice little middle eastern shortbread cookies. i like to give these as gifts or make them for tea time. i also make them often for my fil's diwaniya (men's gathering) to enjoy with their arabic coffee or tea.

records.name: arabian gulf shortbread cookies  ghiraybah
records.text: recipe from the complete middle east cookbook by tess mallos.

records.name: noah s ark
records.text: try this blue concoction!!.

records.name: time for thai grilled fish with chili lime sauce
records.text: this was in my clipping stash which i am trying to clean out. salmon is not traditional thai but with the typical thai seasonings, it should fit right in. the sauce is optional but sounds delicious.

records.name: time for thai grilled fish with chili lime sauce
records.text: i am always looking for fish recipes as we try to incorporate 2 to 3 servings a week.

records.name: mrs  field s cheesecake brownie cups
records.text: these delicious cheesecake filled brownie cupcakes are courtesy of copykat recipes.

records.name: meat   veggie sloppy joes oamc
records.text: i make a batch up every week to keep my son's "hollow leg" filled. i like that its cheap, filling and he gets his veggies in!  also great for group get-together - it can be kept warm in a crockpot until serving.

records.name: spicy honey mustard baby back ribs
records.text: this recipe uses a classic cantonese dipping sauce as its base. the ribs make a wonderful appetizer or can be served as an entree with french fries and coleslaw.

records.name: chunky white chocolate scones
records.text: meltingly delicious. try adding some grated lime zest into the dough with the white chocolate--the tropical taste will make you think.

records.name: black and white chile
records.text: it sounds like a lot of work, but it's realy not, just take it one step at a time. it's worth the wait.

records.name: highlanders
records.text: a lovely shortbread recipe, simple to make and the sugar coating makes these extra special.

records.name: margaret atwood s baked lemon custard cake
records.text: this is a really neat recipe because, as the batter bakes, it separates into two distinctive layers — cake on top and custard on the bottom.

records.name: margaret atwood s baked lemon custard cake
records.text: it looks very impressive, guests will have no idea how simple it is to prepare!  this custard/cake has a very bold lemony flavour. (it also works well with splenda so can be modified for diabetics.

records.name: margaret atwood s baked lemon custard cake
records.text: )  if you don't have individual ramekins, this can be made in a deep pie pan or an 8x8 baking pan. margaret atwood is an iconic canadian author and the recipe was published in bon appétit (jan. 2006).

records.name: chicken fricasse with rice
records.text: chicken fricasse is a creamy chicken and mushroom dish served best with rice, though you can servce it with pasta also, on its own as a side or as a pie filling. it reminds me of the taste of chicken and mushroom pukka pie filling.

records.name: chicken fricasse with rice
records.text: a guaranteed win the whole family will love. serves 3-4.

records.name: grilled lemongrass pork skewers
records.text: a great appetizer or main course. from the homemade simple website, submitted for zwt 9. prep time does not include  30 minutes to marinate. cooking time is approximate.

records.name: banana oatmeal waffles
records.text: from a cookbook called rise & dine canada, recipes from b&b's across canada.

records.name: pollo en salsa de mani
records.text: a peruvian/ecuadorian dish given to me by a dear friend. wonderful!!.

records.name: magnificent meatballs
records.text: good size meatballs wrapped in crisp bacon with a distinctive sour cream and tomato sauce.

records.name: finest hour cookies
records.text: cookie making is an art, and i am not only an artist, but a perfectionist. after many tweaks to this recipe, i've decided that it's as good as it possibly can become.

records.name: basil olives
records.text: if you do not have fresh basil available, pesto will work in a pinch. add a heaping tablespoon to the olives and taste. add more as needed. i like to use a mixture of half black and half green olives.

records.name: maple berry pudding cake
records.text: i played with a king arthur flour recipe and got this tasty delight. yum!.

records.name: twice baked jumbo mini cheesecakes
records.text: this is an easy recipe that is perfect for potlucks, picnics, brunch, and larger dinner parties. compared with many other recipes for mini cheesecakes, these ones are bigger (hence "jumbo mini") and twice-baked.

records.name: twice baked jumbo mini cheesecakes
records.text: try experimenting with different toppings! three options included in this recipe are strawberries, maple bacon and dark chocolate. the cheesecakes are best served chilled.

records.name: white chicken chili  no red ingredients
records.text: i scoured recipezaar to find the best ingredients/quantities to make a white chili without red ingredients (no beef, chili powder, tomato products) and came up with a winner.

records.name: white chicken chili  no red ingredients
records.text: i delivered this to a friend who recently had a baby and her husband declared it one of the best meals he's ever had!  my husband also loved it but requested an extra teaspoon of cumin next time--you be the judge.

records.name: sweet vanilla soymilk
records.text: this is what i created for when i don't have ready-made storebought vanilla soymilk. it is so easy to mix up and just keep a bottle handy in the fridge for chai tea, pouring on cereal, etc. i also use this in my muesli recipes here on zaar.

records.name: glitter s shrimp scampi
records.text: this is my favorite along with my family. it's fast and easy and elegant. if you like more sauce, you can melt some and pour it over before you serve it. if you have more people just add more shrimps. it goes a long way as dinner or appetizer.

records.name: peanut buttery peanut butter fudge
records.text: this recipe is from a wonderful friend i used to work with. my father-in-law always requested this fudge and kept it all to himself!.

records.name: broccoli  cheese   rice casserole
records.text: this isn't the typical back-of-the-can recipe. no gooey condensed soup, no lifeless frozen broccoli, no sit-on-your-shelf-forever "cheese product". this is an irresistible casserole. delicious for a weeknight supper or worthy of a dinner party.

records.name: broccoli  cheese   rice casserole
records.text: it is wonderful served along with most anything. chicken, ham, beef, pork chops, whatever!.

records.name: turkey cutlets with citrus sauce and capers
records.text: delicious recipe for sauteed turkey cutlets with a zesty sauce of lemon, lime and capers.

records.name: chicken   chorizo skewers
records.text: this is from taste. com. au, i love chorizo so this is one for a bbq soon!.

records.name: mcdonald family meatloaf
records.text: as it seems like eveyone's else's recipie is, this recipe was passed down through my mom. i like to use a combination of lean and not-so-lean ground beef for this recipe. personally, i use a 2:1 ratio of 90% lean and 80% lean ground beef.

records.name: mcdonald family meatloaf
records.text: i suppose some may prefer to include mushrooms in the meatloaf, but that has never suited me. although it's a lot messier, mixing the recipe with your hands provides an even consistency.

records.name: mcdonald family meatloaf
records.text: i always serve this meatloaf with my version of beef succotash.

records.name: t g i  friday s jack daniels grill salmon
records.text: from "top secret recipes, lite!" this is supposed to be 12 points per serving, but i think it's actually less than that.

records.name: mom s chili beans  meatless
records.text: dad was never a big meat eater, so mom had to rearrange the recipe to his tastes. make some cornbread, cover it with the chili, top it off with shredded cheddar cheese and sour cream to present a great dish!.

records.name: black cherry cider
records.text: you can use cherry juice alone for this drink, but the apple cider gives the drink body and depth. keep the spicing light and simple, so that the cherry flavor isn't overpowered. from the book, "drinks to warm a body & soul".

records.name: hawaiian kabobs
records.text: the delicious combination of flavors & the grilled pineapple really makes this come together.

records.name: hawaiian kabobs
records.text: i have posted the original recipe, which is meatless, but have added chicken with great results (just be sure to marinade separately from veggies and discard chicken marinade).

records.name: hawaiian kabobs
records.text: this is great for summer bbqs and camping!  prep time includes bare-minimum marinating time.

records.name: banana couscous
records.text: my son poured agave syrup on this and ate with abandonment.

records.name: star fruit  carambola  chutney
records.text: this has a wonderful tang. it is and eyeopener on toast. on chicken, fish or pork you get a meal in a moment. great on rice, too.

records.name: swordfish steaks with spicy marinade
records.text: thought this sounded interesting. recipe source: local newspaper.

records.name: creamy shrimp pasta salad
records.text: yummy and well suited for summer entertaining. the colors make the dish pretty, but it's healthy and filling, too. made with fat-free mayo, you can't go wrong.

records.name: vegetable scone
records.text: i went to a restaurant in town and they had these scones and i searched for them on this website and liked one, but i changed a few things. i hope you enjoy them!.

records.name: vidalia onion sweet tart
records.text: courtesy of our local paper, this recipe won a main-dish category and was also an overall winner at the vidalia onion festival cook-off a few years back. from a woman named shirley poole who says it is also delicious served cold.

records.name: rosemary infused sweet shortbread
records.text: this very unusual, but super yummy recipe was the first one my mum, my sis and i made after several years of not making christmas cookies together.

records.name: rosemary infused sweet shortbread
records.text: we all were a little sceptical at first due to the combination of sweet and savoury flavours, but the end result convinced us all! what a great, easy and very, very yummy cookie recipe! the original comes from the cookie spread 2009 of a leading german women's mag, called "brigitte".

records.name: rosemary infused sweet shortbread
records.text: i hope youll enjoy it as much as we did!.

records.name: oven chipped potatoes
records.text: posted for zaar 2005 world tour. this comes from a cookbook of countries along the danube. the recipe is from germany. i have not tried this recipe yet. update:  just tried this the other night.

records.name: oven chipped potatoes
records.text: the potatoes have a really nice texture!  i could see adding garlic or more onion if you want. i recommend sprinkling the salt more evenly over the potatoes instead of combining it with the butter, but otherwise it's very tasty!.

records.name: potato pure with hazelnut oil
records.text: adapted from a recipe i found in the august/september 2008 issue of 'dish'. to make this recipe vegetarian, simply use vegetable stock in place of chicken stock.

records.name: potato pure with hazelnut oil
records.text: if you don't have a recipe for vegetable stock and would like to make some which basically uses all your vegetable peelings, you might like to try my vegetable stock #135453.

records.name: mexican style meat and vegetable stew   azteca s molcajete
records.text: here's my take on azteca restaurant's molcajete stew. delicious!  don't let the long ingredient list bother you. although there are a lot of them, this recipe is actually quite easy to put together. quick and easy!.

records.name: spaghetti primavera  adopted
records.text: adopted from zaar feb 2005. all comments below are from the original chef. i will update when i have prepared this recipe myself. leah.

records.name: spanaki psimeno
records.text: this recipe is greek in origin and was originally posted for zaar world tour 2005.

records.name: spanaki psimeno
records.text: and inspired by summerwine's fabulous photograph, i've finally got round to making it! i must admit that when posting i didn't realise just how much spinach this recipe uses; we're talking serious popeye territory.

records.name: spanaki psimeno
records.text: i found i hadn't bought enough spinach and had to supplement fresh with frozen. but it worked fine. summerwine's comment below about salt is absolutely spot on. i made this without salt and have updated the recipe to delete this ingredient.

records.name: spanaki psimeno
records.text: the recipe was 'borrowed' from recipes4us. co. uk.

records.name: hajar s chewy melty caramels
records.text: these are the best caramels i could come up with after a lot of trial and error. i wanted something chewy but not an everlasting gobstopper! i wanted chewy with a melting quality and i finally got it.

records.name: hajar s chewy melty caramels
records.text: not an everyday thing for the calorie conscious but a yummmmy treat every now and then. your yield will depend on how you cut them. i get approx. 45. big or small you will love them!.

records.name: cashew cream regular and thick
records.text: cashew cream stands in for dairy in a variety of ways. in the raw food world, it is used for lots of desserts. when you cook with it, it can be so much more-from cheese filling in ravioli to heavy cream in soups.

records.name: cashew cream regular and thick
records.text: it can be stored 2-3 days in the fridge  and can be frozen for up to 6 months(although when defrosted  it can be a little lumpy, so pulse in blender a few times to smooth it out before using it). the trick is to use raw cashews.

records.name: cashew cream regular and thick
records.text: they have no flavor of their own, they are just a vessel for fat and creaminess. because it has a nice fat content, cashew cream reduces in a pan even faster than heavy cream. cashews need to soak overnight, so don't skip this step.

records.name: cashew cream regular and thick
records.text: this is from the conscious cook by tal ronnen. chef tal was a former meat eater that  now applies traditional french culinary techniques to meatless cuisine. he shows that avoiding meat and dairy does not mean sacrificing taste or satisfaction.

records.name: cashew cream regular and thick
records.text: enjoy!.

records.name: yogurt lemon nut cake
records.text: from an old copy of southern living.

records.name: marbled chocolate cheesecake low carb
records.text: i got this recipe in my email. it looks great for all the low carb diets.

records.name: red tulip masterfully crafted by    tasty
records.text: a --tasty-- invention! read important note below in the directions.

records.name: cream of fresh cauliflower soup
records.text: ordinary base that can be used with many types of vegetables for creamy, wonderful soups. my husband's favorite is the potato soup.

records.name: algerian  beef
records.text: highly seasoned beef pairs with kidney beans and hominy in this latin-inspired dish. hominy is corn that has been soaked in lime or lye. the result is a versatile grain with a chewy texture and a very light, smoky-sour flavor.

records.name: cheese and onion muffins
records.text: great for lunch.

records.name: chive and garlic mashed potatoes
records.text: this is a recipe from tyler florence. we made these tonight and thought they were fantastic, so i couldn't wait to share them! they were the fluffiest, most flavorful potatoes we have ever had.

records.name: crme de menthe bars
records.text: delicious 3 layer bars perfect for the holidays.

records.name: stuffed cabbage stew
records.text: had something like this once. had lots of left over things on hand just had to try it. if there are any leftovers this heats well in the microwave.

records.name: way too easy warm peanut butter   chocolate dip spread
records.text: this was a pregnancy-induced creation during one of my hormonal late night snacking periods. i was craving a peanut buttery and chocolate dip for sliced bananas and came up with this. it's very creamy and delicious.

records.name: way too easy warm peanut butter   chocolate dip spread
records.text: serve warm and dip your favorite accompaniments to your hearts delight, or cool and serve as a cracker spread. it's yummy either way!.

records.name: crock pot turkey for sandwiches
records.text: this is great for potlucks or parties, or just to use up leftover turkey.

records.name: cinnamon onion butter
records.text: this is how we do butter in texas! you just can’t have too much onion, and the cinnamon works with that sweet onion flavor so well. i created this for my website, smoked 'n grilled.

records.name: fennel lemon salad
records.text: yummy! this is especially good on really hot summer days.

records.name: danish gin fizz
records.text: from the 1001 cocktails website, this cocktail includes lime juice and mixer added to gin, brandy and cherry heering, a danish liqueur with a dark cherry taste.

records.name: oven barbecued hot dogs
records.text: kid pleaser!.

records.name: orange almond chicken breast
records.text: this is one of my quick & easy chicken recipes, which i usually serve over brown rice.

records.name: cranberry pineapple minis
records.text: from the december/january 2009 hallmark magazine.

records.name: perfect easy microwave applesauce
records.text: this applesauce freezes wonderful!.

records.name: cinnamon rolls with lemon cream cheese icing puc
records.text: i have a resturant that serves coffees and pastries, the cinnamon rolls we were serving were good, but not exceptional. i have been working on making a cinnamon roll that would keep customers coming back for more. this is it. give it a try.

records.name: lasagna in a skillet   in about 30 minutes
records.text: what i love about this recipe, is that it's possible to have lasagna within approx. 30 minutes and only have one pan to wash! it's an easy weeknight recipe to prepare. comfort food with ease. :)  this is an adaption from cook's illustrated.

records.name: lasagna in a skillet   in about 30 minutes
records.text: *note: i use preshredded cheeses for quick prep. the 30 minute time is what the original recipe states, and the time it takes me to prepare - however, the time is an approximation and may take a bit longer. enjoy!.

records.name: pick and mix salad
records.text: this is from jamie oliver's ministry of food cookbook. i love the idea behind it, so i thought i would share it with you.

records.name: pick and mix salad
records.text: the idea is simple, you choose 1 ingredient from each section, and build your salad from the ground up, to suit your tastes!  you then dress it with a salad dressing of your choice.

records.name: pick and mix salad
records.text: use the measurements included as a guide only (i haven't added measurements for each ingredient, just an example in each category), as that is all up too you also!  there are no rules, just choose your 6 ingredients, and build your own great salad!.

records.name: no fat fruit treat
records.text: i make this for my sister who's on weight watchers. she uses this for her fruit and milk. it's not fat free but 1. 75 grams and 177 calories for one serving.

records.name: marie s italian lasagna
records.text: the very best lasagna you could ever ask for.

records.name: easy cinnamon sugar cookies
records.text: i like this recipe because it only has a few ingredients and is very easy to make. prep time does not include optional 1 hour of refrigeration. i hope you enjoy!!!!.

records.name: peaches and cream dessert casserole
records.text: in 'the best casserole cookbook ever' by beatrice ojakangas.

records.name: western skinny scramble  low fat
records.text: this recipe starts out with egg whites that are cooked in the microwave then cooked in a skillet with canadian bacon, onion and bell pepper and topped off with some cheddar cheese.

records.name: western skinny scramble  low fat
records.text: from the most decadent diet ever cookbook by devin alexander, author of the biggest loser cookbook.

records.name: carrot pecan cookies
records.text: these drop-style cookies have a cakey texture and are not overly sweet; once topped with an easy-to-make pineapple glaze, they are just right! this recipe was created for the ready set cook #10 contest.

records.name: disappearing pear honey
records.text: i looked at all of the recipes i could find and smashed them all together in this one. i am very pleased with the results. the honey stands out nicely with the fruit flavors.

records.name: lucky 13 party dip
records.text: a southwest favorite, with a secret 'punch'! serves a large crowd, but you can cut it down for your own needs.

records.name: filet mignons with balsamic pan sauce and truffle oil
records.text: dh and i made this recipe for lunch today and thought it was good for a fast and easy to prepare meal. it is from my williams-sonoma "steak and chops" cookbook. instead of cooking the steak in a pan as posted, we grilled ours.

records.name: filet mignons with balsamic pan sauce and truffle oil
records.text: dh usually adds a small bit of steak fat to the pan he's cooking the sauce in to give it flavor. we used white truffle oil, as the recipe does not specify white or black.

records.name: curried red lentil sweet potato soup
records.text: this is a tasty, healthy, and kid-friendly soup that is easy to make. it was inspired by "vegetarian pleasures" by jeanne lemlin. see bottom of the directions for ways to improve on the kid-friendliness of this recipe.

records.name: flatbread with caramelized onions   cheese
records.text: this is a very versatile dish from bonnie stern who has owned a cooking school in toronto canada for over 30 years. it can be served at a cocktail party, as an appetizer or as a main course with a side salad.

records.name: flatbread with caramelized onions   cheese
records.text: my dh & i have been known to devour the whole thing, with a few glasses of wine, on a saturday night!!.

records.name: hearty oven stew
records.text: ah yes, here we go with yet another stew recipe!! don't recall where i got this recipe, but have been making it for years. it is so darn simple to make and tastes mmmmmm good.

records.name: hearty oven stew
records.text: the original called for pillsbury flaky biscuits that could be added to the top of the stew but i prefer it without. i much prefer to have homemade buttered tea biscuits with this meal.

records.name: hearty oven stew
records.text: however, i have added the instructions for the biscuits just in case you might like to try it that way. hope you like this stew as much as my hubby & i do.

records.name: sylvia s garlic toast
records.text: great for chilli or pasta meals.

records.name: sourdough chicken pesto panini
records.text: i got a new grill pan for the stove and was just trying some things out and this turned out great. i actually grilled the chicken up the night before and then stored it in the fridge until the next afternoon.

records.name: sourdough chicken pesto panini
records.text: that way too, it gave me time to let the grill pan cool so i could clean it for the pressing of the sandwich.

records.name: sourdough chicken pesto panini
records.text: if you are using a grill pan you will need something heavy to place on top to press it, i used a pot that i just placed a heavy bottle of water into for the weight(okay it looked a bit strange.

records.name: sourdough chicken pesto panini
records.text: so if you have a panini press go right ahead and use it!, if not this does work!)also this recipe is for one sandwich, but of course you can double or triple it to meet your needs.

records.name: sourdough chicken pesto panini
records.text: you can make your own pesto, but to save time i used store bought.

records.name: chip cake delicious
records.text: it's all in the title. what more can be said?! :).

records.name: cockaleekie bake
records.text: this is a nice warming meal on it's own. i wanted to use leeks that were in season and a good price. and of course leeks have a nice delicate taste.

records.name: cockaleekie bake
records.text: i used mostly the white part of the leek and saved the dark green for soup so nothing went to waste. if you choose you can make the sauce with half milk and half stock.

records.name: roasted red pepper rice salad
records.text: from june 07 ladies home journal - made to go with recipe #243622.

records.name: baked scallops with lime
records.text: from runners world magazine. the original recipe called for 1/2 cup of white wine but i like it with a little less.

records.name: antipasto salad
records.text: quick and simple, this is one of those back of the package recipes. kraft.

records.name: martha lindley s chicken pie
records.text: this recipe is a favorite in our church where mrs. lindley was a member years ago. this is the recipe our umw group uses when we make dinner for the local ruritan club as a fundraiser.

records.name: martha lindley s chicken pie
records.text: the original recipe is without vegetables, but my husband and i prefer it with some vegetables added. you can cook the chicken in any way you prefer, but i use the method in recipe #18832 , shir-will chicken delight. (thanks uncle bill!).

records.name: martha lindley s chicken pie
records.text: preparation time does not include cooking of chicken.

records.name: gnocchi burro e salvia
records.text: i am italian and i live in milano with my us husband and our 2 daughters;. this is one of our every week recipe. enjoy it!!!!.

records.name: saturday morning pancakes
records.text: our family has pancakes every saturday morning and this is the recipe that i've been using for years. my son likes it so much, he doesn't even use syrup. the rest of my family only uses real maple syrup.

records.name: vietnamese banh mi sandwich with grilled beef
records.text: the vietnamese sandwich is a wonderful combination of flavors and textures.

records.name: vietnamese banh mi sandwich with grilled beef
records.text: this version is made with very thinly sliced grilled beef with a charred and carmelized meat flavor, a layer of crunchy sweet and sour pickled carrots and daikon (recipe posted separately), a layer of soft and sweet shallots and fresh and crispy lettuce and cilantro.

records.name: vietnamese banh mi sandwich with grilled beef
records.text: the recipe is from the steamy kitchen cookbook by jaden hair. tip:  slice the beef very thinly before the meat has completely thawed, or ask the butcher to slice it thinly when you purchase it.

records.name: vietnamese banh mi sandwich with grilled beef
records.text: if you have a package of the thinly sliced beef for cheese steaks, that will work too (as long as it isn't pre-seasoned).

records.name: tequila pork roast
records.text: a perky treat for your dinner guests.

records.name: zucchini and yellow squash tian
records.text: i saw emeril do this on tv and it looked so pretty, then we tried it and it tasted as good as it looks. wonderful taste, easy dish, great with a plain meat like grilled steak or chicken.

records.name: jennie s spinach salad dressing
records.text: created by my niece, jennie, this sweet and sour dressing goes well with many different types of salads. adjust sugar to your taste, as some people prefer a less-sweet dressing. also good on fruit and lettuce salads.

records.name: stir fried zucchini and beef
records.text: my version of a recipe from a book titled quick & easy korean cooking for everyone, via recipesource. com. the recipe originally called for cucumbers instead of zucchini; somehow i bought the zucchinis instead (i know, i know.

records.name: stir fried zucchini and beef
records.text: ) and i loved the end result, so here it is! the directions are a little vague, but i am a beginner cook and managed just fine. enjoy over rice, with sriracha.

records.name: fresh cranberry citrus relish
records.text: this no cook relish is a tart and refreshing relish. good with turkey, it provides an especially effective counterpoint to heavier birds such as goose and duck. stored, covered, in the refrigerator, the relish keeps for at least a week.

records.name: fresh cranberry citrus relish
records.text: use it as an intriguing spread on turkey sandwiches.

records.name: home style scalloped potatoes
records.text: nothing fancy here - just good, old fashioned and delicious scalloped potatoes.

records.name: ann s easy almond slide
records.text: this is an original drink that i created. the amounts given work for me but if you enjoy a stronger drink feel free to use more of each liqueur. the drink is so named because it slides down real easy. warning, it's sweet.

records.name: gluten free chocolate chip peanut butter cookies

records.name: amish market oatmeal oamc
records.text: amish market, a specialty grocery store, is a new york city institution. it is an urban foodie haven with an eclectic variety of hard to find ingredients as well as a dizzying array of prepared foods made from the freshest ingredients.

records.name: amish market oatmeal oamc
records.text: a mainstay of their breakfast offering is their creamy and delicious oatmeal which sits in large pots over a water bath and enjoys a cult-like following.

records.name: amish market oatmeal oamc
records.text: cooked long and slow, their oatmeal is a steaming, hot cup of comfort warming your soul on cold and snowy mornings in the city. i came up with this version after a serious weekend craving for amish market oatmeal.

records.name: amish market oatmeal oamc
records.text: the secret is the whole cinnamon stick that infuses the whole pot while it is cooking. my daughter, an oatmeal purist and aficionado as well, happily approved of this, and began requesting it during the week for breakfast.

records.name: amish market oatmeal oamc
records.text: none of us likes instant oatmeal, so i tried freezing it and it reheated nicely. now we can have slow cooked oatmeal on busy mornings when standing over a stove isn't feasible.

records.name: amish market oatmeal oamc

records.name: amish market oatmeal oamc

records.name: kohl cannon or colcannon

records.name: kohl cannon or colcannon
records.text: in it would be buried, well wrapped in waxed paper or foil for today's world, 4 favors. a penny (for wealth), a button (for poverty), a ring (for marriage, and a matchstick (for spinsterhood).

records.name: kohl cannon or colcannon

records.name: lavender mint tea  single serving
records.text: due to popular demand, the proportions of mint and lavender have been altered to make this lovely tea even lovelier. :).

records.name: starry night taco cups
records.text: these mexican-style snacks will surely add sparkle to a slumber party spread! to make them, line muffin cups with tortilla shells, then filled each with a not-too-spicy beef mixture kids can garnish with cheese, lettuce and other toppings.

records.name: starry night taco cups
records.text: for tasty dippers besides, you could serve the cutout stars with salsa.

records.name: easy honey french dressing
records.text: sweet and tangy and much better than store bought. once you make this, you'll be experimenting with alot of other homemade dressings. most are surprisingly easy.

records.name: small batch fresh strawberry jam
records.text: this is a quickly prepared jam that calls for smaller amounts of fruit and sugar. cooking it in a wide pan speeds up the gelling process so no pectin is needed. the jam has a soft set, a bright color and a full fruit flavor.

records.name: small batch fresh strawberry jam
records.text: perfect for spooning over toast but it may not be stiff enough for a peanut butter sandwich. this came from a newspaper article. this uses only 3 cups of sliced strawberries which is about 1 1/2 pints or 4 cups of whole berries.

records.name: moist cornbread muffins
records.text: we don't like cornbread per se, so i was looking around and found these today (12/19/06). i made them. oh my gosh!! moist isn't the word! the batter is very liquidy. they are almost like a spoon pudding.

records.name: praline crunch bars
records.text: take a basic cookie dough and give it a tasty twist. with little effort, you come up with a delicious dessert sure to please.

records.name: thai beef  crock pot
records.text: delicious and full of flavor. from better homes and gardens 5-ingredient slow-cooker recipes 2004.

records.name: cantaloupe  berry and pineapple smoothie
records.text: although i tweaked the recipe below, the original was found in the 2003 cookbook, slim smoothies.

records.name: sweet potatoes with marshmallow creme sauce
records.text: these creamy sweet potatoes are topped with an incredible marshmallow sauce. recipe courtesy of louisiana sweet potato commission.

records.name: jody s lentil salad
records.text: my friend's mom, jody, had some leftover lentil salad in her refrigerator when i was spending a weekend there. i had some for lunch, and after that, i kept sneaking a spoonful every time i was in the kitchen. when i left i asked for the recipe.

records.name: jody s lentil salad
records.text: here it is!  it's very forgiving -- don't worry if you don't have the exact right amount of everything. it can be served hot or cold. perfect to bring to a potluck or a picnic, or just to keep around as a side dish.

records.name: healthy mango lassi
records.text: this delicious lassi is a healthy alternative to ice cream drinks or soda.

records.name: hot mustard dip
records.text: a delicious dip to serve with pretzels or ham.

records.name: pork chops with sweet curried onion
records.text: this is a quick weeknight entree that is simple and tasty. i usually up the jam to 4 tablespoons. from bon appetit.

records.name: family favorite potato salad   german kartoffelsalat
records.text: this is my version of both my mother's and german grandmother's potato salad. a family favorite that is a requirement at all gatherings! i hope you enjoy.

records.name: sweet and spicy pumpkin seeds
records.text: it is like candy pumpkin seeds.

records.name: spanish halibut
records.text: this colorful dish is lovely for entertaining. you can present the fish on a large warm platter and let people take what they like. serve with rice pilaf, tossed salad, and a pitcher of sangria.

records.name: cheese and onion flan
records.text: this recipe comes from england. it goes very well with baked potatoes and a salad.

records.name: vegan hot cocoa   no dairy or soy
records.text: posted in response to a request for non dairy/soy hot cocoa. hope it helps!.

records.name: potato casserole with caramelized onions
records.text: this "southern living" recipe is great served with roasted chicken or baked pork chops.

records.name: maple nut coffee twist
records.text: this recipe is from pillsbury family kitchens cookbook. this is really delicous and makes a nice presentation. the dough is really easy to work with. i did need to add a couple more tbsps of flour to the dough.

records.name: maple nut coffee twist
records.text: this calls for a 12-inch pizza pan, but i'm sure a large cookie sheet would work just fine. :).

records.name: black bean corn salad
records.text: it is healthy and you can use it as a side dish or a dip with torilla chips.

records.name: diane s corn pudding
records.text: when my bil retired from the uscg, my sister threw a big party to celebrate. their neighbor diane brought a large casserole of this corn pudding over to share. it was so good, not a bit was left.

records.name: diane s corn pudding
records.text: diane gave my sister the recipe and she passed it along to me!  (diane made it w/ fresh corn!)  this is the exact recipe i recieved; however, i reduce the amt of sugar called for as i find fresh corn pretty sweet.

records.name: hg cranberry sauce
records.text: from hungry girl. saved here for safekeeping. this looks so yummy. note prep time doesn't include chill time.

records.name: italian cannelloni
records.text: i'v had this recipe for 20 years. it was given to me by my brother in laws mother (italian). i have on occassion substitued the ground beef and pork for ground chicken and/or turkey. everyone in my family drools when they know i'm making it.

records.name: thunder and lightning
records.text: this italian pasta dish is named for its ingredients: fried chickpeas (the thunder) and lots of black pepper (the lightning). it's meatless, but not vegetarian.

records.name: little cheddar meatloaves
records.text: i found this recipe in a cooking magazine and it has since become a family favorite!:).

records.name: blue cheese crescent spirals
records.text: i got these off the pillsbury website. they were a contest winner and i can see why. made these for thanksgiving and everybody raved! i think these will also make a good christmas appetizer and i plan on having these at my christmas eve party.

records.name: coppertone  rum   coke        sort of
records.text: rum strikes again. a variation of cuba libre!   what's  you're guess on how it got it's name?   basically the recipe is a 1 to 3 ratio of rum to coke, but rz wanted actual measurements.

records.name: coppertone  rum   coke        sort of
records.text: don't understand why; 1-3 ratio seems like a better international measurement to me!.

records.name: spicy ketchup glazed bacon wrapped water chestnuts
records.text: these will be a huge hit at your party! the recipe may be doubled or tripled, you may wrap all the chestnuts hours in advance and refrigerate until ready to bake --- try to purchase the thin sliced bacon for this then slice each strip into three pieces --- i use the heinz spicy ketchup, if you cannot find the spicy ketchup just add in some cayenne pepper, also try to purchase the thicker long toothpicks :).

records.name: soupe au pistou   provenal vegetable soup
records.text: full of summer garden vegetables this soup uses a pistou (basil-and-parsley sauce) for nice herbal flavor.

records.name: soupe au pistou   provenal vegetable soup
records.text: it sounds like any mix of fresh garden veggies would work with the pistou - perfect for the random small handfuls of veggies that come out of a small garden. from epicurious by ruth cousino.

records.name: chicken  ham  and rice soup  canja
records.text: from the little brazilian cookbook by elizabeth lambert ortizz. she says. this apparently simple soup is made special by the addition of rice, tomatoes, carrots, and chopped ham.

records.name: chicken  ham  and rice soup  canja
records.text: these combine to lift the flavor out of the ordinary, making the soup a substantial one, ideal for a light meal when accompanied by a green salad and a dessert.

records.name: chipotle chicken casserole
records.text: a one-pot, family-style meal with smoky chipotle flavor. yet to try, posted for safekeeping. from lifestyle. msn. com.

records.name: bean and potato enchiladas
records.text: a quick and simple dish. serves 4 but can be multiplied to feed a crowd. garnish or dip with guacamole, sour cream or salsa.

records.name: caramel apple coffee cake
records.text: this delicious cake goes great with coffee.

records.name: sweet n sour macaroni salad
records.text: my sister gave me this recipe a long time ago. this salad is so good that you won't want to stop eating it. i make it for my family and neighbors and usually end up with an empty bowl.

records.name: sweet n sour macaroni salad
records.text: update:i do not add the cup of sugar called for in the original recipe. it is sweet enough with just the sweetened condensed milk and still very "yummy. ".

records.name: guisado a la cerveza  beef tenderloin and beer stew
records.text: i originally got this from a microwave cookbook but decided it was a hassle to open the microwave every 10 minutes. i adapted it to the stove top. cooking time will depend on how tender the meat is.

records.name: guisado a la cerveza  beef tenderloin and beer stew
records.text: maggi sauce can be found in most well-stocked supermarkets in the ethnic foods section.

records.name: grilled cheese special
records.text: this recipe sounds kind of odd, but it really does taste good. i saw it on a lunch time news show a few years ago.

records.name: versatile buttermilk bread   banana or zucchini
records.text: i got this recipe from my sister-in-law while i was searching for a moist banana bread recipe years ago. she said the buttermilk makes all the difference.

records.name: versatile buttermilk bread   banana or zucchini
records.text: after trying a handful of different recipes - i am inclined to agree!  the original recipe is for banana bread.

records.name: versatile buttermilk bread   banana or zucchini
records.text: i loved it so much i also altered it to make zucchini bread too!  this recipe is one of those throw everything in a bowl and mix recipes - which is why i love it. it also freezes very well.

records.name: versatile buttermilk bread   banana or zucchini
records.text: **if you don't have buttermilk - plain yogurt can easily be substituted. use 1/2 cup yogurt with a splash of milk.

records.name: mongolian barbecued breast of chicken
records.text: with reddened annatto rice. (makes 3 1/2 cups rice). the marinade is absolutely fabulous. very simple recipe even though the ingredients are long. from chef2chef.

records.name: horseradish breaded chicken breast
records.text: this recipe is so quick to make, and the chicken comes out very moist and tender. the horseradish definitely gives a nice kick, but it's not too overpowering. the dh really loved it. the amounts i've listed here are not exact.

records.name: horseradish breaded chicken breast
records.text: just make it to taste, and make enough to coat the chicken breasts.

records.name: seared spiced salmon steaks with black bean salsa
records.text: i just loooooove the combination of lime and fresh coriander. mmmmmmmmmmmm. in this recipe from 'delia smith's winter collection', you've got it on top of the salmon as well as in the salsa.

records.name: seared spiced salmon steaks with black bean salsa
records.text: of course you can only do the salmon or only the salsa, but the two go really well together. i served this with what we call here 'wild rice mix'. it's white long grain rice with pieces of wild rice in it.

records.name: seared spiced salmon steaks with black bean salsa
records.text: marinating time is not included in the cooking time. the ingredients and in particular the salsa is very much like tex-mex cuisine.

records.name: 5 tacos
records.text: costs about $5. 00 to make.

records.name: yoghurt and poppy seed dressing
records.text: this is lovely on all sorts of salads, especially spinach with pieces of orange.

records.name: don s pot roast  crock pot
records.text: my husband loves to make pot roast in the crock pot on the weekends. this is his favorite way of making them. depending on the size of the roast, you can add all of the veggies to the crockpot for a one-dish meal.

records.name: don s pot roast  crock pot
records.text: it's also good with a pork roast.

records.name: fabulously low calorie  still delicious chocolate chip cookies
records.text: a really light and fluffy, like a sponge cake, chocolate chip cookie, on the lighter side and still oh so good!.

records.name: apple braised pork chops
records.text: i went to dinner at a great restaurant near detroit, ordering chops with a wonderful savory-sweet apple and dried cherry sauce. this is my interpretation of the dish. it is a quick, yet impressive dish.

records.name: raw torte
records.text: an all natural sweet treat.

records.name: no cream alfredo sauce
records.text: i make my alfredo sauce with evaporated milk from the pantry instead of fresh cream from the supermarket. my family enjoys this convenient and delicious sauce often.

records.name: no cream alfredo sauce
records.text: they claim to like it even better than restaurant alfredo sauce! i hope you'll also enjoy it.

records.name: pizza with honey  caramelized onions  cheese and mushrooms
records.text: delicious.

records.name: scrambled eggs with fines herbes and tomatoes
records.text: this is wolfgang puck's recipe from the food network. i had some home grown tomatoes, and thought this would be a great breakfast, and it was!  i did increase the quantity of fresh herbs, but you can reduce those to be more like his recipe.

records.name: scrambled eggs with fines herbes and tomatoes
records.text: i also subbed creme fraiche for his heavy creme.

records.name: spicy baked chicken wraps
records.text: this recipe is perfect for an easy, quick, weekday meal and is great to use up any leftover chicken that might be on hand. i've been asked for this recipe so many times that i figured it would be faster to post and share ;).

records.name: polynesian marinade
records.text: good marinade for chicken. posted in response to a request.

records.name: chicken   asparagus with cous cous
records.text: i adapted this from a recipe i saw on one of jamie olivers tv shows - it is so simple yet the flavours are beautiful !!.

records.name: raisin bar sheet cake
records.text: this is my mother's recipe from when we were kids, and the first recipe i prepared solo as a child. my mother's old cookbook still bears the traces of a cooking mishap. i had a little problem with the hot water and a metal bowl.

records.name: raisin bar sheet cake
records.text: needless to say, don't pick up a metal bowl with boiling water in it -- it's hot. icing the cake while slightly warm is essential, the icing goes on much easier and forms a nice glaze. it's very moist cross between a bar and a cake.

records.name: fuyu bundt cake
records.text: the fuyu is a non-astringent variety of persimmon (it won't dry out your mouth, i promise). they are flat not pointy. they are eaten while still firm like an apple (peeled or unpeeled). they are very sweet and creamy and slightly spicy.

records.name: fuyu bundt cake
records.text: i love them! most recipes made with them are salads, salsas and chutneys. this is one of the only baking recipes i've found. it is from an old sunset magazine. it turned out wonderful! the clove taste is dominent but i liked it.

records.name: fuyu bundt cake
records.text: it was good hot out of the oven but even better the next day. i'm going to try more baking with this type of persimmon in recipes that use apples.

records.name: fuyu bundt cake
records.text: *next time i make it, i think i'll try adding 1-2 tbsp of orange zest and perhaps an orange glaze. this should work in 2 loaf pans as well.

records.name: fuyu bundt cake
records.text: *i've never had a problem with this recipe mixing the baking soda with the fuyus, as it says, but if you're wary of the same thing happening to you that happened to lalaloula, add the baking soda to the dry ingredients.

records.name: beef  and pasta with mushroom sauce and vegetables
records.text: i got this from a kraft canada kitchens recipe a few months back. it's quick and easy to make. vegetarians can omit the beef for a nice vegetarian pasta meal.

records.name: sweet bourbon corn pudding
records.text: this recipe came by way of b. smith, and has become a family favorite side dish. especially around the holidays.

records.name: shrimp with green garlic sauce
records.text: a beautiful and luscious dish. bright pink shrimp with a pale green sauce. make sure you have plenty of bread to soak up any remaining sauce. nothing this good should be so easy!.

records.name: spinach quesadilla
records.text: from the grit cookbook (a vegetarian restaurant in athens, ga).

records.name: garlic roasted corn snack   weight watchers
records.text: i received an email from weight watchers this morning and it had this recipe featured.

records.name: garlic roasted corn snack   weight watchers
records.text: 1/2 cup = 2 points (for those following the ww points plan)  notes from the website:check after 25 minutes to make sure smaller pieces of corn are not burning.

records.name: garlic roasted corn snack   weight watchers
records.text: store any uneaten kernels in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. to recrisp any soft kernels, reheat in oven on a sheet pan until crispy.

records.name: garlic roasted corn snack   weight watchers
records.text: add even greater flavor to this recipe by tossing the corn with flavored vegetable oil such as basil- or chili-flavored oil (for the flex plan only).

records.name: lemon lavender layer cake
records.text: this lovely layer cake that i created is delicately flavored with the unique flavor of lavender and the bright flavor of lemon.

records.name: ecuadorean corn and purple potato salad
records.text: clipped from an old issue of the houston chronicle newspaper, this is a great salad, perfect for lunch or a light dinner!.

records.name: shanghai meat buns
records.text: a tasty snack or as a meal.

records.name: warm rice pudding with seasonal fruit
records.text: this is a michael chiarello recipe that i found in the energy times magazine. saving it to try. the cook times are a guess right now.

records.name: melt in your mouth macaroni salad
records.text: this macaroni salad is garden-fresh tasting with its unique blend of shredded carrots, cucumbers, and radishes. the buttermilk  dressing has a garlicky dill flavor. this was clipped out of ladie's home journal magazine about 20 years ago.

records.name: turkey tortilla spirals
records.text: this is an easy appetizer, great for potlucks!.

records.name: hot   healthy bean soup
records.text: a healthier, lower-sodium, vegetarian version of the infamous taco soup. this makes a ton, so be prepared to feed a crowd or freeze it for later like i do. i hope you enjoy!.

records.name: vegetarian spring rolls
records.text: the best thing about these is they're baked and not fried but they still come out very crispy.

records.name: vegetarian spring rolls
records.text: i have occasionally "cheated" and fried these, as a couple of the photos show, so if you're in a hurry or just don't mind the calories, please go ahead and shallow fry in a frying pan for a couple minutes on each side.

records.name: vegetarian spring rolls
records.text: this recipe will give you 12 large spring rolls or 24 if you're using the smaller sized wrappers.

records.name: creamy strawberry crepes
records.text: these are our favorite crepes, perfect for christmas morning.

records.name: spinach and pumpkin curry
records.text: a vegetable curry which is far too spicy for me but which i believe many would enjoy. it's certainly full of nutrition. i found this recipe in a march 2005 issue of the magazine 'fresh'. i've posted it here exactly as i found it.

records.name: spinach and pumpkin curry
records.text: although i have cooked such dishes, as a non-eater, i have no feel for them so am ill-equipped to modify them in any way, but i do hope that anyone trying this recipe will make it their own by adjusting it to meet their own taste preferences.

records.name: spinach and pumpkin curry
records.text: and for a spot of culinary trivia: among the spices in this recipe is turmeric which - according to the notes accompanying the recipe - "has been called 'poor man's saffron' as it imparts a yellow colour at a fraction of the cost"!.

records.name: the rainbow room s carrot and peanut salad
records.text: this snack dish is from nigella lawson's book "forever summer".

records.name: aztec guacamole
records.text: i recently visited my brother and sister-in-law. she is a fabulous cook who learned from her mother growing up in mexico city. she doesn't cook from recipes, but from memory and experience of how she was taught.

records.name: aztec guacamole
records.text: we had a fabulous meal of beef tacos with this guacamole. i watched so i could make it at home. it's different than most because of the tomatillos, and it's wonderful with the beef. i posted the beef taco recipe separately.

records.name: sensational cucumber salad
records.text: is your garden exploding? this will help. got this from an old employer of mine. it is tasty and very unusual.

records.name: salted chocolate chip cookies
records.text: i know, another chocolate chip cookie recipe. these are really wonderful though. they are not too sweet and the salt complements the chocolate beautifully. it is important that the flours and granulated sugar be mesured by weight.

records.name: salted chocolate chip cookies
records.text: i use murray river australian flake salt for sprinkling on top of the cookies.

records.name: warm chocolate cake   bridges restaurant  danville  ca
records.text: from bon appetit, january 2000. these individual cakes have a soft, pudding-like center. serve with frangelico ice cream.

records.name: mema s black eyed pea dish
records.text: a family-favorite way to eat those black-eyed peas at new year's. serve over rice or, even better, cornbread. i sometimes use ro-tel for the diced tomatoes for an extra kick. cook the day before to allow flavors to meld.

records.name: crazy mother in law pleaser cheesy chicken
records.text: i made this for my mil when i forgot to turn on the oven for the turkey roast. it was great!! this was a quick save, and the idea came from a dish she had prepared from a 60's vintage book.

records.name: crazy mother in law pleaser cheesy chicken
records.text: the original was more involved, but this tasted just as good.

records.name: ez low cal bananas foster
records.text: watching calories and fat intake but would still like to indulge in one of your favorite desserts? try this easy and quick recipe. it fooled everyone in my family!.

records.name: dom s caesar salad
records.text: from dom deluise. the original caesar salad did not have anchovies, and this doesn't, either.

records.name: low fat chicken chili for two
records.text: this is a recipe i created when i started my low fat diet. it is very good served in a bread bowl or over the top of a baked potato. this recipe does double well if you would like to make more than two servings.

records.name: grilled philly cheesesteak tacos
records.text: a recipe from rachael ray.

records.name: deli hero sandwich
records.text: my family could eat this sandwich every day of the week! adjust all ingredients to taste, the sandwich needs to chill for 30 minutes or longer before slicing and serving, servings is estimated and prep time includes chilling time.

records.name: chilled fresh pea and lettuce soup
records.text: wonderful for hot summer days.

records.name: uber easy lentil chili
records.text: why is it that tomato soup is always on sale? i always have way to much of it in my cupboard and i love this recipe because it gets rid of it quickly.

records.name: chicken popcorn
records.text: more popcorn!.

records.name: egg substitute for baking
records.text: this is a great substitute for anyone who either has an egg allergy or. if you're like me and you have a recipe that needs eggs fast and youre completely out. it's great, and it's fast!.

records.name: chocolate cherry fudge bundt
records.text: a delicious off-the-shelf cake.

records.name: creamy chicken  stuffed bell peppers
records.text: these are terrific! if i could rate something i myself shared on rz then this would get 5 stars!! great for leftover chicken and oamc.

records.name: rita s recipe from felina in italy
records.text: this is an open-faced eggplant sandwich from dom deluise.

records.name: pumpkin marmalade
records.text: this spread is a great addition to any holiday table. it is best served with a sharp white cheddar cheese and hearty bread. you can use either fresh or canned pumpkin for this recipe.

records.name: pumpkin marmalade
records.text: the cooking time is actually the time needed to cool the spread before you can use it.

records.name: fagiole pasta  not pasta fagiole soup
records.text: this is a southern calebrese (soveria-simeri) variation of pasta fagiole soup, only it's really a pasta dish with a flavorful tomato, bean, and onion sauce.

records.name: penne and italian sausage
records.text: this recipe is from the milk calendar which i receive annually. it is a one pot recipe which i made often when i was working, and still come back to when i need a "comfort food" dish. the ingredients can be varied to suit your family's taste.

records.name: penne and italian sausage
records.text: i don't use the chili powder and usually let simmer for about 25 min over med low heat with occasional stirring.

records.name: thanksgiving pizza
records.text: super yummy pizza with the flavors of thanksgiving, perfect for a casual feast any time of year, or using up leftovers.

records.name: thanksgiving pizza
records.text: note that one 18 ounce package of "jennie-o so easy turkey breast roast in homestyle gravy" cooked 30 minutes is the perfect amount of gravy and turkey for two pizzas.

records.name: irish tea
records.text: from the landmark tavern in new york.

records.name: kourambiethes  greek almond shortbreads
records.text: i haven't made this recipe yet. it is posted for the zaar world tour 2006. the cookbook i found this recipe in says that kourambiethes are a christmas specialty in greece. prep time includes 1 hour refrigeration time.

records.name: rigatoni with sweet sausage and tomato sauce
records.text: the best rigatoni recipe! from the sopranos.

records.name: bacon wrapped waterchestnuts with pineapple
records.text: these are my favorite version of this popular appetizer. the addition of pineapple adds a nice sweetness. these appetizers are always the first to go whenever i serve them.

records.name: bacon wrapped waterchestnuts with pineapple
records.text: i've had good look pre-baking them and serving them warm in a crock-pot or just reheating in the microwave if you want to make them ahead of time.

records.name: no cook snowballs
records.text: with all the snowball recipes on here, i was shocked to see that this one wasn't.

records.name: no cook snowballs
records.text: this is a super quick and easy recipe that even the youngest child can help with (our 2 yr old neighbor had a grand time)! the perfect christmas treat! this recipe came from one of the many gooseberry patch cookbooks.

records.name: venison teriyaki
records.text: absolutely delicious, much like those served in chinesee restaurants. no one will know this is venison. they can also be made with cubed beef. my children devour these! prep time includes 3-1/2 hours marinating time.

records.name: seitan and mushrooms in paprika cream
records.text: from "vegan express. " this was the first time my family and i tried seitan, and it was awesome. we absolutely love this recipe. the sauce is divine. yum, yum and more yum!.

records.name: 100   whole wheat
records.text: the trick to making 100% whole wheat bread is the extra knead which gives the yeast and gluten a second chance to creat a lighter loaf. gluten gives the whole wheat flour the structure needed for a good loaf.

records.name: 100   whole wheat
records.text: if your store doesn't carry it, try the local health food store.

records.name: copycat kentucky pie
records.text: this is the closest recipe i can find to replicating the kentucky pie at mcalister's deli. this stuff is absolutely to die for! it's great if you serve it like they do at mcalister's.

records.name: copycat kentucky pie
records.text: warm, drizzled with chocolate syrup, topped with whipped cream, and served with vanilla ice cream.

records.name: mocha chips  n bits
records.text: you can make with or without icing. personally, i think it's easier, and just as yummy, to leave off the icing!  time doesn't include preparing applying icing.

records.name: mashed potato volcanoes
records.text: play with your food!  this recipe is more of a concept than a recipe that needs to be exactly followed - you can make your mashed potatoes and sauce any way you want them.

records.name: mashed potato volcanoes
records.text: it's best to give the child their own portion of lava to pour, makes it more fun! too bad the lava can't actually shoot out of the volcano, we're working on that.

records.name: mashed potato volcanoes
records.text: variations of this can be found all over the web, so i have no idea where the idea originated.

records.name: mashed potato volcanoes
records.text: this is perfectly vegan friendly, as it can be made with rice or soy milk and margarine, in fact it was written that way when i found it at veg family. enjoy!.

records.name: churer fleischtorte  swiss meat pie
records.text: a meat pie from chur in the swiss canton of graubünden (grisons).

records.name: golden southwestern breakfast slop
records.text: i like a heavy country style breakfast because i seldom eat lunch. i cooked this one up to get something tasty and bulky that lasts me for a long time. spice it to your own taste.

records.name: stuffed manicotti verde
records.text: this is from my moosewood low-fat cookbook. this looks like a vegetarian recipe my dear other half will actually eat!.

records.name: baked spanish spinach balls in roasted bell pepper sauce  albond
records.text: this is a traditional recipe from the region of madrid, spain's capital. for the cheese, use any mild cheese that melts well, such as monterey jack. found on-line and posted for zaar world tour 5.

records.name: potato sauerkraut soup
records.text: very hearty winter fare for the crock-pot.

records.name: coconut  banana and strawberry smoothie
records.text: recipe courtesy of bon appetit, may 2006.

records.name: bacon sloppy joes
records.text: a recipe from the everyday with rachael ray magazine. i have made it quite often and love it more every time!.

records.text: fyi: because of the mayo content, we put the bowl of salad into a slightly larger-sized bowl filled halfway with ice to keep the salads cold and fresh.

records.text: this is a comforting, delicious, and flavorful casserole that is great for potlucks. my whole family gets excited when my mom makes this-- a rare occasion! from taste of home 2004 (submitted by jeanette travis).

records.name: eight layer taco spread
records.text: yummy!.

records.text: these are very similar to the steamed potatoes my mom 'mimi' used to make in the cast iron skillet.

records.name: miss kitty s oven roasted potatoes
records.text: i like to make these with any roasted meat - just put them all in the oven at the same time - set it and forget it !!  i use pyramid all natural mediterranean salad herb seasoning for this dish - i find it on the spice aisle at the grocery.

records.name: heavy duty hash browns
records.text: be warned! this is not for everyone. it's a heavy breakfast sidedish that will stick with you until lunch.

records.text: i've seen so many recipes for tomato soup on zaar but nothing like mine so i decided to post it.

records.name: mock mashed potatoes
records.text: this is a great substitute for mashed potatoes for those on a low carb diet.

records.name: potato and beet salad
records.text: every easter my mom would make this potato salad. this is not exactly hers but my version.

records.name: potato and beet salad
records.text: don't wait for easter make it for your next picnic! do use new potatoes if you like them firm but i myself like my potatoes soft so i find myself using russets, and if you don't want a precise cut salad with firm potatoes use russet.

records.name: potato and beet salad
records.text: i find myself rough cutting the russets potatoes because they do fall apart and add to the creaminess of the dressing.

records.name: potato and beet salad
records.text: fyi-you can toss the cubed, cooked, still warm, potatoes with the vinegar or beet juice and let set till cool even up to over night. then add remaining ingredients.

records.text: this recipe is so good, quick and easy to make. it's been a staple in our house for many years now.

records.name: bleu cheese omelet
records.text: cheese and apples are natural partners, and in an omelet they are an extra special combination. this is a good vegetarian dish to try on your family. this recipe is from the american family cookbook.

records.name: burrito stack
records.text: from the canadian living magazine test kitchen "try this warming meal with creamy sliced avocado on the side".

records.name: fresh   chunky roasted tomatoes with anchovies  garlic   basil
records.text: this is so simple and delicious! i've never had tomato sauce like this before. this is the only way i will make my fresh tomato sauce from now on!.

records.name: kentucky style green beans
records.text: my mom's recipe. a really good pot of beans.

records.name: sour cream salsa chicken for crock pot
records.text: this recipe has a smooth mexican taste.

records.name: mexican bites
records.text: this is a spicy version for quesadillas. the sour cream dip helps with the heat, but boy are they hot--watch out!  i make them when my husband has friends over for football games and they are gone in minutes.

records.name: cobb salad panini
records.text: i just watched tyler florence make this. its looks so good!.

records.name: zucchini mock crab cakes
records.text: these taste just like the ones made with crab. most people don't know the difference. it's a good way to use up zucchini during "zucchini season. ".

records.name: easiest mac  n  cheese
records.text: the easiest and tastiest macaroni and cheese recipe. so easy my 10 year old can make it! also the only mac and cheese my very picky 7 year old will eat. make sure to use extra sharp cheddar, it makes all the difference.

records.name: easiest mac  n  cheese
records.text: best of all, no need to pre-cook the noodles! adapted from moosewood low fat favorites.

records.name: thai peanut stir fry sauce   easy
records.text: yummy easy addictive sauce from newspaper, oregonian foodday. blend 5 ingredients together and heat if desired.

records.name: virginia s scalloped potatoes   ham
records.text: my mom used to make this for us kids when we were young and didn't have much money. she used to make this with a can of spam. i make it with ham, either way it is so good, inexpensive and just plain comfort food.

records.name: virginia s scalloped potatoes   ham
records.text: this can be microwaved if in a hurry.

records.name: meatballs in creamy mushroom sauce
records.text: i make this with my recipe#69173 but you can use your own favorite meatball for this ;-) this is great served up on cooked hot egg noodles, or cooked rice, prep time does not include making and cooking the meatballs.

records.name: picnic potato salad
records.text: this potato salad doesn't have any mayonnaise and is great for a picnic because it keeps well. good with burgers or steak or whatever else you like on the barbecue. leftovers keep well in the fridge for a couple of days if you have any.

records.name: picnic potato salad
records.text: for my vegetarian friends i leave out the meat. posted in response to a request.

records.name: pretty in pink pretzels
records.text: from every day with rachael ray april 2007. these are so cute! time does not include standing time.

records.name: pot roast in foil
records.text: easy pot roast that makes it's own gravy. to me, the gravy is the best part. this can also be done in a crock pot beautifully - great for the busy mom! roast does cook down and is well done.

records.name: crock pot steak and potatoes
records.text: an easy and delicious meal. true comfort food.

records.name: beef  moose or venison chili
records.text: this is a really thick hot chile. i myself don't use the hot peppers or tabasco sauce. i also use the ground red pepper instead of the crushed red pepper. i like my chili a little more thinner so i also add tomato juice.

records.name: beef  moose or venison chili
records.text: make this on a nice cold day and it'll heat you up in no time.

records.name: artichoke stuffed chicken breast  but with a different hat
records.text: this is based on recipe #350909, and i thought i would try it a bit differently one night. it's done basically the same, just roasted red bell pepper and provolone cheese on top, instead of mozzarella. enjoy!.

records.name: rose a  rita  cocktail
records.text: this is a strawberry margarita with a twist. tequila rose liqueur is one of the ingredients. tequila rose is strawberry flavor cream liqueur and tequila  and is pink, creamy and tasty. i have made this drink two different ways.

records.name: rose a  rita  cocktail
records.text: in a blender, which makes the drink foamy because of the 7up, and in a tall glass. i got the original recipe from the tequila rose web site and improvised it a little bit. if you want to, you can use club soda instead of 7up.

records.name: rose a  rita  cocktail
records.text: i don't know how it tastes with club soda though. it is a very refreshing drink.

records.name: no bake  creamy coconut pie
records.text: very good,but very sweet. my mother gave this recipe to me.

records.name: strawberries and poppy seed dressing

records.name: trail mix granola muffins

records.name: southern caramel cake
records.text: authentic southern caramel cake. prep time includes cooling.

records.name: peabody cookies
records.text: these cookies are melt in your mouth delicious. they are different from anything else i have ever made. they are so buttery. i have been making these for 19 years and they are the ones my family always request at the holidays.

records.name: peabody cookies
records.text: the recipe was found in a cookbook from christian academy school my son attended when he was young. the book said it is the same cookies that they make at the famous peabody hotel, hence the name.

records.name: pain blanc
records.text: this is my grandmother's bread recipe. i love it, and so does my husband and kids. these can be frozen as soon as they have cooled. they taste just as good when thawed.

records.name: pain blanc
records.text: at christmas time, i bake extra batches and give them out to  my siblings so they can also reminisce about their childhood.

records.name: zucchini bean salad
records.text: from taste of home, october/november 2007.

records.name: fudgy chocolate layer cake
records.text: this is not an overly sweet cake. this is very much a chocolate cake! delicious!.

records.name: maple oatmeal bread

records.name: vegetarian smoky  spicy corn chowder
records.text: adapted from a non-vegetarian recipe in real simple magazine.

records.name: ricotta filled brownie squares
records.text: i know, another brownie recipe, but i checked and there aren't any yet using ricotta cheese. they're simple, moist and quite delicious. the original recipe came from silvia maynard, fort worth, texas.

records.name: kale chips   skinnied
records.text: this is a recipe from gh, and i've messed with it a little to make it kind of like crispy seaweed.

records.text: i haven't tried this but it's only 2. 5 points on the weight watchers program. might be worth it.

records.name: double orange or lime popsicles

records.text: this was contributed by olga d at another board and is a fabulous, easy, impressive appetizer.

records.name: simple crock pot carnitas
records.text: easy recipe with few ingredients to get flavorful, delicious carnitas. this does not have the citrus flavor of many carnitas recipes. after i remove my meat from the crock pot, i crisp it up a little under the broiler.

records.name: the ultimate turkey tetrazzini
records.text: i put this together with a lot of help from emeril. this is his recipe with a few tweaks and is oh so good. we thought this was a "bam" good turkey tetrazzini. :-d  i hope you like it too.

records.name: butterbeer cupcakes
records.text: i haven't made these, but stashing it here for safekeeping. this was created by amybites blog site here:  http://amybites. com/?p=623. it's worth the read and seems overwhelming a sound recipe.

records.name: mango curried brie
records.text: not really a recipe, more of a serving suggestion. very easy and the unique combination of flavors is delish. this looks pretty on the plate too. use one of the small (3-4 inch) whole rounds of brie (camembert, goat cheese brie, etc).

records.name: roast lamb with potato  onion and pepper gratin
records.text: this is an interesting way to cook the lamb and a vegetable gratin at the same time. the juices from the lamb drip into the gratin dish placed underneath the lamb. it's good, and a fun way to cook, but beware, it can get rather messy.

records.name: amy s beef stir fry
records.text: adapted from "dining in quarters a" cookbook by donna kaup--excellent.

records.name: pineapple and cheese muffin melts
records.text: a tasty snack from australian bh&g diabetic living.

records.name: 50 second fudge
records.text: the easiest more absurd fudge in the world, but for the skeptics out there, this recipe works.

records.name: easy food processor hummus
records.text: once you make this once yourself and find out how easy and delicious it is, you will never buy store bought again. makes 1 1/2 cups.

records.name: vienna cafe cake
records.text: simple but elegant 3-layer cake makes any occasion special.

records.name: barbecued buffalo wing dip with a twist

records.name: barbecued buffalo wing dip with a twist
records.text: open the chips and pass the margarita's!  recipe courtesy one of my good friends generous enough to pass on this keeper.

records.name: hearty lamb stew with mushrooms and carrots
records.text: this recipe will feed 3-4 people, it can easily be doubled, and is best if prepared a day ahead, refrigerated and warmed the following day. i have made this stew many times, it is wonderful! serve with hot cooked egg noodles.

records.name: hearty lamb stew with mushrooms and carrots
records.text: i like to add in some frozen peas also.

records.name: cheesecake parfait
records.text: i've been making this since the 1970's and it's great for satisfying that cheesecake craving. for pot luck or family gatherings, double the recipe and serve in a trifle bowl.

records.text: choose any type of pie filling, but i've found when doubling the recipe, one can of filling and one can of coconut is adequate. my personal favorite is blueberry.

records.name: pan glazed chicken with basil
records.text: this originally came from weight watchers, but i changed it from frying to broiling with much better (and healthier) results.

records.name: cranberry lemon cake
records.text: i love the tart taste of cranberries and lemons. so i had to make something with both together. perfectly tart and not too sweet. and so easy to make. my kids love them too! a perfect combination.

records.name: broccoli with dijon sauce
records.text: i received a lot of side dish recipes from our local store. so i'm posting the ones that sound good. low fat and low cholesterol.

records.name: almond roca bars
records.text: these bars are delicious and very easy. we make them around the holidays and everyone enjoys them.

records.name: danish pastry dough
records.text: a very versatile and rich danish dough. can be used with almost any filling and formed in any way imaginable including cinnamon rolls.

records.name: chicken piccata light

records.name: two cheese quesadillas
records.text: i love all different kinds of quesadillas. i thought i would share this one.

records.name: rosemary breadstick twists
records.text: these are especially good served with pasta or soup. other spices can be substituted for the rosemary, like basil or dill.

records.name: orange crush  soda pop  ice cream
records.text: my grandmother always made orange crush ice cream when we came to visit her in the summer. it holds many fond memories from my childhood. a friend gave me this recipe and i wanted to save it just in case i lose it again!.

records.name: alligator hush puppies
records.text: recipe from the 2003 texas gatorfest, these sound tasty. serving sizes and yield are estimated. prep time includes 10 minutes 'stand' time. posted for zwt5.

records.name: norske kjttkaker  norwegian meatballs
records.text: "kjøttkaker" is on every norwegian menu. i do not use a recipe, so mine taste a little different every time. i wrote down the following recipe yesterday, and the whole family agreed that these "kjøttkaker" rocks.

records.name: norske kjttkaker  norwegian meatballs
records.text: note to nyteglori: tangy sauce will make it something else. authentic norwegian meatballs have brown gravy.
