records.text: this tastes like a fresh fruit version of a thick shake with amaretto. the amaretto gives a warm flavour to this otherwise ice cold treat!.

records.name: mrs  k s toll house pecan pie
records.text: pecan pie recipe that my grandmother used to make for our family. it supposedly comes from a restaurant in silver springs, md called mrs. k's tollhouse.

records.name: strawberry rhubarb cobbler
records.text: i came up with this variation from three different recipes. it's a delicious cross between a pie and crisp. it doesn't turn out runny, so if you like runny cobblers, this is probably not your cup of tea =) enjoy!!!.

records.name: rich hamburger casserole
records.text: a very easy casserole. if you want to.

records.name: oatmeal cranberry cookies
records.text: kids and adults love this cookie! easy to make, quick to disappear.

records.name: time life swedish meatballs
records.text: according to the 1968 time/life book, foods of the world: the cooking of scandinavia, this recipe makes true swedish meatballs. the proper name is sma kottbullar.

records.name: mom s fudge
records.text: posted in reply to a request. i didn't see any similar to this when searching. my mom got it from a church magazine in the early 1960's. great for the biceps & triceps!.

records.name: spanish style rice
records.text: not exactly the real deal, but close enough. for salsa, i used medium heat, but depending on your taste buds, you can use anywhere from mild to exra hot!.

records.name: strawberry avocado salad with balsamic dressing
records.text: strawberries and avocados are huge favorites in this family, so this salad was a winner!  to make it more substantial, add cooked prawns.

records.name: reuben rolls
records.text: had these at summerfest in milwaukee and just had to re-create. i have deep-fried or baked with success. great served with a horseradish sauce.

records.name: e z est ever pot roast
records.text: so simple and such rich flavors. we have this several times a month and there are never any leftovers. nothing is easier and tastes so good. a real.

records.name: ham and cheese patties
records.text: i love recipe #137575 and i really love ham and cheese sandwiches, so i thought why not try to combine the two. this is what i came up with. thank you chef dari donovan for inspiring me. submitted on june 13th, 2006.

records.name: mocha chocolate chip cheesecake bars
records.text: what could be better than chocolate chip cookie & cheesecake?.

records.name: red onion trout
records.text: another i created to use on steelhead i had in the freezer. found not too many recipes on line that i liked, so i made this one up along with another recipe. hope you enjoy, my family loved it.

records.name: chocolate mascarpone cream
records.text: an elegant, easy no cook desert. serve it topped with sliced, toasted almonds, berries or fresh fruit. you can substitute your favorite liqueur for the grand marnier. recipe from.

records.text: add a little luxury with this deceptively simple side dish.

records.name: roast beef pasta salad
records.text: cook time includes chill time.

records.name: frozen harlequin pie
records.text: my husband is celebrating his first thanksgiving since being diagnosed celiac, so i am going back to recipes that need no alteration to be gluten-free. this is delicious, although very rich due to the nut crust.

records.name: chicken athena
records.text: found this recipe in bon appetit too busy to cook. i don't always have aniseed and ouzo around but the combination is intoxicating! great accompanied by orzo.

records.name: chicken wing bbq sauce
records.text: i have gotten this recipe from my fil. i use it to par-broil the chicken first then finish it on the grill. i also use it for pork chops on the gril, i baste and flip alot though.

records.name: chicken wing bbq sauce
records.text: if deep frying the wings add some hot sauce to the mix to your tasting.

records.text: this is perfect for a weekend family breakfast because it can be prepared the night before and then popped into the oven in the morning.

records.name: hearty lentil soup
records.text: if you like lentils, you should love this soup. i like it best with the smaller amount of stock, so it's nice and thick and rich.

records.name: baked coconut shrimp
records.text: found in march 2013 women's health.

records.name: moroccan marinade
records.text: wonderful savory flavors!  spice up your dinner with this quick marinade.

records.name: pepperoni drop biscuits
records.text: an interesting addition to italian-type entrees. my brother, after he took his first bite, said that it was like "a little party in your mouth. ".

records.name: roasted pumpkin bites
records.text: i was introduced to these at a party and was pleasently surprised at how good they were - a nice mixture of sweet pumpkin, tangy balsamic and hot chili powder. this recipe comes out of a local supermarket magazine here in holland.

records.name: roasted pumpkin bites
records.text: i think it's a perfect appetizer for halloween or thanksgiving.

records.name: grilled basil lemon turkey breast
records.text: our family and friends enjoy this and hope you do too. a flavorful layer of basil, lemon, garlic and romano cheese under the skin. i have the butcher cut one turkey in half and use one half for this.

records.name: grilled basil lemon turkey breast
records.text: use a meat thermometer- working towards at least 165 degrees-no one enjoys under or over cooked poultry and with charcoal grilling it is pretty tricky to have a standard that fits everyone.

records.name: grilled basil lemon turkey breast
records.text: dh puts the meat thermometer in thickest part right away at beginning of grilling. servings and cooking time depend upon size of turkey breast. i serve with recipe#485341, roasted asparagus, coleslaw, and my recipe#462312.

records.name: grilled basil lemon turkey breast
records.text: hubby has made this several times.

records.name: chef jean s alfredo sauce
records.text: this is very simple and has two "secret" ingredients to jazz it up a bit(gorgonzola and lemon zest). the parmesean cheese amount is an estimate, i just use enough to thicken the sauce, adjust as needed.

records.name: zucchini raita
records.text: this raita is a lovely change from the more common cucumber raita. madhur jaffrey, the recipe author, writes in eastern vegetarian cooking that she can eat it by the spoonful, all by herself.

records.name: zucchini raita
records.text: it can also be served warm, however, i've only tried it cold. madhur jaffrey calls this dish yogurt with courgettes, but i think it is a dish that we usually refer to as raita.

records.name: sesame peanut candy
records.text: this chinese candy can be made with black sesame seeds for halloween. cooking time includes 90 minutes for cooling--an estimated time.

records.name: old fashioned bean and ham soup
records.text: i took a little from one recipe and a little from another recipe to come up with the kind of bean soup we like. putting it here for safe keeping.

records.name: potluck cauliflower  and lettuce salad
records.text: there are many combinations for cauliflower salads, this particular version is the favorite in our area. a delicious make ahead, perfect for potlucks and family gatherings. great salad to add to the holiday table.

records.name: potluck cauliflower  and lettuce salad
records.text: for those special occasions i serve this in a cut glass bowl. making it look as good as it tastes. i have been known to add slivered almonds to make for extra crunch! this salad requires at least eight hours mellowing time.

records.name: potluck cauliflower  and lettuce salad
records.text: best made the night before. that is a big plus when you are cooking for a crowd!.

records.name: cranberry orange shortbread
records.text: these cookes are another delicious way to use cranberries during their too short season and are great to add to holiday cookie trays. recipe source: gardner (winter 2003/04).

records.name: tomato salmon bake
records.text: this recipe gives salmon an italian flavor. this is great with chicken as well. you can also substitute roasted red pepper dressing for sun dried tomato. serve it with a green salad for a great meal any time of year.

records.name: tomato salmon bake
records.text: recipe source: simple and delicious.

records.name: raindrop soup
records.text: made this for the celebration of the year of the dog. chinese new year 2005! it was part of a wonderful meal. and i have to admit that i changed it up a bit to "dress it up".

records.name: chicken   sausage jambalaya
records.text: this is a recipe from my pastor's wife, who moved here from louisiana. i have tweaked it a bit to suit my family's taste. definitly a family favorite.

records.name: ham   cheddar crescents
records.text: i adopted this recipe in aug. 2006; it originally was posted by cbw. i love these, and dh loves to dip them in spicy mustard. cbw's original comments: "found these in a pillsbury cookbook and have made them several times.

records.name: ham   cheddar crescents
records.text: my hubby and i really like these with a bowl of soup. simple, but really tasty!".

records.name: tomato simmering sauce for fish
records.text: works well for strong flavored fish like tuna, bluefish, and mackerel. from a fish cookbook ripped from the days when i didn't keep track of the source.

records.name: fairy bread
records.text: this recipe brings back great memories from my childhood. my grandmother would always serve it at high tea, making me feel so special to eat it.

records.name: pizza burger

records.name: sweet and gooey parsnips
records.text: with this recipe the poor forgotten parsnip is transformed into a simple and simply delicious side dish.

records.name: caramel cupcakes with butterscotch frosting
records.text: these delicious cupcakes and frosting were featured in fine cooking, april/may 2004.

records.name: yook gae jang  korean spicy beef and vegetable soup
records.text: i love this korean spicy beef and vegetable soup!  it does take some time and like most korean dishes, a lot of work goes into making it, but it is definitely worth it.

records.name: yook gae jang  korean spicy beef and vegetable soup
records.text: my mom used to make this in a bigger batch than the one i posted, and we would eat this for days and days (we didn't mind because we loved this)!  we've since learned that we can freeze this.

records.name: yook gae jang  korean spicy beef and vegetable soup
records.text: i hope you like spicy food because this can get really spicy!  to make it spicier, i like to add more chili pepper instead of the red pepper paste.

records.name: yook gae jang  korean spicy beef and vegetable soup
records.text: note:  the recipe does not allow for me to include 1 package fernbrake into the list of ingredients. you can buy one that is already packaged in water, or buy dried fernbrake, reconstituted in water.

records.name: yook gae jang  korean spicy beef and vegetable soup
records.text: this makes the dish!  without it, it's just ok.

records.name: beef stroganoff   crock pot
records.text: from betty crocker's slow cooker cookbook. excellent. if someone in the family doesn't like mushrooms, run them through the food processor, they will never know.

records.name: maple citrus salad
records.text: a good recipe from foodnetwork specials great holiday gifts. this is so pretty put in a basket with oranges, a tin of cinnamon, a bottle of maple syrup, orange extract and some muffins!.

records.name: tofu frosting
records.text: mori nu recipe for frosting with adjustable flavors and colors.

records.name: creamy roasted red pepper pasta with sausage
records.text: you can use your favorite sausage or substitute diced chicken.

records.name: asian curried sesame peanut butter noodles with shanghai tips
records.text: sweet and savory noodles in a curried sesame peanut butter sauce. you can add chicken or sausage for a one dish meal.

records.text: now, this campaign is being backed by the johns hopkins bloomberg school of public health and is aimed at reducing the risk of heart disease, stroke and cancer by cutting consumption of saturated fat by at least 15%. sounds good to me!.

records.name: italian chef s salad
records.text: a classic salad with an italian twist. note:  olives, artichoke hearts, and salami all add salt, so you may find you don't need further salt in the salad. serves 2-3 as a main course salad, 4 as side salad.

records.name: radical ride granola mix 2007
records.text: this recipe comes from snack attack cookbook for kids. it is easy, and does taste so good. take it with you when you go and discover the great outdoors and hunger strikes you.

records.name: pork tenderloin with sweet and tangy sauce
records.text: this is an easy one for the grill from a shop rite recipe card. i raided the recipe cards!.

records.name: parsley  olive oil  and garlic sauce
records.text: from the "seven fires" argentinian cookbook. this pesto-like sauce is offered in many restaurants as an alternative to chimichurri or salsa criolla. use it on recipe #478140 and other grilled meats.

records.name: matzo kugel
records.text: my grandmother was known for being an amazing lady. she was also known for her matzo kugel and her noodle kugel. no matter the occasion, passover, rosh hashana, yom kippur, or even thanksgiving, this is what she was always asked to bring.

records.name: matzo kugel
records.text: it does not need to be a jewish holiday to enjoy this savory stuffing like casserole--nor do you need to be jewish. this is so delicious year round and very, very easy.

records.name: south beach diet black bean soup  phase i friendly
records.text: this is a quick and flavorful adaptation of the general recipe in the south beach supercharged book. it's warm and homey and quite filling, plus it's delicious!.

records.name: pasta della california
records.text: again. i am not a huge pasta eater, but this is so darn good!.

records.name: stuffed red cabbage leaves  rotkohlrouladen
records.text: from 'best of german cooking'. posted in response to a requst. times are estimates.

records.name: one dish scallop meal
records.text: a healthy all-in-one recipe using bay scallops, rice and vegetables. from "looneyspoons".

records.name: salami rollups
records.text: this is a great diabetic snack - 0 carbs, so we don't have to worry about insulin. when i make it, everyone always enjoys it.

records.name: brazilian iced chocolate
records.text: this is excellent. i don't like the taste of coffee at all, but i could drink my weight in this stuff. it can be served as a dessert with ice cream on top instead of whipped cream if you prefer. the cook time is chill time.

records.name: easy kid pleasin  strawberry buttercream frosting
records.text: the ultimate kid pleaser, great frosting for baking recipe #396312 as cupcakes. would also be tasty on a traditional vanilla/white cake! i love getting creative with nesquik.

records.name: the best chocolate chippers
records.text: i was babysitting a friend's baby one day and she brought me some of these for a reward. i insisted on the recipe and here it is. these freeze very well, too, if you have them that long.

records.name: bacony chicken
records.text: simple yet elegant meal, serve with flavored rice and a salad.

records.name: pumpkin surprise pie
records.text: from family circle 10/07, this has a surprise sublayer of cream cheese.

records.name: garbanzo goulash
records.text: a quick vegetarian macaroni dish. from the new american diet.

records.name: simply marinated cucumbers
records.text: very simple and light. a nice way to use garden cucumbers.

records.name: tomato bruschetta
records.text: a simple yummy addition to a cozy italian-themed supper, or great all by itself for a snack.

records.name: quick tahini yogurt sauce
records.text: try this on falafels, or any other eastern dish. you could thin it out a bit and use it on salad too! enjoy!.

records.name: tom s fruit dip
records.text: a creamy and smooth sweet fruit dip to go with any type of fruit.

records.name: cuban spicy yellow rice
records.text: authentic yellow rice, cuban style, with a little bit of dh's spicy flair, without worrying about the cost of saffron. this is a must in our house. its fast, simple, so yummy, even the kids love it.

records.name: cuban spicy yellow rice
records.text: i usually have to double recipe so i can bring leftovers to work. goes great with our cuban chuck eye steak and chimichurri topping, or even a marinated chicken dish.

records.name: tamales de pollo con chile verde  green chile chicken tamales
records.text: these tamales are really moist and the filling is full of flavor. you can adjust the heat to your liking. it is a rick bayless recipe.

records.name: tamales de pollo con chile verde  green chile chicken tamales
records.text: the directions include thorough directions for wrapping the tamales or if you prefer, you can use your favorite method. if using store bought prepared masa,  make sure to use masa for tamales and not masa for tortillas.

records.name: hg s swirls gone wild cheesecake brownies   ww points   3
records.text: this was a featured recipe today in an email from hungry girl:  brownie points!    armed with our trusty can of pumpkin and a few more slick tricks, we set out to create a guilt-free version of the double whammy that is the cheesecake brownie.

records.name: hg s swirls gone wild cheesecake brownies   ww points   3
records.text: and we achieved success in under 6 hours (not record time, but impressive nonetheless). read on for the fudgy 411!   serving size: 1 brownie  calories: 133  fat: 2g  sodium: 312mg  carbs: 29g  fiber: 1.

records.name: hg s swirls gone wild cheesecake brownies   ww points   3
records.text: 5g  sugars: 8g  protein: 3g   points® value 3*.

records.name: char siu pork cutlets with chinese coleslaw
records.text: from the local state paper the west australian. sounded/looked delicious to the dh and i, so saving it here for later and as such times are estimates. even without the slaw i think this recipe is worth consideration for the pork lovers.

records.name: killer buffalo wings
records.text: these are great to serve at parties. fun for watching sports. be prepared to make a lot, because you'll watch 'em disappear!.

records.name: greek fries
records.text: i used to get these fries at cheap little greek restaurants. when i moved, however, no place served them anymore. so i started experimenting and found it was quite easy to make them on my own. these are a simple and delicious way to do fries.

records.name: city market peach cobbler
records.text: a wonderfully tangy peach cobbler that i found in a supplement to the sunday newspaper years ago. i don't think i've ever served it to anyone who hasn't liked it. the filling is also great for a pie.

records.name: city market peach cobbler
records.text: for a really decadent dessert, serve this with a scoop of blue bell homemade vanilla ice cream! yum!! the preparation time is approximate since i've never timed it. the cook time includes chill time for the dough.

records.name: mini banana loaves
records.text: ever since i got a mini-loaf pan, i've been trying to put everything in it ;)  it's perfect for individual servings.

records.name: apple spiced tea brine
records.text: make this brine for turkey or any poultry you enjoy! do take into consideration the nutritional facts will not be right. as for most of the brine does get washed away and discarded. serving size depends on the size of poultry you brine.

records.name: beef teriyaki stir fry
records.text: this is so good, because the meat gets so tender and flavorful after being marinated. it's a great one dish meal, and if you don't have a wok, a skillet will do just fine.

records.name: triple layer banana cream pie bars
records.text: a kraft foods food & family magazine dessert that i can't wait to try!.

records.name: bria s kahlua cake
records.text: kahlua + chocolate = orgasmic! one of my miraculously easy cake mix concoctions. i got this from my mother, who probably got it from 101 things to do with cake mix, but i'm not sure.

records.name: cream of tomato soup with green chilies and cilantro pesto
records.text: submitted per request for tomato soup and i thought this seemed really interesting and a bit different from the ordinary tomato soup. recipe source: bon appetit (december 1986).

records.name: latkes
records.text: whip these potato cakes up in the food processor, fry them and then freeze ahead for super easy food on the day you need them.

records.name: chile cornbread salad
records.text: i got this recipe out of taste of home. it is delicious!.

records.name: polynesian cake
records.text: this is a recipe from my great grandma.

records.name: shish kebobs
records.text: my family really liked these kebobs. when i made these i choose to just cook the meat which i used stew beef. when i made the marinade i doubled the marinade.

records.name: shish kebobs
records.text: i also tripled the garlic, i used apple cider vinegar, i used carb well a-1 steak sauce and i ended up adding 4-6 tsp, i also added 1/2 tsp each garlic salt & onion powder. when i made these i cooked these on my indoor grill.

records.name: shish kebobs
records.text: i found this recipe at ossg recipes.

records.name: pizza topping  pissaladiere
records.text: pissaladiere is basically an onion pizza. you may use recipe #256080 for the dough.

records.name: pizza topping  pissaladiere
records.text: it's important not to change this recipe much, i wanted to use less olive oil (but i didn't) but it was needed to make the pizza moist on top and i wanted to leave the sugar out (but i didn't) but it was needed to make the onions sweeter.

records.name: pizza topping  pissaladiere
records.text: this recipe came from marie claire zest by michele cranston.

records.name: mushrooms and asparagus with sherry vinaigrette
records.text: found in the magazine everyday food. i love mushrooms and asparagus and what better way to fix them than this. for the mushrooms use a mix of button, cremini,  and shitake or whatever you have on hand.

records.name: macaroni salad
records.text: very delicious and easy to make. you can use elbow macaroni, bow tie pasta or penne pasta. you can add chicken, shrimp or tuna. it's good  whatever you do, so you can be creative.

records.name: heavenly rich seafood lasagna
records.text: this lasagna is sooo rich. if you're lucky enough to live near a great seafood market this is an easy yet elegant dish. unfortunately, i only make it rarely because of the cost of seafood where i live.

records.name: blueberry and orange cupcakes
records.text: i'm doing a clean-up in all my magazines and i'm posting some recipes for safe-keeping. this one is from coup de pouce.

records.name: picnic tarragon yogurt potato salad
records.text: a simple and tasty potato salad!  easy to make and easier to enjoy!.

records.name: poc chuc
records.text: this is an ancient mayan recipe i managed to get off of erika its a pretty tasty meal:) good with mashed potatoes and gravy:) with a small salad and a side of corn:).

records.name: gourmet magazine s asian cucumber ribbon salad
records.text: this is a simple, light, and refreshing recipe from gourmet magazine. cooks' note:  do not let dressed cucumber salad stand more than 20 minutes before serving, or it will become soggy.

records.name: chilli baked stuffed onions
records.text: this is a recipe shared by mr falafel from the newsgroup alt. food. vegan. i have posted this here so that i don't lose this recipe as his recipes tend to be very worthwhile.

records.name: pumpkin pecan muffins
records.text: this is a tasty, healthy muffin that both kids and adults will love. i got the recipe from a whole foods cookbook published by la leche league.

records.name: pumpkin pecan muffins
records.text: the ingredients list looks lengthy because many things are included in both the muffin and the topping so i just have two bowls ready and measure for both at the same time.

records.name: pumpkin pecan muffins
records.text: to give an extra nutritional boost, i cut the oil to 1/4 c and add an extra 1/4 c of pumpkin. they come out very moist.

records.name: mom s marinated cucumbers
records.text: mom makes these year round (if she can get the cucumbers). which is a good thing, because i love 'em. :) if you like pickled veggies, you'll love these! prep time includes marination.

records.name: tre s bloody mary pickled green beans
records.text: i love these in my bloody marys they aren't the same without at least two of these beans in the glass.

records.name: ichigo daifuku   strawberry mochi
records.text: ichigo daifuku are sweet japanese snacks filled with strawberry and anko (sweet red bean paste), also known as strawberry mochi.

records.name: apple buttermilk loaves
records.text: i just came across this old recipe. it's something that i know dh will really enjoy and i don't want to lose it.

records.name: hops bread
records.text: this melt in your mouth bread is a trinidad favourite. etra amounts always have to be bought, as they're usually devoured in the car on the way home from the local bakery  very nice with scrambled egg  filling. courtesy  www. trinigourmet. com.

records.name: pattypan squash fritters
records.text: pattypan is very mild-flavored, so my husband will eat it. and it's abundant, too, so we're always looking for ways to serve it. served with fresh corn and sliced tomatoes, this is a meatless meal. try a horseradish sauce for the fritters.

records.name: penne alfredo for one
records.text: here’s a recipe for all my single friends out there. just because you’re cooking for one doesn’t mean you can’t indulge every now and again. you'll love this creamy sauce and it's fresh italian appeal.

records.name: kirazli roka salatasi
records.text: from turkishcookbook. com. a salad from istanbul. note: because fresh cherries are out of season (shame, because rainier cherries from washington state would be amazing in this recipe!) i replaced them with sweet dried cherries.

records.name: kirazli roka salatasi
records.text: you also have the option of substituting other seasonal fruit: peaches, pears, etc. in either fresh or dried form. turkish feta subbed for the tulum cheese (the latter which i've yet to find here locally).

records.name: sugar free orange polenta muffins
records.text: delicious orange polenta muffins that can be made quickly and easily. you can also add cranberries and nuts to add some variety to this recipe.

records.name: fruit smoothie no bake cheesecake
records.text: since becoming intrigued with smoothies, this recipe caught my eye! it comes from kraft foods & makes a tasty little dessert square! preparation time does not include time needed to firm up in refrigerator.

records.name: special peanut butter sandwich
records.text: my boys love this sandwich. very nutritious.

records.name: bbq d chicken
records.text: this is a good company dish--easy and you can visit while it is baking.

records.name: judy s volcano bread
records.text: judy was a really fun lady that i worked with about 15 years ago. she brought this in to the office one day and it was addictive. you can add bacon if you like but i thought it was good just like this.

records.name: white truffle popcorn
records.text: from sally schneider's cookbook, "the improvisational cook", an easy way to take a snack to a whole new level!  don't overdo do it on the truffle oil; a little goes a long way.

records.name: valerie s chicken pot pie    from woman s day mag
records.text: this chicken pot pie is so easy to make. i include it in my "three meals in thirty minutes" lesson. get chicken on sale and cook several cups in advance. shred and freeze in plastic freezer bags with 2 cups per bag.

records.name: valerie s chicken pot pie    from woman s day mag
records.text: then you have the only time-consuming ingredient already cooked!  everyone who tries this dish loves it!  the french herbs give it a lovely flavor that sets it apart.

records.name: quick   delicious pork chile verde
records.text: this is a quick version of chile verde, but it doesn't skimp on any of the flavor. i make it with white rice and salad, with warm tortillas on the side. but it's great as a filling for burritos too!!!.

records.name: churro cheesecake bars
records.text: the taste of cheesecake without the lengthy wait.

records.name: reuben crescents
records.text: i just can't pass up a tasty reuben!  you can substitute pastrami or turkey pastrami for the corned beef.

records.name: guaranteed to impress shrimp dip
records.text: this is a delicious recipe i got from my brother's father in law. i always get rave reviews when i make it! i don't like onions, so use dried minced onions- but don't serve right away so they can absorb the moisture.

records.name: the healthiest banana and blueberry muffins
records.text: this moist, simple, sweet, tasty & healthy recipe has only 7 ingredients, it's a real winner and you could use raspberries in place of blueberries.

records.name: pumpkin cognac creme brulee
records.text: source: cottage living magazine 10/2007. you can leave out the cognac; you'll lose the depth of flavor, but the custard will cook the same.

records.name: noodle heaven  oamc
records.text: this recipe is from cook for a day, eat for a month. we have had it multiple times, and it is really good. i wanted to share it, because it freezes well, if you wanted to double it and have it again on yet another one of those busy weeknights.

records.name: skinny strawberry sandwich
records.text: i have not tried this recipe. i got the recipe from tops courtesy of california strawberry comission.

records.name: new england boiled dinner  corned beef   cabbage
records.text: corned beef, cabbage, and other veggies--so good, not just on st. patrick's day. really easy to do, the chopping is the most work, and while the corned beef simmers, you have plenty of time to take care of that.

records.name: new england boiled dinner  corned beef   cabbage
records.text: adapted from it's all american food, by david rosengarten.

records.name: music parents famous frito pie
records.text: this is a recipe that i came up with to sell at our local festivals. and wow what a hit. try it the kids just love it.

records.name: really easy and good sugar free strawberry jam spread
records.text: a simple and delicious sugar-free jam, try this using different fruits and gelatin powder :).

records.name: avocado salad in ginger and orange sauce
records.text: great flavours in this dish.

records.name: caramelized baked chicken legs wings
records.text: delicious! yummy  caramelized legs, kids love these! so quick and easy and no marinating required.

records.name: caramelized baked chicken legs wings
records.text: just prepare the sauce, pour over the chicken and pop in the oven!  i actually like this with wings better ;-)    very important to leave it in the oven until it has caramelized to avoid disappointment.

records.name: caramelized baked chicken legs wings
records.text: thank you to everyone for their positive reviews!  try adding sambal oelek as chef  #27416 has suggested in his review. what a great idea ;-).

records.name: turkey focaccia club w  special cranberry mayonnaise
records.text: i just have to share this recipe, printed in toh by judy wilson. it is a must-have for leftover turkey after-thanksgiving or, for that matter, anytime by using store-bought sliced turkey breast.

records.name: turkey focaccia club w  special cranberry mayonnaise
records.text: i would have this for dinner on chilly nights with a bowl of steaming soup and a fruit salad.

records.name: venus de milo baked stuffed lobster
records.text: for over 45 years, venus de milo restaurant has been recognized as one of the premier restaurants in southeastern massachusetts and rhode island, and is capable of hosting banquets up to 2000 people! it is also famous for one of it's chefs, emeril lagasse, who worked their after culinary school.

records.name: venus de milo baked stuffed lobster
records.text: this is one of the recipes that makes them famous. note:  see my instructions on "how to broil a lobster" and prepare for stuffing in my misc. cookbook.

records.name: scarlet s lemon crumb muffins
records.text: so much work but oh so good. just the right amount of lemon flavor and with the topping. fantastic.

records.name: pumpkin chocolate brownies
records.text: i haven't tried these yet. i wanted to post the recipe here for safe keeping. they sound delicious. i'm sure they'd be a great addition to any holiday dessert table. i found this recipe at meals. com.

records.name: pumpkin chocolate brownies
records.text: cooking time is baking time combined with cooling time.

records.name: jellied cranberry beet relish
records.text: for anyone who'd like a change from the usual cranberry sauce, this recipe may just be what you've been looking for. it's a tangy-sweet relish just brimming with beautiful ruby-red beets, celery, onions and, of course, cranberries.

records.name: jellied cranberry beet relish
records.text: serve it with roast turkey or roast goose. this relish may be made up to 24 hours before serving. <<cooking time is refrigeration time. >> the recipe comes from the canadian living christmas book.

records.name: taco surprise casserole
records.text: the kids gave it this title because i think they were surprised they like it so much. i use a fork, but have extra taco chips around for scooping.

records.name: seaman family barbecued ribs
records.text: this is brad seaman's family's recipe for ribs. they're no-fuss, delicious ribs that use both a spice rub and a barbecue baste.

records.name: seaman family barbecued ribs
records.text: although there are plenty of good spice rubs you can buy, they're a snap to make, and by experimenting with the ingredients you can really add a personal touch to your ribs.

records.name: kohlrabi coleslaw
records.text: tired of making and eating the same old coleslaw for you summer picnics? why not try something interesting and different? this is so yummy.

records.name: one   point  hearty chili
records.text: this is a fabulous tasting chili, that i found online.

records.name: one   point  hearty chili
records.text: i have served this chili to my friends & they didn't know it was diet & loved it!  any meal recipe for one point is worth a try, in my book! and once i tried it, i was hooked! the flavor that the beef broth adds, is just awesome!.

records.name: high fiber pea salad
records.text: this is a great and healthy salad loaded with fibery goodness! great for lunches. :-).

records.name: yet  another broccoli rice casserole   husband approved
records.text: despite a million broccoli casserole recipes on this site, i couldn't find one that fit my criteria so i ended up making one up.

records.name: yet  another broccoli rice casserole   husband approved
records.text: turned out amazing (so says hubby) and there weren't any leftovers despite there being only 2-1/2 of us (mom, dad, and toddler).

records.name: hot mexican style spinach dip
records.text: this is an awesome dip, and so easy to make. from southern living's ultimate book of appetizers.

records.name: cherry breeze pie
records.text: haven't tried, but it looks good.

records.name: restaurant style baked potatoes
records.text: i have always wanted light and fluffy baked potatoes like i would get in nice steakhouses, but never could do it at home! i found this recipe and holy cow.

records.name: restaurant style baked potatoes
records.text: it worked!! :d who'd a thunk? key is to start with a mealy fleshed potato - idaho is best i find.

records.name: restaurant style baked potatoes
records.text: and the salt draws the moisture out of the potato while baking, making it light and fluffy!! it really works! ingredient amounts are just there because they have to be, but use however many potatoes you need.

records.name: cheesy spinach artichoke dip
records.text: forget the hot mayonnaise -- this is cheesy and luscious. people who don't like spinach-artichoke dip come back for more and more again. i've never taken it to a potluck without having to write down the recipe for someone.

records.name: easy orange fizz
records.text: this is from the florida department of citrus. the time alloted for cooking is actually time for ice-cubes to freeze.

records.name: the strawberry smoothie
records.text: a wonderful, healthy, and slushy way to cool off!.

records.name: pomegranate teriyaki sauce
records.text: great to use for a marinade for tofu, chicken or fish!  something a bit different.

records.name: broccoli dijon
records.text: i think i got this from world wide recipes, a recipe email zine i used to get. this sauce is really good on mashed potatoes, too.

records.name: brandy cream shrimp
records.text: very elegant, very good! this is an easy recipe for a romantic dinner. you could also put the shrimp on picks for an appetizer.

records.name: grilled drunken artichokes
records.text: after half a bottle of wine, you'd be drunk too! time does not include marinating overnight.

records.name: quick n light curry apple chicken wraps
records.text: i love these flavors together, and this is a quick way to get my fix!  perfect for a healthy snack or light lunch wrap. try adding shredded cheddar as well.

records.name: vegetarian black bean chili
records.text: i make this for my daughters all the time and it's now a family stand-by. easy, tasty and dinner's ready in about 1 hour. serve with salad and hot cornbread. it's also really nice with shredded sharp cheddar sprinkled on top.

records.name: chicken soup with dumplings
records.text: a hearty soup with thick chewy dumplings.

records.name: granny s dirty rice
records.text: a childhood favorite. nothing like typical cajun dirty rice, but served in many southern homes in the 70's.

records.name: mini apple pies  sandra lee
records.text: this recipe from sandra lee is for cute little apple pie burrito type snacks that you can feed the kids or yourself and not feel guilty either in terms of money or fat and calories. great late night munchies too.

records.name: mini apple pies  sandra lee
records.text: simple to prepare and tasty without deep frying. you can sub in your own homemade apple pie filling or use store bought. enjoy! chefdlh.

records.name: maple garlic salmon
records.text: i love this recipe because it is so easy & yummy for any busy work day. preparation time includes the minimum marinade time, but the marinade can be done before leaving for work in the morning.

records.name: maple garlic salmon
records.text: this is easily scaled to marinate any amount of salmon. i make this often just for myself with only 1 nice salmon steak. just use the 2:1 ratio of maple syrup to soy sauce, then add enough garlic and black pepper to suit your personal taste.

records.name: maple garlic salmon
records.text: goes well with rice, string green beans or peas, too.

records.name: creamy bratwurst stew
records.text: i have not tried this recipe. this recipe is from all recipes. the recipe was submitted by susan holmes.

records.name: capsicum or bell pepper torte
records.text: a great light lunch with some salad!.

records.name: the real  black tie mousse cake by olive garden
records.text: this is it. the real deal. very time consuming, but worth it. delicious and decadent, this is a four-layer chocolate mousse cake.

records.name: apple cake  jewish pie
records.text: a good apple cake, similar to a crumble.

records.name: spinach and sun dried tomato bechamel lasagna
records.text: a  thick creamy bechamel sauce takes the place of alfredo sauce in this recipe --- if you are not a lover of spinach you may omit if desired,  also to save some time cook the lasagna noodles a day in advance and place in an generously oiled baking sheet with oil brushed between the layers of noodles to prevent sticking, cover and refrigerate until ready to use, after cooking the noodles  this takes very little time to put together and you may completely layer the lasagna and refrigerate up to 24 hours in advance before baking --- start the bechamel sauce slightly in advance, you will need to cool a portion of it to add to the ricotta mixture --- this is very good!.

records.name: red beans and couscous
records.text: southern living by way of a great friend.

records.name: spicy easy english muffin pizza
records.text: easy.

records.name: roasted salmon with brussel sprouts
records.text: from martha stewart.

records.name: cane s special sauce
records.text: the very sauce recipe used in raising cane's. i tested and made sure to include all of the ingredients. i like this proportion as it is not too much or too little.

records.name: cane s special sauce
records.text: i calculated the proportion based on the exact use of the huge tubs made at the actual places.

records.name: lindy s chocolate chocolate chip cake
records.text: from betty crocker. this recipe is dairy free. i can make this all by myself. you can also make this as cupcakes. it makes 12.

records.name: keg s mushroom neptune
records.text: i love these from the keg restaurant and hope these are a great imitation!  recipe from recipecircus.

records.name: glorious grill cheese and pickles   how good is that  longmeadow
records.text: i love cucumbers, and the next step in keeping cucumbers year round is to pickle them. there is nothing more glorious in nature then opening a processed and canned dill pickle from the summer months.

records.name: glorious grill cheese and pickles   how good is that  longmeadow
records.text: just biting into one sets off a whole memory of the previous garden and all the treasures it yielded. the second part of the recipe really is based on the typical and very heart warming grilled cheese sandwich.

records.name: glorious grill cheese and pickles   how good is that  longmeadow
records.text: talk about memories! remember when you were a youngster, and the rain was pouring sheets outside? you were chilled to the bone from trouping around in it and  mom met you at the front door, helped you out of your wet clothes and gathered the old cast iron skillet out of the cupboard.

records.name: glorious grill cheese and pickles   how good is that  longmeadow
records.text: she then buttered two slices of homemade bread with real butter and put two wonderful slices of cheddar cheese between the bread and grilled away until the sides of the bread became crusty and brown? the inside oozed the cheese out, as it was ready to be devoured alongside potato chips and a pickle.

records.name: glorious grill cheese and pickles   how good is that  longmeadow
records.text: since i saw this recipe from "rachel ray" i have adapted this for the use of my summer pickles and pumpernickel or rye bread. but really you get your pickle, get your bread, some great cheese slices and there you go.

records.name: glorious grill cheese and pickles   how good is that  longmeadow
records.text: stay in from the rain of the day, and use your cast iron skillet for a trip down memory lane.

records.name: strawberry pecan muffins

records.name: all in one roast chicken dinner
records.text: don't expect a fine dining recipe -- this is rustic, comfort food for the busy cook, which will fill the kitchen with its fragrance as it roasts! i make this dish at least once a week or ten days, and always heave a sigh of relief when i've shoved the entire dinner into the oven in one go and can leave it to cook itself, while i do something more interesting! a salad is all i make as an extra.

records.name: all in one roast chicken dinner

records.name: marie callender s banana cream pie by todd wilbur

records.name: marie callender s banana cream pie by todd wilbur
records.text: one bite and you'll be hooked. i threw away all my other banana cream pie recipes. fresh ripe bananas in a rich vanilla cream, topped with fresh whipped cream or fluffy meringue.

records.name: marie callender s banana cream pie by todd wilbur
records.text: for a faster version you may use ready-made graham cracker crusts (the nilla cookie crust is the best). you may use low-fat/no fat products & artificial sweeteners instead of the sugar with no flavor change.

records.name: marie callender s banana cream pie by todd wilbur

records.name: baked haddock and seafood

records.name: decadent chocolate fudge cake
records.text: chunks of chocolate cake mixed with chocolate ganache pressed into a springform pan, chilled, unmolded, and then coated with more ganache. to die for! the interesting way this cake is made is what drew my attention to it.

records.name: decadent chocolate fudge cake
records.text: i had to try it! i was not dissapointed!! a heart shaped insert for the springform pan will also make this a great valentines dessert. i got this recipe from busycooks. about. com. mmmm.

records.name: fried spaghetti
records.text: here's a great way to use up that extra cooked pasta. you can use sauced or plain, long or short pasta, as long as it is already cooked. makes a great lunch dish, or a good side dish with your favorite meat for a quick summer dinner.

records.name: oriental green cabbage salad
records.text: i got this recipe from a co-worker about 5 years ago. she used to bring this for potlucks at work. she shared this recipe with me because i just adore this salad!.

records.name: my chicken parmigiana with homemade pasta sauce
records.text: my family likes a sweet sauce so if you don't like it sweet, just omit the sugar. i do recommend that you add a little sugar, though, to remove some of the acidity taste from the sauce.

records.name: my chicken parmigiana with homemade pasta sauce

records.name: my chicken parmigiana with homemade pasta sauce

records.name: my chicken parmigiana with homemade pasta sauce

records.name: smoked boston butt

records.name: smoked boston butt
records.text: together with the section called "picnic", they comprise the shoulder of the pig. the boston butt is the upper section of the shoulder.

records.name: american kitchen classic louisiana gumbo

records.name: american kitchen classic louisiana gumbo
records.text: creole cooking is city cooking: refined, delicate and luxurious, developed and originally prepared by servants while cajun cooking is french cooking techniques on a host of new ingredients unknown from the cajuns stays in nova scotia and france, exotic forms of meat, game, fish, produce, and grains.

records.name: hamburger   rice skillet meal

records.name: pork lo mein

records.name: soup  vegetable or chicken vegetable  no salt added

records.text: garlic stuffed olives wrapped in an easy cheese dough and baked until warm and crisp! a spicy, salty treat! perfect appetizer or snack.

records.name: pork shanks  chamorra  in mole  super easy slow cooker

records.name: adams ginger snappys

records.text: cooking for yourself or a crowd can be pretty difficult if you have to alter recipe sizes (unless you have zaar to do it for you!)  this recipe is soo simple to multiply, you can do it for one or one hundred!.

records.name: spaghetti with ground turkey

records.name: spaghetti with ground turkey

records.name: carbonate your own ginger ale
records.text: i found this recently while going through some papers from high school - something we did in a bio lab. it was actually pretty tasty.

records.name: carbonate your own ginger ale
records.text: here is the intro: "fermentation has been used by mankind for thousands of years for raising bread, fermenting wine and brewing beer.

records.name: carbonate your own ginger ale
records.text: the products of the fermentation of sugar by baker's yeast saccharomyces cerevisiae (a fungus) are ethyl alcohol and carbon dioxide. carbon dioxide causes bread to rise and gives effervescent drinks their bubbles.

records.name: carbonate your own ginger ale
records.text: this action of yeast on sugar is used to 'carbonate' beverages, as in the addition of bubbles to champagne). we will set up a fermentation in a closed system and capture the generated carbon dioxide to carbonate our home made ginger ale.

records.name: carbonate your own ginger ale
records.text: you may of course adjust the quantities of sugar and/or extract to taste. note that the lemon called for in step eight is optional. and if you want a spicier drink, you can increase the amount of grated ginger.

records.name: carbonate your own ginger ale
records.text: as with any yeast fermentation, there is a small amount of alcohol generated in the beverage (about 0. 4%)". credit on the page is to: http://biology. clc. uc. edu/fankhauser/cheese/cheese. html.

records.name: dijon red wine vinaigrette

records.name: digestive tea
records.text: this classic digestive tea will help alleviate bloating and trapped gas. fennel seeds are sweet anise-flavored herbs long revered in europe and asia for their health benefits.

records.name: digestive tea
records.text: the seeds contain phytochemicals, anti-oxidants, dietary fiber, alkalizing minerals (magnesium, zinc, potassium & calcium) and the vital vitamins, a, b and e.

records.name: digestive tea
records.text: they also contain essential oil compounds that have digestive and anti-flatulent properties; and when ingested with ginger and peppermint, combine for a natural bloating remedy.

records.name: digestive tea
records.text: fennel tea is said to be great for nursing mothers with colicky babies. from hail merry.

records.name: lemon buttermilk rhubarb bundt cake
records.text: in 'rustic fruit desserts' by cory schreiber and julie richardson.

records.name: grilled stuffed portabella mushrooms
records.text: this is a very healthy recipe - found on a hospital diet guide for a heart healthy diet and to lose weight - however, one would not expect these to be sooooo good!!!  my husband who loves steak but isn't so much into mushrooms, went crazy over these - i served them with black & blue steak burgers (no bread) and a salad, all were grilled outdoors and really a fantastic meal!.

records.name: light and creamy california vegetable salad

records.name: mrs  carlson s everyday cookies
records.text: this recipe comes from a wonderful lady who lived down the street from me when i was growing up. she went to our church so i often saw her. my family lived on a cul-de-sac and i remember my sisters and i traveling down to visit her.

records.name: mrs  carlson s everyday cookies
records.text: her children were long since grown and i think she appreciated the visits as much as we kids did. she would feed us these cookies and fortunately she passed the recipe to my mother.

records.name: mrs  carlson s everyday cookies
records.text: it's been more than twenty years since we lived on that street. however, we still see ms. carlson at church. she was there to see my older sister married and the baptism of our family's first grandchild.

records.name: mrs  carlson s everyday cookies
records.text: she is now in her late 80's and i fear time is short. yet i hope that perhaps a new generation will appreciate the cookies she set out with care for her special guests, the three sisters from up the road.

records.name: mrs  carlson s everyday cookies
records.text: i hope you enjoy them as much as i did/do.

records.name: simple super soft chocolate chip cookies

records.name: irish manhattan

records.name: irish manhattan
records.text: every christmas and thanksgiving he would make a traditional manhattan and my mom and i would always doctor ours up with lots of ginger ale, sit back, and watch the fireworks explode! these have a very strong alcohol flavor and are potent- and i do not recommend making this if you are looking for a fru-fru drink! the recipe is adapted from bon appetite and they suggest that if you prefer it a bit drier to make the vermouth portion half sweet and half dry.

records.name: country gravy mix

records.name: sinless whole wheat chocolate chip cookies
records.text: experimenting while trying to make some healthy cookies and came up with this. a little different texture (kind of like a bagel pancake cookie), but very light for being whole wheat, and surprisingly good.

records.name: betty s of york tea room fat rascals   fruit buns scones
records.text: when i worked in york, i used to nip down to betty's of york tea rooms in my lunch break and treat myself to one of these delicious buns! actually, they are a cross between a bun and a scone, and betty's fat rascals differ from some other recipes, as they have whole blanched almonds and glace cherries on top! the origin of the name is unknown, but they are thought to have been made since the mid 19th century - under the name of fat rascals! they originate from yorkshire and durham, and are very popular in most bakeries in the north east of england.

records.name: betty s of york tea room fat rascals   fruit buns scones
records.text: these tasty fruit and peel buns are wonderful with a cuppa, to take on a picnic or, to tuck into a lunch box for the hungry workers and children! the original recipe uses lard, probably where the word "fat" comes from - but i am not a lover of lard, so i have specified butter.

records.name: betty s of york tea room fat rascals   fruit buns scones
records.text: a poignant historical note: a few years after betty’s opened its doors in york war broke out, and betty’s – in particular the basement ‘betty’s bar’ – became a favourite haunt of thousands of airmen stationed around york.

records.name: betty s of york tea room fat rascals   fruit buns scones
records.text: ‘betty’s mirror’, on which many of them engraved their signatures with a diamond pen, remains on display today as a fitting tribute to their bravery, as obviously, some never came back.

records.name: betty s of york tea room fat rascals   fruit buns scones
records.text: (nb: i note that a reviewer has said these are not betty's fat rascals!! well of course they aren't, as i don't have the "secret" recipe - but they are a very close match! there are dozens of fat rascals recipes throughout yorkshire, this recipe is as close as you will get outside betty's tea room! enjoy them as a typical yorkshire treat, as i still do in france!).

records.name: fruit and fiber parfait   ww friendly 1 point

records.name: fruit and fiber parfait   ww friendly 1 point
records.text: there seems to be some questions as to how i arrived at this being 1 pt when others are saying 4 pts.

records.name: fruit and fiber parfait   ww friendly 1 point
records.text: according to the online ww point tracker, which is what i track with: 1/2 cup fiber one cereal = 0 pts;  6 ounces weight watcher's 1 point yogurt = 1 pt;  1/4 cup blueberries = 0 pts;  1/2 cup strawberries = 0 pts.

records.name: fruit and fiber parfait   ww friendly 1 point
records.text: remember, zaar's nutritional information facts are based on generic "low fat yogurt". i highly recommend you track each item for yourself in your point tracker instead. hope that helps!.

records.text: these are  just like my mom used to make. they smell really good while they cook. goes great with chicken and mashed potatoes.

records.name: mankomo s farmhouse bread

records.name: red beet chocolate cake

records.text: these tender pancakes are great for leisurely mornings when you don't need to rush. they are light, fluffy, and fabulous.

records.text: this is my sis's recipe and it has saved me many-a-time in a "trying to impress my girlfriend's family" crunch. everyone will love it! a little bit goes a long way.

records.name: easy baked mac and cheese
records.text: easy and delicious, you'll never want to go for the kraft box of blues again!!.

records.name: hawaiian pork chops   weight watchers
records.text: i found this recipe at obesity help. the recipe was posted by marylyn. weight watcher points 7. when i made these pork chops i used 6 boneless pork chops.

records.name: hawaiian pork chops   weight watchers
records.text: i used a 20oz can of pineapple slices which i had 3 slices leftover and i cut the remaining 3 slices up. i also doubled the sauce and used splenda brown sugar.

records.name: betty s derby fried chicken
records.text: i don't know who betty is, but this is the best fried chicken recipe i have ever used. i've been using this recipe since 1990 when i found it in the dallas morning news food section.

records.name: nestle cookies   cream fudge
records.text: nestle cookies & cream fudge.

records.name: salsa borracha or drunk salsa
records.text: just the name cracks me up! this is a great salsa! it might seem unusual for you but serve this warm! it is a great change of pace! this is also great on top of tacos or enchiladas or anything!.

records.name: apricot peach smoothies
records.text: yummy summer sipping! i really enjoy this, even though i don't typically drink any creamy drinks. this was a taste of home recipe. prep time includes freezing time for the banana.

records.name: turkey or chicken spaghetti tetrazzini
records.text: this is a great way to use up leftover turkey or chicken, you can freeze one casserole and  just thaw in the refrigerator overnight.

records.name: 14 day coleslaw
records.text: another different way to have coleslaw. a lighter version than using mayonnaise based dressings. this comes from a friend who got it from her sister who got it from??.

records.name: chicken breast spanaki
records.text: picked up recipe from food network. it's great tasting and reminds me of my trips to greece.

records.name: spiced christmas coffee
records.text: warming and sensual this coffee is something special.

records.name: grandma jayne s shrimp dip
records.text: i got this recipe at a gluten-free cooking class that our local grocery store put on. this is a recipe from the chef that taught the class got from her grandmother. this would also be good spread on a plate and topped with cocktail sauce.

records.name: grandma jayne s shrimp dip
records.text: cooking time does not include overnight chilling time.

records.name: chocolate caramel brownies
records.text: yum.

records.name: uncle bill s vegetarian stuffed peppers
records.text: i have been making this recipe for many years and had it published in my cookbook. using the 3 colors of sweet peppers makes the presentation look great and it is very tasty. choose nicely shaped large peppers.

records.name: helen s peanut butter cookies
records.text: a good friend in college gave me this yummy peanut butter cookie recipe. unfortunately, she died of cancer shortly after graduating. each and every time i see this recipe it reminds me of helen and the good times we had in college.

records.name: sparkling berry jello salad
records.text: i make this jello often in the spring/summer. it looks really nice in a mold and sets up great. the fresh berries in the center of the mold makes a beautiful presentation.

records.name: strawberry spinach salad
records.text: this salad isn't too sweet, even with the strawberries. it has a good texture with the monterrey jack cheese & the walnuts.

records.name: wheat salad with vegetables
records.text: from 'mediterranean fresh', by joyce goldstein. sounds delicious. using farro wheat which has a nutty taste & texture. don't overcook the grain. you want it tender but still chewy. start checking for 'doneness' after 20 minutes.

records.name: wheat salad with vegetables
records.text: ps:  i've made this using pearl barley as i didn't have any farro wheat. this sub worked really well. my picture shows the barley version.

records.name: pork spread
records.text: this is my father's recipe and brings back such fond memories of my family. we always enjoyed this during the holidays. we would have this in the mornings, spread on toast. always served it with crackers for an appetizer.

records.name: pork spread
records.text: my father enjoyed it in a sandwich, with mustard and always had to have bread and butter pickles on the side.

records.name: green beans greek style
records.text: a simple and tasty green bean casserole with tomatoes. serve as a vege side for 4 to 6 people.

records.name: foolproof  pastry
records.text: this is flaky, delicious, and easy to work with. makes enough for 1 10 inch double crust.

records.name: bajan coconut ice
records.text: from islandflave. com. cooking time is chill time.

records.name: creamsicle pie
records.text: recipe given to me by a co-worker. makes 2 pies.

records.name: mom s favourite seafood pasta
records.text: this recipe is one of our favourite for company. i dedicate this one actually to my long time friend and pastor jack, who was able to eat the 3 portions out of 4, and wipe the dish with bread to get to last bit of sauce.

records.name: mom s favourite seafood pasta
records.text: ha,ha,ha!!! he loved it. i'm sure you will too! anyway i choose a narrow like spaghetty, linguine or sometimes if i have fettucine for this recipe.

records.name: sesame glazed chicken
records.text: quick, low fat and so good, a great weekday meal, served with rice.

records.name: grilled chicken caesar salad sandwiches
records.text: why not try this great sandwich at your next bbq instead of burgers and hotdogs?.

records.name: lasagna soup
records.text: i couldn't believe how easy and tasty this recipe is. i love the half-melted pieces of cheese in the soup!  this is from cuisine at home.

records.name: cheerwine holiday party punch
records.text: this recipe is from the cheerwine official website. cheerwine is a cherry-flavored soda that has been produced in north carolina since 1917.

records.name: cheerwine holiday party punch
records.text: while cheerwine is found mainly in the carolinas and virginia, it is available in some parts of the midwest, california, and scandinavia.

records.name: bulghur pilav
records.text: bulghur is rich in b vitamins and iron. serve this with imam bayildi. this recipe is posted for zaar world tour 2005. i've not tried it yet. i found it in a moosewood cookbook.

records.name: can t be beat brownies
records.text: this recipe is easy and delicious. you  mix by hand so clean up is a snap. i think the key is to cut the shortening in like you cut shortning into a pie crust. i haven't found a better recipe.

records.name: butternut squash  roasted garlic   sage soup
records.text: this is a great fall or winter soup. very impressive for dinner parties!    to roast garlic, cut off the top of a head of garlic & drizzle with a little olive oil. wrap in foil & bake for about an hour at 350°f.

records.name: amanda s delicious cilantro potato salad
records.text: my neighbor served this at a baby shower and everyone wanted a copy of the recipe. this was addictive and had a unique, fresh taste. don't leave out the bacon at the end. it is an essential ingredient, as is the chopped cilantro and lime juice.

records.name: romano s macaroni grill focaccia
records.text: this is a "copycat" recipe which i've posted in answer to a message board request. i found this recipe at cdkitchen. com.

records.text: a recipe from ricardo posted for zwt8.

records.text: great as the recipe says !.

records.name: white cheddar scalloped potatoes
records.text: 2nd place taste of home winner.

records.name: jalapeno cream cheese baby back rib pinwheels
records.text: this one's easy. it's relatively quick to prepare though there is marinating involved. you can ask your butcher to cut the baby back ribs in half lengthwise or take a bone saw to them yourself to make narrowed strips. this is delicious and juicy.

records.name: corny chicken tacos

records.text: another great recipe from my local newspaper.

records.name: caramelized sweet potato  or squash  pizza

records.name: caramelized sweet potato  or squash  pizza
records.text: we used red onion and a whole wheat, premade pizza round. i'd suggest tailoring the spices to taste. the original may be found here: http://www. vegetariantimes. com/recipes/8860?utm_source=vegetarian&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=content.

records.name: lentil and almond burgers
records.text: a healthy choice!  serve with salad or chutney. from aol food. prep time includes chill time.

records.name: cranberry apple ginger sauce
records.text: use only granny smith apples or a similar firm apple, this is a fantastic cranberry sauce recipe, and one that you will be making all time once you taste it! if you prefer a less sweeter sauce then reduce the sugar by a couple of tablespoons.

records.name: cranberry apple ginger sauce
records.text: if you don't have a cinnamon stick just add in a pinch of cinnamon powder, or omit the cinnamon completely. plan ahead the sauce needs to chill for a minimum of 3 hours before using.

records.text: these cookies are light, lemony, and just melt in your mouth and you can't eat just one! my sister-in-law found them in the paper and they were wonderful i have to share!.

records.name: spicy grilled fish
records.text: this is a really tasty, economical and different way to enjoy fish! lots of flavor from the marinade and easy clean up! winners in my book. i am sure this would work very well on any firm, mild fish.

records.text: when i made this i was a little crunched in the time department so i only got to marinade it for 1 hour and it was delicious. plan ahead! this is best marinated for at least an hour but no more than 2 hours.

records.name: spicy grilled fish
records.text: in a pinch, just let it marinate while the grill is heating.

records.name: chilean butternut squash casserole

records.name: chilean butternut squash casserole
records.text: i've changed this recipe only slightly from the chilean squash in the moosewood cookbook. you can substitute mashed pumpkin or yams (unsweetened, of course!), but the butternut is best and worth the effort.

records.name: chilean butternut squash casserole
records.text: a tip for easier clean up: i just mash the squash right in the casserole and mix everything there. i wipe off the upper sides wih a clean, damp dish towel and pop it in the oven.

records.name: chilean butternut squash casserole
records.text: i've been tempted to add a cup or two of cooked rice or other grain to make it even more hardy, but i haven't tried that yet. note: cook time does not include time for baking the squash; that can be done ahead and refrigerated.

records.text: this recipe was on the back of a bottle of heinz 57 sauce years ago and i lost the recipe. it recently popped back up in an ore ida ad for their grillers. the chicken is so easy and tastes so good, so i'm putting it in food. com for safe keeping.

records.name: crisp rice date nut balls
records.text: this is good to make at christmas and give as gifts.

records.name: chili s white chocolate molten cake

records.name: chili s white chocolate molten cake
records.text: also, this is way too easy to taste so good!.

records.text: i don't know shep ogden is but he makes some neat little pickles. cooking time is chill time.

records.text: this has became a favorite of mine; just put it in the crockpot and forget about it for a few hours.

records.text: my husband made this for dinner last night, i don't know where he got the recipe, but man.

records.name: lime chicken linguine w cilantro cream sauce   roasted zucch
records.text: it was like eating in a 5 star restaurant! don't let all the steps and ingredients scare you off, this recipe is for the entire meal! the flavour reminded me of being in costa rica :) prep time is marinating time.

records.name: chicken atop rice

records.text: who doesn't like a good tart ;)  a simon rimmer recipe from delicious magazine.

records.text: this is so delectable. what else can i say!? i love pumpkin!.

records.text: thie loaf is really like a cake with the caramelized banana. it's beautiful. from rachael ray.
