records.name: tuscan red  white   green pasta sauce
records.text: the only chopping needed is for the onion and garlic and you can even buy those pre-chopped, too! prep time does not include thawing the spinach.

records.name: shaker fried apples
records.text: note:  after fiddling with the conversions to quarts and lbs, i discovered this is for a huge crowd!  so. i cut the recipe way down!  while on a family vacation, we visited shaker village at pleasant hill in mercer co. kentucky.

records.name: shaker fried apples
records.text: this is the largest restored shaker village in the us. if you are not familiar with the shakers, they are the members of the united society of believers in christ's second coming.

records.name: shaker fried apples
records.text: they led a very humble life, believing in celibacy, separation (men on one side of the house, women on the other), and the philosophy of "hands to work, heart's to god".

records.name: shaker fried apples
records.text: their contributions to agriculture, handcrafting, and furniture construction is awesome. google "shakers" and see for yourself. this recipe is served at the trustee's house lodging and is part of what they call "daily fare".

records.name: shaker fried apples
records.text: they are simply delicious and wonderful served with a slab of butter and a homemade biscuit. cook time is approximate, as it depends on how hot your "low" is.

records.name: very best banana loaf
records.text: this banana bread is, without a doubt, one of the very best i have ever made. the loaves have a very nice deep color and a beautiful crumb. the secret is not the unusual liquid ingredient, the secret is slow baking.

records.name: very best banana loaf
records.text: oil makes this recipe parve, (thanks mirj for explaining this to me & chia and miraklegirl for your help too).

records.name: green and gold casserole
records.text: this meatless side-dish casserole was affectionately dubbed "trough delight" by my husband. it's rich and tasty and is a huge hit at potlucks. you could even cut them up small and serve as appetizers.

records.name: green and gold casserole
records.text: from my well-used recipe card i think this came from better homes and gardens, 1987. it's so good! i hope you try it!.

records.name: orange brunch cake
records.text: the presidents' own white house cookbook, by jones. a nice coffee cake.

records.name: aromatic pumpkin chili
records.text: this recipe came about because i was craving a "different" kind of chili. pumpkin immediately came to my mind. the smell that filled my house while simmering was amazing!  this chili was thick and creamy, not much color but delicious!.

records.name: chicken and rice cheesy casserole
records.text: this is a quick meal using campbell's healthy request cream of chicken. i get this ready the night before and throw it in the oven at noon or morning, set the timer and come home to a hot, healthy dinner.

records.name: creamy green bean salad with horseradish   bacon
records.text: posted for a request. i have not tried this yet. adapted from.

records.name: deep fried turkey flavor injector marinade
records.text: dominick came up with this delicious creation. it was a big hit!.

records.name: spicy seafood stew
records.text: this zippy stew is very easy and quick to prepare.

records.name: rescued turkey stock
records.text: i call this "rescued", because so many people throw away the turkey carcass after a big meal. don't! rescue it! making stock is not hard or complicated.

records.name: rescued turkey stock
records.text: you'll be rewarded with delicious soup, and an amazing aroma will fill your home as you make the stock. and you don't even have to make soup right away -- just freeze the stock!.

records.name: quick avgolemano  orzo and chicken soup
records.text: found this in cooking light, january 2006, and we had it for lunch the day after christmas. we served this with a green tossed salad with bottled greek dressing and ricotta-garlic pita wedges will post this recipe as well.

records.name: quick avgolemano  orzo and chicken soup
records.text: avgolemano(ahv-goh-leh-moh-noh) is a tangy greek soup that combines chicken broth, eggs, and lemon juice. traditional versions include rice; this interpretation, uses orzo.

records.name: quick avgolemano  orzo and chicken soup
records.text: the soup can be made up to three days ahead and refrigerate but do not freeze. just reheat over low-low heat.

records.name: tgi friday s spinach and artichoke dip
records.text: this is always requested at potlucks and dinner parties!.

records.name: nana s fruit loaf
records.text: my mummys nana invented this fruit loaf, and it is to die for and so impossibly simple and quick to make. and for a bonus, it's egg free.

records.name: red pepper and sun dried tomato pate
records.text: lovely on crostini.

records.name: simply delicious pineapple crab tarts  sp5
records.text: official contest entry: simply potatoes 5fix. simple and easy appetizers, good for that special occasion or just anytime! if you really want to "wow" your guests, just serve these at your next dinner party.

records.name: simply delicious pineapple crab tarts  sp5
records.text: who can resist that creamy goodness inside a crunchy baked phyllo cup!.

records.name: braided sesame seed bread
records.text: this is the first bread i ever made when i was a kid. i consider it fail-proof, and it's very good. preparation time doesn't include rising time.

records.name: orange rice   spice breakfast
records.text: an interesting and flavorful change from oatmeal. this is sort of like a healthy breakfast version of rice pudding. this can be made much easier and faster by using 2 cups cooked brown rice.

records.name: orange rice   spice breakfast
records.text: you could also use soymilk/powdered soymilk for the milk/milk powder. cook time is for cooking rice, prep time is for heating the whole mixture, although heating time will be longer if you use cold leftover rice.

records.name: orange rice   spice breakfast
records.text: recipe is credited to julie delaplane of anderson, indiana and is from the la leche league international cookbook "whole foods for the whole family. ".

records.name: healthy applesauce pancakes with no sugar added
records.text: these pancakes freeze very well!  make them small for toddlers to hold or larger for the rest of the family. i like to use flavored (blueberry, strawberry, etc) applesauce without any added sugar.

records.name: healthy applesauce pancakes with no sugar added
records.text: if you use a flavored applesauce, you may omit the vanilla flavoring. the flavors are great so that there is no need for syrup!  this recipe is adapted from www. wholesometoddlerfood. com.

records.name: plum   ginger chicken
records.text: more chicken.

records.name: outrageous muffins with soy flour from bob s red mill
records.text: this recipe was on the front of the soy flour package - and now that my package is empty i want to make sure i don't lose the recipe. these are fantastic muffins.

records.name: outrageous muffins with soy flour from bob s red mill
records.text: i've played around with the quantities of dry ingredients a few times based on what i had on hand, and they still turned out really well. but the best batch was the one that followed the recipe to a "t". if you decide to try them, enjoy!.

records.name: how to seed a pomegranate
records.text: this instruction comes from pom  to teach you how to open a pomegranate. i love pomegranates but i have always found them difficult to use!.

records.name: lou s mango pie
records.text: i just made it up after getting a good deal on mangoes. if available, use appleton estate jamaica rum. please, no light rums or spiced rums.

records.name: peanut butter  jelly  and chip sandwich
records.text: my younger brother and i would always take our potato chips and put them inside our pb&j sandwich. we loved the crunch! and, the saltiness of the chips really off-sets the sweetness of the sandwich.

records.name: peanut butter  jelly  and chip sandwich
records.text: i think we got the idea from an episode of the cosby show after seeing cliff huxtable line his hoagie with potato chips and wash it all down with grape soda!.

records.name: egg and watercress tea sandwiches
records.text: just like the dainty sandwiches served at harrods! for a less traditional tea sandwich, you can use pumpernickel, rye or sourdough bread, thinly sliced.

records.name: egg and watercress tea sandwiches
records.text: for a visual treat, garnish the patter of sandwiches with edible flowers such as pansies or nasturtiums, along with the watercress.

records.name: tuna  or fish or chicken  with ginger shiitake cream sauce
records.text: excellent, no-fail and incredibly simple. guests are always floored by this recipe! i adapted it from bon appetit. get all of your ingredients ready before you begin (mise en place), as the cooking goes quickly.

records.name: tuna  or fish or chicken  with ginger shiitake cream sauce
records.text: also, be sure to use regular full-fat whipping cream -- the flavor of the cream is key to this and low-fat substitutions won't work well.

records.name: tuna  or fish or chicken  with ginger shiitake cream sauce
records.text: if you decide to substitute chicken breasts for the tuna, decrease the heat and increase the cooking time to thoroughly cook the chicken. serve on a bed of baby greens, alongside wasabi mashed potatoes. perfection!.

records.name: mary s savory marinara sauce
records.text: this is my mom's delicious marinara sauce recipe that she kindly provided to me. i have fond memories of her making this sauce often and filling the entire house with its wonderful aroma.

records.name: mary s savory marinara sauce
records.text: it has a savory tomato-y taste, a nice hint of basil, and goes well with all types of pasta (including lasagna). i also like to use it for homemade meatball heroes. i hope that you all will enjoy it as much as we do!.

records.name: mom s cauliflower salad
records.text: a great salad that uses uncooked vegetables. it is crisp and tasty. the green olives and bacon give it a great taste.

records.name: uncle dobos ramen omelet
records.text: this is a very popular recipe with my family of sisters and their kids. both my sisters claim this recipe as "theirs. "  ;)  good for breakfast or even dinner. i’ve heard that a lot of college kids and bachelors like this one, too.

records.name: uncle dobos ramen omelet
records.text: it tastes great, but since it’s full of butter, noodles, and cheese it’s not something i make often.

records.name: prohibition mary pickford cocktail
records.text: along with her husband, douglas fairbanks, the golden-haired mary pickford was at the pinnacle of the first generation of movie royalty. this 1920s cuban concoction does her honor. http://www. prohibitionrepeal. com/history/cocktails. asp.

records.name: crepes  aux fines herbes
records.text: another great recipe from my friend, gaye. these crepes will enhance any seafood or poultry filling. i use them when i make gaye's recipe for chicken crepes in sherried mornay sauce,#225193.

records.name: crepes  aux fines herbes
records.text: you can place waxed or parchment paper between each crepe and freeze them for later use. prep time does not include refrigerated time.

records.name: crunchy chinese cucumber salad
records.text: a lovely crunchy salad which takes a bit more time than a simple cucumber salad, but it's really worth it! goes well as a starter or a side dish with a chinese meal.

records.name: crunchy chinese cucumber salad
records.text: cooking time includes leaving the cucumbers in salted water for 20 minutes and standing time (to develop the flavour of the salad) of 2 hours.

records.name: chicken mushroom leek wraps
records.text: you can use any kind of chicken you want. this makes a nice, light lunch that the kids and i love, believe it or not. i got the idea from chuck in killbuck's recipe for portabello and leek rollups #39883.

records.name: chicken mushroom leek wraps
records.text: i tried to make it but couldn't find any good bok choy, had some different cheese on hand, and thus this knock off was born.

records.name: devilishly moist chocolate cake
records.text: tish boyle.

records.name: vickie s quick   easy jambalaya
records.text: after watching so many people cook jambalaya in my lifetime i thought that there had to be a easier and quicker way to get that great flavor on a busy schedule.

records.name: vickie s quick   easy jambalaya
records.text: this is what i came up with on evening and my family fell in love and have shared with lots of friends. enjoy!!!.

records.name: margaritas made with beer
records.text: from a real estate flyer for beach rentals!  i love to find recipes in surprise places like this. doesn't say how many this serves so i am guessing 4.

records.name: twilight zone
records.text: this is a very pretty drink ; ).

records.name: easy pie crust
records.text: this crust you can make with you mixer and it is very tasty.

records.name: lemon ice cream  without ice cream maker
records.text: a wonderful real lemon ice cream, reminds me of lemon sherbet but creamier. easy to make and refreshing on hot days. make sure you squeeze fresh lemons for this one. bottled lemon juice just doesn't measure up in this recipe.

records.name: lemon ice cream  without ice cream maker

records.name: tilapia   summer vegetable packet

records.name: ceviche with ahi tuna

records.name: ceviche with ahi tuna

records.name: ceviche with ahi tuna

records.text: an awesome copycat recipe for souper salad chicken enchilada soup.

records.name: carrot soup with a secret
records.text: i make this soup for my kids. they love the colour, but i also tell them it is "cheese soup" and they eat their veggies without even knowing it!  that is my little secret! it is basically just carrots, some orange squash, and cheese.

records.text: i also make it in a fairly large batch and freeze some for later. for the squash, use any orange fleshed kind. for this one, i used butternut.

records.name: apricot and raisin butter cake

records.name: apricot and raisin butter cake
records.text: tips: if you're making the whole recipe, you may use a bundt pan. if halving the recipe, use a 8" square or round pan.

records.name: arrachera beef marinade
records.text: when not in mexico i use this recipe to make my own arrachera beef, a marinaded flank steak. the beef is perfect for tacos, fajitas or chili. please note that cooking time is actually the minimum time needed to marinade.

records.name: weight watcher jerk chicken

records.name: tropical peach colada

records.name: curried cauliflower or  gobi gobi
records.text: this is kind of a reinterpretation of the classic aloo gobi, only not by the braise process. because the cauliflower emits so much water, it doesn't need to be braised but somewhat steamed for a lighter crisper texture.

records.text: found this recipe on a freebie forum i visit. sounds yummy.

records.name: whole wheat pretzels

records.name: broiled chicken deluxe

records.name: tofu pad thai

records.name: wicklewood s not hot but smokin  chilli
records.text: if you do want some extra heat just add 1/2 teaspoon of chilli powder or a few dashes of tobasco. delicious served with plain boiled rice or favourite savoury rice, we prefer my  aztec rice #448815.

records.name: comfort soup  spinach   meatballs
records.text: update: the meat juices are what make the flavor of the broth, so if the beef is too lean (or not enough is used), there won't be an oily sheen to the soup, which is what gives it the wonderful taste.

records.name: high altitude oatmeal raisin cookies

records.name: festive hot broccoli dip

records.name: christmas tree hunting punch

records.name: christmas tree hunting punch
records.text: when you find the perfect tree, then pour a cup of punch, nibble on some christmas cookies you also thoughtfully packed (needing nourishment after all that hunting!), and enjoy the scenery.

records.name: christmas tree hunting punch
records.text: if you're lucky there will be some beautifully falling snowflakes to add to the anticipation. double or triple the recipe for a crowd--this freezes and thaws nicely for another occasion, too.

records.name: christmas tree hunting punch

records.name: cinnamon applesauce jello

records.name: chicago style hot dogs and fries
records.text: the famous chicago style hot dog was born when street cart hot dog vendors came onto the hard times of the great depression.

records.name: chicago style hot dogs and fries
records.text: money was scarce, but business was booming for these entrepreneurs who offered a delicious hot meal on a bun for only a nickel yes only a nickle.

records.name: chicago style hot dogs and fries
records.text: they'd start with a vienna beef hot dog, nestle it in a steamed poppy seed bun and cover it with a wonderful combination of toppings.

records.name: chicago style hot dogs and fries
records.text: this unique hot dog creation with a "salad on top" and its memorable interplay of hot and cold, crisp and soft, sharp and smooth, became america's original fast food and a true chicago delight.

records.text: i threw this together with what i had on hand, wanting something "asian". i couldn't think of a name for it, so when a student tasted it, i decided to name it for her.

records.text: roasted sweet potatoes combined with the flavor of coconut and spicy gingersnaps cookies in the crust. recipe from whole foods. prep time does not include baking time for sweet potatoes.

records.name: cranberry mince pie
records.text: i adopted this recipe from the recipezaar account and made it for christmas. i am not a fan of mincemeat but with the cranberries and the egg nog cream it was quite tasty.

records.name: anthony s chicken
records.text: lightly breaded chicken breast covered with a honey mustard barbecue sauce containing chopped bacon, diced tomatoes and onions. this dish is baked over pasta topped with monterey jack cheese.

records.name: ground beef cannelloni
records.text: i won't lie, this recipe is a lot of work, high in fat and high in calories. it will take a couple hours to make and i only do it once year on my husband's birthday. all that said, it is so worth it.

records.name: ground beef cannelloni
records.text: if you want to break you diet this is the one to do it with. my mother says she got the recipe when my father was stationed in germany in the 70's. i don't think she even remembers the original source any longer.

records.name: ground beef cannelloni
records.text: of note: i have never used the chicken livers, but the original recipe does call for them. plum tomatoes are difficult to find these days and you can substitute any canned tomato you like.

records.name: kenny s farmer skillet
records.text: my granddad was a farmer and made this frequently for my mother during her childhood. mom made it for me as breakfast or anytime. i've left this recipe in its most basic form.

records.name: kenny s farmer skillet
records.text: it's not that it can't be gourmet, i just believe that its grandest statement is about cooking convenience and instant belly comfort. to me, that has its own five star merits.

records.name: kenny s farmer skillet
records.text: of course, you could add onions and peppers, different cheeses,  bacon or ham, leftovers from the fridge, or fancy spice blends. i make it a priority to cook a couple of extra baked potatoes to save for making this later. and it is always good.

records.name: baked garlic rice pilaf
records.text: this is so good, it's hard to stop eating it. great texture with crunchy edges, great flavor with garlic and black pepper. i like to serve it with poultry, pork, or fish. plan ahead, it bakes for 70 minutes.

records.name: fizzing sherbet powder  candy powder
records.text: posted in response to a request. this is a homemade version of the fruit-flavored candy powder that's sold in little cardboard sticks. you can lick off a spoon, or a straw, or even a licorice tube.

records.name: fizzing sherbet powder  candy powder
records.text: i haven't tried it, but someone else has and said it came out very good. and since it wasn't here on zaar, now it is!.

records.name: crock pot pork and beans
records.text: these are so good. they were brought to a pot luck at work. my husband loves this recipe so i make it often. servings are approximate. overnight standing time is not included.

records.name: cumberland cranberry orange nut bread
records.text: my mother makes this every christmas to give out with her cookie packages. i love it and can never get enough.

records.name: easy apple cider

records.name: halibut with herbed vegetable quartet
records.text: this was so good. points. 8.

records.name: midwinter chili
records.text: when it comes to chili i am an addict. i see a recipe i try it. this recipe is an accumulation of what worked in all those attempts. it is a great recipe.

records.name: chili s honey mustard dressing
records.text: i worked at chili's for years, here is how we made the honey mustard dressing. you won't believe how easy it is. i used to make this stuff by the gallon in the kitchen every week.

records.name: favorite popovers
records.text: my brother is diabetic and because these popovers have such little flour, he loves them. i have these down to a science -- very little cleanup. these are delicious and light.

records.name: mushroom sauce for bbq meats
records.text: for this recipe use either the cottage cheese or sour cream - you really can tell very little difference. make in advance, if you wish and just reheat. i don't like my sauce too thick but add a bit more flour if it is too thin for your liking.

records.name: mushroom sauce for bbq meats
records.text: add garlic, hot peppers whatever you fancy, this is just the base recipe.

records.name: the mansion s chicken tortilla soup
records.text: this soup is almost addictive!  tried to find something to match the puerto vallarta but i think this may be better!    love it!!!!.

records.text: from ww website everyday gourmets makes 6 servings  points® value 1,  per ½-cup serving:.

records.text: i had this soup at a church dinner. i couldn't believe how tasty it was, for just having simple ingredients. this soup really hits the spot.

records.name: daube de boeuf
records.text: posted by request,from fine cooking 3/07.

records.name: vegetarian swedish meatballs
records.text: i grew up loving swedish meatballs and wanted a vegetarian substitute. i even suprised myself with its wonderful taste and texture. i served it with mashed potatoes (the extra sauce around the meatballs makes great gravy) and brussel sprouts.

records.name: cinnamon oatcakes

records.name: sir james s beetroot salad

records.name: sir james s beetroot salad

records.name: pumpkin pie crunch  light version
records.text: my whole family loves pumpkin pie crunch, which is a simple dessert that tastes like pumpkin pie with a buttery crumb topping. however, the fat and calories in the original version are deadly.

records.name: pumpkin pie crunch  light version
records.text: in this lightened version, the fat and calories are basically cut in half, without much sacrafice in flavor. nov.

records.name: pumpkin pie crunch  light version

records.name: cooked potato or pasta salad dressing

records.name: malaysian laksa
records.text: laksa is a malaysian soup made from laksa flavour spicy curry, coconut cream, noodles, prawns/shrimp, chicken and lots of fresh toppings.

records.name: malaysian laksa
records.text: this recipe is considered to be a cheat version because it uses laksa paste, however the results are still very yummy. you can vary the ingredients in the soup to your own taste.

records.name: malaysian laksa

records.name: malaysian laksa
records.text: this recipe is from sbs's food safari and is made by aryan mansor.

records.name: steak paste

records.name: all purpose mexican seasoning
records.text: combine with oil and use it to marinate corn, chickpeas, potatoes, and beans for a crispy healthy snack, and it's also great for tacos, fajitas, quesadillas, and i swear by this seasoning for my arroz con frijoles.

records.name: all purpose mexican seasoning

records.name: easy red kidney beans   brown rice with chili flavors  vegan

records.name: easy red kidney beans   brown rice with chili flavors  vegan
records.text: and healthy brown rice! i had a few green onions so i added them for pleasing color and flavor, made a nice burrito base with queso blanco, spinach, and tofu!.

records.name: sloppy joe meatballs paula deen style
records.text: this recipe comes from paula deen's magazine. i added green pepper to her recipe and i also put these meatballs in my crockpot after baking them instead of back in the oven.

records.name: artichoke and basil dip

records.name: mackinac island style fudge
records.text: ah mackinac island, a michigan tourism paradise known for its horse-drawn carriages, lilacs, the grand hotel [scene of the movie "somewhere in time"] and, oh yes, fudge.

records.name: mackinac island style fudge
records.text: wander through the streets and about every 3rd or 4th shop you pass will be a fudge shop, and you'll usually be able to watch the freshly boiled up fudge being spread and cooled on a marble slab.

records.name: mackinac island style fudge
records.text: it's strangely addicting watching this process, and if you hang around awhile you'll get a sample eventually. this recipe purports to be an authentic version, though no particular fudge shop was mentioned as owning the recipe.

records.name: mackinac island style fudge
records.text: the initial recipe is for a vanilla fudge. chocolate fudge and peanut butter fudge variations follow, so read through the entire recipe if you want to make either of those flavors.

records.name: spinach noodle kugel  dairy
records.text: kugels are so easy to make and there are so many varieties. this is from ida loverde, "from our jersey shore kitchens",(1982). it is kosher as a dairy dish since it has sour cream and butter.

records.name: cathy   gary s cornbread
records.text: i don't know where c & g got this recipe. it has no oil or shortening in it, yet, it doesn't taste lacking. although it is best slathered with butter.

records.name: cathy   gary s cornbread
records.text: freezes really well, i cut it into quarters and freeze them individually so you take out only what you need. great with chilis or soups for a quick dinner. it also seems to go down well on the patio with a glass of wine! :).

records.name: oven fried chicken your way
records.text: i recommend serving it with roasted potatoes (get them in the oven before you even start breading the chicken) -- toss raw potato chunks with olive oil, kosher salt and the same spice blend you use with the chicken (roast for about 45 minutes).

records.name: oven fried chicken your way
records.text: yum!.

records.name: brazilian beer chicken

records.name: brazilian beer chicken

records.name: brazilian beer chicken
records.text: try, if possible, to find a brazilian beer if you can: antarctica (a pilsener-style brew) will produce a mild-flavored chicken; xingu black beer (a dark bitter stout) will produce a bird with a rich, malty flavor.

records.name: brazilian beer chicken

records.name: onion cheese bread  bread making machine

records.name: venezuelan pepito sandwich   pepito venezolano
records.text: the pepito is a venezuelan street food favorite: a beef (or chicken) sandwich, drenched with sauces and condiments. the beef is seasoned with worcestershire sauce (salsa negra) and garlic.

records.name: venezuelan pepito sandwich   pepito venezolano
records.text: the bread is a large soft hoagie-like roll, and the condiments typically include lettuce, tomato, carrots, cabbage, and many sauces, such as guasacaca (an avocado relish, which i have posted a recipe for), bbq sauce, ketchup, mayo, mustard, etc.

records.name: venezuelan pepito sandwich   pepito venezolano
records.text: the whole thing is topped off with crispy potato sticks.

records.name: venezuelan pepito sandwich   pepito venezolano
records.text: unfortunately, this site would not allow me to post all of these options in the ingredient list, but please choose from these suggestions!  when you buy a pepito from a street vendor, there are usually many sauces to choose from and you can customize your order.

records.name: chocolate royal icing
records.text: i tried to make brown royal icing to decorate bear shaped cookies. but even with good quality food color paste, i couldn't get it dark enough. this was the answer.

records.text: this is a sauce my mom would always put on baked chicken or country style pork ribs. this is a tangy and sweet sauce.

records.text: this is a recipe i made up as my dd and myself love a good spanish rice. it is very easy and so yummy.

records.text: tropical hawaiian bread made with mangoes and macadamia nuts with warming spices of cinnamon, cloves, allspice, ginger and yes a pinch of cayenne pepper.

records.text: throw it all together and put it on some toast.

records.name: curried chicken salad   something natural  nantucket
records.text: from the something natural restaurant in nantucket, ma as seen on rachael ray's $40 a day. this is a very flavorful, no mayonnaise, chicken salad that is excellent served on croissants, multi-grain bread or salad greens.

records.name: curried chicken salad   something natural  nantucket
records.text: i have adapted to use 1/2 c. sour cream and 1/2 c. yogurt rather than 1 c. yogurt. be sure to taste as you season because flavor may vary depending on the strength of your curry powder and dijon mustard.

records.name: chocolate peanut butter tofu mousse
records.text: this is heavenly and high protein.

records.name: dairy free ranch dressing  tofu
records.text: i am allergic to all dairy and miss ranch dressing so very much!  here is a version i came up with to satisfy my craving. tastes almost like the real thing!.

records.name: allessio s frittata   tomatoes and sweet peppers
records.text: a simple delicious frittata with a little heat to it. i bake it in the oven at 325, i find it easier, however whichever you prefer.

records.name: smoked sausage  butternut squash and wild rice soup
records.text: this is an emeril recipe. i made it for thanksgiving and it was soooo good!  i thought i'd share.

records.name: smoked sausage  butternut squash and wild rice soup
records.text: it was a bit time consuming but so worth it!  also, if you don't know how to work with whole squash (i didn't) - here's a very helpful link to cut and paste in your browser - http://www. youtube. com/watch?v=prl-jjg2byy.

records.name: shrimp salad spread
records.text: an adaptation of paula dean's sandwich spread, but made for dipping. it can be inexpensive and the best at the party! a food processer dream recipie.

records.name: junior league  roquefort pear salad w grapes   spiced pecans
records.text: roquefort pear salad with grapes and spiced pecans.

records.name: one pan pork chops
records.text: this a recipe i came across while looking for easy recipes that are a little different than my usual pasta. im not a big fan of pork so i never make chops but these you cant go wrong with.

records.name: lemon bbq beef ribs
records.text: (don't tell anybody, but these also happen to be lowcarb. thing is, people won't notice, they're so tasty!!)  :).

records.name: shrimp ceviche
records.text: this is my twist on the traditional mexican ceviche (which differs from that of south american cuisine). it's a very colorful and appealing appetizer dish, and is exceptionally low in calories.

records.name: shrimp ceviche
records.text: the shrimp is "cooked" chemically by the acid in the lime juice, rather than physically (with heat). you may substitute a good-quality white fish, such as halibut or mahi-mahi, for the shrimp, if desired.

records.name: shrimp ceviche
records.text: depending on how fast and skilled you are with your knives, and whether you use fresh-squeezed or bottled lime juice, the initial prep for this ceviche can take anywhere from 15 to 60 minutes.

records.name: dot s special brownies
records.text: this recipe has been handed down from my mom to me just recently. the original recipe was from my aunt's personal recipe collection. they freeze very well for make ahead treats.

records.name: dot s special brownies
records.text: this recipe uses oats, chocolate chips and has a nice orange glaze that is poured over the top of the brownies once they are removed from the oven.

records.name: carrot raisin quick bread
records.text: another gem i found through cooking light magazine. this gives a very moist and packed with flavor quick bread that is lower in calories than a cake.

records.name: carrot raisin quick bread
records.text: i like to add chopped walnuts or pecans to the bread but the original recipe does not call for them so i left it as written. it is also fun to add about a 1/2 cup of shredded unsweetened coconut for a fun twist.

records.name: steak   mushroom hoagies
records.text: this is just one of those baked sandwiches that you get a craving for every once in a while. this is good.

records.name: yellow rice casserole  vegetarian
records.text: a family friend first turned me on to this dish. i warn you, it's addicting. feel free to adapt to your personal taste (ie change the type of soup, heat of rotel, etc. ). one of the many wonderful things about a casserole.

records.name: yellow rice casserole  vegetarian
records.text: if vegetarian, please read the food labels before you buy. most yellow rice mixes and cream soups contain chicken product. the ingredients i use below are completely vegetarian.

records.name: snap beans and potatoes
records.text: eating home grown snap beans (green beans) is a rite of summer. this is a simple southern side dish that my entire family loves.

records.name: maple pork

records.name: gypsy pork steaks
records.text: a simple way to do pork on the outdoor grill or under the broiler in cooler weather.

records.name: mediterranean stuffed eggplant   low carb and primal paleo
records.text: this stuffed eggplant recipe is phenomenal and very versatile. use the meat "stuffing" to fill mushrooms and bake for delicious party appetizers. it makes 4 servings. but you may just want to eat the entire recipe yourself.

records.name: mediterranean stuffed eggplant   low carb and primal paleo
records.text: this is intentionally a low carb, high fat (lchf) recipe. if you want to tone down the fat content, feel free to reduce the amounts of cooking fat used, or substitute olive oil. enjoy!.

records.name: mini grasshopper cheesecakes
records.text: a thin mint cookie for a base and a  yummy green filling. perfect for st patricks day or anytime. a big hit with kids too. my own creation. you will need 18-24 foil cupcake liners for these.

records.name: fried oreos

records.name: apple crumble  known as apple cracknell from sussex uk

records.name: apple crumble  known as apple cracknell from sussex uk
records.text: i find 1/4 to 1/2 cup is enough for my 'taste'. source: favourite sussex recipes by pat smith.

records.text: this is always a crowd pleaser. i received this recipe from my sister in-law susan. this dish is always empty at the end of a party. easy on clean-up.

records.name: malted milk chocolate chip cookies   wow
records.text: wow! my dh won't let me make any other chocolate chip cookies since he's had these. if you like malted milk, these are the cookies for you!!! enjoy!.

records.name: layered pumpkin cranberry bread mix in a jar
records.text: this makes a lovely home made gift to give to friends and family.

records.text: of course, cheese could also be added for non-vegans.

records.name: pasta with chicken in a light white wine and fresh herb sauce

records.name: pasta with chicken in a light white wine and fresh herb sauce

records.name: fluffy apple pudding
records.text: mum is not sure where she got this recipe, although she and my aunty are certain it was from their aunty may. this is such a yummy pudding. you really need a mixer such as a kitchen aid for perfect results, but hand mixing is fine.

records.name: fluffy apple pudding
records.text: this is excellent re-heated.

records.text: my mom helped come up with this one. it's a good way to sneak in a serving of vegetables plus it's tasty.

records.name: the best vegetarian pizza
records.text: this is the best veggie pizza i have ever had, and i do not like veggies but i will eat them just for this recipe. it is a two step process making your sauce and then cutting up all of your veggies for toppings.

records.text: it is a very cool and refreshing taste i love to eat my cold pizza and drink a big glass of lemon sweet tea on ice.

records.text: "this is a really nice indian recipe, taught to me by an elderly indian lady, who used to cook for all her family. it is a simple recipe and tastes lovely served with rice. you can also use mutton instead of chicken. ".

records.name: ham
records.text: a delicious ham. different from the usual pineapple ham.

records.name: kenner patton s  my chicken
records.text: this is an interesting recipe that i found in a cookbook called "bbq nation" from fred thompson. you marinate the chicken, grill it and then steam the chicken.

records.name: kenner patton s  my chicken

records.name: kenner patton s  my chicken
records.text: i have estimated the time to grill the chicken, it will depend on what pieces you use and their size.

records.name: grilled steak with bourbon sauce
records.text: i found this gem in a food and drink magazine the local liquor store gives out.

records.name: the best poultry stuffing ever

records.name: the best poultry stuffing ever
records.text: the only change i have made to it is to add the 3 whole eggs. the recipe is for a 20-25 pound turkey, but if you make one third of the recipe, it makes more than enough for a 12-15 pound bird. you'll never use another recipe after this one.

records.name: the best poultry stuffing ever
records.text: i've also baked it outside the bird in a greased casserole at 350 degrees for about 1-1 1/2 hours.

records.text: made for good things are cooking here!! (a non-cooking game) in the australian/new zealand cooking forum - http://www. recipezaar. com/bb/viewtopic. zsp?t=233992   please note that the marinating time isn't included in the prep time.

records.name: coconut rum preserve
records.text: i posted this before i had actually made it, when i was gathering recipes & ingredients. since it <sounds> so good, i may try this again, adding some pectin. other suggestions welcome!].

records.name: peach and passionfruit pavlova roll
records.text: i found this delicious sounding recipe here: http://www. taste. com. au/recipes/19222/peach+and+passionfruit+pavlova+roll.

records.name: iron curtain goulashsuppe
records.text: during the cold war i zig-zagged across the iron curtain and found myself one day in buda- pest  the next day in prague, the next day in leipzig. i complied this pan central european beef stew by trying to take the best of each region.

records.name: iron curtain goulashsuppe
records.text: then i americanized it a bit, but mainly because the hungarian agent i stole the last bit from threatened me with a fate worse than death should he ever taste his great grandmothers goulash stateside.

records.name: iron curtain goulashsuppe
records.text: i contemplated killing him quietly, but decided to just tweak the recipe. his name was alton something. anyway.

records.name: herb and cheese pasta supreme
records.text: i toyed with some selected ingredients from the rsc #11 contest, added my own and came up with this delightful pasta recipe. my family fell in love with it and told me that it just could be a winner.

records.name: baked citrus apples and pears
records.text: this recipe is also good for children!.

records.name: cranberry orange cheesecake
records.text: cranberries are a yummy and healthy add-in to all sorts of recipes. they're available all year-round fresh, frozen or dried. everyone loves cheesecake and this one is high on our list of delicious. got this out of bh&g.

records.name: blitva  croatian swiss chard dish
records.text: it can be made more creamy when potatoes are very well cooked, or soupy when more liquid is preserved. on my scale this would be 3. 5 stars (please see how i rate recipes).

records.name: delicious chicken pot pie
records.text: this chicken pot pie recipe takes a little time, but it is well worth it!! this is an all-time favorite in our family. great on a cold winter day.

records.name: mexican ham and bean soup
records.text: perfect for a cold, wintry evening or lunch! this is a filling, good "comfort" food soup that will make your whole kitchen smell wonderful! serve with corn bread and a salad.

records.text: a really easy square recipe that i've made for christmas a number of times. i can't remember the original source, but it was handed down to me from my mom.

records.text: this is an easy, quick dinner. we love fajitas and stir-fry. i found this recipe on razzle dazzle recipes.

records.name: oriental hamburger dish
records.text: this quick and easy dish is so good over rice or noodles.

records.name: oil free oven fried rice
records.text: this is another recipe my bf's mother gave me that i have revamped and made healthier. the original recipe called for 1/2 cup oil which i felt was unnecessary, i removed it completely and the recipe still turned out great.

records.name: oil free oven fried rice
records.text: it also called for 3 ½ cups water and 2 chicken bouillon cubes; i cut down on the sodium by using low sodium chicken broth instead.

records.name: creamy pea   chive pearl barley risotto  reduced fat
records.text: i am a big fan of pearl barley as it is cheap, tasty, healthy and very filling. this sounds like a great new way to enjoy pearl barley with a bit of an italian flare. i originally found this recipe in the bbc good food magazine.

records.name: easy coconut drops

records.name: slow cook potato kugel  gluten free
records.text: potato kugel is always better the longer you bake it! so keep it in that oven!!! a good tip for potato kugel, is always to use a food processor - otherwise you end up with a gooey grey mess - and i don't know anyone that actually likes grey potato kugel! keep a bowl of cold water on had for your peeled potatoes as well, to keep them that much whiter!.

records.name: mongolian grill style mongolian  sauce
records.text: if you love the mongolian sauce at your favorite mongolian grill restaurant, then you'll love this recipe. the original version was a bit too sweet for me, so i just reduced the brown sugar to 1/4 cup instead of 1/2 cup.

records.name: mexican chickpea soup
records.text: from an old womean's day. yummy.

records.name: chocolate granola apple wedges
records.text: great after school snack for the kids, or a get together. can be easily doubled. braeburn, gala , and fuji apples will work for this.

records.name: grilled chicken pizza with alabama white sauce
records.text: you might love this so much, you will give up red sauce completely! i will be using mushrooms to replace the chicken to make this vegetarian. adapted from grilling. com and found posted on jenn's food journey.

records.name: vegetarian meatloaf that tastes like meatloaf

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: a translucent golden-brown crust allows the green of the avocado to be seen. the crispy exterior is a counterpoint to the unctuous interior.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: these are a signature dish for me, and the one i most often get requests to make (although my seafood and ricotta stuffed buckwheat pancakes run a close second).

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: these fritters came about ten years ago when i was shopping for a dinner i was making for a friend who is a cia-trained chef. i was in a vegetable market and saw these gorgeous avocados that i just knew would be ripe in the next two days.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: i tried to think of what i could do with them since a) everyone serves cold avocado, and b) i really am not fond of guacamole. as i tried to think of what i could make with them that was hot, the work 'fritters' jumped into my head.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: having never made a fritter before, i was a little surprised to have that thought; but having never known when a vegetable was going to be ripe before i figured i was on a roll and decided to go for it.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: to serve with my never-before-tried-fritters, i decided to make a crème fraîche-lime-cayenne dipping sauce.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: so i made fresh crème fraîche, and used it as a base not only for this dip, but for a tia maria sauce to go with the flourless chocolate cake i made for dessert (another never-before made item, but with the recipe from cook's illustrated it was the only thing i wasn't making up as i went along).

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: the result of the fritters was that i got to taste the test fritter, then had to dive across the couch before the last one was devoured in order to have a second.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: the one evolution in the recipe is the change from cayenne to chipotle in the dip. i like the smokiness, and it gives a rough edge to something very smooth - i am all about contrast.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: feel free to use whatever chile or combination thereof that you like best. this dip is easy and stands on it's own at a party for anything you want to dip into it. i have also made it with vegan sour cream with great results.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: the name alligator claws comes from an alternate name for the avocado: the alligator pear, as well as the fact that the wedges of avocado look like claws.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: (for those not familiar with the name alligator pear, it derives from both the tough, textured exterior - reminiscent of an alligator's hide, and the fact that you really can't eat one until it softens - just like a pear.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: )  alligator claws are also a great name to call them if you have kids who either won't eat anything that sounds weird and you want to keep them to yourself, or - if you want your kids to eat them - if you have kids who'll only eat things that will gross other people out.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: if you are preparing these for kids (and i recommend you do whatever name you choose to call them), protect their palates and tone down the heat of the sauce.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: maybe skip the chiles altogether and put in just a hint of finely ground pepper (white pepper won't look like black specks throughout the dip - i'm normally not that fussy, but it's something kids will notice).

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip
records.text: allow half an avocado per person. this is so rich that more is too much.

records.name: alligator claws  avocado fritters  with chipotle lime dip

records.name: zaar chat buffalo roast
records.text: this was a "group effort" other 'zaar members helped me too. buffalo is very lean. there is very little fat on it and it tends to be be tough. therefore you need to soak the roast in a brine solution for 48 hours before cooking it.

records.name: zaar chat buffalo roast
records.text: you can either use the recipe i have included or you can use dineals recipe #11266. i used that recipe and made a few changes to it to make my own recipe. it also needs to be slow cooked. buffalo is sweeter than beef.

records.name: zaar chat buffalo roast

records.name: clear gummy bear  cocktail

records.name: clear gummy bear  cocktail
records.text: what makes it different from the others is that it utilizes raspberry-infused vodka and a squeeze of fresh lime, which give this sweet drink a little something extra to enjoy.

records.name: clear gummy bear  cocktail
records.text: when mixed, this cocktail tastes and smells just like the popular candy called gummy bears.

records.name: chicken hurry
records.text: a quick chicken recipe, serve with plain white rice and steamed baby carrots.

records.name: spicy sushi sauce
records.text: this is japan's answer to mcdonald's special sauce. is this what you get with your sushi at a japanese restaurant? if not, it shoud be! adapted from joni marie. she has some great and creative recipes.

records.name: revamped fiber one chocolate cookies
records.text: i took the recipe for fiber one cookies and changed it up a little.

records.name: oreo cookie brownies
records.text: these sound heavenly!.

records.name: tanya s sweet chex mix
records.text: went to an alphabet pot luck tonight where everyone signed up to bring a dish that started with a particular letter of the alphabet. of all the dishes (and there were lots of yummy ones), this was my favorite.

records.name: tanya s sweet chex mix
records.text: i decided to name it after my friend's sweet daughter that made it.

records.name: salmon patties with mushroom sauce
records.text: the mushroom sauce brings a more elegant presentation to the salmon patty. although i like them by themselves as well!  original recipe posted by ruthie grajczyk.

records.name: ginger dressing
records.text: taken from a super food ideas magazine. japanese rice vinegar can be found in asian grocery stores. serve this dressing over a green salad.

records.name: dianne s eggplant parmesan
records.text: i love eggplant in any form or fashion and this recipe sounds simple and delicious. although the recipe does not call for a serving of pasta, this dish would be nice next to (or on top of) some angel hair pasta.

records.name: dianne s eggplant parmesan
records.text: this dish sounded so good while i was typing it that i sent my hubby to the corner grocery store for a few ingredients. looks like we will be having this for dinner tonight. recipe appears in the church supper cookbook.

records.name: spicy garbanzo soup
records.text: quick and easy. make it as spicy as you like!.

records.name: an indoor camembert picnic platter for parties and ftes
records.text: picnic like the french with a perfectly ripe camembert, some garlicky sausage and a fresh, crusty baguette - eh voila! no need to go outside for a picnic, if the weather is inclement; enjoy a picnic in your kitchen at the kitchen table, or use the cheese platter as a centrepiece for parties, fêtes, cocktails or social gatherings! lay a tartan rug on the table and use wicker baskets or a hamper if you wish.

records.name: an indoor camembert picnic platter for parties and ftes
records.text: be as "rustique" or as "chic" as you want to be! great for christmas, thanksgiving, new year, as well as for a summer picnics of course!.

records.name: double decadent brownie torte
records.text: fudgy rich, with a shiny chocolate glaze, this brownie torte will satisfy chocoholics! originally from a recipe card promotion i received years ago. the torte can be frozen, unglazed, by placing it unwrapped in the freezer.

records.name: double decadent brownie torte
records.text: when frozen through, wrap airtight. unwrap before thawing, then glaze.

records.name: bacon and horseradish dip
records.text: goes great with fresh chopped vegetables, crackers, and chips. be sure to have a lot ready for the guys when the sports game is on, cause it will go fast!.

records.name: new york style cheesecake adapted for india
records.text: a wonderful recipe for those who crave cheesecake in india where we can't get cream cheese. this is also low fat. very easy and quick. please let me know how yours turns out!.

records.name: amritsari fish  fried
records.text: this is a dish from punjab, india, and is sold in streets corner in amritsar. do not forget to squeeze lemon juice before eating. try with mint-cilantro chutney.

records.name: vegetable and noodle crunch
records.text: the yoghurt gives this dish an interesting tang. it also tastes good cold the next day.

records.name: scalloped potatoes and onions
records.text: this is the best potato and onion dish i've ever tried. i found the base recipe from allrecipes. com and doctored it up my way. i've even added cooked diced ham to this and it was outstanding!  enjoy! :o).

records.name: cold noodles with tempeh
records.text: from the vegetarian times magazine april 2000. really great recipe, exotic taste but without exotic ingredients.

records.name: chicken italian style saltimbocca
records.text: simple fast, and tasty. ingredients always in the house.

records.name: scalloped potatoes  no dairy
records.text: this is from a dairy-free cookbook. i think it's a really simple and comforting recipe.

records.name: classic white wine spritzer
records.text: i need to keep the colories down but won't give up the wine! this is a great refreshing summer drink with not to much guilt.

records.name: roszke aka nuthorns
records.text: hungarian christmas cookies also referred to as nuthorns.

records.name: pizza  beer  dough
records.text: a good easy dough for pizza using beer. i use dark beer but any canned beer will work.

records.name: sweet potato brownies
records.text: there's no chocolate so i suppose they are more like blondies. from deep south parties (or how to survive the southern cocktail hour without a box of french onion soup mix, a block of processed cheese, or a cocktail weenie) by robert st. john.

records.name: fruit cups with strawberry dressing
records.text: so light, so cool, and so colorful, this fruit salad can't be beat during the hot summer months. another "better homes and gardens" gem! :).

records.name: paprika chicken stew with potato pierogies
records.text: i found this rachael ray recipe recently and it sounds delicious. i haven't made it yet but am posting it so i'll have it handy to make when i get some pierogies and try it.

records.name: no fry sweet and sour
records.text: a sweet and sour recipe with no batter! can be used for chicken or pork. it's very colorful and generally has to be made in a double batch as plates get cleaned quickly.

records.name: peanut butter s mores bars   gift in a jar
records.text: wow! so good! this is love in a jar! hehehe great for gift giving and a great project for kids of all ages! wonderful to do on a rainy day or any day. you will need to attach a card to the jar with the directions to finish the 'smores'.

records.name: peanut butter s mores bars   gift in a jar
records.text: i like to print them out, hole punch and thread on some raffia. tie the raffia and card around the mason jar and give as a gift!.

records.name: broccoli cheddar chowder
records.text: this is a good, quick, kid-friendy tasty chowder. it can also be frozen. sometimes i add some crushed red pepper or other herbs to jazz it up a bit. zwt mid-west region (corn).

records.name: smoked cheese   gouda or alps  potato salad
records.text: if you like smoked cheese you will love this. goes great with a bbq or picnic. put it on you shopping list today, you won't be disappointed.

records.name: souffle  potatoes
records.text: a 'mock.

records.name: gran s squash casserole
records.text: perfect for the holidays cheesy and wonderful. even works on kids who don't like veggies!.

records.name: pralines  n cream muffins
records.text: these muffins are very moist and delicious! great for breakfast or snack. i like to double the recipe because these little jewels freeze well. just wrap securely; seal, label and freeze.

records.name: pralines  n cream muffins
records.text: to reheat frozen muffins, unwrap; microwave at high about 45 seconds per muffin.

records.name: pork   bean bake
records.text: tasty and oh-so-satisfying, this simple main dish is also versatile. it may be baked in the oven, cooked in a crockpot or large covered skillet, even made beside your summer campfire in a dutch oven. hope you enjoy this rsc #10 creation!!.

records.name: chocolate fudge cookies with toffee   dried cherries
records.text: these cookies have a crispy exterior and a soft and chewy interior. the various flavours and textures (rich dark chocolate, chewy sour cherries, and sweet crisp toffee) combine to produce a deliciously addictive cookie.

records.name: chocolate fudge cookies with toffee   dried cherries
records.text: from regan daley's cookbook, "in the sweet kitchen: the definitive baker's companion". if you are using cherries, make sure they are plump and soft. if you want smaller cookies, decrease baking time. dough freezes very well.

records.name: chocolate fudge cookies with toffee   dried cherries
records.text: these are fabulously gooey when warm.

records.name: chili s monterey chicken
records.text: from copykat. com (http://www. copykat. com)  this is traditionally served as a sandwich but may be served as is!.

records.name: sun dried tomato and onion bread
records.text: i haven't tried this yet, but am putting it here so i don't lose it.

records.name: cookies  n cream cake
records.text: this cake looks just like cookies 'n cream ice cream. the kids love it--makes great cupcakes too. be sure not to crush the cookies too small--you want coarse crumbles.

records.name: pan roasted chicken breasts with lemon and caper sauce
records.text: from cook's illustrated. very much like chicken piccatta, but moister, with less hands-on time required. but also not as quick - the choice is yours. (i must warn you that the skillet handle is hot when removed from the oven.

records.name: pan roasted chicken breasts with lemon and caper sauce
records.text: despite repeated reminders to myself, i still grabbed it while making the sauce. ).

records.name: low fat low carb 7 layer tex mex dip
records.text: this recipe cut the calories in half and the fat by 2/3's. it tastes fantastic and it's super duper easy.

records.name: ajeen beckford creamy garlic shrimp
records.text: simple and healthy shrimp idea.

records.name: honey wheat muffins
records.text: from weight watchers: 365-day menu cookbook. these can be successfully frozen and reheated. makes 12 muffins.

records.name: creamy cheesy sausage and potato soup
records.text: one of the best soups you will ever have! to save time cook the sausage, onion and garlic hours ahead or even a day ahead and refrigerate. if serving more than 4 people, i suggest to double the complete recipe.

records.name: raspberry jam with chambord
records.text: i am planting raspberries next week so i wanted to save this recipe so when they come in i can make this. the raspberry jam should be complemented with the raspberry liqueur. from small bath canning by topp and howard.

records.name: smoked sausage with rice pilaf
records.text: this is from the inside of the johnsonville smoke sausage package.

records.name: pumpkin cupcakes cake
records.text: i needed something cute for our fall festival cakewalk at church this weekend and i found this recipe in the better homes and gardens publication "halloween tricks & treats".

records.name: pumpkin cupcakes cake
records.text: it was really easy; the hardest part was picking the orange and black m&m's out of the m&m's ghoul's milk chocolate mix.

records.name: pumpkin cupcakes cake
records.text: if you live in a bigger city or can order online, you can probably order just orange and black ones to make this easier yet!.

records.name: zucchini with walnuts and chives
records.text: rounds of zucchini take on great texture and flavor when sauteed with seasoned bread crumbs, nuts and chopped fresh chives. this recipe was on the package of organic chives.

records.name: microwave teriyaki salmon
records.text: this recipe is heaven-sent for working folk--not only is is quick and tasty, but kids love it and the texture is so velvety smooth that you'll never cook salmon anywhere but in the microwave again! it is low in calories, fat and carbs to boot.

records.name: microwave teriyaki salmon
records.text: serve on a bed of spinach sauteed in a bit of olive oil with fresh minced garlic, salt & pepper (like #28274 or #31108 from this website) and you have a company-worthy, healthful meal.

records.name: microwave teriyaki salmon
records.text: seven minutes refers to cooking time; marinating time is an additional 30 minutes.

records.name: chocolate stout float
records.text: this was the product of a spontaneous decision that led to a very satisfying dessert/summer nightcap. nothing could be simpler!.

records.name: devils on horseback
records.text: these are good enough to be dangerous, as someone at one of our parties once discovered. don't forget those are prunes you're eating!.

records.name: aussie version fried rice
records.text: my husband is originally from australia. when we go back i am constantly looking though cookbooks. i think i found this is one of my mother-in-laws old cookbooks. this is a very simple recipe made with things usually on hand.

records.name: aussie version fried rice
records.text: also, big plus my kids love it.

records.name: corn dogs and dippers
records.text: make your own at home. great kid fare for the summer.

records.name: cilantro serrano chile rice
records.text: goes with filet mignon with avocado and sea salt; i made it with black rice (forbidden rice) and it was a great subsitution. the taste of the black rice, slightly nutty, goes very well with the flavors.

records.name: cilantro serrano chile rice
records.text: i also substituted jalepeno for the serrano, as the serrano chiles were not available.

records.name: grilled turkey sandwiches
records.text: this is one of my youngest son's favorite sandwiches. he asks for this on a regular basis. you can change it up and use whatever kind of cheese you like. my hubby likes this with hot pepper cheese.

records.name: yorkie beef pudding
records.text: i've had this recipe for years. the original version was in women's day magazine, but i've changed it to make it more versitile. i fix it most often to use up leftover beef stew or roast, but i've fixed it from scratch many times as well.

records.name: yorkie beef pudding
records.text: both are excellent. if you use the fluted quiche pan, the yorkshire pudding will puff up in an interesting pattern.

records.name: rigatoni milano
records.text: a hearty pasta dish. found in the australian delicious mag.

records.name: out of this world pie
records.text: this recipe makes two beautiful and delicious pies.

records.name: monkey bread   make at night  bake in morning
records.text: make at night, bake in morning!  my oven has a delay-start function, so i can schedule the rolls to be ready when i wake.

records.name: monkey bread   make at night  bake in morning
records.text: it’s great to wake up to them!  when i need to bring baked goods to breakfast events, i like to make these since all work is done the night before.

records.name: south african date and onion salad
records.text: adapted from time/life foods of the world. this salad may be made a day or two in advance.

records.name: delicious bacon and cracker appetizers
records.text: i'm always on the search for new appetizers. you can always have the ingredients on hand for this one.

records.name: delicious bacon and cracker appetizers
records.text: it's versatile so if you can't find the club or society-style crackers (these are rectangular in shape), any buttery cracker (ritz will do if you can't find club). don't use thick sliced bacon.

records.name: delicious bacon and cracker appetizers
records.text: in fact what i do is take each piece of bacon and lay it on my cutting board and 'smear' it thinner and longer with the warmth of my hands. you might not need the whole box of crackers and you might not use all of the brown sugar.

records.name: delicious bacon and cracker appetizers
records.text: some people like them with more sugar. make these to suit your own taste. yield is approximate because i only make them as i need them.

records.name: chocolate fudge cheesecake
records.text: i made this recipe from southern living for christmas and everyone just loved it! the recipe makes two 9 inch cheesecakes so it feeds a lot of people.

records.name: chocolate fudge cheesecake
records.text: this three layered cheesecake has  a rich brownie bottom layer with a center layer of cream cheese and a decadently rich chocolate glaze covering the top. the recipe is easily halved.

records.name: chocolate fudge cheesecake
records.text: the chocolate glaze top layer is intended to divide between the two cheesecakes. however, i used one full recipe to top one cheesecake. allow 8 hours chilling time. this cheesecake is absolutely delicious and i am sure you will enjoy it, too!.

records.name: quick shrimp   pasta
records.text: quick dinner for 2. great for a date. if you get the shrimp already deviened, dinner's ready in 15 minutes. quick, and tastes like a restaraunt. serve with any tossed salad and fresh bread.

records.name: golden tea buns  sally lunn bunns
records.text: this recipe is different from the other recipes posted in that it calls for heavy cream. published in gourmet magazine, november 1992. these buns are easy to make, no kneading.

records.name: gourmet grouper
records.text: grouper was bogo at the market. i had this recipe from an e-mail recipe group i belong to and finally tried it. i added a little old bay to the crab mixture, just cuz we like the flavor. it is easy with great flavor.

records.name: gourmet grouper
records.text: looks and taste much more fancy than it is, wonderful for a dinner party if your looking to impress.

records.name: hot caramel apple cafe  hot drink
records.text: move over traditional hot cocoa on a cold winters night; you will have a love affair with this concoction. i had this at a starbucks earlier this year; after fooling around with ingredients, this is the clone.

records.name: hot caramel apple cafe  hot drink
records.text: a wonderful drink to curl up with on a chilly night; great for a bonfire or a holiday gathering as well.

records.name: fruity whole wheat yogurt muffins
records.text: these are very moist muffins. you can match the type of yogurt to the type of fruit you are using if you want to improve the flavour.

records.name: hearty potato and leek soup
records.text: this soup is really good in the fall, when the weather is turning cool. if you want to make it lighter, leave out the sausage and white beans. prep time does not include soaking the beans overnight.

records.name: lamb kebabs with coriander yogurt sauce
records.text: an easy recipe that i'm sure you will enjoy! :) happy to share! (time does not include marinating time. ).

records.name: karithopita  greek walnut cake
records.text: this is my mom's specialty and she makes it for all holidays. it is a rich, dark, spicy cake that has been soaked in a syrup and is best served with a dollop of whipped cream.

records.name: aubergine  tomato   parmesan bake  melanzane alla parmigiana
records.text: goodfood magazine, 04/2009 edition, is where i found this recipe. i imagine everyone has at least one version of this meal - so i'm just adding mine one of the biggest advantages is that it tastes better the second day!.

records.name: aubergine  tomato   parmesan bake  melanzane alla parmigiana
records.text: of course i like mine the best!:) can be frozen without topping, vegetarian & "posh" comfort food! marvelous, just wonderful.

records.name: chunky caramel popcorn clusters
records.text: this recipe is from  land o lakes, and they have a winner here for sure. it is downright habit forming! once you start eating it, you just can't stop! a mixture of dark chocolate, white chocolate, cashews, and pecans that can't be beat.

records.name: tofu and noodle salad with peanut sauce
records.text: this is just really yummy! a terrific after-work, summertime meal. i found this one in the daily herald and they attribute it to john ash. i find the noodles, radish and pea shoots in my local oriental grocery store.

records.name: tofu and noodle salad with peanut sauce
records.text: prep time doesn't include marinading time.

records.name: coconut joy cookies
records.text: found this recipe by request at usenet cookbook. i haven't made these yet but it sounds like a supersweet and easy recipe.

records.name: peanut butter plus sandwiches
records.text: this is an energizing snack or lunch. the spread for these can be mixed up ahead of time and stored in the refrigerator for several days. from cooking light (july 2006).

records.name: versatile lemon chicken
records.text: this is my version of the seemingly infinite variety of lemon chicken recipes. it is a mixture of half a dozen different ones i have tried. i settled on this because it is seriously easy to make and very versatile.

records.name: versatile lemon chicken
records.text: the amount of butter, flour and seasoning is really just a matter of taste. however, if you can, use organic chicken because it isn't pumped full of water and nonsense which can ruin the thick gloopy sauce.

records.name: versatile lemon chicken
records.text: you can add whatever you like to it while it is cooking and serve it with anything. my favourite is pasta (conchiglie or penne) and mushrooms or homemade garlic potato wedges. yummy!.

records.name: mixed spice
records.text: i'm posting this to go along with the gingernut recipe i posted, which calls for mixed spice, which is not commonly available in the us.

records.name: green papaya salad
records.text: this is my version of a traditional thai raw salad with a mildly spicy seasoning. i acquired the original recipe from the blue elephant cooking school. the dried shrimp does tend to give this dish a strong flavour.

records.name: green papaya salad
records.text: like my fellow garlic lovers here at zaar, the first time i made this i used more than one clove of garlic, 3 to be exact, but in this dish to much garlic becomes overpowering and one misses out on the wonderful combination of flavours.

records.name: caramel filled delightfulls chocolate chip cookies
fiery kickoff wings
records.text: these wings deliver the winning flavor! grill mates® zesty herb marinade is the perfect short-cut to great taste with crushed red pepper providing the kick.

records.name: cream chicken on toast
records.text: easy recipe using canned or fresh cooked chicken. this is my husband's favorite dish. it is an adaptation of the cream chipped beef on toast such a favorite in the 1950's.

records.name: italian hero sandwich
records.text: this is the sandwich to make when you want an attention grabber! at a good italian delicatessen, you'll be able to find the peppers and sliced meats as well as a crusty loaf that will hold all the fixings.

records.name: italian hero sandwich
records.text: adapted from williams-sonoma outdoors series,picnics and tailgates,by diane rossen worthington (time-life books, 1998).

records.name: dim sum style gai lan  chinese broccoli
records.text: this tastes just like the gai-lan that my dbf and i get when we go to dim sum on sundays. it is really easy to make at home. it is similar to regular broccoli but it is slightly milder and has broad flat leaves instead of florets.

records.name: dim sum style gai lan  chinese broccoli
records.text: if you can't find gai lan, you can substitute broccolini. the baking soda helps the broccoli retain its green color while cooking.

records.name: chipotle cream sauce
records.text: the first time i tasted chipotle cream sauce was at the cheesecake factory restaurant, and i fell in love with it. here's an easy and quick version to make at home! :).

records.name: bread pudding french quarter style with rum sauce
records.text: i love bread pudding and this is one of the best.

records.name: awesome butterscotch shortbread
records.text: these are from a betty crocker cookies cookbook and they are great!!! i'm really critical and picky about cookies, but if you love shortbread and love crispy, you'll love these!!!.

records.name: cold shoulder
records.text: a yummy drink my mom told me about but i have never seen a recipe for it.

records.name: ruby s cheese tidbits
records.text: this is another of my aunt ruby's recipes. one of my absolute favorites !!!   just a note, originally the amount of cheese was incorrect. instead of 1/2 cup it should have said 1 and  1/2 cups.

records.name: brussels sprouts hash with shallots
records.text: this is a great side dish for the holidays. it is the only way my family will eat brussels sprouts. delicious!  from epicurious originally.

records.name: charlotte s whole cranberry bread
records.text: this recipe has been passed down from my grandmother to my mom and now to me. it is one of our family's favorites at christmas time. we like to serve it warm out of the oven with butter spread on top.

records.name: gourmet carrot cake
records.text: dee514 asked me if i had a carrot cake recipe and this is what i sent her. she did say she doubled the recipe and put golden sultanas in it. i haven't tried it. she said it was great any queries ask dee.

records.name: manicotti  sausage   cheese
records.text: one of my favorites recipes--a rich combination of sausage and three cheeses stuffed into manicotti shells! and it's not too difficult!.

records.name: apple cidertini
records.text: this is a terrific cocktail to serve at a halloween party!.

records.name: south american cooler
records.text: enjoy a rich and creamy cooler!.

records.name: chicken mushroom noodle soup
records.text: a simple but good recipe.

records.name: old fashioned cream of tomato soup
records.text: this is the way they made cream of tomato soup before campbells came along. not that i don't love campbells.

records.name: moroccan fish stew
records.text: a friend saw this being created on a tv cookery show and decided to do it for me, it is just so tasty i had to post it, please please try this dish if you don't you'll never know how good this really is!.

records.name: mayan hot cocoa
records.text: inspired by the movie, "chocolat"! cocoa was used by the aztec and mayan as a sacred drink. it was brewed with various spices and drank unsweetened as part of ceremonies. this recipe uses pure cocoa and several spices, including chili peppers.

records.name: mayan hot cocoa
records.text: the flavor is very rich and aromatic, like a dark perfume. experiment with the sweetness to your liking.

records.name: mushroom cheese sauce
records.text: a nice sauce to accompany beef or vegetables.

records.name: israeli couscous salad with asparagus  cucumber and olives
records.text: from bon appetit, june 2006. i discovered israeli couscous at a restaurant over a year ago and set out to find it to try in standard couscous recipes.

records.name: israeli couscous salad with asparagus  cucumber and olives
records.text: (believe it or not i found israeli couscous for sale at safeway grocery store by sheer accident!) quite thrilled to find this recipe very recently!.

records.name: tuna toast
records.text: quick lunch or dinner entree. i love the flavor of tuna and the mushroon soup together. one really hungry person can eat the whole recipe.

records.name: etta s crab cakes  tom douglas
records.text: living in seattle, and having eaten these at etta's, i can attest that etta's crab cakes are superb.

records.name: etta s crab cakes  tom douglas
records.text: they are included in "i love crab cakes: 50 recipes for an american classic" by tom douglas with shelley lance and have been "rereleased" (so to speak) on numerous other websites. one hour of the estimated preparation time is chilling time.

records.name: etta s crab cakes  tom douglas
records.text: timing is based on buying (admittedly pricey)dungeness crab meat. if buying cooked crabs and planning to extract crab meat yourself, add at least an hour.

records.name: creamed spinach and bacon bake
records.text: this recipe is guaranteed to put a smile on any spinach-lover's face and will compliment any meal, since this is a creamed spinach recipe it is not a dish that bakes out totally firm.

records.name: creamed spinach and bacon bake
records.text: to remove the bitterness from the frozen spinach i like to microwave it in a little water for 10 minutes or until boiling, rinse until cold water then squeeze dry, if you don't mind the strong taste then you can omit this step.

records.name: creamed spinach and bacon bake
records.text: prep time does not include cooking the bacon.

records.name: pot of pizza
records.text: mmmm pizza! okay. it's not quite the same as pizza from your favorite pizza place but it's still very good. 6 points for weight watchers. this recipe is core.

records.name: reuben chowder
records.text: delicious, creamy soup that's great on a cold winter day. i got this recipe from friends in hays, ks, a volga german community filled with good cooks!.

records.name: spanish oranges in wine
records.text: especially pretty if you use two or three colors of oranges, e. g. , navel, blood orange, yellow. prep time does not include chilling. i haven't made this yet. posting for zwt3. i will update when i have made it.

records.name: laurel s mango chutney
records.text: i've been making this chutney for years, and have adapted it to my own family's taste. i don't remember where i found this recipe, but everyone loves it.

records.name: laurel s mango chutney
records.text: if you're a chutney lover you could almost eat it with a spoon! especially great with indonesian curries, beef and chicken alike! i hope you enjoy! note: peel mangoes with a vegetable peeler, and carefully cut the flesh away from the fibrous seed.

records.name: tuna casserole with ranch and potato chips
records.text: i made this when i discovered my standby of cream of mushroom soup was gone. (turns out dh didn't put the groceries away very well, hehehe). this isn't exactly healthy, but it's comforting and my daughter (a ranch dressing fanatic) loved it!.

records.name: ww 1 pt  weight watcher muffins
records.text: i eat one of these almost everyday. they are an excellent source of fiber and only being 1 pt. what's not to love???  especially if you are counting.

records.name: ww 1 pt  weight watcher muffins
records.text: feel free to use whatever flavor of muffin mix from krusteaz you choose, just making sure it's the fatfree kind.

records.name: dave s yeast rolls
records.text: this is a simple recipe that i have experimented with over time and it produces absolutely wonderful yeast rolls without having to spend a ton of time.

records.name: dave s yeast rolls
records.text: my total active time is about a half hour (not including allowing the bread machine to do the kneading work and allowing for rising). i use a bread machine to knead the dough but you could do it by hand too.

records.name: dave s yeast rolls
