records.text: this is so easy to make! it uses a cake mix so there is very little measuring and the results are amazingly moist and delicious! the recipe calls for mayonaise, but don't be afraid! it has no effect on the flavor. enjoy!.

records.name: basic meatballs
records.text: got this recipe from a neighbor's church recipe book. i like the oven method of cooking.

records.name: best bean salad
records.text: my version of a recipe found on another site. this is my go to bean salad. great over a bed of lettuce or over cold rice. since manufacturers are constantly reducing can sizes, if your can sizes vary a bit that is fine.

records.name: best bean salad
records.text: prepare ahead because this should be refrigerated for at least 2 hours (8 is preferable). this is reflected in the cooking time.

records.name: baby potatoes and sweet peppers in tomato dill butter
records.text: use the smallest potatoes you find or quarter them as they are stir fried. cooking time includes time to boil potatoes.

records.name: ooie gooie bread
records.text: it is ooie gooie and we love it!  a twist on monkey bread that leaves out all the fat from butter.

records.name: corn and molasses muffins
records.text: these are sweet cornmeal muffins (not too sweet), with a cake-like texture. they'd be good with some currants or raisins added, too, i'd bet. i like them unadulterated and unadorned, though. i don't even think they need butter.

records.name: corn and molasses muffins
records.text: i got this from "enchanted broccoli forest," by the way.

records.name: spinach with rice
records.text: very tasty way to use up leftover cooked rice.

records.name: black bean and sweet potato burritos light
records.text: this is  modified versions of recipe #43473. i made it easier and lighter.

records.name: sausage and beans
records.text: my hubby's buddies love this! just add corn bread and you are done!.

records.name: habanero and poblano hot sauce
records.text: based this recipe on the flavor of poblano mexican hot sauce. it's a hot and tangy sauce.

records.name: lemon lime slush
records.text: from rachel ray's august magazine.

records.name: rouladen  beef roll ups
records.text: this is an old fashioned german recipe that my family enjoys. it has been passed down from my mother who is from germany, try it you will love it.

records.name: pleasure in every spoon indian mutton lamb biryani
records.text: this is the world famous indian chef sanjeev kapoor's recipe. i hope you enjoy it. it's from the young times magazine! preparation time includes marinating time for mutton/lamb.

records.name: carolina red pulled pork shoulder
records.text: from the weber sight a recipe tweeked and want to make.

records.name: low fat blackberry cobbler
records.text: no butter or oils added. i arranged this on my own and it came out great. easy to make and so tasty. the pan fits perfectly in the toaster oven.

records.name: mushroom pt
records.text: a great hors d'oeuvre to make ahead for entertaining. we serve it on toasted baguettes or water crackers with cracked black pepper. you'll need to refrigerate this for at least 2 hours so plan ahead.

records.name: mushroom pt
records.text: share it with friends - they'll be glad you did. (from betty rosbottom's cooking school cookbook - columbus, ohio).

records.name: cornflake choc nut slice
records.text: from an older edition of woman's day - you could substitute rice bubbles for the cornflakes if so desired.

records.name: strawberry margarita
records.text: a favorite southwest beverage that may be prepard with or without alcohol. tangy and sweet that goes great with my bbq stuffed jalapenos. when the strawberries are in season it is better but frozen whole fruit can be used for a winter treat.

records.name: strawberry margarita
records.text: as with any alcohol beverage please drink responsibly.

records.name: snickers dip    the secret is out
records.text: my friend renee shared this recipe at a recent graduation party. you'll make it you'll love it everyone will want the secret recipe you'll learn to hide some for later, because it will disappear fast!.

records.name: zucchini joe  ground beef or turkey with zucchini and egg
records.text: this is a super easy one-skillet dish that tastes amazing and is a great way to get some veggies into kids. it can be made with ground beef or ground turkey (i generally prefer turkey because it is leaner).

records.name: zucchini joe  ground beef or turkey with zucchini and egg
records.text: you can increase the number of eggs to six if you want but i like it this way. you can also definitely eat this as a brunch item but my family loves it for dinner.

records.name: yummy vegan banana flaxseed muffins
records.text: these muffins are super moist and really easy to make. if you are a fan of walnuts or pecans, add them, hey would be great in them!.

records.name: macaroni   hot italian sausage
records.text: a macaroni casserole is always welcome in most families. use mild sausage or bratwurst if you prefer. i like a bit of spice so i like to add a couple of jalapenos chopped and perhaps some olives or some hot sauce.

records.name: macaroni   hot italian sausage
records.text: make it as hot or as mild as you like. good meal for those fall/winter days ahead. serve with a green salad and crusty rolls and there's your meal.

records.name: lemon angel food cake
records.text: this is another dessert that my mother made when i was a kid. its easy, tasty and very light - great after a big meal!.

records.name: grilled eggplant rolls with mint and garlic dressing
records.text: one of the first recipes i used to try out my new bbq. from taste magazine. i liked the picture. my photo is not as professional but i hope it still inspires you to try this recipe!.

records.name: rustic vegetable baguette with smashed avocado
records.text: this is super yummy, and very easy. very filling as well. you can add items to i'm sure to fit your own individual tastes. from betty crocker.

records.name: cinnamon basmati rice
records.text: ahhh! basmati rice!  a staple in indian cuisine. i love this version with my roasted chicken with curry leaves and spices topped with my curried béchamel.

records.name: mock risotto
records.text: as i have told you before, i'm a rice snob, and i don't like instant rice but it sometimes comes in very handy. this makes a good vegetarian meal or side with grilled chicken or fish or even a steak. eating well.

records.name: mock risotto
records.text: this makes another easy and nice rice dish for the resident's.

records.name: creamy kiss
records.text: a creamy almond, irish cream, and peach cocktail.

records.name: good eats southern biscuits
records.text: good biscuits that take no time to cook, i make them at least once a week.

records.name: green beans with red onions
records.text: best if served room temperature.

records.name: yummy pork chop stuffing bake
records.text: we love pork chops and stuffing, this recipe combines the two with creammy mushroom sauce and cheese.

records.name: gabby gourmet s ranch style chicken salad sandwiches
records.text: perfect for a ladies luncheon or tea, these sandwiches are served on croissants and make a great presentation!.

records.name: banana roll  yum
records.text: having a bakery and being a caterer, i have to say this is the one banana roll recipe i used consistently.

records.name: scarface   chicken mushroom alfredo
records.text: this is a very good alfredo dish, my daughter made it at christime time when she was here. everyone loved it and ask for the recipe. even my picky grandson wanted the recipe. the recipe can be doubled as this is what she did, it was delicious.

records.name: scarface   chicken mushroom alfredo
records.text: i don't know where she got the recipe.

records.name: fried ginger chicken for passover
records.text: taken from a 1992 jewish calendar. this contains peanut oil and almonds so please be careful for allergies if planning to serve to guests.

records.name: fiesta corn bake
records.text: this is a quick and easy dish with lots of taste.

records.name: spring pasta salad with asparagus  tomato and mozzarella
records.text: spring is in the air! so many recipes come to mind this time of year. here's one you're sure to enjoy.

records.name: razzle dazzle raspberry parfait
records.text: excellent, easy yet very pretty dessert. everyone i've made this for loves it!!.

records.name: bagels 101  using a stand mixer
records.text: this is a great recipe for a 'bagel party' where everyone can choose and prep their bagel filling and topping choices. this recipe can easily be halved or doubled.

records.name: bagels 101  using a stand mixer
records.text: we tweaked this very detailed recipe from the book 'the best bagels are made at home' by dona z. meilach.

records.name: bagels 101  using a stand mixer
records.text: we took the stand-mixer version and simplified the instructions as well as made some other adjustments as we went along to perfect it and keep it simple. choices for different types of flavors are listed at the beginning.

records.name: bagels 101  using a stand mixer
records.text: selections for different types of toppings are listed at the bottom of the recipe. note: it's recommended to print, read, and understand the instructions completely before beginning.

records.name: bagels 101  using a stand mixer
records.text: onion bagels: add 2 tablespoons of dehydrated minced onion, and replace salt with onion salt. italian herb bagels: add 2 teaspoons of italian seasoning, and replace salt with onion salt.

records.name: airy hamburger buns
records.text: this is a recipe made in the bosch. the cookbook is titled "healthy recipes from the heart of our home" by phyllis stanley. i'm not sure how these would work if not using a bosch, as the bosch does all the kneading for you.

records.name: airy hamburger buns
records.text: but you're willing to try and convert!  the preparation includes rising time.

records.name: best ever butterscotch cookies
records.text: posted in response to a request, this is a recipe from the "farm journal's best ever recipes". i have not made this recipe myself, but most everything i have ever tried from farm journal has been exceptional. prep time, obviously, is a guess.

records.name: excellent  moist tender flounder fillets
records.text: even those who claim to not like fish will "beg" for more of this one. it is so moist and tasty. i think i would try it with ranch dressing as well. i found a similar recipe at another site but adapted it to my tastes.

records.name: excellent  moist tender flounder fillets
records.text: guaranteed you will love this !!!!!!!!.

records.name: roasted vegetable pizza
records.text: a tasty and healthy pizza that features wonderful vegetables!.

records.name: southwestern burgers
records.text: can't go wrong wit a good burger.

records.name: stuffed pollock with shrimp sauce
records.text: i'm not wild about fish, but do love seafood. this is my solution to an economically friendly seafood meal, that looks fancy, i can enjoy with my husband.

records.name: stuffed pollock with shrimp sauce
records.text: serve with rice, pasta or bread sticks, as you'll want something to soak up more of the yummy sauce!.

records.name: cheddar wagon wheels and chili meatballs
records.text: this recipe came from woman's world magazine and my kids love it. it's also simple to put together.

records.name: my favorite snickerdoodles
records.text: who doesn't love snickerdoodles? just say the word - "snickerdoodle" - it's awsome! when i was little i'd always request my mother to make these for me. i'm only guessing on the yield. i don't remember how many cookies this makes!.

records.name: suffolk waldorf salad
records.text: a classic recipe updated with dried cherries and spinach, replacing raisins and lettuce. gala apples are perfect for this salad! adapted from southern living magazine. new england, english, mid atlantic.

records.name: couscous with apricot vinaigrette
records.text: i found this in a realsimple magazine and knew my boys would like it. great with grilled chicken!.

records.name: mjadra   lentils and rice
records.text: this is a typical middle eastern recipe given to me by my niece. her in-laws, who are from the middle east, gave this recipe to her and it has become a staple in their home. i think it's fantastic, too.

records.name: mjadra   lentils and rice
records.text: it could work as a vegetarian main dish, a side dish or lunch. it is traditionally served with a salad made of the following: chopped lettuce, chopped tomato, chopped green pepper, lemon juice and salt.

records.name: mjadra   lentils and rice
records.text: i like to mix the mjadra right in with the salad. yum!.

records.name: wheat berry salad with goat cheese
records.text: gleaned from cooking light magazine and posted here for safekeeping. prep time does not include the overnight (8 hour) soak for the wheat berries.

records.name: blueberry yogurt muffins
records.text: i'm always a fan of blueberry muffins- especially when they are from scratch!.

records.name: puff pastry glazed apricot twists
records.text: these are best served warm out of the oven. this is a double recipe for 16 pastries, you can cut the recipe in half and use just one puff pastry sheet for 8 pastries if desired.

records.name: liquid oreos
records.text: i found this recipe in the october 2007 issue of every day with rachael ray.

records.name: chili con carne with chili cheddar shortcakes
records.text: the biscuits really make this version of chili con carne. delicious.

records.name: frosted pineapple cake
records.text: a simple and sweet dessert, great for company or potlucks!.

records.name: cheesy onion and potato soup
records.text: perfect comfort food.

records.name: caramelized bananas with rum sauce and vanilla ice cream
records.text: this fast and easy dessert is nothing short of sublime. try to use a good rum from puerto rico.

records.name: steak oscar  for 2
records.text: this is so easy and so elegant! serve it for a romantic or special dinner. sure to impress!.

records.name: wake up fruit blend
records.text: tasty morning eye-opener.

records.name: giblet pan gravy
records.text: this is just like grandma used to make. the lost art of gravy making. don't use the packet--go for the real thing!.

records.name: chocolate covered candied orange peel
records.text: from birds & blooms magazine, this reminds me of my mom, who always loved these.

records.name: india style crackers
records.text: a tasty low-calorie, almost guilt-free snack. i concocted this based on an inspiration from murukku (a fried indian snack done in coils) and lavash bread.

records.name: boterkoek  dutch butter cake
records.text: this is a traditional dutch recipe. it's a rich, buttery, dense cake. the key to making it, is keep the ingredients, and also your hands, cold while working the dough.

records.name: peach and blackberry parfait with raspberry coulis
records.text: as simple as this is to prepare, you will find this dessert elegant enough to serve at a special dinner party. for raspberry sauce see recipe i posted recipe #59967. blueberries can easily be substituted for the blackberries, if desired.

records.name: peach and blackberry parfait with raspberry coulis
records.text: cook time reflects time to chill.

records.name: bacon mac  n cheese
records.text: six different kinds of cheeses, a pound of bacon, gooey deliciousness. it doesn't get much better than this.

records.name: bacon mac  n cheese
records.text: i stumbled upon this combination one night in college; rummaging through the refrigerator and cupboards to find something to cook, i found out that i had an ungodly amount of cheese, so i threw it all in et voila, the greatest mac 'n cheese i've ever tasted.

records.name: garlicky mussels in a rich lemon  fresh herb  butter sauce
records.text: moules marinières a classic french/belgian dish, wonderful served with frites and a dollop of mayonnaise. just bought 2 pounds of mussels. tossed this together almost as fast as we ate it! lots of fresh herbs and garlic.

records.name: garlicky mussels in a rich lemon  fresh herb  butter sauce
records.text: make sure you have some wonderful bread to soak up the sauce! or serve over pasta.

records.name: blueberries and cointreau
records.text: take advantage of blueberry season! delictible, and simple, blueberries, with cointreau, and sweet whipped cream.

records.name: biscuit crust
records.text: really good for pot pies, veggie or meat.

records.name: ming tsai s hoisin pork tenderloin sandwiches with napa slaw
records.text: this is very tasty, however i must admit that when cooking the pork the stated amount of time was not enough for my family. after resting the pork was still very pink so i put it back in the oven for another 5 minutes.

records.name: ming tsai s hoisin pork tenderloin sandwiches with napa slaw
records.text: this cooked the pork through entirely. i know that this probably wasn't ming's intention for the dish but for those of you who like thoroughly cooked pork please know you need to cook the meat longer.

records.name: florentine cookie bars
records.text: decorative cookies for the holiday!!.

records.name: chicken rollatini with cheese  ham   spinach
records.text: adapted from robin miller's quick fix show, this is more fussy than her usual recipes but still not terribly complicated and very delicious.

records.name: chicken rollatini with cheese  ham   spinach
records.text: you absolutely can use any kind of soft cheese you like, such as alouette with herbs or perhaps even soft cream cheese with chives. serve with a salad or a bright green veggie and a side of lightly buttered pasta noodles.

records.name: buttery streusel coffee cake
records.text: coffee cake to die for. great on a weekend morning or for brunch. very rich and sweet. makes a lot. yum.

records.name: boiled raw peanuts
records.text: boiled peanuts are common to most southerners and a unique culinary experience.

records.name: crispy parmesan zucchini coins
records.text: a real tasty way to use up zucchini or yellow squash. even the large ones will work. when finished the coins will be a delicious crisp brown on the outside and soft and tasty on the inside.

records.name: swabian noodles  spatzle
records.text: definitely a family favorite!  simple ingredients and easy to make. serve with gravy or melted butter. a great side dish in any german meal.

records.name: swabian noodles  spatzle
records.text: from the new ulm, minnesota cookbook:  "gemutlicher leben schwaben und fein, mit schwabischer kuche und schwabischem wein"  (most happy are the swabians with their swabian cookery and swabian wine).

records.name: thick chocolate pudding
records.text: this is the perfect chocolate pudding. it has a rich chocolate flavor, great texture and is not high in fat. i can't count the number of times i have made this. i hope you enjoy it as much as we do.

records.name: slow cooker adobo pork
records.text: this makes a lot of juicy, extremely flavorful and tender pork for tacos. one of dh's faves! he likes his pretty spicy, so if you don't, you might start with less cayenne and work your way up.

records.name: slow cooker adobo pork
records.text: note:  you may wish to check your pork after about 4 hours on high or 6 hours on low as some reviewers have reported that their pork was done sooner.

records.name: stove top unstuffed green peppers
records.text: we liked stuffed green peppers so much i thought i would make it in easier to serve. i think it has a better taste this way. i also like the way it reheats better.

records.name: festive gruyere fondue
records.text: delicious!  i love this fondue. i hope you will enjoy it too!.

records.name: tomato and basil orzo salad
records.text: this is from sunset. posting for safe keeping times are approximate notes: serve this warm salad as a main dish for a light lunch or as a dinner companion to grilled steak, chicken, or fish.

records.name: blue cheese stuffed potatoes with buffalo chicken tenders
records.text: a delicious, and time friendly dish perfect for movie night or a sports weekend!! (or anytime you have the craving for buffalo sauce and blue cheese). yummy rr creation!.

records.name: refried bean burrito
records.text: not gourmet food but fast, easy and kid friendly:  just served it as an after school  snack:  they ate so much no supper was required!.

records.name: grilled  broiled  tofu and vegetable dengaku
records.text: this is a great way to use miso in grilling and to experiment with tofu. feel free to use this on other protein sources, i've used it on fish, chicken, and pork. i wouldn't suggest it with beef.

records.name: grilled  broiled  tofu and vegetable dengaku
records.text: there are two variations to the white miso sauce that are quite nice. when we make this, we make four miso sauces: white, white with citrus, white with spinach, and red. you should feel free to try all or just one of the sauces.

records.name: grilled  broiled  tofu and vegetable dengaku
records.text: i prefer to cook this under the broiler, simply because i'm not a proficient grill operator. cooking times will depend upon the vegetables you choose and the method used to cook them.

records.name: james river corn pudding
records.text: this recipe was in today's nytimes food section, courtesy of elaine louie the temporary vegetarian. why temporary, i don't know. this "is a recipe that has been handed down pre-civil war. "  wow.

records.name: james river corn pudding
records.text: unlike most corn puddings, it does not contain sugar and purists do not put sugar in their corn pudding. do make this only during corn season when fresh corn is at its sweetest. it's from "a love affair with southern cooking" by jean anderson.

records.name: james river corn pudding
records.text: she likes to make this for dinner parties, and a perfect accompaniment is salad and biscuits served the true southern way, with no honey.

records.name: buffalo wing chicken dip
records.text: if you love buffalo wings, here is the recipe for you!! serve with salty tortilla chips or any other chips you like. the salt helps to bring out the flavor. can be served hot or cold, but i prefer mine hot.

records.name: buffalo wing chicken dip
records.text: if you make this, there won't be any leftovers at the party!! if you want to make this recipe lower fat, you can use neuchatel cheese and fat-free blue cheese. do not use lower fat shredded cheese since it doesn't melt well.

records.name: buffalo wing chicken dip
records.text: just use less of it!.

records.name: white chicken chili with cheddar hushpuppy crust
records.text: great fall or winter meal, quick to put together if you've got some leftover chicken on hand. recipe is from martha white.

records.name: cheesy chile bread
records.text: this is a family favorite. tastes so good!  you can make under the broiler instead of on the grill.

records.name: couscous for breakfast
records.text: i'm always thinking up new ways to prepare hot cereal in the morning. here's another one for you to try! for maximum health benefits, use whole wheat couscous. for a vegan version, try almond milk or soy milk!.

records.name: balsamic cucumbers with basil
records.text: garden-fresh flavors simply presented are sure to please. and nobody but the cook needs to know how easy this one is. ;).

records.name: threadgills san antonio squash casserole
records.text: yellow squash casserole. one of the best!.

records.name: turkey and mushroom stroganoff
records.text: this recipe was featured in an email this morning from the www. lifescript. com website.

records.name: very basic easy white bread
records.text: this is a double loaf recipe i first saw used in a community kitchen, culinary arts training program for disadvantaged people in portland, maine. no sugar? that's what i said.

records.name: very basic easy white bread
records.text: i usually proof my yeast with a teaspoon or so of sugar, but i assure you the recipe works without it. and it's very simple.

records.name: spicy shrimp and spinach fettucini alfredo
records.text: http://www. home-ec101. com/category/cook-it-up/page/28/.

records.name: great banana nut muffins
records.text: these are the best i've come across. love them for breakfast!.

records.name: almond sandwich cookies
records.text: these easy, elegant, tiny sandwich cookies are sure to be a crowd pleaser at showers, tea parties or anytime a little nibble is on the menu. you can tint the filling any color to fit your event or mood!.

records.name: beer cheese soup in bread bowls
records.text: a creamy homemade soup fills a warm and tasty, just-baked bread bowl in just 30 minutes.

records.name: corn  avocado  and tomato salad
records.text: a delightfully healthy recipe by paula deen. the dressing is tangy and light; made with olive oil, lime zest, lime juice, fresh cilantro, salt and pepper. always a big hit at bbq's!.

records.name: chicken parmesan meatballs
records.text: my husband got this recipe from a co-worker who raved about how good it was. we made it with a pound of ground turkey and 2 chicken breasts ground in the food processor. we loved it.

records.name: chicken parmesan meatballs
records.text: a raw tuscan kale salad that has been shredded and tossed with shallots, pecornio, olive oil, tsp of lemon juice, salt, and pepper goes great with this dish.

records.name: pasta with carrots  risotto style
records.text: adapted recipe from the minimalist cooks dinner by mark bittman (broadway books, 2001). if you can't find the short, twisted "twin" pasta called gemelli, use penne instead.

records.name: creamed salmon
records.text: this makes a can of salmon go a little further.

records.name: apple carrot salad with walnuts
records.text: easy and refreshing salad. you can play around and use plain yogurt or add chopped pineapple or kiwi.

records.name: chicken penne al fresco
records.text: this fast and easy dish is a wonderful way to keep your kitchen cool in the hot months while serving up a delicious meal! adapted from pampered chef.

records.name: slow cooker german red cabbage and pork ribs
records.text: from glutenfreely. com. i used bone-in ribs and picked them out, then reused them to make pork broth in the slow cooker overnight. very tasty. i also let it cook for 9 hours and it wasn't dry.

records.name: peach   spice upside down cake
records.text: need a cake to take to a party - this is the one - and it looks beautiful, too! thanks to my sil, loretta!.

records.name: lime and parsley fish with smashed potato
records.text: from bh&g australian diabetic living in my quest for diabetic friendly recipes that i feel my family would enjoy.

records.name: low fat chicken chili
records.text: very flavorful and healthy, filling meal. add fat free cheddar and fat free sour cream for even more flavor.

records.name: chinese ramen broccoli slaw salad
records.text: a friend served this cool, tangy salad when we visited, and i had to have it. everyone i serve it to loves it.

records.name: crock pot salsa chicken
records.text: a quick and easy (and different) spin on chicken.

records.name: mostly a tomato sandwich with basil mayonnaise
records.text: of course, you could add meat and cheese of your choice to this sandwich. mine was concocted to reduce my produce inventory. you won't use all of the mayo. well, you *could* but golly that would be an odd sandwich.

records.name: rajmah  punjabi curried red kidney bean   slow cooker
records.text: this recipe is by anupy singla, whose cookbook, "the indian slow cooker", is a publishing sensation.

records.name: rajmah  punjabi curried red kidney bean   slow cooker
records.text: she says slow cookers are particularly suitable for indian cooking, reminiscent of clay cookers that would have been used for village cooking.

records.name: rajmah  punjabi curried red kidney bean   slow cooker
records.text: this recipe is a traditional and classic north indian dish that you would find in every home, but not in restaurants. comfort food for punjabis, this is the dish her family requests the most.

records.name: pumpkin muffins with ginger and spice
records.text: fall is a great time to start up those ovens and bake these muffins! nice warming comfort food!.

records.name: broccoli bacon raisin salad
records.text: i found this in a southern cooking cookbook. i had to make something for a mother's day family gathering and thru this together. let's put it this way, there was none left and everyone wanted the receipe!.

records.name: canadian salmon strudels
records.text: few things say canadian more readily than salmon and wild rice. combined with flaky phyllo pastry, earthy mushrooms and tender spinach, the patriotic duo is transformed into a heavenly package designed specifically for entertaining occasions.

records.name: canadian salmon strudels
records.text: this is a dynamite entrée for special dinners, always earning high praise and well satisfied appetites. the strudels can be assembled up to four hours ahead.

records.name: pink wine quince compote
records.text: my quince tree's boughs are bending to the ground under the weight of the fruit. quince is a lovely, old-fashioned fruit that deserves to be better known.

records.name: pink wine quince compote
records.text: this is one of my favorite recipes, from the ultimate rice cooker cookbook, by hensperger and kaufmann.

records.name: terry s honey curry chicken
records.text: this is one of my favorite ways to make chicken, and it's incredibly simple. this is one of the recipes my sister terry put in a little self-published cookbook she gave family members (omg) thirty years ago as a holiday present.

records.name: terry s honey curry chicken
records.text: as mine is falling apart, i'm posting these recipes here both to save for me, and to share with everyone.

records.name: mom s gooey chicken
records.text: this is the best, garlic-y, gooey, buttery, moist chicken ever! not so low in fat, but worth every calorie! serve with either rice or potatoes to soak up all the buttery sauce! delish!.

records.name: lemon buttermilk pound cake
records.text: my mother found this recipe from a newspaper around 10 years ago but she never tried it out, so i decided to try it out,and it was a really delicious cake,is not too dry are too moist, just right,top with icing of your choice.

records.name: soba stir fry
records.text: soba noodles are thin buckwheat strands of pasta and are a favorite noodle used in japanese cooking. you should be able to find soba in any asian market or department in your local grocery store.

records.name: soba stir fry
records.text: found this recipe on favorite name brands website.

records.name: black beans and mango salad

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: new intro on 22 sept 08: this recipe has had such strange "reviews" that i thought a new intro was needed! after kiwidutch's 2 star review i did find a major typo in the recipe and corrected it.

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: this recipe has a hundred small variations! as to those who believe that my facts are wrong: the traditional milk tart ("melktert" ) was made by cooks in olden days who made their own puff or flaky pastry, long before it was available frozen! the filling was then poured into the raw flaky pastry, sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon, and baked in a hot oven until puffy and golden brown.

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: naturally this puff settled, like a souffle. to be at its best it was served warm. as time went by, cooks also used short pastry as well, but this needed to be blind-baked before the filling could be added and the final baking done.

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: the present-day shortcuts to be found in abundance in bakeries, shops and home industries in south africa are not really "melktert". melktert is not a custard poured into a crumbly crust and left to set.

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: that must be the "melktert" my critics know and assume to be real milk tart. but those tarts/pies are the kind they used to push into people's faces in old slapstick movies.

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: after the two opinions posted, puzzled by the opinions, i checked all my older recipe books***, and found that all of them, in fact, said "flaky pastry" or "puff pastry", and all of them gave a recipe for a filling to be baked in the crust.

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: there are better recipes than this one. you only need to find the one which works best for you. but a filling which is merely poured into a ready-made crust is not the real thing. and the tannies will be glad i rewrote this intro.

records.name: south african milk tart    traditional
records.text: they must be turning in their graves about those gloppy custard pies being sold as "melktert" these days!  ***kook en geniet/cook and enjoy it (mrs s j de villiers), reader's digest south african cookbook (chief consultant philippa cheifitz), traditional cookery in southern africa (judy desmond), our best traditional recipes (vida heard & lesley faull) -- and also several cookbooks published in country districts.

records.name: stewed eggs   stuvade gg

records.text: fresh mozzarella is submerged in water to retain it's moisture content and preserve it's soft, slightly elastic texture. best when only a few days old, it has a delicate, milky texture. this recipe is from the wisconsin milk marketing board.
